title: Help a Homebound Neighbor - Less than 1 hour of your time!
description:
We are in need of more Route Drivers to help deliver meals to our elderly home-bound neighbors in the Charlottesville Community. We deliver in Charlottesville City and Albemarle County. Each route takes at most, an hour of your time. Pick-up time is between 10:30AM and 11:00AM at 704 Rose Hill Drive.


Once you are entered into our Volunteer Portal, you can create your own schedule and sign up for shifts online at your convienence!


If you're interested, please reach out to our volunteer manager, Abbie Wilson at volunteer@cvillemeals.org or give us a call at 434-293-4364.
missionStatement: Our service's goal is to not only provide healthy food, but also meaningful and daily social interaction to people in the Charlottesville area who would otherwise not be checked on or fed. We are a Monday-Friday operation. Volunteer Meal-Packers are needed between 9:00AM-10:15AM. Volunteer Route-Drivers are needed to pick up their meals between 10:30AM-11:00AM. Route-Times vary in length from approximately 20-60 minutes depending on the mileage and number of clients. Meals on Wheels currently serves over 250 clients each and every day, and that would not be possible without the work of our incredible volunteer base! We are truly thankful for every single volunteer who walks through our door and we make it a priority here to support them as much as they support our organization.
organizationDescription: Meals on Wheels of Charlottesville/Albemarle is a non-profit organization founded in 1977 to deliver hot, nutritious meals to our homebound neighbors in the area dealing with food insecurity. Meals on Wheels works to help better the health and support the independence and dignity of our community members struggling with financial, physical, and mental health challenges affecting their access to food. Food is a basic human right that our team has and always will strive to protect and improve access to within our community.

title: Habitat Store Warehouse Volunteer
description:
Who needs a gym!? Help customers bring large donations in, or load purchases into their vehicles. You may even get to ride in the truck with Jeff! Remember, brains and finesse are more important than sheer brawn, so you don’t need to be a football player to apply.


Responsibilities:

• Help customers bring large items in and out of their vehicles
• Work with Store staff to rearrange furniture on the sales floor and in the warehouse
• Occasional off-site pickups with the Warehouse Coordinator…
missionStatement: The Habitat Store supports Habitat for Humanity of Greater Charlottesville by selling new and used furniture and building materials to the public at discount prices. Our donations come from various places in our community, and all our proceeds help fund our organization's mission to provide affordable housing in the Greater Charlottesville area.
organizationDescription: The Habitat Store was established in May of 2003 to provide a self-sustaining funding source to HFHGC. We also seek to extend Habitat's mission by making home maintenance and furnishing more affordable. A secondary, environmental benefit of the store is the reuse of second-hand furniture and building materials, which helps to reduce waste in our community.

title: Camp Invention Classroom Volunteer - Charlottesville, VA
description:
Camp Invention is looking for Leadership Interns! Are you looking for the ultimate resume and college application builder? If so, we have an opportunity for you to hone your mentoring skills, obtain valuable leadership traits, and gain intellectual property knowledge.


Leadership Interns will receive formalized, online leadership training from a professional coaching and training organization, mentor and inspire Camp Invention Counselors-in-Training and campers, earn up to 40 volunteer hours, receive a letter of recognition from the United States Patent and Trademark Office and more! Space is limited so register for your spot today! For additional information on this opportunity, please contact Annette Crawford at acrawford@invent.org
missionStatement: Camp Invention is the only nationally recognized, non-profit elementary enrichment program inspired by the brightest inventors around, the National Inventors Hall of Fame Inductees. Our programs bring out a child’s natural desire to discover, encourages them to problem solve by inventing a solution, and we do it with certified local instructors in local schools.
organizationDescription: At Camp Invention children are presented with fun, hands-on challenges that encourage creative problem solving, teamwork, entrepreneurship, and innovation. Camp invention is led by experienced local educators and new curriculum is introduced each year, inspired by the Inductees of the National Inventors Hall of Fame!

title: It Takes Little to Be BIG!
organization: Big Brothers Big Sisters of the Central Blue Ridge
description: Changing perspectives. Changing lives. ​ Big Brothers Big Sisters of the Central Blue Ridge operates under the belief that inherent in every child is the ability to succeed and thrive in life. As the area’s leading provider of evidence-based mentoring, our agency makes meaningful, monitored matches between adult volunteer mentors ("Bigs") and children ("Littles"), ages 6 through 16, in the Charlottesville and Albemarle communities.   Our vision: All youth achieve their full potential.  Mission: Create and support one-to-one mentoring relationships that ignite the power and promise of youth.Our Community Based Program:           Bigs and Littles get together on their own to share in fun activities they both enjoy. Matches typically meet for a couple of hours each week or every other week. Some Bigs meet their…
missionStatement: Big Brothers Big Sisters is the oldest, largest and most effective youth mentoring organization in the United States. Our mission is to provide children facing adversity with strong and enduring, professionally supported 1-to-1 relationships that change their lives for the better, forever. Independent research shows that the Big Brothers Big Sisters model of professionally supported relationships between young people and their adult mentors has a direct, measurable and lasting impact. Children in our program perform better in school, are less likely to skip classes and school days, and more likely to avoid risky, unhealthy behaviors and have higher self-esteem and aspirations.
organizationDescription: Big Brothers Big Sisters holds itself accountable to demonstrating outcomes in three critical areas for our Little Brothers and Little Sisters:

title: VA: Charlottesville area - drive cancer patients to treatment
description:
Help cancer patients in your community get to life-saving medical appointments.


Volunteers with Road To Recovery use their personal vehicle to drive patients with limited or no transportation to cancer-related treatment appointments.


Rides are weekdays. You choose the rides that work with your schedule. Drivers are encouraged to provide a minimum of 2 rides per month.


Volunteer drivers are ages 18-84 with

• a safe driving record,
• a current license,
• a reliable vehicle, and vehicle insurance…
missionStatement: The American Cancer Society is the nationwide, community-based, voluntary health organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer, through research, education, advocacy, and service. Help us end cancer as we know it., for everyone.
organizationDescription: The American Cancer Society is a global grassroots force of nearly 2 million volunteers dedicated to saving lives, celebrating lives, and leading the fight for a world without cancer. From breakthrough research, to free lodging near treatment, a 24/7/365 live helpline, free rides to treatment, and convening powerful activists to create awareness and impact, the Society is the only organization attacking cancer from every angle.

title: Mentor at C4K!
description:
MENTORING at C4K...Mentors provide weekly, hour-long, sessions over one semester (4 months). Learning partners spend their time engaging in hands-on activities, learning new skills, exploring software applications, and producing projects that have meaning and relevance in their lives. Each pair’s projects represent an investment of time and effort together and result in the demonstration of mastery of new skills.

1:1 Mentoring

Get matched with one of our youth members and work on exciting STEAM projects together.
missionStatement: We combine mentoring and technology to prepare youth for brighter futures!
organizationDescription: Inspire the next generation by becoming a mentor for youth at C4K.

title: Greeters / front desk help needed!
description: The Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society (ACHS) is preparing to open its doors! We need some friendly faces to welcome visitors to the Historical Society, tell them about ACHS programs and projects, and point them to other great things to do in the Charlottesville area. If you like meeting people and sharing your knowledge of all things Cville, please contact us!
missionStatement: The Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society nurtures and promotes awareness and appreciation of local history by encouraging the identification, collection, study, and preservation of the materials of history; by striving for excellence and quality in research and interpretation of collections and local history; and by disseminating knowledge through educational activities, so that the past may shed light on the present and the future.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1940, the Albemarle Charlottesville Historical Society (Society) is a private, non-profit educational organization (IRS 501 (c) 3) that seeks to study, preserve, and promote the history of Charlottesville and Albemarle County, Virginia. The Society is a membership organization, open to all, and receives no continuing operating support from federal, state or local governments but rather relies on membership fees, gifts and donations, and grants from private foundations. The Society's research library, administered by a librarian on the staff of the Jefferson-Madison Regional Library, contains over 2,000 books and bound periodicals, as well as manuscripts, maps, pamphlets, newspapers, and vertical files relating to the history of our community. Additionally, the archival collection contains over 1,500 artifacts of historical significance to Charlottesville and Albemarle County in addition to over 60,000 photographic images. The Society is located in downtown Charlottesville in the historic McIntire Building. Designed in the Beaux Arts style by architect Walter Dabney Blair, the McIntire Buidling was completed in 1921 and donated by local civic benefactor Paul Goodloe McIntire to the City of Charlottesville as the city's first municipal library. Following an extensive renovation by the Society of this city-owned building in 1993 and the Society moved into it in January 1994.

title: Help keep our gardens beautiful!
description:
I would love to have your help at our home and peaceful gardens in Charlottesville, southwest of Washington, DC. We're next to the University of Virginia - so there is plenty to do.


If you prefer, there are peaceful forests at the end of our street and many great walks and hiking trails nearby in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains. We are in wine-producing country, among much of America's early history.


The city has many cafes and restaurants, concerts and a good cultural life. You can also see a short video about the town at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aQ0QhUX0634  I need help with some landscaping, and a few jobs in the house.  We…
missionStatement: Our non-profit foundation encourages personal and national renewal through America's founding principles of faith, liberty, and compassionate entrepreneurship.
organizationDescription: The American Renewal Foundation was founded in May 1995, so it is in its twentieth year. The Foundation supports classical music in broadcast and performance, particularly in our area. The volunteer opportunity is part is our student program, which hosts overseas and American students for short-term internships. The Foundation arranges travel opportunities around the world for our students, including visits to Europe, Israel and other countries, annual trips to the Caribbean to study marine life, as well as any other interesting destinations.

title: Virginia Host Families for Amazing Exchange Students (Charlottesville)
description:
Opportunity for families & individuals in Charlottesville and surrounding area ! Ready to have a fun experience? Ready to enjoy some cultural diversity? Ready to get inspired?


Invite an international high school student to your home for a few weeks, a semester or even a full school year! Hosting is an amazing experience that will enrich, not only yourself and your family, but also schools and the entire community. Host families come in all shapes and sizes. You may be a single parent, an empty-nester, a couple with or without children - All family dynamics are welcome!


Our students are 15-18 years old and they come from Europe, Asia, Oceania and Latin America. They are carefully selected and come with…
missionStatement: ICES is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting a peaceful world by increasing international awareness and understanding through cultural sharing experiences. As the global community we live in becomes increasingly interdependent and subject to change, today's young people will face numerous challenges on the journey to becoming tomorrow's leaders. We believe the foreign student exchange experience helps young people of all nationalities embrace those challenges and discover new opportunities that will help them dream and achieve more than they ever thought possible.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1991, ICES is a nonprofit organization dedicated to increasing awareness and understanding among the peoples of the world. ICES has accomplished this goal for many thousands of exchange student through its dedicated volunteers and international partners.

title: WHEELSFORALL Members for High School and College students
description:
WHEELSFORALL is looking for active members for its cause of helping families in under supported causes all over the world. Be part of the change and take action within the multiple departments of our organization. Get the ability to refine abilities and use your skills to help others in need. We have multiple opportunities within:

• Social Media Team
• Podcast Team
• Science Team ( Biology, Chem, and Psychology)
• Business Team
• Website Team
• Engineering Team


Get to work with multiple students across the world and be part of the active member community. Join us!
missionStatement: We are a high school student-led non-profit organization dedicated to help provide free and reliable transportation to low income families.
organizationDescription: WHEELSFORALL is a national non-profit organization that works on providing resources to low income families. We have donated over 100 bikes across 4 states and thrive to help the community in multiple areas. The organization is high school student led in order for the youth to have active engagement within the community. We have also helped hundreds of families with free public tutoring, care packages, and food drives in order to spread out the ways we can help our community. WHEELSFORALL has one goal: to help its community it any way it can and have an impact on someone's life.

title: Help Adults Learn English Through Literacy Tutoring-Learn More!
description:
Literacy Volunteers Charlottesville/Albemarle is seeking volunteer tutors to assist adults in learning how to read, write, or speak English. Many of our students are refugees and immigrants.


Wondering if becoming a tutor is right for you? Come to an information session to learn more about our mission, our students, and what it takes to be a literacy volunteer. This one hour session is a virtual and held on Zoom. You can learn more or register directly at literacyforall.org/tutors


Please note that volunteer tutors need to reside in the Greater Charlottesville, Virginia area.
missionStatement: LVCA promotes adult literacy through equitable, inclusive, free, confidential, one-to-one English and Citizenship tutoring.
organizationDescription: We believe all adults should have the ability to understand, speak, read, write, and communicate in English so that they can fully participate in our community.

title: VA Charlottesville: Help solve America's pollution problem.
description:
Volunteer working on the environment and climate change with our grassroots climate group!


CCL volunteers work with their community and members of Congress on climate change solutions. We are organized into more than 450 local chapters across the U.S.


Your activities might include:

• Educating the community about global warming and legislative solutions
• Meeting with congressional leaders
• Writing letters to the editor
• Hosting film screenings and panel conversations
• Meeting with local media…
missionStatement: We build political will for a livable world.
organizationDescription: CCL empowers everyday people to work with their community and their members of Congress on climate change solutions. Our supporters cover the political spectrum and work in more than 450 local chapters. Together, we’re building support for big solutions to climate change.

title: Cook a meal for your neighbor in need in the Charlottesville, VA area
description: Lasagna Love is a global movement with thousands of people cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: we feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during this time full of uncertainty and stress.Lasagna Love matches neighbors who can provide a meal with a neighbor who needs a little help. You can decide how often you participate - once a month, multiple lasagnas weekly, or somewhere in between. You decide how far you can drive to deliver a meal, and if you can accommodate special diets like vegetarian or gluten free. The Lasagna Love Team does the best to match you with a neighbor in need…
missionStatement: Lasagna Love was started at the beginning of the pandemic, when the founder of Good to Mama was looking for a way to help moms in her community. She and her toddler started making and delivering meals to families in the neighborhood who were struggling, whether that struggle was financial, emotional, or simply a feeling of overwhelm. Lasagna Love has since grown into a global grassroots movement, with thousands of people all cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families, but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during a time full of uncertainty and stress.
organizationDescription: Thousands of volunteers in all 50 states, Canada and Australia delivering home-cooked meals to spread love and kindness.

title: Charlottesville, VA Host an exchange student - Volunteer families/Individuals needed
description:
Volunteer to Host a Foreign Exchange Student in your town and surrounding areas!! Benefit from opening your home and heart to an exchange student for a term during the upcoming high school year by: - Making life-long friendship connections abroad - Giving a young person an opportunity to immerse themselves in our American culture and your family - Gaining an international son/daughter


- Gain new perspectives on our American way of life through the eyes of your exchange student…
missionStatement: NWSE believes international exchanges maximize intercultural understanding and motivate participants, including host families, to familiarize themselves with different cultures, thereby broadening their horizons and contributing to increased international respect and cooperation. Furthermore, by developing their intercultural understanding and ability to solve problems in a global context, student participants gain invaluable skills as they enter the world job market.
organizationDescription: NWSE places international high school students with host families and high schools in the United States for periods of one semester or one academic year. NWSE offers similar programs to US students who want to student abroad. NWSE works through area representatives (called Academic Coordinators), who recruit hosts and schools and monitor programs throughout the students' exchanges.

title: Volunteers for Charlottesville CureSearch for Children's Cancer Walk
description: YOU are the driving force behind the next breakthrough in children's cancer research. The CureSearch Walk brings supporters together to raise critical funds to drive the development of safer, more effective treatments for the more than 15,000 children diagnosed every year. As we walk, we'll honor and remember all those affected by this devastating disease.We Need a few volunteers to help set up, work registration, assist with directing walkers, run activity booths and breakdown.Come by a part of a wonderful community event in Charlottesville!
missionStatement: Our mission is to end childhood cancer by driving targeted and innovative research with measurable results in an accelerated time frame.
organizationDescription: CureSearch for Children’s Cancer is a national non-profit foundation that accelerates the search for cures for children’s cancer by driving innovation, transcending research barriers and solving the field’s most challenging problems. We fight every day to make treatments and cures possible for the 47 children diagnosed with cancer each day. We do this in three ways:

title: Family/Group/Individual volunteering
description: Days and times flexible. We welcome from 1 to many volunteers, project depending. We have outdoor projects perfect for a family/household and mostly outdoor work.Fence painting? Trail clearing? Firewood chopping and stacking? Pick up sticks in riding ring (great for kids)!Also some remote options - Web design? Grant Research? More!
missionStatement: Camp Holiday Trails creates a community that empowers children and teens with medical needs to thrive.
organizationDescription: Camp Holiday Trails offers children with chronic illnesses the opportunity to take the same positive risks as their healthy peers in an environment that is safe and medically supervised. Our families live every day knowing the physical, emotional, and financial burdens associated with having a child with a chronic illness. Camp Holiday Trails offers an opportunity for these parents to sleep "with both eyes closed" knowing their child’s medical needs are being met by a caring staff of counselors, medical/nursing students, and healthcare professionals.

Recruiting Organization: Live Life With Purpose International, Inc


We are in need of volunteers and leads to manage our concession stand at Virginia Cavaliers Games. This opportunity will help build our community and we would like for you to be apart of it.

missionStatement: To bridge the gap between intention and action in order to bring about social impact.
organizationDescription: Idealist is a leading online global resource for finding jobs in the nonprofit sector, as well as volunteer opportunities and graduate school programs for social impact.

title: Looking for help at Virginia Cavaliers games
description: We are in need of volunteers and leads to manage our concession stand at Virginia Cavaliers Games. This opportunity will help build our community and we would like for you to be apart of it.
missionStatement: At Alenza Wellness Community Outreach, our mission is to improve our community by implementing physical and emotional betterment by practicing healthy habits one day at a time.
organizationDescription: This was developed due to my mom passing 8 years ago from a massive heart attack and sister passing prior to that with breast cancer. I realize that i need to get up and get moving and impact and influence our community with betterment by practicing heathy habits through exercising and being active.I am assisting title one school in Clayton County that is active with dance, football and etc.

title: Companionship for Hospice patients and their families
description: Companionship volunteers are needed to visit with and enrich the quality of life for a patient with a life-shortening diagnosis who is receiving hospice care. This program, with adequate training, allows volunteers to be matched one on one with a patient. The volunteer will be able to have his/her autonomy to choose various ways to offer kindness through companionship, which may include general dialogue, reading, sharing musical talents, and at times just simply holding their hand. The volunteer can also set their own schedule that is convenient for both parties. Typically, a volunteer would make a companionship visit 2-4 times monthly from approx. 30 minutes to a couple of hours. Additionally, visits could involve helping the family cope by offering respite time as the family member runs errands or running errands for them, helping with light housework or helping to prepare meals. Whether you are retired, a student needing volunteer hours, or just want to make a difference for others, this is an extremely meaningful and rewarding way to contribute to your community.

title: Gallery Assistant/ Volunteer
description:
Join the Lower East Side arts community by becoming a volunteer at Cuchifritos Gallery + Project Space! Through monthly artist/curator discussions, visitor engagement, and community outreach, our volunteers develop their interest and understanding of the non-profit local arts organization, while providing general operative assistance for our artist and curator-centered gallery.


Cuchifritos Gallery + Project Space is dedicated to supporting and strengthening the careers of emerging and underrepresented artists and independent curators. Uniquely situated inside the Essex Street Market, Cuchifritos’ position outside of the borders and confines of traditional art venues compels artists, curators, and audience members to interrogate, study and analyze questions of ethics, immigration, ecology, and power amongst the orderly chaos of the market space. Cuchifritos responds to…
missionStatement: Cuchifritos Gallery + Project Space is a program of Artists Alliance Inc (AAI), a 501c3 not for profit organization located on the Lower East Side. We provide exhibition opportunities to hundreds of independent curators and emerging underrepresented artists. The gallery's location inside the Essex Street Market creates a distinct opportunity to directly engage with the local community about contemporary art. AAI is interested in promoting contemporary artwork in all media, to be shown within a local community setting, though we do not promote community-based art. We seek exhibitions featuring the work of emerging and underrepresented contemporary artists and the curators who seek to exhibit these artists work in a clear and concise context. In addition, we are particularly interested in exhibits that may relate to the Essex Market or Lower East Side area.
organizationDescription: Cuchifritos operates by inviting independent curators to submit proposals. In addition, anyone wishing to submit a proposal may do so by following the submission policy and guidelines listed on our website. Each Spring a curatorial advisory committee composed of curators and arts professionals from diverse backgrounds choose exhibits from the submissions. Cuchifritos presents contemporary art exhibits featuring the work of emerging or under represented artists, and exhibits involving a clear conceptual theme structured to put the work of these artists in context. The gallery's location is designed to underscore the community value of The Essex Street Market by provoking interaction and debate between the multi-cultural local community and the artwork presented.

title: Pro bono attorneys assisting homeless New Yorkers
description:
University Community Social Services, a 42 year old, Lower East Side all volunteer emergency food and social service program, is seeking pro bono attorneys to assist homeless New Yorkers with legal matters. Saturdays either morning shift 8:30 am to 10:30 am or afternoon shift 1:00 pm to 2:30 pm.


www.meatloafkitchen.org
missionStatement: We serve a wholesome, freshly made meal each Saturday - one that we are happy to eat ourselves - in a respectful atmosphere to anyone who comes through our doors, no questions asked. We provide a welcoming place of respite for our guests and offer vital social services to those in need. We do this with an all-volunteer staff, without a single employee.
organizationDescription: Our History University Community Social Services was founded in 1982 by two university professors who saw a great need among the many homeless people in their neighborhood. Together they started a temporary - or so they thought - soup kitchen open to anyone who needed sustenance. Over 25 years later, we’re still going strong, and the need is still great. Long ago, we figured out that meatloaf is a nourishing comfort food that makes a much better meal than soup. We make our meatloaf using an original recipe that we have perfected over the years. People love it, and we have come over time to be known as "The Meatloaf People." Hunger doesn't take a vacation. Every week since our inception, through blackouts, heat waves, blizzards, and even the terrorist attack of 9-11, the kitchen has been there, serving literally hundreds of thousands of meals to needy New Yorkers. Our Philosophy We've learned that just as good food nourishes the body, respect nourishes the soul. Our soup kitchen was one of the first to seat and serve its guests with the courtesy one might find at a restaurant, as opposed to the traditional food line. Despite our name, we are not affiliated with any university nor are we associated with any religious organization. Our volunteers come from all walks of life, bound together only by our shared desire to lend a helping hand to those in need.

title: Volunteer Online as a Conversation Partner
description:
Are you ready to change a life from the comfort of home?


Join ENGin as a conversation partner! This is a flexible and unique opportunity to make a direct impact on someone’s life while discovering a new culture and meeting a new friend.


We’ll pair you up with a buddy in Ukraine for weekly videochats at times that are convenient for you. During your conversations, you’ll practice English with your partner, learn about each other’s cultures, and offer an empathetic, authentic space for connection.


No teaching experience or knowledge of Ukrainian is required to volunteer with us. All of our participants can understand and hold a basic conversation in English. We offer ample training resources, session…
missionStatement: ENGin is a nonprofit organization changing the world one conversation at a time. We connect English-speaking volunteers age 13+ with motivated Ukrainians for online speaking practice and cross-cultural exchange. Through simple weekly virtual conversations, our volunteers make a huge impact - helping young people overcome the language barrier, offering friendship and emotional support, and introducing them to a new culture. In a time of extreme stress for Ukrainians, weekly one-on-one conversations offer a lifeline of normalcy.
organizationDescription: We help Ukrainian youth connect with the global community by empowering them to speak fluent, conversational English. Our work breaks down borders to catalyze Ukraine’s postwar reconstruction and longer-term economic and social development.

title: Fundraising Internship

missionStatement: The Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space (MoRUS) seeks to preserve history and promote scholarship of grassroots urban space activism by researching and archiving efforts to create community spaces, focusing especially on the efforts in the East Village and Lower East Side. We will also exhibit materials that document these actions, to educate people on the political implications of reclaimed space.
organizationDescription: The Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space (MoRUS) is a living archive of the Lower East Side’s squats and gardens. Located in the storefront of a historic building in the East Village of New York, the museum displays materials such as photographs, posters, zines, underground newspapers, comics, banners and buttons that show how local residents cleaned up vacant lots and buildings in the area, and made them organizing spaces for the community. The museum also offers tours on Saturdays and Sundays, which lead participants to the East Village’s most legendary community gardens, squats and sites of social change, and explain their compelling and rich histories.

title: Volunteer as Grant Writer!
description:
Are you a skilled grant writer passionate about making a difference? Join our international team and help secure crucial funding to support our organization's activities. Whether you're an experienced grant writer or seeking practical experience, we value your commitment and expertise.


As a volunteer, you will collaborate closely with our dedicated team to craft compelling grant applications. Your writing skills and technical knowledge will be essential in securing grants and expanding our impact. Stay informed about grant programs to enhance our success.


Our innovative programs have garnered praise, but we need your help to broaden our reach and deepen our impact. Whether you have a track record of successful grant writing or are exploring this field, including through internships, we encourage you to get involved. If you care about our work in Uganda and have exceptional writing skills, sign up today!


Together, we can drive positive change through effective grant writing. Join us and become a vital part of our mission in Uganda.
missionStatement: We are dedicated to enhancing the well-being of marginalized communities by offering them access to education, healthcare, clean water, and essential necessities. Our mission extends further to fostering gender equality and empowerment in order to create lasting transformations within Ugandan societies and alleviate poverty on a national scale.
organizationDescription: Murphy Charitable Foundation is a legally registered humanitarian non-profit organization situated in Uganda. Since its establishment in 2018, our organization has been actively involved in operating within Eastern Uganda, specifically collaborating with local communities residing in the Bukedea district and the surrounding areas of North-eastern Uganda. Having witnessed the profound suffering endured by vulnerable individuals grappling with the consequences of poverty on a daily basis, we have developed a range of projects aimed at tackling the underlying causes of this social issue. The primary objective of Murphy Charitable Foundation Uganda is to advocate for and provide assistance to individuals residing below the poverty line in Ugandan communities, thereby addressing the root causes of poverty.

description: MJHS Hospice has need of administrative volunteers for the office at 55 Water St., NY,NY 10038. missionStatement: MJHS Hospice is committed to the highest standard of quality care and seeks to be the premier provider of health services ensuring access to health and support to the greater New York City area.
organizationDescription: MJHS has one of the largest and most respected not-for-profit hospice programs in the region, offering hospice patients care when and where they need it: at home, in assisted living communities, nursing homes and hospitals across Greater New York. MJHS helps adult and pediatric patients and their families live life to the fullest when dealing with a life-limiting illness by easing suffering, upholding dignity, affirming values and improving quality of life. Building the bridges and finding the common ground for BIPOC communities to be supported in the areas of Food Insecurity, Food Waste, Nutritional Literacy, Health Equity, Food Justice and Sustainability are at the problem center of what needs to addressed in our communities in a very urgent way to comprehensively uplift our communities.


We are seeking persons knowledgeable about "philanthropy" and play a…
missionStatement: The BCA is a nationwide non-profit educational and networking organization of hospitality and food service professionals. Incorporated as a 501(c)(3) in 1998, our mission is to create exposure and provide educational and professional opportunities for culinary and hospitality professionals of color. We accomplish this objective by providing quality educational and employment resources, job coaching, mentoring and assistance with placement, and networking support. Additionally, the BCA exposes inner-city high school students to the culinary arts through workshops and opportunities that introduce culinary arts as a viable career option.
organizationDescription: In 1993, three graduates of the Culinary Institute of America in Hyde Park, NY, including the current president, Alex Askew, met to discuss issues concerning African-Americans in the culinary and hospitality industries. The resulting organization, the Black Culinarian Alliance, was created to analyze and address the lack of education, awareness and exposure for African-Americans in these fields. The Black Culinarian Alliance would prove beneficial for both African-Americans and the culinary and hospitality industries. With education as a cornerstone, the organization moved forward in promoting career opportunities for African-Americans in the culinary and hospitality fields. Operating as the Black Culinarian Alumni Chapter of the Culinary Institute of America, it was the first membership of its kind for minority graduates of a culinary institution. Incorporated as the Black Culinarian Alliance in 1998, and now known simply as the BCA, membership is composed of all ethnic groups and represents one of the largest percentages of professional women in the industry. Embracing this inclusion and understanding the rapidly growing multicultural audience and marketplace, the BCA continues with its objectives and remains focused on its mission as it pertains to all culinary professionals and students of color.

missionStatement: City Relief is a mobile outreach offering people experiencing poverty and homelessness hot meals, supplies, and connections to resources for housing, employment, and health care. These connections change people’s lives. Our Approach: Visiting the same eight locations weekly, we provide a safe place to welcome our guests, share a meal, and discuss solutions to issues they may be facing.
organizationDescription: HistoryIn 1989, City Relief was founded in New York City by Richard + Dixie Galloway. For over 34 years, we've helped transform the lives of those experiencing homelessness & poverty. Today, we foster inclusive communities and create a network of care to assist people as they rebuild their lives.ImpactIn 2022 we served 61,187 Guests by providing 47,686 Meals, and 4,320 Personalized Action Plans, alongside our amazing Volunteers who served 9,891 hours with City Relief!We mobilize over 2,000 volunteers a year - and whether it's your first time or your hundredth time, you have something unique to bring to the table. Volunteers transform lives, and in the process are transformed themselves. Our volunteers are beacons of hope and connection to hurting and isolated people.

missionStatement: We are a relationship-building program that brings isolated people into greater community life. We then support voluntary advocates as they strive to understand, represent, and respond to the interests of their partner. Our vision is a future where the world is keenly aware of the problems people with disabilities face. That knowledge prompts radical personal action to address those needs. Inclusion replaces exclusion, as communities grow in strength and diversity.

missionStatement: Louie's Legacy Animal Rescue is a positive, professional 501(c)3 rescue charity that helps our community and shelter partners save more animals, more quickly by rescuing them, temporarily caring for them in our excellent, supportive foster homes and matching them with fantastic adoptive pet parents.
organizationDescription: Our StoryThe story of Louie’s Legacy started in 2006 when our founder Emily met a Basset Hound mix with red fur and different colored eyes living at a shelter with a 99% euthanasia rate. Not long after bringing him home, Louie was diagnosed with heartworm disease. Some suggested taking him back to the shelter, but Emily refused. Louie was more than just a pet. He brought joy into her life and gave her something to care about and love outside of herself. And in the process of healing Louie, she found that he healed her too. Emily soon realized the overwhelming number of shelter animals whose lives were cut short. Louie could have easily been the same. Instead, he became an incredible catalyst for her mission and the inspiration for Louie’s Legacy. Since then, we've saved thousands ofanimals and become one of the nation's largest foster-based rescues. Our goal is to save as many animals as possible and to expand our reach to help in even more areas, especially those that struggle with high populations of homeless and neglected animals.In 2021, we saved the lives of more than 3,200 animals thanks to the generosity of our volunteers, fosters and donors.

title: Hope and Heritage Gala
description:
Join us for the ninth annual  St. Jude Hope and Heritage Gala in New York City on April 26, 2025. Guests can enjoy cocktails, dinner, a live auction, a Give to Live paddle raise, dancing and more to benefit the lifesaving mission of  St. Jude: Finding cures. Saving children.(r)


The  St. Jude Hope and Heritage Gala honors the inspiring legacy of Danny Thomas, founder of  St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, and celebrates his Middle Eastern heritage. Danny founded ALSAC (American Lebanese Syrian Associated Charities) in 1957 as a fundraising and awareness organization. The generous contributions of the Middle Eastern community, both then and now, have been integral to fulfilling Danny’s vision that "no child should die in the dawn of life."


All proceeds from this event benefit  St. Jude, where families never…
missionStatement: Finding cures. Saving children.
organizationDescription: St Jude Children's Research Hospital is internationally recognized for its pioneering work in finding cures and saving children with cancer and other catastrophic diseases. Founded by late entertainer Danny Thomas and based in Memphis, Tennessee, St. Jude freely shares its discoveries with scientific and medical communities around the world. No family ever pays for treatments not covered by insurance, and families without insurance are never asked to pay. St Jude is financially supported by ALSAC, its fund-raising organization. For more information, please visit www.stjude.org or call 1-800-822-6344.

title: Volunteers Needed for upcoming Social Event ("Coffee House") for Holocaust Survivors (Forest Hills)
description:

Volunteers will play a crucial role in helping in the following ways: setup before the event (tables/decorations); greeting guests, serving refreshments; engaging with the surivors in meanginful conversation…
missionStatement: Selfhelp is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to maintaining the independence and dignity of seniors and at-risk populations through a spectrum of housing, home health care, and social services and will lead in applying new methods and technologies to address changing needs of its community. Selfhelp will continue to serve as the "last surviving relative" to its historic constituency, victims of Nazi persecution.
organizationDescription: Selfhelp is A private, non-sectarian, not-for-profit 501 (c) (3) organization, Selfhelp was founded in 1936 by a small group of refugees fleeing persecution during the Holocaust. Our history is rich and varied because throughout it, we have continued to respond to anyone in need. Our mission has always been to help older adults live happy, independent lives in their own homes with services that help maintain their health and safety. Today, Selfhelp offers 20,000 aging, frail and "at-risk" New Yorkers a comprehensive network of social service, senior housing and home care services. It is also the oldest and largest provider of Nazi victim services in North America. For almost seven decades, Selfhelp has dedicated itself to being a source of information, service, community, and quality home care for New Yorkers.

title: IVC seeks Active Seniors in New York
description: The Ignatian Volunteer Corps (IVC) exists to address the greatest social needs of New York City Metro area with the experience and skills of mature adults. Ignatian Volunteers, men and women age 50 and older, donate approximately two days of service per week and are supported and sustained by IVC's unique spiritual reflection program.
missionStatement: The Ignatian Volunteer Corps (IVC) harnesses the expertise of individuals over 50 who have the passion and commitment to direct their attention to issues impacting their region. Service Corps Members use their time and experience to give back and make a difference. They are leaders of change, offering vital resources to organizations, churches and schools that are at the heart of these struggling communities. Through their direct service among the materially poor, members enter the lived experience of others, showing respect for the dignity and equality of those they serve and serve with.
organizationDescription: IVC works in partnership with hundreds of community partner organizations. These nonprofit organizations provide IVC Service Corps Members with substantive work to serve individuals who have slipped through this country’s safety net. And hundreds of community organizations are on waiting lists to get an IVC corps member.

title: ESL Teachers for Adult Immigrants
description: Institute for Immigrant Concerns, a not-for-profit providing ESOL classes for adult immigrants and refugees, started in 1997, is looking for ESL instructors. Must have Bachelor's or MA Degree and at least 2 years of English teaching experience (whether domestic or abroad). Our students are all motivated and studious adults. We put great emphasis on survival English, employment and cross-cultural awareness. Applicants should be available twice a week, on Tuesdays and Thursdays for our morning or evening classes (10 am -12 pm/6 - 8 pm).We are currently looking for ESL teachers for a 6-week session, and welcome anyone with the potential of teaching future cycles.Applicants must send us a copy of their resume and a brief cover letter.
missionStatement: The mission of the Institute for Immigrant Concerns is providing adult immigrants and refugees of all nationalities with English language skills, as well employment preparation and placement, so that they can gain social and economic independence. In addition we provide pro bono psychological services to refugees and those who most need it. The Institute is a citywide program, attracting students who reside in every borough of New York City.
organizationDescription: Since its inception in 1997, the Institute has provided services to more than 8,000 immigrants, refugees, and asylees from 110 countries. Annually, we serve over 500 immigrants in New York, 25% of whom are refugees and asylees. The Institute offers English classes on three instructional levels, as well as conversation, pronunciation, and computer classes. We are currently co-located with a local worker's education non-profit.

title: Associate Board
description:
We are seeking dynamic, passionate individuals to help found our Associate Board at Droste Mental Health Services, Inc, an agency committed to making mental health services affordable and accessible. The Associate Board brings together a smart, diverse and enthusiastic group of young people to broaden their professional and social circles while helping to strengthen and build upon Droste’s mental health service programs.

As part of the board, you will play a crucial role in organizing events, spreading awareness, and driving our mission forward by connecting with communities and supporters.

missionStatement: For the past 40 years, Droste Mental Health Services, Inc. has been driven by the belief that everyone deserves compassionate mental health care. We've provided thousands of clients in the New York metropolitan area with excellent and affordable services. What started with two volunteers committed to giving back to the community has grown into a team of over 20 providers who serve hundreds of clients annually. Our clinicians, coming from diverse backgrounds and clinical expertise, share a unified mission: providing excellent and affordable therapy. Though our roots are Catholic, our therapy services are not religiously based. We welcome people from all backgrounds, religions, and identities, particularly those in the LGBTQ+ and BIPOC communities who have faced discrimination.
organizationDescription: Droste offers individual, group, couples, and family counseling. Our main programs include:

title: Licensed Social Worker for Mommy's Heart, Inc. to Support Abused and Neglected Children
description:
Volunteer Opportunity: We are seeking licensed social workers (LMSW or LCSW) to participate in our pro-bono mental health program to provide free therapy to abused parents and children facing retaliatory lawfare by their abusers in court. Work schedule and time commitment are determined by volunteer. Therapy may be conducted remotely or in person as agreed to by the patient. Meetings with the executive director of Mommy's Heart may be conducted virtually or in person at the office during designated times. No minimum time commitment required.


More about Mommy's Heart: Mommy's Heart, Inc. (EIN #87-4833078) is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit organization, which provides free legal representation and mental health services to parents and children, who escaped domestic abuse but are now facing legal and financial retaliation by their abusers in the family court system. Mommy’s Heart aims to protect and defend the fundamental rights of fit parents to direct the care and custody of their…
missionStatement: Mommy’s Heart, Inc. is a 501 (c) 3 nonprofit organization, which provides free legal representation and mental health services to fit mothers and children, who have been subjected to intimate partner violence and have been victimized by the abuses and civil rights violations of the family court system.
organizationDescription: The family court system lacks essential domestic violence training and disproportionately favors men over women, allowing alleged abusers to weaponize the court system and use the child as a pawn to perpetuate the torture of their ex partner, who is often punished for speaking out about the abuse. In a 2019 study conducted by George Washington University Law school professor Joan S. Meier, mothers, who reported child abuse, lost custody of their children to their abusers 30 to 50 percent of the time. Custody litigation can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars and has depleted many families of the necessary resources to fight and protect the best interests of their children. High conflict custody cases further exacerbated by family court abuses and civil rights violations make finding competent legal counsel with expertise in this area that much more expensive and challenging. The stress of navigating a very dysfunctional family court system corrupted by special interests stacked against the protective mother and the safety and well-being of her child is traumatizing in and of itself, especially when that mother has just escaped an abusive partner and is now faced with the fear and possibility of losing her child to her abusive ex. Counseling and other therapeutic and supportive services by licensed mental health professionals are essential to helping these women validate their experiences, cope, heal, and maintain their emotional and psychological strength while combating a parent's worst nightmare.

missionStatement: At the "I Have A Dream" Foundation, we provide individualized social, emotional, and academic support to young people ("Dreamers") from under-resourced communities from kindergarten all the way through college, along with guaranteed tuition support. We believe that when given equal access to the resources they need to succeed, all children can ignite their innate potential and achieve their dreams. Since "I Have A Dream" was founded by Eugene Lang in 1981, we have served nearly 18,000 Dreamers in over 200 programs nationally.
organizationDescription: 90% of Dreamers graduate High School, compared to 74% of low-income students nationally.Dreamers are over 3x more likely to earn a bachelor's degree than their low-income peers.College graduates earn, on average, an additional $1 Million in lifetime earnings.

title: Volunteer Guides Needed to Bring Music to New York City!
description:
Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call (MOC) needs YOU to help us spread the healing power of music to those who need it most!


Volunteer Guides (non-musicians) escort Volunteer Musicians room to room as they play music for patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments.


The Volunteer Guide acts as the "eyes and ears" during the MOC Bedside shift and is the liaison between the hospital, patient, and the Volunteer Musician. Volunteer Guides are critical to the success of MOC Bedside and get to experience the healing power of music firsthand without having to be a musician themselves…
missionStatement: Musicians On Call, a nonprofit organization formed in 1999, brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call uses music to promote and complement the healing process for patients, families and caregivers.
organizationDescription: Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. We are looking for VOLUNTEER GUIDES and VOLUNTEER MUSICIANS to help us deliver the healing power of music. As a volunteer with Musicians On Call, you can brighten the days of hospitalized patients - a truly rewarding experience. MOC currently has volunteer opportunities for both Volunteer Guides and Volunteer Musicians at our weekly Bedside Performance Programs.

title: Community Companions Volunteer
description:
Providing safe and socially assited accompaniment for Lenox Hill Neighborhood House Older Adult Center members to destinations in their community, included but not limited to, errands and appointments. Neighborhood House Older Adults Center memebers being escorted are unable to travel independently due to mobility, vision, hearing, or cognitive impairments.


We are especially looking for volunteers who are comfortable traveling throughout Manhattan, including Upper Manhattan. Many of our members are unable to travel independently due to mobility, vision, hearing, or cognitive impairments. Your support helps ensure they can remain connected to essential services and their community in a safe and dignified way.
missionStatement: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 131-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services--social, educational, legal, health, housing, mental health, nutritional and fitness--which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year, ages 3 to 103, on the East Side of Manhattan. Our clients include older adults, homeless and formerly homeless adults, children and families, recent immigrants, disabled persons, adult learners and thousands more. For information on Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, please visit our website at www.lenoxhill.org or connect with us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/LenoxHillNeighborhoodHouse/.
organizationDescription: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House was founded in 1894 by the Alumnae Association of Normal College (now known as Hunter College of the City University of New York) as a free kindergarten for the children of indigent immigrants. Since then, we have remained at the forefront of community advocacy and social and educational change.

title: Chinese-Speaking Friendly Visitor Hospice Volunteers
organization: VNS Health - Hospice Care (formerly Visiting Nurse Service of New York)
description:
The role of the VNS Health Hospice Care Volunteer is that of a professional friendly visitor, providing a supportive, caring presence for patients, caregivers & families. Our goal is to provide comfort, care and compassion to our patients & families during what is often a difficult time. Some of the ways that volunteers help, include: visiting to ease social isolation, providing companionship & socialization, being an active listener, reading aloud, listening to music, playing games, providing a quiet presence, helping with organizational projects and more.


Volunteers with special skills, such as singing, playing musical instruments, hairstyling, cosmetology, pet therapy, etc. are also needed. We are also seeking multilingual volunteers in all boroughs.

organizationDescription: VNS Health Hospice: Comfort, relief, and peace of mind - that’s what you can expect with hospice care from VNS Health.As you or your loved one faces an advanced illness, you can count on VNS Health. From pain and symptom management, to time with family and friends, to emotional support and spiritual care, the VNS Health Hospice Care team is your trusted partner.VNS Health Hospice Care provides expert, compassionate care for individuals and families living with progressive, serious illness at the end of life.

title: Preparing and distributing dinner to those in need
description:
Thanks for your interest in volunteering at Monday Night Hospitality! We are always looking for new people to join our team and we're excited to meet you. No experience is necessary, just energy and a willingness to help our neighbors in need on Manhattan's Upper East Side. Adult of all ages welcome.  Youth volunteers are welcome if they are accompanied by a responsible adult for the first few weeks.


Reach out though our website: https://www.mondaynighthospitality.org/volunteer-form
missionStatement: Each Monday night we offer hot meals are prepared from fresh ingredients, packaged, and distributed with a healthy dose of love and respect for all persons. We also partner with the Gotham Food Pantry to distribute pantry staples and fresh produce. We live our Unitarian Universalist principles, especially our belief in the inherent worth and dignity of all persons, and our belief in justice, equity and compassion in human relations.
organizationDescription: Monday Night Hospitality has been in continuous operation since 1981. Our dedicated teams of volunteers cook, package and distribute 400+ meals each week. A typical meal includes a protein (chicken or a vegan option), pasta or rice, and a vegetable. Meal bags include the packaged hot meal along with water, fruit, bread, and a dessert. We offer meals to take away, and have returned to offering seated, restaurant-style meals in our spacious hall and served by volunteers.

missionStatement: The House of Good Deeds builds community, leads by example, and improves the world through Altruism, one Good Deed at a time: everyone, everywhere, every day. Our vision grows the HoGD into an international organization which organizes charitable events and fosters connections, where Altruists can meet and bond over helping others.
organizationDescription: The House of Good Deeds (formerly the Church of Good Deeds) is a belief system with no deity and no dogma other than helping people help people: we believe in Altruism, and the power of each person to make a difference. We see ourselves as optimally positioned to appeal to the millions of people who have turned away from the superstition of traditional religion, but still want to experience and inspire positive change, celebrate without limitation, and connect with others via our culture of volunteerism and communal support. There’s more to it than that, of course, but we think we’re at the start of something great here and would welcome volunteers who share our vision. We were founded in January 2017 by Leon Feingold and his wife Yuanyuan Wang; the week after they got engaged they found out she had terminal cancer. This charity was created as a way of paying forward on a grand scale the generosity they’d received after her diagnosis, from friends and strangers alike. Their story is viewable at http://HouseOfGoodDeeds.org/our-story

title: Parkinson's Foundation Table at Parkinson's Unity Walk NYC

Below are examples of duties we need help with:


Course Monitors:…

In 2004, funds raised by Head for the Cure enabled the seed money to launch the Brain Tumor Trials Collaborative (BTTC) at the University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, TX.
organizationDescription: The 5K events are not only successful fundraisers, but unique tributes to those who are fighting brain cancer and those who have lost their battles. title: Manage our Social Media - New York Area
description: The Elder Wisdom Circle is an award winning online inter-generational program pairing younger folks in need of advice with a caring and empathetic cyber-grandparent. To date the EWC has facilitated almost 500,000 one on one interactions and been featured in almost 100 media stories. Our site received about 350,000 annual visits, most are reading advice.The EWC has played a critical role during the pandemic giving our seniors a safe way to volunteer from home and a place for younger folks to find comforting advice during this crisis.  In March we will be launching a new feature which we anticipate will be popular with our advice-seekers in their teens, 20's and 30's. We are seeking an experienced social media manager who can help us create a campaign for this new feature and help us launch with a series of initial posts.
missionStatement: Our mission is to provide an opportunity for seniors to utilize their life experience and wisdom to help others by offering thoughtful and helpful advice to younger generations
organizationDescription: We are a web-based nonprofit service organization that pairs online advice seekers in their teens, 20's and 30's with a nationwide network of Cyber-Grandparents, aged 55 to 105, who share their hard-earned knowledge and wisdom. Our Elder members participate individually from their home computers or in groups at retirement communities (with the help of a facilitator). Anyone with access to the Internet can request anonymous advice on any topic and will receive a personalized e-mail response in return. The voice of experience is hip, sincere, and highly sought after by people of all ages; we are the most popular source of free online advice in the country. The Elder Wisdom Circle has been featured on ABC, CBS, BBC, NPR, and in many publications including USA Today and Time.

title: Want to help kids in low-income communities? Become a virtual tutor!
description: If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply directly at  https://forms.gle/De4juKf8HhyLUgBQ7 .  There is more information listed there as well, including information about our pairing process. (You do not need to indicate your interest through VolunteerMatch unless you have specific questions.) Thank you! Background: Pandemic Professors, a 501c3 organization, was founded in April 2020 with the mission of facilitating free online tutoring to students in underserved communities affected by the pandemic. We are a 100% volunteer-based organization. Our philosophy not only supports academic achievement but also emphasizes the importance of socio-emotional health. We rely on committed volunteers who have a passion for education and are dedicated to offering academic support to students at risk of falling behind. Your contribution is crucial in this endeavor!  You will interact with families and help students perform and learn! Join our…
missionStatement: The mission of Pandemic Professors is to facilitate free tutoring to children in low-income communities impacted by the pandemic.
organizationDescription: At Pandemic Professors, we believe all K-12 students deserve an opportunity to receive free supplemental learning through private tutoring, in order to help them remain on track and meet their educational goals. Our organization was founded to match underserved students across the United States with free online tutors to more safely help during this unprecedented crisis and beyond.Historically, students in underserved communities are at greater risk of falling behind in academics and socio-emotional skills. Much like Hurricane Katrina, the COVID-19 crisis is exacerbating the plethora of academic and personal challenges these students already face. Our organization presents students in low-income communities with opportunities to strengthen subject comprehension and boost confidence. The needs, strengths, and voices of the impacted students drive our family-centered philosophy and evidence-based practices.Together with our partners, Pandemic Professors combats adverse effects on learning resulting from the pandemic and exacerbated by poverty. Students in underserved communities don’t lack a hunger for knowledge, they lack the means to access quality tutoring. Pandemic Professors provides effective tools for students to complete their K-12 education, and we will continue to work with our students after the pandemic until the educational gap is resolved. We sincerely hope you consider joining us in the fight to improve the lives of students adversely affected by poverty and the pandemic.

title: Afterschool Program Aide
description:
Youth Strong Program Volunteer


Start Date: ImmediatelyTime Period: Flexible; Immediate Schedule: Tuesdays & Thursdays 4:00PM-6:30PM (may vary)


New Alternatives for Children, Inc (NAC) is an innovative health and social service agency located in Manhattan, which provides services to low-income children with severe disabilities and chronic illnesses and their families.  To learn more about NAC, visit www.NacKidsCan.org


Youth Strong is a program @ NAC that serves teens ages 14-years-old and up, supporting adolescents and fostering a positive transition into young adulthood. Services include:


*     Screenings and follow-up referrals for services within NAC or in the community *     Adolescent peer groups with discussions on topics including positive…
missionStatement: New Alternatives for Children (NAC) is a unique, award-winning child welfare agency offering strength-based social services, medical and mental healthcare and a wide variety of wrap-around services. We serve families that have at least one child with special needs, often in combination with mental health, behavioral and/or developmental diagnoses as well. NAC’s mission is to achieve safety, permanency and well-being within a family, for children who are at risk of abuse and/or neglect and have special medical and/or mental health needs among other challenges.
organizationDescription: The children referred to NAC are medically complex and their birth families have devastating social problems. Their circumstances include poverty, homelessness, domestic violence, substance abuse, immigration and language barriers, parental illness, mental health problems and illiteracy. NAC's children may use wheelchairs or be dependent on medical technology in order to live. They may have HIV/AIDS, cancer, cerebral palsy, respiratory or cardiac problems or spina bifida, among other diagnoses. Growing numbers have asthma, diabetes and diagnoses on the autism spectrum. Some of the children have spent years growing up in the hospital, others have had more surgeries than birthdays, experienced fragmented health services, prolonged hospital visits, and/or medical and educational neglect.

title: Disaster Response Drivers Needed in NYC
organization: American Red Cross - Greater New York Region
description:
Why our Volunteer Drivers are so Important:


Drive a Red Cross vehicle to support our life-saving Home Fire Campaign and Disaster Response teams, responding to our communities in need.As a volunteer driver, in the boroughs of NYC, you become a hero on wheels, responding to the community needs before, during, and after home fires. Every trip you make supports the people of NYC.
missionStatement: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.
organizationDescription: Every single day, the American Red Cross helps people in emergencies. Whether itﾒs one displaced family, thousands of disaster victims, or providing care and comfort to an ill or injured service member or veteran or support to a military family member, our vital work is made possible by people like you. It is through the time and care of ordinary people that we can do extraordinary things.

title: NYC Metro Area Chapter, Board Member
description: Gift of Adoption Fund Board Member, NY Chapter Voluntary Board position OverviewGift of Adoption Fund, a 501c3 national charity, has given away nearly $10MM to complete over 4000 adoptions. The Gift of Adoption Fund seeks to fill the void that separates a child from family through adoption completion grants, giving vulnerable children a permanent home and the chance to thrive. We do this-- in large part -- through our extensive Chapter network. In 24 states (and counting), the Gift of Adoption Fund seeks business and community leaders to join Chapter teams and grow our donor base through networking, awareness, and fundraising. No other charitable initiative delivers the transformational impact of adoption for such a small investment -- not just for the child served, but for generations following.
missionStatement: Gift of Adoption is a national charitable organization that inspires adoption by providing grants to help fund adoptions-- giving children permanent, loving families and the chance to thrive.
organizationDescription: We believe a child without a family is one of life's great tragedies because a child without a permanent home suffers. Orphanages and foster homes do not offer permanent solutions for the millions of children who need families. All children deserve the dignity and love that comes from being a part of a family. Gift of Adoption is committed to creating those families. Gift of Adoption is a national charitable organization that inspires adoption by providing grants to help fund adoptions-- giving children permanent, loving families and the chance to thrive.

title: Mentor a NYC High School Student!
description:
ABOUT US:


iMentor matches juniors and seniors in high school (mentees) one-on-one with volunteer adult mentors based on shared career and personal interests. Matched in relationships ranging from a required minimum of two years to an optional maximum of 4 years, mentor-mentee pairs cultivate their relationship employing a combination of weekly written messages and monthly in-person meetings.


ABOUT YOU:


Our mentors are often college-educated volunteers (but it is not a requirement to have a college degree to be a mentor in our program)…
missionStatement: iMentor builds mentoring relationships that empower first-generation students to graduate high school, succeed in college and career, and achieve their ambitions.
organizationDescription: iMentor matches high school students (mentees) one-on-one with volunteer adult mentors based on shared career and personal interests. Matched in relationships ranging from a minimum of two years to a maximum of 4 years, mentor-mentee pairs cultivate their relationship employing a combination of weekly written messages and monthly in-person meetings.iMentor is changing the face of youth mentoring. iMentor proves that (1) even the busiest, most successful New Yorkers have time to be quality mentors and that (2) formal mentoring increases the rate at which young people graduate from college, which benefits not only them as individuals, but society at large.

title: Volunteer Live Sound Engineer Wanted!
description:
Join Our Team and Help Bring Live Music to Life-Both On Stage and Online!


We are looking for a volunteer Live Sound Engineer to assist with producing high-quality audio for our live concerts, as well as capturing sound for our Live Streaming and Video on Demand (VOD) platforms.


What You'll Do:

• Set up and operate audio your own equipment for live performances
• Ensure top-notch sound quality for both in-person audiences and livestream viewers
• Capture audio for post-event Video on Demand (VOD) content
• Collaborate with artists and event staff to manage sound for both live and digital audiences…
missionStatement: Decibel is dedicated to curating and showcasing exceptional artistic talent across various mediums, fostering cultural enrichment, and inspiring audiences worldwide. Through innovative collaborations and unparalleled creativity, we aim to elevate the arts, cultivate meaningful connections, and leave a lasting impact on both artists and audiences alike.
organizationDescription: Decibel is a premier concert presenter, specializing in curating extraordinary live music experiences. Founded by Charles Carlini, a visionary in the world of entertainment, our mission is to deliver unforgettable performances that captivate audiences and celebrate the richness of musical talent. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for creating magical moments, Decibel continues to set the standard for exceptional live entertainment.

title: Volunteers Needed in our Soup Kitchen
organization: Grand Central Neighborhood Social Services Corporation
description:
Volunteers are a key component to the continued success of GCNSSC. By working within the agency, both groups and individuals can participate in a safe and welcoming environment. We are looking for volunteers to help serve in our soup kitchen.


admin@gcnssc.org
missionStatement: The Grand Central Neighborhood Social Services Corporation is committed to providing immediate relief to Midtown Manhattan's homeless population. We offer both basic necessities (i.e. food, clothing, showers etc.) and a range of social services, including employment counseling, treatment referrals and housing assistance through our Mainchance Drop-In Center. It is our hope, that people will use our center as a bridge to a more secure life, networking and building upon their own skill in order to achieve their goals.
organizationDescription: The Grand Central Neighborhood Social Services Corporation's Mainchance Drop-In Center serves a diverse street homeless population of single adults in and around Midtown Manhattan. As one of the city's largest drop-in centers, we assist individuals of diverse ages, backgrounds and cultures. Many of our clients have been homeless for years.

title: Art Therapy for Student in Temporary Housing (non-clinical)
description:
Art Therapy Mentor (non-clinical position)


About Mentor A Promise:


Mentor A Promise is a non-profit organization, and our mission is to provide socio-emotional learning, academic support, and mentorship to students in temporary housing and facing housing instability. We partner with family temporary housing sites across New York, educational institutions, and community organizations to create a strong support network for young people experiencing homelessness, helping them overcome challenges and forge their own path to success. Become a vital part of our mission by volunteering as a Mentor for our students. Be the change you want to see…
missionStatement: Mentor A Promise is a non-profit organization, and our mission is to provide socio-emotional learning, academic support, and mentorship to students in temporary housing and facing housing instability.

title: Volunteer Digital Retouch Artist
organization: Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep
description: A Digital Retouch Artist at Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep plays a crucial role in our mission of providing compassionate support to families experiencing the loss of a baby. As a Digital Retouch Artist, you will utilize your creative and technical skills to enhance and refine photographs to gift families with the healing images we provide. These photographs serve as precious memories for grieving families, and your meticulous retouching work helps create images that are both sensitive and respectful.Digital Retouch Artists must be proficient in Photoshop and utilize Photoshop software. Other editing programs are not accepted at this time. You will be provided with 4 images to retouch and a retouching matrix…
missionStatement: To introduce remembrance photography to parents experiencing the loss of a baby with a free gift of professional portraiture.
organizationDescription: 'Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep' (NILMDTS) is a nonprofit 501(c) (3) organization. All proceeds go directly into the operation of this organization to help parents who are experiencing an early infant loss.

title: Help Older Adults Connect Through Tech- Manhattan
description:
DOROT's mission is to address social isolation among older adults. We are currently looking for Tech Volunteers. There are opportunities to help in person in Manhattan and onsite at DOROT. Tech volunteers help DOROT older adults learn how to use devices including smartphones, tablets and laptops and basic applications. The minimum time commitment is 1 hour per week for 3 months and DOROT provides all training needed. We are also looking for facilitators that have a stronger background in Tech who can lead group sessions on Zoom on a particular area of focus.


To get started, sign up for a DOROT Tech Coaching Training by clicking here: https://dorotusa.jotform.com/250374274320955
missionStatement: DOROT alleviates social isolation among older adults and provides services to help them live independently as valued members of the community. We serve the Jewish and wider community, bringing the generations together in a mutually beneficial partnership of elders, volunteers and professionals. Our work provides an effective model for others. DOROT is headquartered in Manhattan with an additional site in Westchester County.

description:

TEACH (Together Educating All Children in Hospitals) is an international not-for-profit organization that brings exciting, hands-on, STEM educational programming to children in hospitals. Through engagement with practical science concepts, the children are challenged yet empowered. They emerge comforted and confident, encouraged to successfully cope with the trials that lie before them. TEACH modules challenge children to think creatively and bring an element of fun to an otherwise monotonous day…
