title: Four Diamonds Conquers Childhood Cancer. Join us Today by Starting a Mini-THON at your School!
description:
Four Diamonds’ Mini-THON is a K-12 opportunity where students are empowered to become leaders in the fight against childhood cancer. Students gain work ready skills in communication, critical thinking and problem solving, while promoting teamwork, creativity and spirit within their schools.


As a year-long fundraising effort, Mini-THON is an excellent way to become involved in philanthropy and engage both your school and local community. This effort culminates with a multi-hour, fun-filled event involving games, music, dancing, activities, and more!


If you would like to learn more about our organization and our mission, visit https://www.fourdiamonds.org/mini-thon/
missionStatement: The Four Diamonds mission is to conquer childhood cancer by assisting children and their families through comprehensive support, superior care and innovative research.
organizationDescription: Four Diamonds covers 100 percent of all medical expenses related to cancer care not covered by insurance for eligible Four Diamonds children. Because of the community's steady and generous support, Four Diamonds has assisted 100 percent of the childhood cancer patients who have been treated at Penn State Children's Hospital.

title: Volunteer Tax Preparer and Quality Reviewer
description:
.


BACKGROUND:    The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises and helps people to survive and rebuild their lives. At work in over 40 countries and 29 U.S. cities to restore safety, dignity and hope, the IRC leads the way from harm to home.





SCOPE OF VOLUNTEER WORK:   The IRC’s Program Quality and Innovation Unit assists offices which help newly arrived refugees and other low-income individuals reach self-sufficiency by finding entry-level employment and progress to living wage jobs; learn basic financial management skills and build assets; start small businesses; and access Earned Income Tax Credit.





Under the supervision of the Tax Site Coordinator and Financial Coach, Volunteer Tax Preparers will provide free, professional tax preparation services for low-income clients through IRC’s National Volunteer Income…
missionStatement: International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises and helps people to survive and rebuild their lives. At work in more than 50 countries and over 28 U.S. cities, the IRC provides resettlement, education and empowerment support to refugees and displaced people.
organizationDescription: Our programs in New York:

title: Meal Service Volunteer
description:
We are looking for volunteers to support the GMHC meal service program. You will do a variety of tasks, as assigned by the volunteer manager. This may include serving the meal from behind the line (cafeteria style), assisting clients with mobility issues, bussing tables and/or general clean-up at the end of the service.The shift available:

• Every Week or Every Other Week on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday OR Thursday.
• 11:00am to 2:00pm is ideal but we may be able to offer a shorter shift within that time frame.
• Minimum of 3-4 months commitment.

Prior to being confirmed, the following steps will need to be completed:

• Attend a zoom GMHC volunteer orientation.
• Complete the volunteer application and pledge of confidentiality…
missionStatement: GMHC fights to end the AIDS epidemic and uplift the lives of all affected.
organizationDescription: GMHC is a not-for-profit, volunteer-supported and community-based organization committed to national leadership in the fight against AIDS. We provide HIV and STI testing, food and nutrition programs, housing support, workforce development, legal assistance, advocacy for benefits and health insurance, mental health and emotional support, substance use counseling, and more.

title: Regional STEM leader - New York City Area
description:
Do you have a passion for STEM. Do you believe in equal access in STEM education for all children? If so, you should consider becoming a Regional Leader for a 501(c)(3) non profit with the goal of increasing STEM education for all.


Reach out to local communities (ie libraries, smaller organizations) and use provided materials to teach classes for local youth!


All materials and email template will be provided!


Get featured on our website and Instagram as a Regional Leader
missionStatement: At Crochet for Crisis, we are passionate about creating - crochet pieces that make a difference. Our team is dedicated to crafting cute accessories with love and care. Our proceeds will go towards planning educational events such as public classes and courses. These events will teach young women a variety of skills, such as finance, coding, circuit running and more. Some funds will also be donated to charities that are designed to help women in unfortunate situations gain access to education. We aim to make a positive impact during challenging times by spreading joy through our hand-made crochet pieces.
organizationDescription: The goal of the organization is to fund our STEM based classes in local communities through the use of funds made through the sale of crochet goods.

title: 2024 GreenThumb Harvest Fair Volunteer Team
description:
GreenThumb Harvest FairEach fall since 1979, GreenThumb celebrates community gardeners at the end of the gardening season and the start of fall at a community garden with fun activities like workshops, live entertainment, games, and cooking demonstrations for all to enjoy. The 44th Annual GreenThumb Harvest Fair is on Saturday, September 28, 2024 from 12:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. at El Jardin del Paraiso at 710 E 5th Street in Manhattan.


Join Our 2024 Volunteer TeamWe are seeking dedicated volunteers to assist at the 44th Annual GreenThumb Harvest Fair on Saturday, September 28, 2024 at El Jardin del Paraiso in Manhattan. Volunteers will support staff in various programming including, but not limted to, hands-on workshops, free giveaways, lawn games, and the Fresh Chef Contest…
missionStatement: Established in 1978, GreenThumb is proud to be the nation's largest urban gardening program, sustaining over 550 community gardens and supporting thousands of volunteer gardeners throughout New York City. GreenThumb gardens create hubs of neighborhood pride and provide a myriad of environmental, economic and social benefits to the neighborhoods in which they thrive. GreenThumb's mission is to support and educate community gardens and urban farming across the five boroughs, while preserving open space. By providing free garden materials, technical assistance, educational workshops, and seasonal programs, GreenThumb supports neighborhood volunteers who steward community gardens as active resources that strengthen communities.
organizationDescription: GreenThumb was initiated in response to the city’s financial crisis of the 1970s, which resulted in the abandonment of public and private land. The majority of GreenThumb gardens were derelict vacant lots renovated by volunteers. These community gardens, now managed by neighborhood residents, provide important green space, thus improving air quality, bio-diversity, and the well-being of residents.

title: Children's Scholarship Fund Seeking Young Leaders Board Members
description:
The Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF) is looking for dedicated and enthusiastic young professionals who are passionate about our mission of ensuring all children have access to a quality education to join our Young Leaders Board. Each year, CSF provides scholarships empowering low-income families to send their children to a school that better meets their needs. The Young Leaders Board plays an important role in helping CSF meet the ongoing demand for scholarships by engaging in fundraising and volunteer activities, as well as fostering the continued growth of the Young Leaders program in NYC.


Children’s Scholarship Fund’s Mission: The Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF) provides children of low-income families with tuition assistance in grades K-8, and supports expanding educational opportunities for all…
missionStatement: The Children’s Scholarship Fund empowers families by providing children in need with scholarships, and by supporting expanded educational opportunities for all children.
organizationDescription: While efforts are underway to improve education options, Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF) is providing low-income children with immediate access to a quality education. In fact, since our inception in 1998, CSF has invested more than $1 billion in the education of more than 200,000 children, including more than 40,000 in New York City, encouraging them to reach their full potential.

title: Latina Mentors Needed
description:
LATINA MENTORS NEEDED!!


In 2021,the New York State Mentoring Program (NYSMP) launched the Latina Mentoring Initiative (LMI). The goal of the initiative is to level the playing field for young Latinas and to create a community where success looks like our youth. The unique focus of this initiative is to connect Latina mentors with Latina mentees to empower and support the youth by promoting self-advocacy, building soft skills and confidence, and nurturing aspirations.


We are partnering with Good Shepherd Services to launching a new program which focuses on young Latinas currently in foster care.


Commitment:…
missionStatement: The New York State Mentoring Program (NYSMP) creates supportive mentor relationships for children in schools, foster care, and the court system. Mentors are positive role models who guide youth with respect, structure, and compassion to build positive life skills.
organizationDescription: The New York State Mentoring Program (NYSMP) is a statewide provider of mentoring program services.

title: Food Pantry Volunteer
description:
Event Description


Our pantry is stocked with a wide variety of dry and liquid non-perishable goods thanks to donations from many generous local community organizations, businesses, and individuals. Our food pantry serves hundreds of households each month, and is an irreplaceable resource in our community.


Volunteer Responsibilities

• Stock our pantry shelves.
• Receive pantry deliveries.
• Distribute perishable and non-perishable goods to our neighbors experiencing hunger.
• Socialize with Guests to create an atmosphere of welcome…
missionStatement: Dedicated to serving New Yorkers experiencing homelessness, hunger, and poverty, Broadway Community sets an abundant table, believing that everyone deserves justice, dignity, health, and wholeness. We empower one another with nourishing food, a welcoming environment, shelter, medical care, life skills practice, and faithful accompaniment through challenging times. We serve one another - breaking down barriers of poverty, inequity, and privilege - until all are fed, in body and spirit. We serve.
organizationDescription: We are on the front lines of New York City's homelessness, hunger, and mental health crises. Operating a broad range of programs including shelter, emergency food, on-site medical services, showers, case management, supportive counseling, employment assistance, housing navigation, and more, we help hundreds of people a week meet their basic needs and access the resources they need to improve their life circumstances.

title: The Bronx Needs Mentors: Be Bronx, Be Big (Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC)
organization: Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC
description:
Be Bronx, Be Big: Mentorship That Matters


Bronx youth need mentors who get them-real people from their own communities who can guide, inspire, and help them level up. The Be Bronx, Be Big Initiative is all about connecting young professionals (like you) with Bronx kids who could use a mentor that actually understands their world. Just 4 hours a month can make a real impact on a young person’s future, helping them navigate school, career goals, and everyday life. This is your chance to give back, build community, and be part of something bigger. Be Bronx. Be Big. Let’s change the game together.
missionStatement: The mission of Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City is to provide mentors to all children who need caring adult role models--special friends who can help expand their horizons, realize their potential and enrich their futures--changing their lives. We seek to train community organizations in every neighborhood, empowering them to establish their own mentoring programs.
organizationDescription: BBBS of NYC is considered the founding agency of the nation’s youth mentoring movement. Since 1904, our mission has been to give all children in New York City who face adversity an opportunity to experience a strong, enduring professionally supported one-to-one mentoring relationship with adults that will help change their lives for the better. We partner with families, volunteers, organizations, and the community to inspire positive change in all.

title: Dog Foster
description:
What it Means to Foster with Muddy Paws Rescue:


Because we are a foster-based rescue with no physical shelter, we only have the capacity to save as many dogs as we have foster parents. When you become a foster parent with Muddy Paws Rescue, you will personally be saving the life of a dog who might have otherwise not received a second chance.


Our foster parents begin with a training video as a part of their orientation to review the basics of fostering a pup and provided with basic supplies, and are matched with an experienced personal foster buddy for support. All foster parents are encouraged to join our incredibly supportive online community of foster parents, and for more experienced foster parents wanting to help a wider range of dogs, we…
missionStatement: The mission of Muddy Paws Rescue is to build and support a thriving community of dog-loving humans dedicated to ending the unnecessary euthanasia of companion dogs. We do this through shared learning and education, direct lifesaving, and continuous innovation.
organizationDescription: At Muddy Paws Rescue, we strive to be positive, welcoming, supportive, and responsive. We believe in rescue done right and commit our volunteers, fosters, adopters, and supporters to be thorough, reasonable, and responsible in every way. We are a network of foster homes and rescues, aim to place 1,000 dogs in their forever homes per year.

title: Board member
description:
Board Member (Working Board) Non-Profit Organization


Position Overview:


The Board Member of We W.I.L.L. Thru Sports will play a crucial role in guiding the organization strategically while participating actively in its operational tasks. This is a working board, which means that, in addition to fulfilling traditional governance responsibilities, board members are expected to contribute their time, expertise, and resources to support the organization’s mission and day-to-day functions.


Key Responsibilities:


1. Governance and Oversight:   - Participate in the development and approval of the organization’s strategic plan.   - Ensure the organization complies with legal and ethical standards and adheres to its mission.…
missionStatement: We W.I.L.L. Thru Sports is a non-profit athletic organization providing high-quality affordable programs for youths in collaboration with our community-based partners throughout the Greater New York Metropolitan area.
organizationDescription: While reducing the amount of time youth spend unsupervised at home and on the street, We W.I.L.L. Thru Sports is working to promote positive peer relationships, teamwork, and sportsmanship. We are teaching youth to adopt a healthy lifestyle through sports activities and expose youth to a variety of successful sports professionals, teach valuable life lessons, encourage and expose them to the idea of valuing higher education.

title: Share Your Knowledge about Professionalism!
description:
Share your expertise and interest with students at a NYC public school teaching a seminar session(s) on professionalism, through the W!se Institute. Sessions cover a variety of topics from understanding Job Readiness required to get and keep a job in high-growth industries. Students will explore the crucial workplace skills employers seek but often find lacking in young employees.Seminars are 8-10 consecutive weeks. Volunteers can choose to teach one or more sessions. Each session is 45 minutes. Dates and times will be based on availability. Teach on your own, or team up with other people!


About the W!se Institute: Launched in 1993, the W!se Institute holds hour-long, interactive seminars for students during the school day that focus on career skills and opportunities, college preparation and lifelong learning skills. Seminars are delivered by industry experts and faculty.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please send an email with your resume to Sheila Beatty, W!se Institute Assistant Director…
missionStatement: Working In Support of Education (WISE) is a New York City-based not-for-profit 501 (c)(3) organization dedicated to providing services and programs that prepare students for college and the work place with programs that focus on real world learning opportunities, applied learning and financial literacy Founded in 1999 by Phyllis Frankfort, a well-known educator and education policy advisor, WISE helps schools and teachers design, implement and fund programs which engage students, providing real-world opportunities that enhance students' academic experience, and help prepare them for college and the workplace. Wise prepares students for challenges outside the classroom; Ø leadership and civic engagement, Ø financial literacy and responsibility, and Ø college and the work place.
organizationDescription: WISE programs and initiatives include: · The Quality of Life Innovations, a project-based learning exercise designed to provide real-world opportunities for students and empower them to make a difference. Under the program, students develop research-based proposals to address particular social issues in their communities, plans to improve the "Quality of Life" in their city. The program culminates in a scholarship competition for students. · The W!se Institute for Lifelong Learning, a model school-corporate community partnership. The Institute provides a college-like seminar series offered once per week for students; administers an extensive workplace skills development program; designs learning resources, and raises funds for student scholarships. · The New York Financial Literacy Coalition, formed in 2000, brings together corporate leaders from finance and banking, non-profit organizations, teachers, school administrators, and parents with one common goal: promoting financial literacy among young adults. The Coalition works to promote awareness, finance-related programs, conferences, curricula, and teacher training.

title: Marketing, Social Media, Promotion
description:
We need help with promoting our Harlem Brain center our programs and private sessions in both Harlem and midtown. We are also looking to start to sell more products - we need help with marketing and promotion there as well.


Anyone who is skillful with marketing and promotion of services and products is welcome to apply!


If you also have video and editing skills and can cover some of our events, that would be amazing. We feel they are the most helpful for marketing.
missionStatement: IBREA is committed to raising awareness of the great capacity and desire of the human brain to create health, happinness and peace for ourselves, our community, our nation and the world.
organizationDescription: We do conferences, seminars, educational programs in schools and other settings. Our curriculum has 3 areas of concentration (physical, emotional and cognitive) that together help develop the body and brain and our awareness. We also issue a quarterly publication for the general public. Finally, we do lobbying at the UN forum to convey our messages and report on the results of our programs.

title: Clothing Room Help
description:
Alliance for Positive Change is a leading multiservice organization that provides low-income New Yorkers living with HIV and other chronic conditions with access to quality health care, housing, harm reduction, coaching, basic needs and clothing, and renowned Peer training and job placement programs that cultivate leadership and economic mobility.


Alliance for Positive Change operates a "Wonderful Wearables" clothing room to provide clean, gently used or new clothing to the people we serve. We often receive donations for the clothing room, and we need support to help sort and hang clothing.
missionStatement: Alliance for Positive Change’s mission is to help New Yorkers make lasting, positive changes towards health, housing, recovery, and self-sufficiency as they navigate life with HIV and other chronic conditions.
organizationDescription: Alliance for Positive Change is a leading multiservice organization that provides low-income New Yorkers living with HIV and other chronic conditions with access to quality health care, housing, harm reduction, coaching, peer services, and more. We annually serve 5,000+ low-income New Yorkers.Alliance is a women-led organization that primarily serves New York City’s Black, Hispanic/Latinx, LGBTQ+, and HIV-positive communities, as well as people who use drugs and people in recovery. We prioritize peer-delivered services-the people who inspire and power our programs reflect, understand, and care deeply about the diverse communities we serve.Alliance opened in 1991, at the height of the HIV crisis-a welcoming community of transformation and opportunity. Today, we deliver on the promise of positive change with services and resources that equip people to navigate systemic inequities and achieve health and well-being.

title: The Parris Foundation: S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program
description:
Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation: S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for 2025. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school and high school students. With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City and beyond. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers!


How we do it:…
missionStatement: Mission The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) via scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation currently fulfills its mission by: providing scholarships to students from disadvantaged socio-economic backgrounds who are enrolled in undergraduate programs in the STEM disciplines with a proven financial need; servicing disenfranchised communities by offering educational opportunities in STEM; collaborating with organizations focused on improving access to technology for low-income families; exposing adolescents and young adults to academic and professional opportunities in STEM
organizationDescription: Vision

title: Optical Assistant
description:
Lighthouse Guild is the leading not-for-profit healthcare organization dedicated to addressing and preventing vision loss. Our mission is to provide exceptional services that inspire people who are visually impaired to attain their goals. With Lighthouse Guild, people who are at risk for, or affected by, vision loss have access to all the resources necessary to lead full, independent, and productive lives. We provide services, research and education, and advocate to help people with low vision and blindness. Our vision is a world in which no person is limited by their visual capacity.





The Low Vision Center provides specialized eye exams by low vision doctors to evaluate a person’s remaining vision and overall visual function to help maximize existing vision - often with the use of prescribed optical devices. This opportunity is needed to help the staff in the dispensary with the administrative and customer service responsibilities of the department.





Position:Low Vision Dispensary Optical Assistant…
missionStatement: Lighthouse Guild is the leading not-for-profit healthcare organization dedicated to addressing and preventing vision loss through coordinated vision and health services. With Lighthouse Guild, people who are at risk for, or affected by vision loss have access to all the resources necessary to lead full, independent and productive lives. We provide services, research and education, and advocate to help people with low vision and blindness.
organizationDescription: Lighthouse Guild was officially formed in December 2013 when Jewish Guild Healthcare and Lighthouse International merged, to become the leading not-for-profit vision + healthcare organization. Drawing on more than 200 years of combined service, with histories dating back to 1914 and 1905, respectively, Lighthouse Guild’s experience is unmatched.

title: New York City Social Justice News Editor with LoveJustice - Remote
description:
www.lovejustice.com  is looking for Volunteer Editors who will dedicate one to three hours a week for at least two months. The role is to locate the most impactful social justice news and events from credible sources on the web.


A Volunteer Editor will focus on either a specific cause or a metro area. LoveJustice does not create its own content, its Volunteer Editors identify vital information weekly and provide the content to a senior editor at LoveJustice.com for reposting. Volunteer Editor content gathering is crucial in advancing the LoveJustice mission and social justice awareness.


Potential volunteer editors will provide basic personal information, preference for their cause or metro area, and informal references…
missionStatement: Via its website, social media presence and newsletter distribution, LoveJustice is designed to provide current updates on a wide range of social justice areas - with vital details, relevant news and quick summaries of challenges ahead. Whether working to make our world more just for all or focusing on helping those who suffer from injustice, the effort can be daunting, exhausting and sometimes heartbreaking. LoveJustice is geared to provide peer recognition and the resources for renewal essential to ongoing success in the work to counter the terrible human cost of injustice and deal with its root causes. The organization is neutral regarding religious affiliation, political party or philosophical persuasion - it honors and encourages all who advance the cause of social justice. LoveJustice is an entirely volunteer organization, providing no compensation to any affiliated person beyond reimbursement for direct expenses for normal business operation.
organizationDescription: LoveJustice is a new 503(c)3 non-profit organization established 9/14/2020 in the state of Texas. LoveJustice is currently building its website at www.lovejustice.com to provide information, resources and encouragement for all who are engaged in the advancement of social justice.Site main page will be a member portal - joining is free but members must agree with the mission statement. The main page will have 20 linked pages providing overviews, current news and action items for the following social justice areas: Environment Prison Reform Police Reform Living Wage Housing/Homelessness Immigration Voting Rights Religious Liberty Separation of Church & State War/Global Conflict Hunger Poverty Education Reproductive Rights Women’s Issues/Rights Minority Issues/Rights Health & Wellness LGBT Issues/Rights Cults & Conspiracy Theories Human Dignity & Decency

description:

Through our valued partnership with City Harvest, we provide fresh produce, pantry staples, and essential items to our neighbors in need, particularly the approximately 700 seniors we serve regularly.

title: Walk a dog for a neighbor in need!
description:
Meet Blue!Blue is a friendly blue nose pitbull who would love more exercise!Blue's guardian is recovering from a car accident and now uses a walker. We are looking for volunteers who can commit to a once weekly dog walking shift for this sweet pup!


If you enjoy spending time with both people and pets, PAWS NY offers wonderful opportunities for our volunteers to provide direct services to our clients who are living with a physical illness or disability, mainly through our Housecall Program. Volunteers provide help with dog walking, litter box maintenance, transportation to/from the vet, and other pet-related tasks our clients struggle to do on their own.


In order to begin providing services, all volunteers are required to attend an orientation. We are flexible in terms of the level of commitment, and welcome all interested individuals to attend an orientation session to learn more about our work. You will learn more about PAWS NY and the services you will ultimately provide to our clients. *Please note that…
missionStatement: The mission of PAWS NY is to preserve, support, and nurture the human-animal bond for New York City’s most vulnerable residents. Our programs help keep pets in their homes while protecting and promoting the bond that is so physically and psychologically valuable to our clients. Thus, our motto: helping people by helping pets.
organizationDescription: Our services enable people and pets to stay together through thick and thin.

title: New York City Fight for Air Climb
description:
The American Lung Association is seeking volunteers for the New York City Fight for Air Climb on Saturday, March 22, 2025, at One Penn in NYC.


Opportunities are as follows:


Setup on Friday, March 21, 2025 from 5:30 - 8 pm


Day of event tasks vary from 7am - 12:30 pm


Breakdown of the event from 11am-2pm


When you volunteer at the climb you are supporting people with lung disease who are fighting for every breath.


Contact Judy at Judy.Deane@lung.org if you have any questions or would like to volunteer.
missionStatement: To save lives by improving lung health and preventing lung disease.
organizationDescription: For over 115 years, the American Lung Association has remained steadfast in its mission to save lives by improving lung health and preventing lung disease. We are dedicated to defeating lung cancer, serving as a champion for clean air for all, improving the quality of life for those with lung disease, and creating a tobacco- and vape-free future. Guided by a strong moral compass, we continue to advance our mission as we always have - by combining education, advocacy, and research efforts.We are committed to providing you with the most up-to-date information on all things lung health to help you as we move towards a world free of lung disease. We offer a number of programs that are designed to help people quit smoking, learn to live with and control their asthma, and prevent adolescents from smoking, just to name a few.As long as anyone struggles to breathe freely, the Lung Association will be there to champion for them. Because when you can’t breathe, nothing else matters.

title: Race to Cure Sarcoma New York City 5K
description:
The Race to Cure Sarcoma (RTCS) is the premier 5K Run/Walk series in the United States, focused on raising awareness and important research funds for sarcoma. Sarcoma is a rare cancer found in adults and nearly 20% of all childhood cancers. Through the Race to Cure Sarcoma events, sarcoma patients, survivors, caregivers, medical professionals, and people who have lost a loved one, all come together as a community to support innovative research for better treatments and an end to sarcoma.


Join our movement to help people impacted by sarcoma.  Volunteer to support the Sarcoma Foundation of America (SFA), in one of the following key areas:

• Registration: Greet participants as they arrive at the registration tent…
missionStatement: The mission of the Sarcoma Foundation of America (SFA) is to advocate for sarcoma patients by funding research and by increasing awareness about the disease. The organization raises money to privately fund grants for sarcoma researchers and conducts education and advocacy efforts on behalf of sarcoma patients.
organizationDescription: Our goal is to find the cure in our time. We do this by:

title: For Students & Schools--Help Feed Children and Families in Need
description:
Students, Clubs, Teachers, and Youth Groups


Partner up with Cereal4all to address a shortage of breakfast food donations at food banks


STUDENT AMBASSADOR PROGRAM* Earn 10 Community Service Hours* Take an active role fighting hunger and food insecurity in your city


SCHOOL CEREAL DRIVE PROGRAM* Help your local food bank give breakfast & happiness to families in need* Earn an appreciation gift card for your school or club


For more details, visit https://cereal4all.org…
missionStatement: Cereal4all is a youth-run nonprofit fighting hunger around America’s breakfast tables. We work with students and schools to ensure food banks can offer breakfast to disadvantaged children and families. Through our cereal drives and other community projects, we increase youth awareness about hunger issues, promote volunteerism at an early age, and help feed households struggling to secure a meal in the morning.
organizationDescription: Cereal4all is a unique 501c3 nonprofit run by students who are passionate about fighting hunger and strengthening our communities. We believe cereal is about breakfast and starting off the day, but it’s also about happiness. Since breakfast & happiness are two things the world can use more of, we’re working to make it happen. We also think the world can use more young people volunteering at their local food banks and getting more invested in the well-being of their cities and towns, so we’re working on that too. Team up with us to make a positive difference in your community.Since 2016, Cereal4all has provided over 270,000 bowls of cereal to children and families in need and encouraged students across the United States to get active in the fight against hunger.

title: Practice singing with the NYC choir for everyone: Everybody Sing
description: Everybody Sing is a group for anyone to join who wants to practice choral singing. No audition, no fee, no expectation, and no perfectionism. We sing for fun, for the benefits to our physical and mental health, and to share our music with small audiences in casual venues. The group sings a wide variety of music styles with and without accompaniment. Members are invited to sing harmony or melody. Everybody Sing, in its first year, had three public singing engagements; all three were successes. Most importantly, the group has begun to cohere as a community of friends. The choir's theme song is Lean On Me. We hope to perform our first full-length indoor concert in Fall 2025. Join us! Every Tuesday 6:30 - 8 PM at Columbia University's Casa Italiana, 1161 Amsterdam Ave just below 118th Street.  everybodysingnyc.com
missionStatement: THE MISSION OF EVERYBODY SING IS TO FOSTER AND PROMOTE THE ART OF CHORAL MUSIC IN A COMMUNITY-FOCUSED, VOLUNTEER SETTING THAT WELCOMES ALL WHO WISH TO JOIN. EVERYBODY SING IS FREE, WITHOUT AN AUDITION, AND INCLUDES AN EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT: WE STRIVE TO LEARN HOW TO SING BETTER IN ORDER TO HAVE MORE FUN TOGETHER.
organizationDescription: Everybody Sing had its first rehearsal in February 2024. Director Rick Whitaker had been an opera student at the University of Cincinnati College/Conservatory of Music but was defeated by extreme stage fright. He shifted to creative writing and moved to New York at the age of 20. (He has published three books.) But his experience as a student singing in choirs left a nagging desire in him to direct his own group. His day for more than 20 years has been producing concerts at Columbia University's Italian Academy, where he had access to a small theater. He pitched the choir to his executive director who approved his plan wholeheartedly. The idea is simple: a group for anyone to join who wants to practice choral singing. No audition, no fee, no expectation, and no perfectionism. We sing for fun, for the benefits to our physical and mental health, and to share our music with small audiences in casual venues. The group sings a wide variety of music styles with and without accompaniment. Members are invited to sing harmony or melody. Everybody Sing, in its first year, had three public singing engagements; all three were successes. Most importantly, the group has begun to cohere as a community of friends. The choir's theme song is Lean On Me. We hope to perform our first full-length indoor concert next fall.

title: Paint the Bronx Purple - Volunteer to Raise Alzheimer's Awareness!
organization: Alzheimer's Association New York City Chapter
description:
Paint the Bronx Purple - Volunteer to Raise Alzheimer’s Awareness!


The Bronx has one of the highest rates of Alzheimer’s in NYC, and we need passionate volunteers to help raise awareness and take action! Whether you're a CUNY student, Bronx resident, or community leader, your time and skills can create real impact.


Volunteer Roles:


Planning Committee - Lead awareness efforts, organize events, and recruit volunteers.Task Force - Assist with event logistics, community outreach, and engagement…
missionStatement: The mission of the Alzheimer’s Association is to eliminate Alzheimer’s disease through the advancement of research; to provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through brain health. To learn more, visit alz.org/nyc or call the 24/7 Helpline 800.272.3900, anytime.
organizationDescription: The Alzheimer's Association was founded in 1980 by a group of family caregivers and individuals who recognized the need for an organization that would unite caregivers, provide support to those facing Alzheimer's, and advance research into the disease.Today the Alzheimer's Association reaches millions of people affected by Alzheimer's and other dementias. We are the leading voluntary health organization in Alzheimer's care, support, and research. You can help advance our mission by volunteering for one of our signature fundraising events - the Walk to End Alzheimer's or The Longest Day.

title: Surgery Center Liaison
description:
We are seeking compassionate and personable volunteers to partner with the patient experience team at MEETH! MEETH is well known for their surgery center in which we see about 70-100 patients a day. Our patients go home the same say as their surgery. We are only open monday through friday. Please contact me directly if you are interested! Kdonohue2@northwell.edu


Responsibilities Include:

• Interacts with all the patients and family members for any comfort care needs (ice, water, tea blankets).
• Check in on our patients , offer some reassurance or an ear to listen to

• Escort family members and visitors to their destination throughout the facility.

missionStatement: The mission of MEETH is to deliver outstanding health care with compassion and respect, to promote wellness in its communities and to advance the field of medicine through education and research. We seek excellence in all endeavors, aspiring to provide premier services to a diverse patient population and to nurture an environment in which health care professionals and staff can learn and thrive. MEETH shares the Northwell Health vision of making a difference by putting patients at the center of everything we do each day. Our employees contribute to the success of our goals by living up to our core values: Caring, Excellence, Innovation and Integrity.
organizationDescription: Manhattan Eye, Ear & Throat Hospital (MEETH) is a specialized center that focuses on high-quality care for eye, ear and throat conditions-but that's not all we do. description:

Benefits of Being a Rotarian:

missionStatement: Changing lives by providing children access to health and fitness education
organizationDescription: Active Plus has served the community by providing children with the necessary tools to live a healthy and active lifestyle. Our programs are led by top health educators and fitness instructors and focus on holistic health education. The combination of fitness and nutrition programs delivered in schools makes Active Plus a unique and comprehensive force to drive improved results in the areas of classroom performance, childhood obesity, and healthy lifestyle.Active Plus’ mission statement is simple but is a full expression of our purpose and is the mantra that drives our everyday actions. Active Plus’ mission and core values are an integral part of the strategic plan and provide the foundation for the future. Our mission is to change lives by providing children access to health and fitness education.At Active Plus, we dream of a world where access to smart, feasible holistic health education and activities are available to all children. We know that if we can engage children in being active, teach them to make healthy choices and make those choices as enticing and accessible as the alternatives, we can create a legacy of healthy habits and impact an entire generation. At Active Plus we dream big because we never want to stop fighting for our children. Our team is well prepared to see this vision to fruition, and together we can make it happen.

title: Board of Directors.

Ripple Effect Artists, Inc. (REA) addresses injustice and causes social impact through art - primarily by producing masterful plays - presenting them along with talk-back discussions in partnership with educators and advocacy groups. These events, our education, and our game-changing philanthropy cultivate empathy, shift audiences from APATHY to ACTION, and create a RIPPLE EFFECT in the larger community. Ripple Effect Artists is an Actor’s Equity 501(c)3 theatre company.

Fundraising


Accounting…
missionStatement: Ripple Effect Artists Inc. is dedicated to mounting cutting-edge theatrical productions of masterfully-written published works which ask bold questions and provoke dialogue. These productions, our education that empowers students, and our game-changing philanthropy boldly dare to move our audiences from APATHY to ACTION, creating a RIPPLE EFFECT in the larger community and world.
organizationDescription: Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and those ripples build a current which can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance." -Robert F. Kennedy. WE BELIEVE IN: * Theatre and the ability it has to inspire an audience to make a difference * Student empowerment * Theatrical, game-changing philanthropy * Dialogue inspired by theatre * International outreach and the impact of art on the world * Inspiring young student-actors to create their own Ripple Effect

title: The Communication Exchange Program
description:
Are you outgoing, friendly and interested in meeting and mentoring people from different cultures? The Communication Exchange Program provides the opportunity to connect professionals with graduate international business students to help them practice their informal listening and speaking skills and provide them with an opportunity to connect with New York City and American culture.


CXP is perfectly suited for individuals who possess an open mind, are non-judgmental, embrace cultural diversity, have a genuine interest in education and its impact on people's lives, and are enthusiastic about learning from others.What is the Communication Exchange Program?


The Communication Exchange Program is a program that provides a full-circle immersion in language, communication and culture to international graduate students of the Gabelli School of Business by matching with volunteers. Participants in the program meet virtually or…

The school will leverage its rigorous academics, global outlook, New York City location, and Jesuit heritage to educate students in all business disciplines with the mindsets and capabilities that enable business to move society forward.

title: Become a College Mentor and Support a High School Senior's Next Steps!
description:
East Harlem Tutorial Program’s (EHTP) mission is to support scholars to build the academic skills, strength of character, and emotional well-being to thrive in school and lead in their communities. The College Mentoring Program is one way we work towards achieving our goal.


CMP is a two-year postsecondary advising, access, and success program for high school seniors in EHTP’s programs and schools known as East Harlem Scholar Academies. Students and mentors make a two-year commitment to the mentoring relationship, extending from the senior year of high school (CMP Y1) into the first year post-graduation (CMP Y2).

organizationDescription: EHTP operates out-of-school time programming that provides academic enrichment, college-ready resources and social-emotional support for students in after-school programs for grades K-12 and operates 5 public charter schools known East Harlem Scholars Academies. EHTP would not be the organization that we are today without the help and support from our amazing volunteers. Volunteers empower our scholars, prepare them for academic success, support their social enrichment, and help them gain the confidence they will need to succeed in college and in life.

title: Practice singing with the NYC choir for everyone: Everybody Sing
description: Everybody Sing is a group for anyone to join who wants to practice choral singing. No audition, no fee, no expectation, and no perfectionism. We sing for fun, for the benefits to our physical and mental health, and to share our music with small audiences in casual venues. The group sings a wide variety of music styles with and without accompaniment. Members are invited to sing harmony or melody. Everybody Sing, in its first year, had three public singing engagements; all three were successes. Most importantly, the group has begun to cohere as a community of friends. The choir's theme song is Lean On Me. We hope to perform our first full-length indoor concert in Fall 2025. Join us! Every Tuesday 6:30 - 8 PM at Columbia University's Casa Italiana, 1161 Amsterdam Ave just below 118th Street.  everybodysingnyc.com
missionStatement: THE MISSION OF EVERYBODY SING IS TO FOSTER AND PROMOTE THE ART OF CHORAL MUSIC IN A COMMUNITY-FOCUSED, VOLUNTEER SETTING THAT WELCOMES ALL WHO WISH TO JOIN. EVERYBODY SING IS FREE, WITHOUT AN AUDITION, AND INCLUDES AN EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT: WE STRIVE TO LEARN HOW TO SING BETTER IN ORDER TO HAVE MORE FUN TOGETHER.
organizationDescription: Everybody Sing had its first rehearsal in February 2024. Director Rick Whitaker had been an opera student at the University of Cincinnati College/Conservatory of Music but was defeated by extreme stage fright. He shifted to creative writing and moved to New York at the age of 20. (He has published three books.) But his experience as a student singing in choirs left a nagging desire in him to direct his own group. His day for more than 20 years has been producing concerts at Columbia University's Italian Academy, where he had access to a small theater. He pitched the choir to his executive director who approved his plan wholeheartedly. The idea is simple: a group for anyone to join who wants to practice choral singing. No audition, no fee, no expectation, and no perfectionism. We sing for fun, for the benefits to our physical and mental health, and to share our music with small audiences in casual venues. The group sings a wide variety of music styles with and without accompaniment. Members are invited to sing harmony or melody. Everybody Sing, in its first year, had three public singing engagements; all three were successes. Most importantly, the group has begun to cohere as a community of friends. The choir's theme song is Lean On Me. We hope to perform our first full-length indoor concert next fall.

title: New York City Walk for Pancreatic Cancer Research
description: * Please be aware that we are in the process of updating the date for this event, and will communicate our new date as soon as it is confirmed. *The Lustgarten Foundation is the top private funder for pancreatic cancer research. We have funded $283 million in pancreatic cancer research, and 100% of all contributions from our walk events go directly to research. At this volunteer opportunity, there will be the chance to pass out refreshments, help with registration and check-in, and assist on the walk route.If you are interested in participating, please fill out this form: https://lustgarten.org/volunteer.If you have any questions, please reach out to dallison@lustgarten.org.
missionStatement: Our Mission To advance the scientific and medical research related to the diagnosis, treatment, cure and prevention of pancreatic cancer by: Increasing funding and support of research into the biological mechanisms and clinical strategies related to the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of pancreatic cancer; Facilitating and enhancing the dialogue among members of the medical and scientific communities about basic and clinical research efforts that relate to pancreatic cancer; Heightening public awareness of pancreatic cancer diagnosis, treatment, and prevention and providing informational support for pancreatic cancer patients, their families, and friends.
organizationDescription: N/A

title: HHFM Volunteer Board Member
description:
Harvest Home Farmer’s Market (HHFM) provides low-income communities with access to farm fresh local produce and the education to achieve healthier lifestyles.


HHFM is a New York City-based, 501(c)3, non-profit organization dedicated to increasing access to local, farm-fresh produce in low-income neighborhoods. Founded in 1993, our markets create community gathering places that educate the public about health and nutrition, support regional agriculture and provide job opportunities. Our farmers’ markets are open six days a week during the farmer's market season; serving all members of each community.


HHFM operates markets in the Bronx, Brooklyn and Manhattan. We accept Cash, Credit/Debit, Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Food Stamp)/ EBT cards, Women Infant and Children checks (WIC), Farmer's Market Nutrition Coupons (FMNP), Health Bucks and Health Senior Healthy Shoppers coupons (H2S2)…
missionStatement: Harvest Home Farmers’ Market, Inc. (HHFM) is an East Harlem-based nonprofit dedicated to increasing access to farm-fresh, locally grown produce, particularly for consumers in low-income New York City communities identified as "fresh and healthy food deserts." Founded in 1993, HHFM operates 14 farmers' markets in Harlem, the Bronx, and Brooklyn--areas under-served by grocery stores and other fresh food outlets. The farmers' markets provide direct-to-consumer economic opportunities for 35 farmers and food producers who sell their goods at HHFM markets.
organizationDescription: HHFM has been a significant player in food access and healthy food issues for over 20 years. We have proven that there is considerable demand for fresh food in low-income areas and that when low-income consumers have access to better choices they will take full advantage of them. Through collaboration with other organizations, systems-based advocacy, and public education, we have helped establish a regional and environmentally responsive food and farm economy that supports good nutrition, prevents hunger, enhances communities, and supports healthy lifestyles.

title: Empower the Next Generation: Become a Math Mentor!
description:
Are you ready to make a real impact? Join Common Denominator in our mission to help in-need middle school students excel in math and build confidence through tutoring with a mentorship approach. Our goal is to ensure that students connect math to their everyday experiences and develop a keen interest in how math relates to themselves and the world around them.


As a volunteer, you’ll create a supportive and uplifting environment where students can explore, discover, and achieve those unforgettable "ah-ha" moments. With your guidance, they’ll strengthen Common Core math skills and discover new possibilities for their future.


Why Volunteer with Us…
missionStatement: To help underperforming NYC middle school students master fundamental math skills so that they have a strong foundation upon which they may develop critical thinking skills used in real life situations.
organizationDescription: Common Denominator, formerly known as Top Honors, is a not-for-profit, mathematics tutoring program that helps reinforce basic mathematical skills for middle school students. Common Denominator's unique and structured curriculum focuses on math concepts, real-life examples, and incorporates competitive mathematics-driven games that motivate students to learn.

title: Pop Up Pantry in Washington Heights: Help Needed!
organization: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York
description:
Catholic Charities Community Services' Feeding Our Neighbors program are hosting pop up food distribution sites to help clients in needs. This program is responding to communities in particular need. Please consider helping at one of our pop up sites to ensure that they are able to serve as many clients as possible!*Please see below for dates and locations!As a volunteer, you will:

• Distribute food to clients
• Register clients so they can receive items
• Assist with line control and flow
• Be a friendly face, ready and willing to help…
missionStatement: The Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of New York seeks to uphold the dignity of each person as made in the image of God by serving the basic needs of the poor, troubled, weak, and oppressed of all religions. We collaborate with parishes and Catholic and non-Catholic partners to build a compassionate and just society. Through a network of administered, sponsored, and affiliated agencies, Catholic Charities delivers, coordinates and advocates for quality human servcies and programs touching almost every human need.
organizationDescription: Catholic Charities is made of 90 direct service providing agencies and programs covering the ten counties of the Archdiocese of New York.

title: Graphic Artist
organization: New York African Chorus Ensemble Inc.
description:
We are looking for a talented Graphic Artist to join our nonprofit team as a volunteer. In this role, you will design eye-catching visual content for our programs, events, and social media, helping to promote cultural diversity and the arts while boosting our outreach and engagement.


This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your artistic skills, build your portfolio, and support impactful community programs. Flexible hours and remote work options are available. Join us and help bring our vision to life through powerful visuals!
missionStatement: NYACE contributes to the diversity of NYC's vibrant cultural life and employs the arts as a tool to create a bridge of understanding between people of diverse cultures. Much more than a singing group, we provide easy access to the learning, performance, and viewing of African traditional, popular, and art music. . NYACE serves the low income population by creating programs that provide easy access to the participation in and viewing of highly artistic performances. In addition, the organization provides opportunities for relatively unknown performing groups to take part in our programs and, thus, widen their audience base.
organizationDescription: New York African Chorus Ensemble Inc is a multiracial, and multicultural organization that contributes to the improvement of the quality of life of the elderly, mentally, physically and economically challenged, youth, adult and the poor. Incorporated in 2004, NYACE has a reputation for presenting and organizing culturally enriching and highly artistic programs in NYC for free especially for culturally and economically underserved communities in Harlem. Our programs include annual concerts aimed at demystifying Africa and connecting the community with music by African composers, a year-long workshop on African music that empower a multiracial group of low income, aspiring musicians with superior performance skills while they develop greater self-confidence, disciple and understanding for others, an annual festival that builds community and celebrates the diverse cultural communities in NYC; and a conference on African music and dance.NYACE creates opportunities for an international sharing and exchange of ideas. In addition, the organization provides opportunities for relatively unknown performing groups to take part in our programs and, thus, widen their audience baseNYACE is the recipient of the 2011 "World Harmony Award" from the NY Metropolitan Martin Luther King Jr., Center for Nonviolence and the 2012 "Blue Heart Award" from Berlin, & a Congressional Proclamation from Congressman Rangel.

title: Columbia University Volunteer GED Teaching Assistant [Reading/Writing/Social Studies]
description:
Are you...


Looking for teaching experience?


Interested in supporting adult students in the classroom?


Excited about reading, writing, and social studies?


You might be a good candidate for teaching GED content with Community Impact! We are recruiting for our next session set to begin at the beginning of February and run through the end of April. We are looking for teaching assistants to volunteer in-person.


Classes run from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm and 6 - 8:30 pm on Mondays and Wednesdays. Teaching Assistants will shadow and assist teachers. Teaching assistants who excel will be invited to apply to be instructors. This is a great opportunity to gain teaching experience! Individuals who already have teaching experience and a Bachelor's degree are welcome…
missionStatement: Community Impact is an independent nonprofit organization dedicated to serving disadvantaged people in the Morningside Heights, Harlem, and Washington Heights communities. Community Impact strives to advance the public good by fostering meaningful opportunities for students, staff, and faculty of Columbia University in order to provide high-quality programs and instill the importance of life-long service.
organizationDescription: From its earliest inception as a single service initiative formed in 1981 by Columbia University undergraduates Joe DeGenova and David Joyce, Community Impact has grown into Columbia University’s largest student service organization and a primary interface between the University and the Morningside Heights and Harlem communities. As Community Impact integrated itself into the neighborhood’s social safety-net, students identified and responded to new community needs, expanding the number of services available to clients and working towards transforming the organization into an integrated service network with a strong education emphasis. We currently provide a multitude of services, including continuing adult education programs to help community members obtain high school equivalance. We offer ESL classes for immigrant families, and a workforce development program to help our community gain meaningful employment.

title: Cultural Programs Representative | Study Abroad for High Schoolers
description:
About Us:We are dedicated to empowering U.S. high school students with life-changing study abroad opportunities, fostering global citizenship, personal growth, and cultural understanding.


Role Overview:


By getting involved as a Study Abroad for High Schoolers Representative, you will be making a difference in the world-one young person at a time. You’ll be the all-important point person for students in your area as they embark on their study abroad journey. From guiding and advocating for them to offering support and friendship, you’ll play a crucial role in ensuring each student gets the most out of this transformative experience.


We are looking for dedicated volunteers who would engage with students aged 15-18, their families, and educators to promote study abroad programs. You will play a vital role in connecting young learners…
missionStatement: Do something historic. Host an exchange student...or become one.
organizationDescription: n/a

title: Volunteer for Pet Therapy with Seniors Inspīr!
description:
Enhance Lives through Innovation and Compassion!


Welcome to Inspīr Senior Living, where we dedicate ourselves to creating environments of immersion, innovation, and holistic wellness. Our mission is to foster a community where residents can embrace a life of luxury and fulfillment, surrounded by a vibrant atmosphere. We take great pride in delivering exceptional senior living services that consistently exceed expectations. As we enrich the fabric of life within our communities, we welcome individuals who are passionate about enhancing the lives of our residents through our comprehensive approach to well-being. If you are interested in joining our commitment to holistic wellness, we invite you to volunteer at Inspīr Senior Living. Together, let's create meaningful connections and elevate every moment…
missionStatement: We strive to do what’s best for our residents, their families and their loved ones so that we can give them the treatment that they deserve.
organizationDescription: From the moment you visit Maplewood's senior living communities, you will be surrounded with warm, inspired environments, services and amenities that define "the good life" at every turn. You will soon discover a lifestyle that feels natural yet new, exciting yet secure. At Maplewood Senior Living communities, you and your loved one will experience this instinctive feeling, day after day, season after season.

title: Be a reading tutor - support students' path toward reading proficiency (New York City)
description:
Volunteer just over an hour per week to empower a student through reading.


Reading Partners believes that our communities do better when all students have access to high-quality learning opportunities and the critical reading skills needed to prepare them for academic, social, and civic success.Reading Partners is seeking in-person and online volunteer tutors to work one-on-one with students this school year, 2024-2025.Give a little over one hour per week. We offer flexible weekday session times. No experience is required, as we provide volunteers with a structured curriculum, training, and ongoing support to help you and your student succeed…
missionStatement: Our mission is to help children become lifelong readers by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction with measurable results.
organizationDescription: Reading Partners is a national education nonprofit that partners with students, their families, schools, and communities to provide students with individualized literacy support and the foundational skills they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. We do this by training community volunteers to deliver one-on-one, literacy lessons, using our structured and easy to follow, evidence-based curriculum. Volunteer tutoring happens in-person via our Reading Partners Traditional program and virtually via our Reading Partners Connects program. Programming varies by region. We currently serve twelve regions, nationwide: Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, Denver, North Texas, Tulsa, Twin Cities, South Carolina, Washington DC, Baltimore, and New York.

title: New York, NY -  Fundraising Walk Volunteers Needed!
description: We are hosting the Annual New York VisionWalk at the Central Park Naumburg Bandshell on April 12, 2025! We are looking for volunteers to help out with day-of execution of the event! This may include passing out refreshments, helping with registration, and aiding participants along the walk route.To learn more: Give.FightingBlindness.org/NewYorkVisionWalk or FightingBlindness.org
missionStatement: The urgent mission of the Foundation Fighting Blindness, Inc. is to drive the research that will provide preventions, treatments and cures for people affected by retinitis pigmentosa (RP), macular degeneration, Usher syndrome, and the entire spectrum of retinal degenerative diseases. The Foundation is a beacon for those affected by these blinding diseases. Join the fight and help us accelerate our mission.
organizationDescription: Since its inception in 1971, the Foundation Fighting Blindness has raised over $954 million and funds thousands of research studies at hundreds of prominent institutions worldwide.

title: New York-Presbyterian Victim Intervention Program Volunteer Advocate
organization: New York Presbyterian Hospital- Victim Intervention Program
description:
NYP Victim Intervention Program Advocates are individuals of at least 21 years of age, who all share a commitment to support survivors and advocate on their behalf through the Emergency Department experience.Advocates are specifically trained to be first responders to survivors of sexual assault, domestic violence, and family violence. They provide information and emotional support to survivors as well as to survivors' support systems. Advocates complete a 40-hour training in order to learn about the dynamics of abuse/violence, how to assist a survivor in safety planning, and how to provide crisis counseling.


Training will take place across 7 sessions on the below 2025 dates:


Thursday, March 27, 6 - 9pm…
missionStatement: The Victim Intervention Program provides a range of free and confidential supportive services to survivors of sexual assault, domestic violence, family violence, and other crimes, as well as to survivors’ support systems. We provide continuity of services, starting from the immediate moments following an incident, through the entire healing process. We help survivors by providing information about their options and resources and supporting them through their decisions.
organizationDescription: Victim Intervention Program services are always completely free and confidential, and are offered to individuals ages 12 and older.

title: Doula Volunteer: Meaningful relationships with people at the end of life
organization: The Doula Program to Accompany and Comfort
description:
***2025 TRAINING APPLICATION PERIOD CLOSED. Please contact us if you would like to be added to the email list for the next applicaton period this fall.***





The number of people facing the end of life without friends or family is startling. Our mission is to minimize the emotional, spiritual, social isolation and loneliness that so many individuals experience at the end stage of life.


The Doula Program to Accompany and Comfort specially trains, carefully matches and supervises Doula Volunteers who visit individuals living at home, in nursing homes and in hospitals throughout New York City. Doula Volunteers visit weekly for an hour with one individual for as long as that individual lives, whether 5 months or 5 years…
missionStatement: The Doula Program to Accompany and Comfort's mission is to minimize the isolation and loneliness experienced by individuals with life limiting illness who are experiencing the end stage of their lives with few or no friends and family.
organizationDescription: Individuals are known beyond their diagnosis, through special relationships with a Doula Volunteer. The Doula Program to Accompany and Comfort recruits, screens, specially trains, carefully matches and supervises Doula Volunteers who visit individuals weekly in hospitals, healthcare facilities and at home. Our Doula Volunteers will visit one individual weekly.

title: Volunteer Ship Restoration Program
description:
Join the crew at South Street Seaport Museum in preserving, restoring, and maintaining our historic fleet of ships. Get your hands dirty, make some friends, and learn useful and unique skills!


This year-round program invites volunteers to help maintain and restore the Museum’s stationary and operational vessels. We welcome all levels of experience and offer the chance for new volunteers to learn and preserve these precious skills.


Entry level: No special skills are required, just a willingness to learn and be part of a team. During every month of the year, Museum volunteers and staff work together to care for the fleet. Work includes: cleaning and organizing, repairs, painting, polishing, varnishing, and general maintenance. In the Fall, the sailing vessels are down-rigged for the…
missionStatement: The South Street Seaport Museum uses its historic buildings in the Seaport District, collection of artifacts, and fleet of vessels to celebrate the rich heritage of the Port of New York through exhibitions and education programs exploring the past and present connections of the city and the sea.
organizationDescription: Founded on May 22, 1967, the South Street Seaport Museum is dedicated to telling the story of the port of New York and the maritime history of the region.

title: Feed The Unhoused & Asylum Seekers on Sunday Afternoons
description:
Come join our progressive church on Park Ave & 60th Street as we feed our neighboors a hot Sunday Supper. Great for 16 and up. Families welcomed.


Volunteers help prepare sandwiches and salad. During service, they serve toiletries,food and drinks. One volunteer a week can be our designated dishwasher.


If you are looking to invest in making this a long term commitment, we are training people to be Lead Volunteers and Cooks.











If you have any questions, please email bjordan1047@gmail.com
missionStatement: We seek to love God above all things, and our neighbors as ourselves.
organizationDescription: Christ Church is a Reconciling United Methodist Congregation.

title: Get Involved as a Mentor or Editor for IndyKids
description: Do you have a passion for children’s literacy and progressive journalism? IndyKids helps young students ages 9-14 improve writing, reading and research skills while learning about social justice issues and world events that aren’t always covered by mainstream children’s media. We’re looking for dedicated volunteers who have a background in journalism, writing or education to mentor our Kid Reporters and edit the IndyKids newspaper.   volunteer@indykids.org
missionStatement: IndyKids is a free newspaper written for kids, by kids that covers current news and world events from a social justice perspective. Through interactive workshops, kids between the ages of nine and 13 learn about journalism, media literacy and important issues facing today's world. Based out of New York City, IndyKids is distributed across the United States and beyond.
organizationDescription: IndyKids produces content monthly during the school year (September through May) with five print editions and four sets of web exclusive articles. IndyKids currently produces 10,000 copies of every print issue - and reaches kids in 36 states across the nation through 200 classroom and individual subscriptions. On average, about 1,000 people download the PDF of each print issue. The search-able website receives over 7,000 unique visitors each month.

title: Fundraising Volunteers Needed - Support World Disaster Center
description:
The World Disaster Center is seeking passionate Fundraising Volunteers to help expand our efforts in disaster preparedness, response, and recovery. As a volunteer, you’ll play a crucial role in raising funds through word-of-mouth, crowdfunding, and creative campaigns. Join us in making a real impact on disaster-affected communities worldwide.


Preference is for on-site volunteers anywhere in the United States.


We welcome individuals from all backgrounds who are passionate about disaster resilience, fundraising, and community engagement. No prior experience is necessary-just a willingness to contribute and make a difference…
missionStatement: World Disaster Center's mission is to empower communities by providing life-saving information before, during, and after disasters. We strive to redefine global disaster management by harnessing integrated technologies and collective human intelligence to enable preemptive action, effective response, and sustainable recovery from disasters.
organizationDescription: World Disaster Center envisions a world where every community, regardless of how remote or vulnerable, is equipped with the tools and resources necessary to prepare, withstand and recover from disasters, transforming challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.World Disaster Center adopts a holistic approach to disaster management by integrating existing resources and leveraging in-house advanced technologies, creating tailored solutions for local communities, disaster responders, and decision-makers. We bridge the gap between UN agencies, governments, NGOs, private sector, and volunteer networks, while utilizing cutting-edge tools such as AI, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), drones, and real-time data analysis. This synergy facilitates more efficient preparedness, better disaster coordination, and faster recovery, delivering actionable insights when they are most needed.

title: Volunteers - Assist Older Adults  with the Digital World
description:
Digital Grandparents (DGI), We are seeking volunteers to assist older adults with improving their technology skills during our community service program. Volunteers are needed to engage in one -on-one tutoring with older adults on Saturdays from 2-4 PM at the St.Agnes NYPL on the Upper West Side (Amsterdam between 81 and 82 sts)


The organization has had 501(c)(3) status since 2010.


Send an email to info@dg-inc.org with the subject line "I want to volunteer" if you are interested in applying to become a DGI tutor or to learn more about our program.
missionStatement: Digital Grandparents, Inc. is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit corporation committed to providing older adults with access to the wonders of computers and the Internet. Our programs seek to open up the world of Internet communication, social media, news and information, on-line shopping and games, photo-sharing and editing, and more to the growing segment of older adults who struggle with or wish to improve their skills with this new technology. We can help them enrich their lives by enabling them to connect with people and explore the world from their living room chairs.
organizationDescription: Digital Grandparents (DGI). We are seeking volunteers to assist older adults with improving their technology skills throuth our community service program. Volunteers are needed to facilitate the community service program on Thursdays for a minimum of four months starting in August 11.
