title: 2025 United Airlines NYC Half Marathon
description:
Come out and Support Team Life Woithout Lupus at the 2025 United Airliens New York City Half Marathon! Volunteers will receive a purple shirt (provided by the LRA) to wear while cheering.


We’ll provide you with the names of the runners and a mobile app to track their progress in real-time. If you can, be sure to snap a photo of the runners and capture those unforgettable moments!


We'll be gathered to  cheer at 40 CENTRAL PARK SOUTH 59TH STREET BETWEEN 5TH AND 6TH AVENUES NEW YORK, NY  10019 In Front of the restaurant  Sarabeth's  @10:30AM
missionStatement: The mission of the Lupus Research Alliance (LRA) is to find better treatments and ultimately prevent and cure systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE or lupus), a debilitating autoimmune disease, by supporting medical research.
organizationDescription: The Lupus Research Alliance (LRA) is a national voluntary health organization based in New York City that was founded in 1999 and is chaired by Robert Wood Johnson IV, a member of the founding family of Johnson & Johnson. By committing millions of dollars to significant lupus research every year and holding nationwide lupus walks to secure additional funding, the ALR is proactively battling lupus.

title: Irish Arts Center Book Day 2025
description:
Monday, March 17, 2025 | 8am - 4pm (in 3 hours shifts)


Volunteer for a fun St. Patrick’s Day tradition! - The return of Irish Arts Center’s Annual Book Day


On or near St. Patrick’s Day each year, we rely on great volunteers to help us hand out free books by Irish and Irish-American authors across the boroughs of New York City.


Volunteer shifts can be suited to your availability and we try our best to match people to the borough of their choice. For more information and to sign up please fill out our availability survey here:  https://forms.gle/RcxKHqx1JkH9N2RPA


If you aren't available on Book Day itself, Monday, March 17, don't fret! A large part of the event prep depends on your help in making sure each book has an Irish Arts Center sticker and bookmark. Volunteering for these "stuffing" days is a fun way to get involved with the center in a…
missionStatement: Founded in 1972, Irish Arts Center is a New York-based arts and cultural center dedicated to projecting a dynamic image of Ireland and Irish America for the 21st century, building community with artists and audiences of all backgrounds, forging and strengthening cross-cultural partnerships, and preserving the evolving stories and traditions of Irish culture for generations to come.
organizationDescription: The Irish Arts Center is located in historic Hells Kitchen in New York City. We are a multi-disciplinary arts and cultural center with a very full schedule as we present theatre, music, dance, literature, and film throughout the year. We have an active visual and cultural exhibition program. We also have a very strong education program offering over 30 classes a week in Irish music, dance, and language.We work very hard to share what is a unique and rich cultural heritage with not only Irish and Irish-Americans but with the greater community as well.

title: Alternatives to Violence Project Workshop Facilitator
description:
Lead three day, life changing experiential workshops in New York State prisons, schools and communities through exercises in affirmation, communication, cooperation, community building and creative conflict transformation.


AVP is based on the understanding that every person is valuable and that wisdom lies within the group. Facilitators do not have answers. We are all learning together. Facilitators create a safe place for participants to discover our own truths.


Key responsibilities:

• Facilitate on-team three day workshops
• Monitor group process and respond to keep building community and…
missionStatement: The Alternatives to Violence Project is a multi-cultural volunteer organization that is dedicated to reducing interpersonal violence in our society. AVP workshops present conflict management skills that can enable individuals to build successful interpersonal interactions, gain insights into themselves and find new and positive approaches to their lives. The AVP program offers experiential workshops that empower people to lead nonviolent lives through affirmation, respect for all, community building, cooperation and trust.
organizationDescription: AVP is a grassroots, volunteer program dedicated to reducing violence in our lives, in our homes, in our schools, in our prisons and in our society. AVP New York is a collective of volunteers in New York State who, in teams of two to seven, facilitate eighteen-hour minimum experiential workshops over three or more days. Those completing all three levels of workshop become apprentice facilitators and may serve on-team with seasoned facilitators.

title: GG & POP Institute: Supporting Art, Community, and Cultural Engagement - Social Media Volunteer
description:
Volunteer Opportunity with GG & POP Institute: Supporting Art, Community, and Cultural Engagement


GG & POP Institute is seeking committed volunteers to support its community-focused mission of fostering creativity, cultural connection, and artistic growth. As a key cultural organization, GG & POP Institute runs a variety of programs and events that invite the local community to experience art in meaningful ways, connecting with both contemporary issues and traditional craft practices.





About GG & POP Institute and Its Initiatives


GG & POP Institute’s work extends across various creative initiatives, bringing art, dialogue, and social engagement together under one roof…
missionStatement: Cultivating intuitive thinking towards innovation, our mission is to use art, design and wellness to prototype new ideas. We foster intergenerational connections, provide inclusive spaces, and aim to create experiences that transcend boundaries and uplift communities. Through collaborative projects, educational programs, artist training, performances and curated exhibitions, we ignite passion and promote iterative processes that encourage lifelong learning and self-expression. GG & POP Institute envisions a future where art and design serve as cornerstones for free-thinking to grow unconventional concepts.
organizationDescription: GG & POP INSTITUTE (GPI) is a nonprofit artist- run space dedicated to fostering intergenerational creativity, sustainability, and wellness. Located in the heart of East Harlem, GPI has swiftly become a pivotal institution operating under three pillars: art, design, and wellness. Offering a dynamic space for collaborative projects, educational programs, performances, and curated exhibitions, we aim to promote iterative processes that encourage and promote lifelong learning and self-expression.

title: GG & POP Institute: Supporting Art, Community, and Cultural Engagement - Social Media Volunteer
description:
Volunteer Opportunity with GG & POP Institute: Supporting Art, Community, and Cultural Engagement


GG & POP Institute is seeking committed volunteers to support its community-focused mission of fostering creativity, cultural connection, and artistic growth. As a key cultural organization, GG & POP Institute runs a variety of programs and events that invite the local community to experience art in meaningful ways, connecting with both contemporary issues and traditional craft practices.





About GG & POP Institute and Its Initiatives


GG & POP Institute’s work extends across various creative initiatives, bringing art, dialogue, and social engagement together under one roof…
missionStatement: Cultivating intuitive thinking towards innovation, our mission is to use art, design and wellness to prototype new ideas. We foster intergenerational connections, provide inclusive spaces, and aim to create experiences that transcend boundaries and uplift communities. Through collaborative projects, educational programs, artist training, performances and curated exhibitions, we ignite passion and promote iterative processes that encourage lifelong learning and self-expression. GG & POP Institute envisions a future where art and design serve as cornerstones for free-thinking to grow unconventional concepts.

title: South LA Tutors Urgently Needed!
description:
Are you enthusiastic about helping students experiencing homelessness receive quality education and support in South LA? School on Wheels is searching for dedicated individuals to step into the role of being mentors and a sense of stability for our students. For one hour, once a week, you can make a world of difference in a student’s life. If you possess a compassionate heart, and a commitment to making a difference, we invite you to join our team and contribute to our mission of empowering unhoused youth through education.


You can apply at https://schoolonwheels.org/apply-to-be-a-volunteer/


Role and Responsibilities:…
missionStatement: To enhancing educational opportunities for children from kindergarten through twelfth grade who are experiencing homelessness.
organizationDescription: Volunteering to tutor children experiencing homelessness with School on Wheels is a one-hour-a-week commitment and no teaching experience is needed. Volunteering with School on Wheels is an opportunity to share something significant with a child and in return gain meaning in your own life. You can make a difference by supporting children who live in local shelters, motels, foster group homes, and vehicles.Opportunities: We have both online and in-person opportunities in Santa Barbara, Ventura, Los Angeles, Orange, San Bernardino, Riverside, and San Diego ( online only ) counties. You can also volunteer at our Learning Center in Downtown LA with staff and other volunteers. Many children go to the Learning Center after school and throughout the summer.The process to become a volunteer includes a few easy steps: fill out our application, attend a virtual training, provide two references, and complete a background check.To learn more about School on Wheels and how to apply please visit our website at https://schoolonwheels.org/apply-to-be-a-volunteer/* Interested applicants must be 18years old and above, who reside in California*

title: Helping Elders is Awesome!
description: Have some time and compassion to spare? Join ElderHelpers.orgWe put you in touch with elders in need of care who don't require special skills, just good-hearted people.Help Elders with activities that you enjoy on a schedule that works best for you! What to Expect?By sharing a little about yourself on our website, you're saying that you're ready, willing, and standing by. Your profile will be searchable on our site, and you will be contacted by a family as needs arise in your community!Get started by applying today at ElderHelpers.org
missionStatement: Giving everyone a new perspective on life in regards to life expectancy and the aging experience.
organizationDescription: We create safe and convenient connections between volunteers and elders.

title: March for Babies Event Breakdown CA Los Angeles
description: Assist March of Dimes staff with event breakdown on event day
missionStatement: Our mission is to lead the fight for the health of all moms and babies. Our goals are to end the preventable maternal health risks and deaths, end preventable preterm birth and infant death, and close the health equity gap.
organizationDescription: March of Dimes is a nonprofit organization committed to ending preventable maternal health risks and death, ending preventable preterm birth and infant death and closing the health equity gap for all families.March of Dimes believes in a world where every mom and baby is healthy regardless of wealth, race, gender or geography. The U.S. remains among the most dangerous developed nations for childbirth, especially for families of color. Through research, programs and advocacy, our supporters enable us to be there for parents throughout their pregnancies.

title: Enjoy meeting new people? Become a walk-in tutor for adults!
description: Did you know that nearly 1 million adults in Los Angeles face literacy or language barriers?  Join us to share your love of reading and: -- Learn new skills! We provide all the training, materials, and support you'll need to be effective. -- Meet lots of great people from different cultures and places. -- Face challenges and learn how to overcome them. -- Develop (or grow!) a passion for learning and teaching others. -- Create real and meaningful change in your own community. -- Gain great experience that can be applied in multiple job fields. Volunteers are fundamental to the success of library literacy services…
missionStatement: The Los Angeles Public Library provides free and easy access to information, ideas, books and technology that enrich, educate and empower every individual in our city's diverse communities.
organizationDescription: The Los Angeles Public Library is largest public research institution west of the Mississippi.

title: 2025 Food Drive 4 Homeless-Low income Families Tour, Dtla,CA
description:
(: Amen. It's 2024 so let have some fun with other joyful volunteers collecting Food and Cookies 4 the Fun Zone Reading Club 4 Homeless Kids Families in world-famous Downtown Los Angeles, CALos Angeles County is "The homeless capital of the United States of America" (: With over 38,473 peoples living on the streets? Joyful volunteers donate smiles and candy other items to serve to homeless- low-income kids (:


The candy and prizes and other items you the joyful volunteer donate will be giving to the homeless- low income kids that participate in the 2025 fun zone reading club 4 kids party tour (:
missionStatement: to provide Homeless and low-income Kids with Free Books,Shoes,Baby Diapers,Bikes,Toys,Sports Camp,Fun Field Trips,Clothes give Volunteer Work Experience with our Internship Program
organizationDescription: Fun Zone Reading Club for Homeless Kids is a Reading Merit program that Club Member Read a Book and write a short Book report turn it in to Earn points to be turn in for Fun rewards like Books,Toys,Bikes and Fun Field Trips

title: Project Director - Los Angeles CA
description:
Project Coordinator


Join Us in Making a Difference!





Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference.





About Us:


Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and 'Street Care'. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and we have been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile individual to join our management team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you!





The Project Director
missionStatement: Helping individuals thrive academically, socially, and emotionally
organizationDescription: Bright Mind is a community wellness education organization.Bright Mind recently launched Street Care, a massive initiative built by our homelessness and wellness experts, 'your toolkit to help homeless people.' We have an app, an expanding series of informational materials and instructional videos (25+ already), and more (at streetcare.us). We are pioneering an online and on-the-streets outreach approach, accessible to everyone.For all of Bright Mind's work, well-being, tenacity, curiosity, and creativity are the heart of the approach, to help individuals thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. We are passionate about building community. This is a crucial time to create positive change, and we look forward to working together as we accomplish great things together!

title: Volunteer as a Mentor at Betty Plascencia Elementary !
description:
Who Are We?


Young Storytellers is a youth development and arts education nonprofit organization based in Los Angeles and with programs across the country. Our mission is to spark creative self-discovery through storytelling. and equip young people to be the driving force of their own narratives.We’re passionate about bringing people together and creating stories to raise the voices of those who don’t often get heard. We believe that when a young person understands the power of their own story-made of their unique background, culture, race, gender, sexuality, immigration status, geographic location, and economic status-it creates a more empathetic and equitable future for everyone. We raise voices, one story at a time…
missionStatement: Young Storytellers sparks creative self-discovery through storytelling. Our programs highlight young people as the center of their own narratives, emphasize that their stories matter, and celebrate their unique voices as the ones telling them. Young Storytellers works towards a future where young people experience, through the stories they write, the impact that their thoughts, feelings, and words can have on the world in which they live. We raise voices, one story at a time.
organizationDescription: In elementary school, Young Storytellers uses storytelling to help young people explore their creativity and imagination. In middle school, we use storytelling to explore their goals for the future and what challenges might stand in their way. In high school, we use storytelling to explore the impact their voice can have in their community - and, more broadly, the world.

title: Support Red Cross Blood Drives - Volunteer! (Los Angeles)
description: You play a crucial role in the Red Cross mission. With your help, we can succeed in providing lifesaving blood to cancer and transplant patients, premature babies, accident victims and others who need blood.The Role of Blood Donor Ambassador is to provide excellent and enthusiastic customer service and enhance the donor experience. Each blood donor deserves to be treated as an honored guest! Engage with donors to make the donation experience fulfilling and set the stage for a long-term commitment to regular blood donations.
missionStatement: The American Red Cross prevents and alleviates human suffering in the face of emergencies by mobilizing the power of volunteers and the generosity of donors.
organizationDescription: Every single day, the American Red Cross helps people in emergencies. Whether its one displaced family, thousands of disaster victims, or providing care and comfort to an ill or injured service member or veteran or support to a military family member, our vital work is made possible by people like you. It is through the time and care of ordinary people that we can do extraordinary things. Join a team of 4000+ regular volunteers in the Los Angeles Region to deliver services to local communities daily, weekly or monthly.

title: Executive Assistant
description: ** If you are sending us a message, please also check your spam mail for a response from us.**Thank you for considering this position.This volunteer position will be working close to the Founder of the charity.Love My Neighbor Foundation is a 501 (c) 3 nonprofit. We feed the homeless of downtown Los Angeles every Thursday. LMNF was est. Dec. 2014. We plan on expanding the charity and helping in other areas. We are looking for someone that is reliable, dedicated, has a passion for helping others, and that wants to be a part of a team. Someone that is able to at least physically volunteer with us on 2 Thursdays of every month (if not every Thursday). Volunteering every week isn't…
missionStatement: Establishing a viable and respectable means for homeless individuals to receive the necessities of life as they regain their way back into society. Love My Neighbor, is not just another foundation giving away food, clothes etc. This foundation was established to allow homeless individuals to keep their pride and dignity as they receive food, clothing, shoes, toiletries and spiritual enlightenment. Our volunteers are individuals in the community that realize the plight of the homeless and display such by giving countless hours to ensure their comfort when distributing necessities.
organizationDescription: We serve our Skidrow Neighbors every Thursday from 12p-2.

title: Resident Services Program Associate (LISC AmeriCorps)
description:
Help develop and nurture relationships with community partners to further support financial education efforts as a Program Associate for LTSC’s Resident Services department. You will work closely with Resident Services staff to receive financial training to provide a financial curriculum for youth that come from low-income households.


This is an 11-month position where you will typically serve 40 hours a week, normally Monday through Friday, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., with occasional evenings and weekends. You will report in person at our office and will be required to travel locally for meetings and community events.


When You Serve:


· Earn a $27,200 stipend payable by bimonthly direct deposit.


· Earn an additional $7,395 education benefit to pay down qualifying student loan debt or to continue your education…
missionStatement: For over 40 years, Little Tokyo Service Center (LTSC) has provided a safety net of social welfare and community development services to empower people and communities in need. LTSC provides culturally and linguistically appropriate services to the Japanese American community in the Greater Los Angeles area, builds multi-family affordable housing projects to uplift low-income neighborhoods of color throughout Los Angeles, and promotes equitable development and cultural preservation in the Little Tokyo neighborhood.
organizationDescription: Volunteers are the heart of our organization. You can truly make a difference in the lives of our clients and residents and positively impact the community! Opportunities range from one-time event help to providing ongoing support for various programs. Consider making a donation here: https://give.ltsc.org/give/327045/#!/donation/checkout

title: Explore Teaching STEM
description:
Explore becoming a science, technology, engineering or math teacher in an under-resourced community. EnCorps supports STEM professionals ready to explore STEM teaching. Please note that to qualify for the EnCorps STEM Teachers Program, applicants must not currently have a California teaching credential / license / certification in the core subject they intend to teach.


About the EnCorps STEM Teachers Program The EnCorps STEM Teachers Program recruits STEM professionals interested in exploring teaching in an under-resourced community. Once accepted into the program you are known as an EnCorps Fellow and will work with your dedicated Program Coordinator to develop an individualized plan…
missionStatement: WE ARE STEM PROFESSIONALS PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY EDUCATION TO CLOSE ACHIEVEMENT GAPS FOR STUDENTS IN LOW INCOME COMMUNITIES
organizationDescription: Founded in 2007, EnCorps Inc. is a Los Angeles-based nonprofit with operations in California as well the greater Denver, Colorado and New York City areas. EnCorps connects highly effective STEM educators with public school students to counter the systemic injustice preventing children in under-resourced communities from accessing a high-quality STEM education. The EnCorps STEM Teachers Program(r) recruits, selects and supports STEM professionals and experts in the science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) fields as well as individuals who possess an advanced STEM degree to transition to teaching as an innovative, long-term solution to the STEM teacher shortage and to counter the alarming lack of math proficiency of middle and high school students nationwide. The EnCorps STEMx Tutors Program matches middle school students, currently under-performing in math, with volunteer STEM professionals, subject-matter experts and STEM college students to increase math skills and confidence prior to students entering high school.

title: Drive Cancer Patients to Treatment as a Road To Recovery Volunteer-Los Angeles
description:
Organization: American Cancer Society





The American Cancer Society provides free rides to treatment for people with cancer. As a trained Road To Recovery volunteer driver, you can change someone’s life in as little as one hour a week by ensuring a ride is available, so care isn’t stopped or delayed.





Keep in mind that most rides are needed during Monday through Friday, primarily between 7 a.m. and 7 p.m. Drivers should have regular availability at some point during that time frame (you choose your availability).





If you own or have regular access to a safe, reliable vehicle, then you’re already on the road to volunteering. But you’ll also need to…
missionStatement: At the American Cancer Society our mission is to improve the lives of people with cancer and their families through advocacy, research, and patient support, to ensure that everyone has an opportunity to prevent, detect, treat, and survive cancer.
organizationDescription: While most people know us for our research, we do so much more. We promote healthy lifestyles to help you prevent cancer. We research cancer and its causes to find more answers and better treatments. We fight for lifesaving policy changes. We provide everything from emotional support to the latest cancer information for those who have been touched by cancer.

title: Community Cooking Club
description: Help make delicious meals for the Ladies of DWC with other volunteers. You will be provided with a recipe and a list of ingredients needed to prepare the meal. Each volunteer will choose a small list of ingredients that they will bring with them when they join their group to prepare the meal. Events happen approximately twice per month on weekday evenings. Email us at groupvolunteerevents.org for upcoming dates!
missionStatement: Founded in 1978, the Downtown Women’s Center (DWC) is the only organization in Los Angeles focused exclusively on serving women and gender diverse individuals experiencing homelessness. We end homelessness for women and gender diverse individuals by providing safe housing and supportive services centered on wellness, employment, and advocacy. Our Housing First and trauma-informed service model includes: Access to basic needs and resources through our Day Center, where participants can receive three daily meals and access to showers, restrooms, mail, and telephones. On-site housing and supportive services, with our 119 units of permanent housing across two residences making us one of the largest housing providers for women in the country. Community-based housing services, provided in partnership with the Los Angeles County Department of Health Services, the Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority (LAHSA), the Governor’s Office of Emergency Services, and various private foundations and corporations. Health and wellness services, including individual and group counseling, medical care, mental health services, preventive screenings, Trauma Recovery Center services, and enrichment activities We welcome volunteers who share a commitment to DWC’s core values of safety, respect, social justice, and community, and invite you to join us in our mission to end homelessness for women in Los Angeles. Volunteers are integral to this work!
organizationDescription: Support from volunteers is invaluable as we work towards our mission of ending homelessness for women and gender diverse individuals in greater Los Angeles through housing, wellness, employment, and advocacy, Our ever growing list of volunteer opportunities include: * Kitchen: make and serve meals for 150-200 women per shift * Day Center: welcome participants and guests, answer phones, distribute toiletry kits, etc. * Learning Center: offer one-on-one computer support to participants * Residence Host: welcome and check in with our permanent supportive housing residents * Maintenance Assistant: help our facilities keep DWC clean and safe for participants, staff, and other volunteers * Donations Sorting: receive, sort, and organize clothing and other donations that come into the center * Classy Closet: organize and pull items from the storage area dedicated to professional attire that participants use for job interviews etc. Email volunteer@downtownwomenscenter.org or visit downtownwomenscenter.org for more info!

title: Speak Spanish? Facilitate a Spanish Job Preparation Class in Los Angeles
description:
Chrysalis serves people navigating barriers to the workforce by offering a job-readiness program, individualized supportive services, and paid transitional employment. We empower our clients on their pathway to stability, security, and fulfillment in their work and lives.





We are seeking volunteers who are highly motivated by Chrysalis’ mission and desire to improve the social and economic fabric of our community.


Are you fluent in Spanish? Please consider joining our team of volunteers and teaching one of our Spanish classes! Our volunteer opportunity includes facilitating job preparation classes for our clients as part of their professional development and job training program.





This is an in-person ONLY volunteer opportunity!


Time commitment is  6 months minimum with availability to provide services at least  1 hour minimum every other week (weekly is also an…
missionStatement: To create a pathway to self-sufficiency for homeless and low-income individuals by providing the resources and support needed to prepare for, find, and retain employment.
organizationDescription: Our Volunteers are essential to this mission, and work directly with clients to help them gain employment. You can:Facilitate classes (job search readiness courses)Perform One-on-one resume building, interview practice and online applicationsProvide Job search assistance Sort donation items We seek volunteers with excellent communication skills who want to make an impact in their local community. You will be directly involved in helping people enter the working world and regain their confidence, pride and stability.Volunteer opportunities are available Monday-Thursday 8am-4pm and Friday 8am -12pm. Training is provided, and we ask for a 6 month commitment. Opportunities are available in the San Fernando Valley, Downtown LA, Santa Monica, Anaheim and the Inland Empire.

title: Volunteer to encourage Roosevelt High School students with engaging writing projects
description:
826LA provides a variety of free programming throughout the week for students ages 6-18, designed to challenge and enchant while strengthening writing skills.


"I first heard about the amazing work 826LA was doing through a dear friend. I signed up immediately when I learned about the wonderful opportunity to share my passion for writing, social justice, and working with youth. I am thrilled to be a part of such a dedicated and caring team of folks doing transformative and necessary work in so many communities."


-Sophia, 826LA volunteer

Getting Started…
missionStatement: 826LA is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting students ages 6 to 18 with their creative and expository writing skills, and to helping teachers inspire their students to write. Our services are structured around the understanding that great leaps in learning can happen with one-on-one attention, and that strong writing skills are fundamental to future success. With this in mind, we provide after school tutoring, reading and creative writing workshops, in-schools projects, and field trips! All of our programs are challenging and enjoyable, and ultimately strengthen each student's power to express ideas effectively, creatively, confidently, and in their individual voice. We have two brick and mortars in Mar Vista and Echo Park, as well as three Writers Rooms at Roosevelt High School, at Manual Arts High School, and at Venice High School.
organizationDescription: We have a high need for volunteers to support our day time Field Trips and In-Schools programs. You can help facilitate brainstorming sessions and share-outs, type up student ideas, and support the editing process. You'll also have the opportunity to work one-on-one or with a small group of students, on various writing projects ranging from personal statement essays, Catcher in the Rye essays, poetry, creative writing, and everything in between.

title: Kitchen Aide
description: The Kitchen Aide assists in the preparation of meals in a fast-paced environment and in the cleanliness of the equipment and work area. Duties include washing, peeling, chopping, and cutting foodstuffs under the Kitchen Area Supervisor; preparing and packaging cold and hot packs for delivery; assembling frozen meal packages; and adhering to health and safety/FDA guidelines. Volunteers should have the ability to bend, stoop, kneel, and twist; ability to stand prolonged periods of time; and ability to lift ten pounds or more.Shifts are usually 8 am to noon. Volunteers are needed Mondays - Fridays.Must pass a background check and attend a brief orientation prior to volunteering.
missionStatement: We prepare and deliver warm nutritious meals to homedbound ill seniors everyday of the year in the Los Angeles area.
organizationDescription: We prepare and deliver warm nutritious meals to homedbound ill seniors everyday of the year in the Los Angeles area.

title: 2025 Big Sunday Ice Cream Give away To Homeless U.S. Vets in Downtown LA
description: Be part of a joyful team who's mission is to serve the  Skid row community.Why: Volunteers will donate time and provide some ice cream to feed homeless vets and others homeles peoples. With thousands of homeless vets living on the streets in Downtown Los Angeles, the need is high to reach and feed them so they can get access to mental health and housing services. Who: Pasadena-Altadena Community Youth Association's mission is to provide at-risk youth with free sport camps, books, field trips and a pathway to community service. Join them in the next couple of Sundays, as they provide U.S. homeless Veterans with a free cooked meal, winter coats, tents, blankets, shoes, hygiene kits and socks.
missionStatement: To provide at-risk youth with free sport camps, books and free field trips and a road to do community service.
organizationDescription: We clean sweep the side walks of world famous skid row on Saturdays 9am-11amwe need sweeper to sweep the side walks then bag and dump trash in local dumper? water the flower bed? power wash the side walks,paint donated trash cans, paint murals, plant trees, bring food to feed the homeless vets, read out loud to kids every Thursday for 10mins then give a 5 mins Q&A on why reading is fun, cook food to bring for Xmas eve feeding, collect and give out winter coats, do data entry, phone banking, marketing, and branding design.

title: Volunteer city staff LA
description:
Mil Mujeres Legal Services


Mil Mujeres Legal Services, a Non-Profit organization is looking for a City Staff Volunteer in Los Ángeles.. On-Site.


About the Organization:


Mil Mujeres Legal Services is a nonprofit organization focusing on immigration benefits for survivors of violent crimes and their families. We offer immigration legal services to the low-income Latino community who have been victims of violent crimes within the United States. Our primary focus is gender-based crime survivors.





We are looking for a City Staff Volunteer for our LA office!


Role description:


Immerse in the most relevant legal migration processes, contact and…
missionStatement: Mil Mujeres Legal Services is an organization that helps victims of violence by petitioning for immigration status with The United States Citizenship and Immigration Services. We provide low-cost legal services to low-income families who would not otherwise be able to afford legal services
organizationDescription: Mil Mujeres Legal Services is an organization that helps victims of violence by petitioning for immigration status with The United States Citizenship and Immigration Services. We provide low-cost legal services to low-income families who would not otherwise be able to afford legal services

title: Host an International Exchange Student!
description:
Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student!





All our students need is:

• A bedroom (can be shared with host sibling)
• 3 meals a day
• Transportation to and from school, if there are no school buses provided
• A welcoming family! :)




*All other expenses (activity fees, personal items, etc.) are paid for by…
missionStatement: AnB Education Stands for Above and Beyond Education. "Inspiring the Dream of Education across all Nations." Established in 2009, AnB Education is a non-profit international exchange organization committed to the support of cultural experience along with academic support. And approved by the CA Attorney General's Registry of International Student Exchange Visitor Placement Organizations.

title: Los Angeles Chinatown Firecracker Event
description:
Sign up here: https://firecracker10k.org/volunteers#content


Established in 1978.


L.A. Chinatown Firecracker Run Committee, Inc. (LACFRC) are a non-salaried group of volunteers who donate their time and energy to organize and stage events and programs; promoting health, fitness, and cultural awareness to the greater Los Angeles community.


All proceeds are reinvested in the community, in support of elementary schools and non-profit organizations, providing service and programs that benefit local neighborhoods…
missionStatement: To promote health and fitness, education, cultural awareness, and community involvement, by organizing athletic and community programs, events.
organizationDescription: The Los Angeles Firecracker Run Committee, Inc. is a community-based, 501.3(c)(3) non-profit organization staffed by non-salaried volunteers who donate their time and energies to organize and stage an annual run/walk/bike event. Proceeds from the Firecracker events are used to promote an enhanced quality of life for those who live and attend school in and around the greater Los Angeles Chinatown area, by providing charitable and civic organizations with financial and logistical support.

title: Transport
description: Transporting dogs within Los Angeles as needed - typically picking up dog from foster and taking to vet and returning, or other basic dog transport needs.  Car would need to be able to fit a medium size dog carrier for safety.
missionStatement: We pride ourselves in taking discarded Lives into our own - Healing them - and righting the wrongs heaped upon those innocents. We are Humans. We are flawed. And that is why we rely on each other. We are at our Finest as a Collective...and that is the place we serve THEM best. We know that THEY need Our Help - Just like we need YOUR Help. That is why we are Community Faced. To Educate, Negotiate, Support, Empower, and Enable individuals to Help their own...and then Assist Others. THAT is the way we GROW. THAT is the way we Save MORE Lives. We will not adopt our way out of pet overpopulation in L.A. This NOT a shell game, nor a shuffle. We must go Wider. Deeper.
organizationDescription: We are a non profit canine rescue group based out of the Echo Park / Silverlake areas who work to find dogs in need a home, rehabilitation of dogs who have special needs and educating the public about dog ownership and responsibilties.

title: Monthly Film Festival Volunteer
description: NewFilmmakers Los Angeles (NFMLA) is looking for talented, passionate, and dedicated people to help run our monthly Film Festivals in Downtown Los Angeles.Most of NFMLA's Film Festivals will be held at the South Park Center in Downtown Los Angeles (1139 S. Hill Street, Los Angeles 90015). Parking is available at 1133 S. Olive Street, 90015 (validations are provided). *The only exceptions are NFMLA's Latinx and Hispanic Film Festival in September and Middle Eastern & Arab Film Festival in December, which are both sponsored by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences (The Academy Awards aka The Oscars). Both of these festivals will be at the Mary Pickford Center in Hollywood.
missionStatement: NewFilmmakers LA at Sunset Gower Studios is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization designed to showcase innovative works by emerging filmmakers from around the world, providing the Los Angeles community of entertainment professionals and film goers with a constant surge of monthly screening events. NewFilmmakers LA provides a forum where filmmakers can be recognized for their contributions, have open audience discussions about their projects and connect with industry professionals for insight on distribution, production, acquisition and representation.

title: Host a Child in Foster Care in Los Angeles!
description:
What does it mean to be a "Host"?


Think of it as being a super mentor and opening your heart and home to a child who needs the stability, security, and support of a family.


By hosting through our Los Angeles Weekend Miracles program, you commit to spending regular time with an older kid in foster care, this means seeing them at least twice a month for a minimum of a year. Host families spend this time getting to know a teen, building a connection, and supporting them as they navigate their lives with the goal of developing a lifelong, connected, caring relationship. Additionally, Hosts help advocate to find an adoptive family if that is what their host child wishes.…
missionStatement: Our mission is to create change so that children to be adopted grow up in families and are connected to caring adults. Kidsave International is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization
organizationDescription: In 1993 Terry Baugh traveled to Russia to adopt a child. She was not prepared for what she saw. The orphanage was a huge, cold institution with an insufficient number of caregivers for all of the children. Children with shaved heads were sitting in playpens with no toys and no stimulation. Terry shared her experience with Randi Thompson, her business partner, also an adoptive parent. They did their homework and learned that the neglect caused by orphanage living creates brain damage, psychological problems and slows development.

title: Volunteer panelist: Motivate LA youth with your story!
description:
Did you have a relatable role model in high school who motivated you? Or do you remember wishing you had one?


Now, you can be that role model. During Motivational March (March 24-28), join the PLUS ME Project as a volunteer panelist to inspire high school students in Los Angeles by sharing your story and raising $100 to support our mission.


As a volunteer panelist, you will:

• Choose a virtual volunteer onboarding to attend in the month of February.
• Choose a virtual panel practice to attend in the month of March.
• Share your story to inspire students who need to hear it in person during the week of March 24th to the 28th. (You will share on one day during one class.)…
missionStatement: PLUS ME Project believes everyone has a story that matters. We activate the art of personal storytelling to build confidence in youth as they pursue their college, career, and life goals.
organizationDescription: Since our founding in 2013, PLUS ME has impacted over 150,000 middle and high school students from over 350 low-income schools across the LA area. We provide guest speaker presentations, storytelling workshops, writing workshops, and professional development programs for students, educators, and parents-all developed with guidance from experienced educators. We also offer two $1,000 scholarship opportunities (My Story Matters: LISTEN; My Story Matters: IMPACT). There are five awardees for each scholarship, meaning we provide a total of 10, $1,000 awards each year. Both require applicants to submit a 1500 word personal narrative which is read and scored by PLUS ME staff and volunteers.

title: Sew or Knit? Share your talents with PIH Health Good Samaritan Hospital (PHGSH)
description: Looking for volunteers willing to share their talents either sewing or knitting items for our patients from the comfort of their home or in person at the hospital. Items can include beanies, scarfs, blankets, pillows etc. These items help provide comfort and help us enhance our patient experience and help us meet our vision of patients firsts. Volunteers can help with the entire process or work in parts. For example, one volunteer can cut out patterns, another can sew patterns or help stuff pillows. Hours are flexible.
missionStatement: PIH Health, a not-for-profit regional hospital and health center, delivers healthcare services to southeastern Los Angeles County and portions of the San Gabriel Valley and Orange County. PIH Health provides high quality health care without discrimination, demonstrating compassion, respect, and dignity in caring for all patients. Recognizing its charitable mission, the hospital's efforts are directed toward contributing to the health and well-being of its communities in an ethical and a fiscally prudent manner. PIH Health is committed to building a mutually supportive healthcare team-consisting of board members, medical staff, employees and volunteers. This team is dedicated to maintaining a modern facility staffed by highly skilled personnel and to offering specialized centers of excellence, research opportunities, education, and community healthcare programs.
organizationDescription: Volunteer Services is currently seeking adult and student volunteers. We currently have 3 categories of volunteers: High School, at least 16 years old and a Sophomore, College and Adults, adults, primarily not in school. When applying, please indicate which category you are.

title: Walk/Run with People Overcoming Addiction (DTLA/Pico Union -Tuesday or Thursday afternoon)
description: To apply, please visit our website and complete the online application: https://www.stridesinrecovery.org/volunteerUse your passion for exercise and your friendly personality to support people on their journey to long-term sobriety. As a Strides in Recovery assistant coach / mentor, you will walk, jog or run with small groups of the newly sober who are receiving treatment at a DTLA program in the Pico Union area. All activities take place on a gated property. You do NOT need to be a serious runner. You do need to be capable of walking/jogging several miles while being a good listener and engaging in supportive conversation.  Exercise, and especially exercise done toward a goal and with a team…
missionStatement: Strides in Recovery is a Southern California nonprofit which helps newly sober individuals grow physically, emotionally and mentally stronger so they can do their best at the hard work of recovery. We achieve these results by coaching people in addiction treatment programs to complete 5Ks, 10Ks, and half marathons.
organizationDescription: Use your passion for exercise and your friendly personality to support people on their journey to long-term sobriety. As a Strides in Recovery assistant coach / mentor, you will walk, jog or run with small groups of the newly sober who are receiving treatment at an addiction recovery program. You do NOT need to be a serious runner. You do need to be capable of walking/jogging several miles while being a good listener and engaging in supportive conversation. Exercise, and especially exercise done toward a goal and with a team, has been clinically proven to promote the mindset needed to stay sober and reduce the risk of relapse. Training for this role will include an overview of the causes and treatment for addiction, with an emphasis on the physical, emotional, and mental health benefits of exercise in early recovery.The first-year post-addiction treatment relapse rate is 40-60%, and since the pandemic, the number of overdose deaths has been climbing. You will be part of bringing those numbers down! Together, we will support recovery. Together, we will change lives.

Creating and implementing diverse and enriching programs and opportunities that support STC, UNITE-LA provides a seamless sequence of school- and work-based learning opportunities as well as connecting activities aimed at creating a vital link between classroom learning and â real worldâ living.

title: In-School Volunteer for Students Impacted by Incarceration at New Village Girls Academy
description: Pain of the Prison System (POPS) creates, oversees and supports clubs that meet weekly throughout the academic year in high schools. POPS was created to support students who have been impacted by the carceral system. Most club members have parents and/or other loved ones who are or have been incarcerated; some students have been incarcerated themselves; and a number of students have family members who have been detained and/or deported. Needless to say, these students face a significant amount of stigma and loss. But in POPS clubs, students begin to recognize their own resilience while building supportive relationships with their peers. The POPS curriculum encourages students to find and use their voices in conversation, writing, artwork, and other types of creative expression…
missionStatement: The mission of POPS the Club is to support youth impacted by incarceration and confront the challenges they experience. Through arts-based programs, POPS creates a safe, empowering space for these youth, transforming stigma into hope and dignity so they can thrive academically, socially, and emotionally, now and as adults.
organizationDescription: POPS the Club started in 2013 at Venice High School as a method of supporting youth who have loved ones in prison to hope and healing. POPS was established as a 501(c)3 in early 2014, and as of June 2019, clubs have been established in eight high schools in Los Angeles, as well as in Georgia, New York, and Pennsylvania. POPS publishes an annual anthology of POPS students' and graduates' writings and artwork. Our goal is to bring the POPS program to high schools across the country. The impact of the support of peers, a curriculum focused on self-expression, mindfulness, and community engagement has been profoundly healing.

Because of our unique onboarding process for both volunteers and participants, we are able to connect you with a participant that will likely become your good friend. Our matches are intentionally made to create reciprocal bonds. Also matches are made during your availability, whether you…

organizationDescription: We empower individuals to live connected and fulfilled lives through our Community Services Division. title: Disrupt the Cycle of Homelessness by Walking/Running with Us in LA
description: Join the Back on My Feet community in your city for an early morning walk/jog/run engaging as part of a support system to our members - your new team, promoting community, wellness, accountability, and achievement!!! You will not only be part of revolutionizing the way society perceives homelessness, you’ll have a chance to be part of your teammates' journey toward self-sufficiency. Orientation to join a Back on My Feet Circle-Up is on demand - GET STARTED HERE: https://backonmyfeet.org/get-involved/volunteer/
missionStatement: Back on My Feet empowers people to achieve economic independence through fitness and community. Who We Help: We work with people experiencing homelessness or addiction who currently reside within shelters and recovery facilities. How It Works: We run and walk 2-3 times a week to build a sense of community and responsibility. With the support of workforce development, our members can work toward sustainable employment and self-sufficiency.
organizationDescription: Back on My Feet seeks to revolutionize the way society approaches homelessness. Our unique model demonstrates that if you first restore confidence, strength and self-esteem, individuals are better equipped to tackle the road ahead. For all in need, we aim to provide: practical training and employment resources for achieving independence; an environment that promotes accountability; and a community that offers compassion and hope.

title: Mentor an LA Student! Change two lives.
description:
We're looking for one mentor for every student in our program. That mentor could be you!


Mentoring is a big part of what I Have a Dream Foundation - Los Angeles does for our students. We provide a long-term program of academic enhancement, mentoring and cultural enrichment and help our Dreamers graduate from high school, ready to attend college and realize their dreams.


A mentor is asked to meet with their mentee for their monthly group session with other paired mentor/mentee matches to receive continual support during the building of their relationships. Plus an opportunity to use their learned tools from the group sessions in practice during their 1-on-1 outing. They should also keep in touch once a week via…
missionStatement: The "I Have A Dream" Foundation of Los Angeles (IHAD-LA) was founded in 1987 and is a comprehensive educational enrichment and dropout prevention program. IHAD-LA adopts an entire grade level of inner-city elementary students and provides year-round tutoring, mentoring and cultural enrichment through high school graduation. IHAD-LA guarantees each adopted student, known as a Dreamer, a partial scholarship to pursue their higher education goals.
organizationDescription: The have the occasional need for Dream Speakers educated on specific topics such as resume building, interviewing, and social media etiquette for workshops. They have a Dream Big STEM Event every April where an organization in the STEM field hosts a field trip for students to learn about different careers. Organization is also looking for corporate partnerships, board members, and sponsorships with fundraiser they host in the spring.

organizationDescription: Our 'CANVAS OF CARE' program is a monthly SIP-N-PAINT class held at our partnered senior facilities in LA. We are looking for 5-10 MULTI-LINGUAL Artists, painters, illustrators, etc. able to lead group painting sessions (2-3 hours), What We're Looking For:- Fluency in Korean, Spanish, Mandarin, or Cantonese - Must be able to communicate clearly with seniors in their native language.- Artistic Skills - Previous experience in leading art classes or working with diverse groups of people is a plus!- Compassionate Heart - We're seeking individuals who genuinely care about enriching the lives of seniors, showing patience, kindness, and respect for their life experiences.- Reliable Transportation - Must be able to travel to various locations in Central Los Angeles.- Independence & Teamwork - Ability to guide the painting class independently, while collaborating with facility coordinators to ensure a smooth experience for the seniors.Program Commitment:- Monthly Sessions - We are seeking volunteers who can commit to one session per month (2-3 hours per session) for 6 months to 1 year.- Locations - With our partnered Adult Day Health Care Centers and Assisted Living Facilities in Central Los Angeles.- Starting Date - January 13, 2025.We Provide All Painting Materials - We supply everything you need for the class, including canvases, paints, brushes, aprons, etc.

title: Fellowship 25' - High School Ambassador
description: Our fellows will mainly be in charge of running Voter Education Week's at their high schools. High School Voter Education Weeks aims to increase youth voter participation and foster civic engagement among young people across the nation while also educating students on how to register to vote. This week-long event will bring together schools, educators, students, and community leaders to empower high school students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become active and informed voters.
missionStatement: New Era of Democracy strives to increase youth civic engagement and political participation, strengthening young voices.
organizationDescription: New Era of Democracy is dedicated to empowering the next generation of leaders through political engagement and civic participation. As a youth-focused nonpartisan non-profit organization, we strive to ignite a passion for democracy and social responsibility among young individuals. New Era is currently organizing its first ever New Era Fellowship, where high school ambassadors are in charge of running Voter Education Weeks at their schools. Fellows will be in charge of organizing events/activities on their campuses throughout the week that will cover various aspects of the electoral process, including voter registration, understanding ballot measures, researching candidates, etc. Fellows will coordinate with other students, teachers, and admin in order to carry out this week. New Era is committed to bringing youth representation to students within school districts. In fact, within the ABC Unified School District, we were able to get the signatures of 500 students from 3 high schools to establish a student representative position on the school board. This student would be responsible for representing the interests of all students from the district. We are hoping to expand this operation and coordinate with students who do not currently have this position available on their school boards. Join us at New Era of Democracy, and together, let's create a world where youth voices are heard and where civic engagement thrives. Together, we are building a stronger democracy, one young leader at a time.

title: Chair, Divine Wellness
description: The Right Kind of Black Girl (TRKBG) Program Committee, Divine Wellness Recruitment AnnouncementThe Right Kind of Black Girl (TRKBG) is seeking new program committee members for its's Divine Wellness Program. TheTRKBG Program Committee works collaboratively together to plan, implement, and execute events, workshops, and general programming for TRKBG's program, Divine Wellness. Thank you for considering the opportunity to join The Right Kind of Black Girl's Program Committee. We are thrilled to extend an invitation to passionate individuals who share our commitment to empowering women of color. As a committee member, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the organization's future, driving impactful initiatives, and fostering positive change within our community. This is more than a position; it's a chance to be part of a movement that celebrates diversity, resilience, and empowerment. We invite you to explore this opportunity further and contribute your unique talents and…
missionStatement: The Right Kind of Black Girl (TRKBG) provides a pathway to freedom from through unity, advancement, and living a life of wholeness. We are committed to building a world where women thrive, uplift their communities and each other as they journey to greatness.
organizationDescription: The Right Kind of Black Girl Inc. is a grassroots women-led 501(c)(3) tax exempt not-for-profit organization founded by Shambria Williams in 2018. The Right Kind of Black Girl (TRKBG) provides a pathway to freedom from through unity, advancement, and living a life of wholeness. We are committed to building a world where women thrive, uplift their communities and each other as they journey to greatness. We envisions a world where Black women and girls are not simply surviving but thriving. We aim to create social systems free of gender, economic and racial barriers. We have come together to initiate a strong re-enforcement of that infrastructure by forging our collectivepaths through corporate, entrepreneurial, social, and personal obstacles. We take a holistic approach to supporting Black women and girls from the Afrikan diaspora between the ages of 15 and 60 who stem from generational poverty to cultivate sisterhood by empowering them to lead, innovate, and serve our communities. We are dedicated to aiding our communities in living a life of wholeness that is define uniquely for every individual we serve.

title: Mentor- Refugee Support (Spanish/Farsi/Pashto)
description:
The Interfaith Refugee & Immigration Service (IRIS) is a social and legal service agency dedicated to aiding refugees, asylees, migrants and other displaced persons fleeing persecution. Involvement from established community members broadens the quality of support that clients receive. Immigrants & refugees have many new social, economic, and environmental factors to navigate.


With kind and dedicated volunteers as IRIS Mentors, IRIS services will be expanded to include greater social connection and individualized support in overcoming resettlement challenges. These are significant assets in developing stable self-sufficiency.


An IRIS Mentor will be a reliable connection and support for an individual or family finding stability. Using their knowledge of the local area and life experiences, IRIS Mentors will work withclients on specific goals for reaching self-sufficiency in LA, depending on client need and mentor background. Mentors will need to note activities completed with clients. This mentorship position is a commitment to support for at…
missionStatement: The mission of Interfaith Refugee and Immigration Service (IRIS) is to provide a gracious welcome as well as tangible tools and connections to help new arrivals achieve self-sufficiency in the United States. IRIS has several programs including: refugee resettlement, immigration legal services, cultural orientation, food pantry program and an ESL/Civics program. IRIS is a program of the Episcopal Diocese of Los Angeles and operates in conjunction with Episcopal Migration Ministries.
organizationDescription: IRIS provides a gracious welcome and tangible tools for self-sufficiency to hundreds of refugees, immigrants, and asylees in the Greater Los Angeles region each year.

title: Community Meals: Mid-Day Support
description: Clean and prep kitchen space!Why: Serve LA provides an average of 1000 meals per week. These community meals occur Monday through Friday with breakfast from 10-11 am and dinner from 5-6 pm.Who: Serve LA is seeking the renewal of Los Angeles by guiding the marginalized from suffering to flourishing and equipping others to do the same in their own neighborhoods. We serve LA by providing meals, recovery, and holistic support to the unseen among us in the cityWhat's Expected: The Mid-Day support role helps to clean the dining room, prep rooms, dishes, and kitchen with the goal of resetting the facility for the rest of the day ahead.What's Required:
missionStatement: Serve LA is seeking the renewal of Los Angeles by guiding the marginalized from suffering to flourishing and equipping others to do the same in their own neighborhoods. We serve LA by providing meals, recovery, and holistic support to the unseen among us in the city.
organizationDescription: Serve LA provides an average of 1000 meals per week. These community meals occur Monday through Friday with breakfast from 10-11am and dinner from 5-6pm. The doors open at 5am to begin prep, a volunteer driver leaves at 7am to retrieve donations from various grocery stores from which we pull food to cook with and then distribute the rest to partners all over the city. Our volunteer teams include prep chefs, food sorters, drivers, dining room hosts, back of house plating, and then lots of cleaning support until 8pm when the facility closes. In addition, Serve LA provides about 200 showers a month with the help of volunteer shower attendants and San Fernando Valley Rescue Mission's mobile shower unit. The shower program runs twice a week, Tuesday and Thursday from 9-11:30am. Shoes, clothing, water bottles, and hygiene items are distributed upon request and as supplies allow.At the end of the day our goal remains the same: we want to be more than a meal. With each plate we strive to serve hope to our community, hope for healing, hope for transformation, hope for renewal - a hope placed in the power of the Gospel because we believe Jesus changes everything.

Can you be there for him?Description of Role:Cancer changes everything for the family and children enrolled in our program would like support from a mentor during hard times. Walk With Sally is dedicated to providing hope through our individualized mentoring and community building services to empower children experiencing trauma through a parent, guardians, relative, sibling's cancer journey. No one should face a loved one's cancer alone. Help us…
missionStatement: Walk With Sally is dedicated to lessening the burden of cancer for children and families through critical programs and services by way of mentorship, mental health support, art healing, and financial empowerment.
organizationDescription: Walk With Sally believes no child should walk alone in the face of a loved one's cancer journey. Because we don't want cancer to define or limit children for the rest of their lives, we create hope, healing and a supportive community through individualized mentoring, which transforms the lives not only of the children, but also of the families impacted by cancer.

title: Social Media Manager - L.A.
description: The Elder Wisdom Circle is an award winning online inter-generational program pairing younger folks in need of advice with a caring and empathetic cyber-grandparent. To date the EWC has facilitated almost 500,000 one on one interactions and been featured in almost 100 media stories. Our site received about 350,000 annual visits, most are reading advice. The EWC has played a critical role during the pandemic giving our seniors a safe way to volunteer from home and a place for younger folks to find comforting advice during this crisis. In March we will be launching a new feature which we anticipate will be popular with our advice-seekers in their teens, 20's and 30's. We are seeking an experienced social media manager who can help us create a campaign for this new feature and help us launch with a series of initial posts.
missionStatement: Our mission is to provide an opportunity for seniors to utilize their life experience and wisdom to help others by offering thoughtful and helpful advice to younger generations
organizationDescription: We are a web-based nonprofit service organization that pairs online advice seekers in their teens, 20's and 30's with a nationwide network of Cyber-Grandparents, aged 55 to 105, who share their hard-earned knowledge and wisdom. Our Elder members participate individually from their home computers or in groups at retirement communities (with the help of a facilitator). Anyone with access to the Internet can request anonymous advice on any topic and will receive a personalized e-mail response in return. The voice of experience is hip, sincere, and highly sought after by people of all ages; we are the most popular source of free online advice in the country. The Elder Wisdom Circle has been featured on ABC, CBS, BBC, NPR, and in many publications including USA Today and Time.

title: Volunteer at our CSU/Expo Urban Expo Farm!
description:

Community Services Unlimited has worked with dozens of partners and thousands of community residents to build and maintain the urban farm since 2004 and working with multiple partners have offered free hands-on educational programming for residents of all ages.Individuals are welcome to volunteer with an RSVP by emailing volunteer@csuinc.org.


Groups must make prior arrangements before coming to volunteer. We cannot accommodate groups without prior arrangement; if you wish to bring a group from your workplace, school, organization please send an email to csu@csuinc.org. We welcome groups of all sizes to come and volunteer with us as part of their community service and team building activities. Groups must make prior arrangements before coming to…
missionStatement: Our Mission is to foster the creation of communities actively working to address the inequalities and systemic barriers that make sustainable communities and self-reliant life-styles unattainable. We are committed to supporting and creating justice-driven community-based programs and educational initiatives, which seek to foster dialogue, and create awareness and critical consciousness.
organizationDescription: Together our programs work to create a sustainable local food system where food is grown, distributed and bought within our own community, incorporating training and educational programs, the creation of jobs and entrepreneurial opportunities and supported by partnerships with regional farmers.Understanding that their are unjust and destructive systems that have created the social and environmental injustices that impact our community, the Community Food Village project is responding with a similar systems approach to building awareness, leadership and positive change. All of the project activities are intertwined and are implemented in partnership with individuals and organizations in the community. To learn more about our different programs visit: https://csuinc.org/programs/

title: On-Call Volunteers Desperately Needed, Help Us Save Dogs!
description: We are in very URGENT need of standby volunteers (and event volunteers) so if you care about helping our pups please jump in to help and/or share this email with 5 friends in the Los Angeles area that may be able to pitch in and help volunteer. A Standby Volunteer is someone who can be on-call in case we have a last-minute transportation need. It could be anything from taking a dog to the vet, to a new foster, getting medication or supplies to a dog or most importantly, being a dog's hero by giving her/him a "freedom ride" from a shelter where they may be euthanized.After sending in your schedule, we will check with you to confirm that you are able to help put on that day still and contact you if anything comes up. We try to let people know a few days in advance but…
missionStatement: We are a 501c-3 dog rescue foundation dedicated to rescuing dogs, the day they are to be euthanized, from various Los Angeles shelters and placing them in loving homes. We do NOT take dogs in ... we rescue only from shelters. The Ace of Hearts Foundation is in memory of "Ace", a wonderful American Bull dog who was rescued from death, and touched the lives of many! (Especially founder Kari Whitman!) We rescue all breeds...and don't discriminate against any!
organizationDescription: Hello!Love dogs? Looking to help out and make some new friends along the way? We need Standby Volunteers daily! Emergency Volunteers/Stand By'sThis may seem like the least helpful, but actually our stand-by's always save us & the dogs! We need you!You give us the days and times you are available and we add you to a list. Then, if something comes up that day- you will be the first one we call. This helps us reach out to volunteers with availability that day instead of calling our entire volunteer list. If there is a day, half a day, or even a few hours you can volunteer to be placed on a "call in case of an emergency" list, let us know! This can be for many different tasks, and almost always requires some driving. We try very hard to plan things in advance, but if there is a last minute opportunity to save a life, get a dog adopted, or a foster emergency, it helps to have a handful of people we reach out to first!We are in desperate need of standby volunteers!Can't help with this but still want to volunteer? We can always use extra hands:-Emergency fosters-Long term fosters-Temp tests for dogs in shelters -Transporters (taking dogs to appointments/park/foster)-Event volunteers -House check volunteers

title: Food Pantry - Help Distribute Produce to Folkx in South Central
description: Setting up /tear down of the event & distributing 300 lbs of produce to families in South Central LA one Saturday a month at Universal Community Health Center.Why: Promote wellness and health by providing free vegetables and fruits to South LA community members and residents. An ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure.Who: For 15 years, Universal Community Health Center has been an institution of healing for the South LA community. We believe that one's quality of health should not be pre-determined by zip code - that all people deserve dignity, respect, and the best healthcare services regardless of their ability to pay. In efforts to best serve our community living in a food desert, we have begun a monthly food pantry program open to all. Since our first food pantry in June 2024,  20 volunteers have distributed over 700 lbs. of vegetables and fruits to over 1000…
missionStatement: Universal Community Health Center opened its doors in 2007, with just one clinic. Formally incorporated in 2009 by Dr. Edgar Chavez, Chief Executive Officer, Universal Community Health Center (UCHC) is a non-profit (501(c)(3) Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) and Patient-Centered Medical Home (PCMH) serving families in South Los Angeles. In 2010, UCHC became an FQHC look alike, and in 2015 opened its second clinic, the San Pedro site. In 2017, UCHC became a HRSA deemed grantee, and in 2018 updated its scope of services to include Behavioral Health. UCHC has since expanded to operate six (6) health center locations and a mobile health clinic. Mission- To provide quality and accessible healthcare to under-served communities and to provide a patient centered model of care to empower communities towards wellness. Vision- Comprehensive Care for all UCHC’s service delivery model provides comprehensive services across all life cycles with a focus on prevention and empowerment of patients to take charge of their health and to lead healthier lifestyles. Services include primary and behavioral health care, including health screenings, family planning, gynecological care, and well-child visits. In addition, UCHC strives to assist its patients with practical arrangements for additional and supporting services including transportation, translation, referrals for primary and specialty care, case management, remote patient monitoring, chronic disease management for diabetes and hypertension, and assistance with understanding and adhering to provider-recommended care plans. And more recently, UCHC offers Covid-19 testing and vaccinations. UCHC continues to be based on meeting the specific healthcare needs of South LA, which includes residents of disadvantaged communities with many barriers to accessing services. Furthermore, linguistically appropriate service is a priority at UCHC. Spanish/English speaking staff members are actively recruited for each area of health center operations, and local residents are hired whenever possible. The vast majority of clinic staff live within our service area. Universal Community Health Center’s service area encompasses more than 1.15 million residents and more than 306,000 households. Though UCHC grew exponentially in 2020, providing for preventative, routine medical care and the urgent needs of community members most affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, tremendous unmet need still remains a threat to our collective wellbeing. Understanding that physical health, mental health, and a high quality of life are interrelated aspects of a person’s overall wellbeing, UCHC has forged extensive relationships with a growing network of service providers in the community which are critical to effective comprehensive care. UCHC is an authorized provider of several public programs including: Child Health and Disability Program (CHDP), Comprehensive Perinatal Service Program (CPSP), Family Pact for family planning. These partners and services include the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) program. Other community partners and services include the Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) program,employment services, housing services, food assistance, domestic violence services, substance abuse and recovery programs; senior programs; regional centers; family resource centers, and a variety of other social service organizations.
organizationDescription: Hello! Universal Community Health Center (UCHC) has started a monthly food pantry that is open to all community members in South Central LA. I am seeking volunteers that can support prepping the 300 lbs of produce to be ready for distribution for our Saturday food pantry. I am also seeking volunteers that can support day of food pantry activities, such as signing in food pantry participants, distributing food to participants, controlling the flow of car/pedestrian traffic, breaking down boxes and supporting build up / tear down of the event. I am happy to provide a volunteer oreintation to help volunteers understand what the tasks and goals of the tasks are

title: Seeking Dynamic Board Members in Los Angeles for Nature-Based Org
description: Wildwoods is a different kind of environmental organization. Created in response to the school shooting at Columbine, Wildwoods' programs use ecology and the outdoor experience as a framework for human relations. Our work happens at the nexus of social science and natural science. In addition to traditional "environmental education," our programs address Nature Deficit Disorder and the inequity of access to nature from a public health and a social justice perspective.Next year we'll celebrate our 25th anniversary of serving the greater Los Angeles area…
missionStatement: The mission of Wildwoods is to enrich lives through nature.
organizationDescription: Founded in the aftermath of the tragic school shooting at Columbine, Wildwoods uses ecology and the outdoor experience as a framework for human relations, helping young people understand that the principles governing nature's ecosystems -interdependence, diversity, and sustainability- are just as important to the social fabric of our schools, communities, and workplaces.

title: Photography/Video for Martial Arts Studio
description: We are looking for people who would like to build their resume and portfolio, working with world-renowned Aikido expert, Lia Suzuki Sensei.Must be available during our class times to capture photos and video footage for our social media networks and new online martial arts network.- - -Please apply online here: https://calendly.com/aki-usa/15minThen email us your portfolio at admin@aki-usa.org
missionStatement: It is the goal and purpose of Aikido Kenkyukai Santa Barbara to pass down the true message of Aikido and to nurture a better society by creating individuals of responsibility, compassion, judgement, and character.
organizationDescription: We're a group of dedicated Aikido students under the direction of Lia Suzuki Sensei. In the summer of 2007, we lost our training space on lower State Street due to an extreme rent increase. After regrouping and reorganizing, our aduts' class came together in a temporary space at the Veterans' Memorial Building. The kids' class reconvened a full year later, refusing to give up hope for continued study under Suzuki Sensei. Now, we're a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization. We excited and grateful to be able to be back training weekly. Our future goals are to once again have our own dedicated training space, take field trips to Japan, and to hold events to benefit the community through this fantastic art that we love called Aikido - the Art of Peace.
