title: Be a reading tutor - support students' path toward reading proficiency (Hermon/Highland Park)
description:
Volunteer just over an hour per week to empower a student through reading.


Reading Partners believes that our communities do better when all students have access to high-quality learning opportunities and the critical reading skills needed to prepare them for academic, social, and civic success.


Reading Partners is seeking in-person and online volunteer tutors to work one-on-one with students this school year, 2024-2025.Give a little over one hour per week. We offer flexible weekday session times. No experience is required, as we provide volunteers with a structured curriculum, training, and ongoing support to help you and your student succeed…
missionStatement: Help children become lifelong readers by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction with measurable results. The Reading Partners program focuses on children from low-income communities who are struggling with reading. Working with partner schools, the program offers children one-on-one tutoring with a caring volunteer who is dedicated to one child's success. Teachers refer English speaking, K-5 students who have fallen behind six months to two years in reading to Reading Partners. Once enrolled, students receive tutoring twice a week in 45-minute sessions. Students who were once struggling in many subjects not only become proud, confident readers, but also transform into children excited about learning and succeeding.
organizationDescription: Service Enterprise

title: Student Concierge
organization: Braille Institute of America, Inc. (Los Angeles Center)
description: Volunteer as a Student Concierge to support students at Braille Institute's Connection Pointe in Los Angeles.Who: Braille Institute is committed to eliminating blindness and severe sight loss as barriers to a fulfilling life.Why: Through educational training, programs, and services, Braille Institute helps tens of thousands of people each year regain and maintain their independence. Braille's educational, social, and recreational programs are provided in an environment of hope and encouragement, seeking to reinforce the confidence, self-esteem, and dignity of those who are visually impaired and enabling them to live, attend school, and work as they choose.What to Expect: Contact individuals to set up appointments for tech support using booking software (training provided)
missionStatement: Braille Institute is committed to eliminating blindness and severe sight loss as barriers to a fulfilling life. Through educational training, programs, and services, we help tens of thousands of people each year regain and maintain their independence. We serve to enable families, friends, and others to understand the realities of sight loss. We also inform and educate the public about the capabilities of people who are visually impaired. Our educational, social, and recreational programs are provided in an environment of hope and encouragement, seeking to reinforce the confidence, self-esteem, and dignity of those who are visually impaired and enabling them to live, attend school, and work as they choose.
organizationDescription: Volunteers are needed in Braille Library to assist with various clerical duties, e.g., greet guests, contact patrons via telephone, basic check-ins, which may include checking on lapsed or inactive library user accounts for deletion. Volunteers are also needed to check in devices such as Victor Readers and digital players. Investigate use of BARD, e.g., difficulties, successes, need for assistance in how to use software. Depending on experience and comfort level, volunteers are needed to participate in outreach email campaigns, assisting with drafting emails, letters, and marketing teases aimed at various constituents, organizations, and stakeholders. Assist Library Outreach Manager as needed.Assist students in library, cafeteria, classrooms, and other areas as needed, maintaining a professional and friendly attitude. Volunteers are needed to instruct (voluntary and needs-based) or assist instructors with various non-core courses (e.g. art, music, dance, exercise, etc.) based on experience, skillset, and availability. Volunteers will also assist various departments as needed, which may include housekeeping in the cafeteria or other areas.

title: Be an Advocate for Solutions to US and Global Poverty
description:
RESULTS is a movement of passionate, committed, everyday people. Together, we use our voices to influence political decisions that will bring an end to poverty in the U.S. and around the world.


RESULTS advocates believe that everyone deserves a chance to thrive in their community. No one should worry about being hungry or losing the safety of their home. But too many people in the U.S. and around the world face this reality each day. To build a better future, we must take action to protect people's rights to health, nutrition, housing, and financial stability.


You can make a difference as a RESULTS advocate…
missionStatement: RESULTS is a movement of passionate, committed everyday people. Together they use their voices to influence political decisions that will bring an end to poverty. Volunteers receive training, support, and inspiration to become skilled advocates. In time, volunteers learn to effectively advise policy makers, guiding them towards decisions that improve access to education, health, and economic opportunity. With every hour of their time, volunteers multiply their impact through the enormous power of advocacy -- whether it’s helping change policy to support millions of families putting food on the table or helping raise billions of dollars for the world’s most vulnerable children. Backed by the in-depth research and legislative expertise of staff, RESULTS advocates realize the incredible power they possess to use their voices to change the world.
organizationDescription: For over 40 years, RESULTS and RESULTS Educational Fund have been shining light on critical, effective solutions to poverty. By combining the powerful voices of civic advocates with research and oversight of U.S. anti-poverty efforts at home and abroad, RESULTS has been changing government priorities and people’s lives.

title: FEAST Volunteer Opportunity - Food Distribution
description:
FEAST’s Food Access Program, launched in March 2020, recovers high quality farm-fresh produce in partnership with  Food Forward and  Seeds of Hope to distribute to our participants. To address food and nutrition insecurity, Wellness Program Participants receive 10-12 lb bags of fresh produce weekly.


Every other Wednesday, we package over 60 bags of groceries at Mercado la Paloma in South Central from 9:30am - 12pm. Our volunteers are vital to the success of our Food Access program. They support by receiving, sorting, and packaging recovered food for our FEAST participants.


Volunteer tasks include:

• Packaging produce…
missionStatement: FEAST's mission is to promote health and wellness through the power of healthy food and human connection.
organizationDescription: At FEAST, we believe that a healthy life has three main ingredients: whole foods, whole people and whole communities. However, we live in a world where many people lack access to basic, healthy fresh affordable foods, and where many more feel isolated from one another. Inequitable food environments, unhealthy diets and social isolation are key contributors to the dramatic rise of obesity and dietary diseases affecting our country today.

title: Hay Transporter ("Hay Elf")
description:
Volunteer(s) needed to pick up 1-3 bales of hay from Riverside Dr. in Glendale or from Red Barn in Reseda, bag it, then deliver it to West Los Angeles and/or Playa del Rey. Hay and fuel costs will be covered by the organization (unless you want to cover the costs and then get a charitable receipt from the organization).


Since traffic is lighter on the weekends, most "hay elves" prefer to pick up hay then--but any day is fine, as long as someone is available to receive the hay.


The frequency of each volunteer's hay runs will depend on the number of new hay elves we recruit. We currently have one hay elf doing a weekly or bi-weekly run, depending on demand for the hay. Since the demand has gone up to the point where we need hay weekly, and our primary hay elf needs a break, we need more hay elves.
missionStatement: To educate the public about house rabbits, promote affordable spay/neuter programs for rabbits, and provide safe shelter, food and medical care to rescued and abandoned rabbits in foster care.
organizationDescription: A non-profit rabbit welfare organization.

title: Cat Chauffeur! Transport Cats and Kittens Throughout Los Angeles
description:
Want to help cats and kittens? Become a volunteer with Stray Cat Alliance’s transportation team!


We are looking for compassionate animal lovers who want to make a difference! Stray Cat Alliance is in need of volunteers to help us transport cats to and from our headquarters in South LA. Locations for pick-ups and drop-offs include city shelters, foster homes, and spay/neuter clinics. No experience needed. You can use either your own vehicle or our large van.  If you have any questions, please email us at Volunteers@StrayCatAlliance.org. Check us out at StrayCatAlliance.org…
missionStatement: Stray Cat Alliance educates and empowers communities to advocate for every cat’s right to be safe, healthy, and valued.
organizationDescription: Every day, our team works to save the helpless lives of kittens and cats by providing: spay/neuter, trap-neuter-return (TNR), adoptions, wellness care, medical care, and community shelter support. Our goals are to:

title: Be A Writing Coach for A Low-Income High School Student in LA
description:
If you would like to learn more about volunteering with Minds Matter SoCal, please use the link below to sign up for an informal 15-30 minute coffee chat with a member of our team!  https://mindsmattersocal.org/volunteers/


Quick Overview:  Do you enjoy helping students find their voice and learn how to best present themselves through their essays for college admissions? If so, join us as a writing coach for college applications and scholarships! Your focus is on helping students draft personal statements, UC prompts and other college/scholarship application essays. With the uncertainty around the future of standardized tests, the college application essays take on even greater importance. You will directly help a small handful of students shape their unique voices, powerfully present their stories and successfully navigate the application essay process.


Volunteer Roles & Responsibilities:  Writing coaches are paired with 2 to 4 students, start in March of their Junior year, and continue to spring…
missionStatement: to connect driven and determined students from low-income families with the people, preparation, and possibilities to succeed in college, create their future, and change the world.
organizationDescription: Minds Matter supports students in their sophomore, junior, and senior year. Our program offers a unique combination of mentoring support, group instruction, and social-emotional learning. We provide students with the resources and guidance needed to gain admission, enroll, and succeed at rigorous four-year colleges. Support continues during college with internships, professional skills-building, and access to our alumni platform.

title: Help us feed your neighbors in need in the Los Angeles, CA area
description: Lasagna Love is a global movement with thousands of people cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: we feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during this time full of uncertainty and stress.Lasagna Love matches neighbors who can provide a meal with a neighbor who needs a little help. You can decide how often you participate - once a month, multiple lasagnas weekly, or somewhere in between. You decide how far you can drive to deliver a meal, and if you can accommodate special diets like vegetarian or gluten free. The Lasagna Love Team does the best to match you with a neighbor in…
missionStatement: Lasagna Love was started at the beginning of the pandemic, when the founder of Good to Mama was looking for a way to help moms in her community. She and her toddler started making and delivering meals to families in the neighborhood who were struggling, whether that struggle was financial, emotional, or simply a feeling of overwhelm. Lasagna Love has since grown into a global grassroots movement, with thousands of people all cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families, but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during a time full of uncertainty and stress.
organizationDescription: Thousands of volunteers in all 50 states, Canada and Australia delivering home-cooked meals to spread love and kindness.

title: SUPPORT SURVIVORS AND BECOME A COUNSELOR ADVOCATE
description:
Given the uncertain upcoming changes that will affect our communities, we are preparing for Peace Over Violence’s Winter 2025 Counselor Advocate Training.


The time to act is now. Our communities are preparing to unite for a stronger, more just, and caring future. One that prioritizes freedom, safety, dignity, peace, and self-determination for all. This is a call to action for all who believe in standing together, for all who know that our communities are our strength. Let's make our voices heard and our actions felt.

Wednesday, January 8th, 2025.
missionStatement: Peace Over Violence (formerly the Los Angeles Commission on Assaults Against Women) is a non-profit, feminist; multicultural, volunteer organization dedicated to a building healthy relationships, families and communities free from sexual, domestic and interpersonal violence.
organizationDescription: Peace Over Violence is a social service agency dedicated to the elimination of sexual and domestic violence and all forms of interpersonal violence.

title: Assistant Coach and Program Support for Basketball Program
description: Volunteer with Hollywood PAL's sports program to help drive change in the lives of underserved youth. Why: Hollywood PAL supports Los Angeles youth in under-resourced communities to live a healthy and thriving life. Your presence can make a significant difference in a young persons direction and life choices. The majority of our youth need extra support getting through challenging life circumstances and processing their traumas in healthy and safe ways.Who: Hollywood PAL drives positive change in the community we serve by partnering with LAPD and school-aged youth in programs that celebrate diversity, equity, and inclusion and inspire personal excellence, social awareness, and civic engagement. Our sports programs focus on providing equal access to all youth to engage in fitness activities and team sports, and provide a safe place for our youth to develop their fitness  and physical and socio-emotional strengths in order to imprint…
missionStatement: Hollywood PAL drives positive change in the community we serve by partnering with LAPD and school-aged youth in programs that celebrate diversity, equity, and inclusion and inspire personal excellence, social awareness, and civic engagement.
organizationDescription: We are in need of consistent and caring volunteers for our Academic enrichment programs. Our tutoring and mentoring programs provide essential academic and social/career support to school aged youth. In our tutoring program we partner youth up with a volunteer that meets with them one to three hours a week (depending on youth need and tutor availability) Mondays through Thursdays after school. The program runs across the school year and we ask that volunteers can commit to a minimum of once a week for an hour for at least one semester. Our mentoring program also partners our youth with an adult volunteer to help them through academic and social challenges including career direction, peer pressure etc - there is a curriculum that our staff use to lightly guide the conversations. Our mentors and mentees meet once a week on Tuesdays at 4pm for an hour. We similarly ask that volunteers are available for atleast one semester in the year - preferably the whole year. Volunteers do not need to be teachers or educators but we prefer they are passionate about helping youth and are able to converse with youth and can be patient with youth who are not used to speaking up and exploring their future possibilities.

title: Want to help kids in low-income communities? Become a virtual tutor!
description: If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply directly at  https://forms.gle/De4juKf8HhyLUgBQ7 .  There is more information listed there as well, including information about our pairing process. (You do not need to indicate your interest through VolunteerMatch unless you have specific questions.) Thank you! Background: Pandemic Professors, a 501c3 organization, was founded in April 2020 with the mission of facilitating free online tutoring to students in underserved communities affected by the pandemic. We are a 100% volunteer-based organization. Our philosophy not only supports academic achievement but also emphasizes the importance of socio-emotional health. We rely on committed volunteers who have a passion for education and are dedicated to offering academic support to students at risk of falling behind. Your contribution is crucial in this endeavor!  You will interact with families and help students perform and learn! Join our…
missionStatement: The mission of Pandemic Professors is to facilitate free tutoring to children in low-income communities impacted by the pandemic.
organizationDescription: At Pandemic Professors, we believe all K-12 students deserve an opportunity to receive free supplemental learning through private tutoring, in order to help them remain on track and meet their educational goals. Our organization was founded to match underserved students across the United States with free online tutors to more safely help during this unprecedented crisis and beyond.Historically, students in underserved communities are at greater risk of falling behind in academics and socio-emotional skills. Much like Hurricane Katrina, the COVID-19 crisis is exacerbating the plethora of academic and personal challenges these students already face. Our organization presents students in low-income communities with opportunities to strengthen subject comprehension and boost confidence. The needs, strengths, and voices of the impacted students drive our family-centered philosophy and evidence-based practices.Together with our partners, Pandemic Professors combats adverse effects on learning resulting from the pandemic and exacerbated by poverty. Students in underserved communities don’t lack a hunger for knowledge, they lack the means to access quality tutoring. Pandemic Professors provides effective tools for students to complete their K-12 education, and we will continue to work with our students after the pandemic until the educational gap is resolved. We sincerely hope you consider joining us in the fight to improve the lives of students adversely affected by poverty and the pandemic.

title: IT Technical Support Volunteer
organization: Los Angeles LGBT Center - Volunteer Resources

missionStatement: "Building a world where LGBT people thrive as healthy, equal and complete members of society."

title: Volunteer Affiliated Photographer
organization: Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep
description:
You will find fulfillment by volunteering your talent to families experiencing the loss of a baby. The professional-level photographs you will gift can turn a hidden pain into healing for bereaved families, bring awareness to a community, and provide a sense of honor to you.


Our Affiliated Photographers walk alongside families during some of their only moments with their babies. The majority of our sessions take place at hospitals and all photos are gently retouched in black and white.


The Affiliated Photographer position requires an application and evaluation of photography and lighting skills.
missionStatement: To introduce remembrance photography to parents experiencing the loss of a baby with a free gift of professional portraiture.
organizationDescription: 'Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep' (NILMDTS) is a nonprofit 501(c) (3) organization. All proceeds go directly into the operation of this organization to help parents who are experiencing an early infant loss.

title: - COPY - Photographer/ videographer
organization: B A R E TRUTH INC
description: Hello,B.A.R.E. Truth Inc. is a non-profit that advocates for the homeless by providing food, clothing, housing and resources for other items needed. The non-profit also has a mentorship program that provides tools to assist with self-esteem, providing a safe space to express feelings as well as someone to walk along side the students to help with the difficulties of life. We are in need of a professional photographer and videographer. We host several events throughout the month and we need someone to help us capture those moments.
missionStatement: B.A.R.E. TRUTH is an organization that provides mentorship, independent living assistance and wellness services to impoverished individuals and families, helping them attain healthy, purpose-driven lives, ultimately changing the economic and living conditions of communities.
organizationDescription: B.A.R.E. Truth Inc. was founded by Joseph Bradford III in 2016. His passion to help the community started at an early age. At the tender age of seven, Joseph's father passed away and within the same year became homeless and lived in shelters with his mother and siblings. Joseph understood at an early age, that often times good people fall on hard times and due to unforeseen circumstances can find themselves homeless and needing assistance. We want to make a real lasting difference in this world by strengthening communities and dedicating real time and efforts towards this epidemic of homelessness. Also, there is a strong need for mentor-ship programs in these same communities as families can be broken apart for various reasons and children miss the opportunity to have a positive role model speak greatness into their lives. B.A.R.E. Truth Inc. wants to take a stand and help others in impoverished communities throughout the world by providing assistance for the homeless and mentor-ship programs to help enrich the youth.

title: Parkinson's Champions Cheer Team Opportunity-Los Angeles Marathon Weekend 2025
description: COme join us to cheer on our amazing Parkinson's Champions athletes as they complete a race of a lifetime! Race day is always an exciting time, a lot like being at a sports game. Help us wave some pom-poms, hold a sign, hoot and holler, and help spread awareness about Parkinson's Disease.
missionStatement: The Parkinson’s Foundation makes life better for people with Parkinson’s disease (PD) by improving care and advancing research towards a cure. We provide education, resources and programs throughout the nation. Whether you are newly diagnosed with PD or have been managing it for years, a care partner, family member or friend of someone with PD, we are here to help you.
organizationDescription: We are leaders in ensuring expert Parkinson’s care, educating and empowering the Parkinson’s community and driving the understanding of Parkinson’s through research. As a national organization with local presence and impact, we bring help and hope to the estimated one million people in the U.S., 10 million worldwide, who are living with Parkinson’s.

title: Event Manager Internship for FILM FESTIVAL!
description:
Help Heal One World put on the world premier Awareness Raising Film and Music Festival. Takes place virtually and in person this year! Oct 2024. You are a event manager, key within the organization. Help with PR, Event management, connecting with other non-profits, dealing with film makers, outreach, planning of parties, panels and VR as well as sponsorship outreach. Celebrity outreach, fundraising gala, yoga events. Must be somewhat available during festival itself. Full school credit available or just expanding your resume/experience. . Awareness Festival can be seen at http://www.awarenessfestival.org


Our 15th year!
missionStatement: Heal One World was formed to help connect people in need of non-invasive treatments, that are generally not covered by insurance, access to this help on a sliding scale or donation basis. We hold classes on a free or sliding scale basis that provide self help and self healing techniques. We assist to arrange and promote clinics where low cost treatment can be found, as well as maintain a database of providers who are interested in helping those in need and create a long term focus of well being of body, spirit and mind.
organizationDescription: Our purpose is to help facilitate low/no income adult and children with physical and mental health issues that are not being fully addressed by medical care that is covered by insurance or is invasive to have the opportunity to receive non-invasive, treatments or consultations such as, but not limited to: Dietary Consultation, Acupressure, Acupuncture, Herbology, Feldenkrais-Movement awareness, Cranial-Sacral, NeuroMuscular Therapy, Pilates, Yoga, Exercise and many others. See NIH website http://nccam.nih.gov/ (not affiliated with NIH or NCCAM) for information on these therapies and how they are accepted as a important part of health and healing. Any and all medical issues will always be suggested to be addressed by medical doctors and this aide only be supplemental and complementary. We are soliciting and cultivating a roster of health professionals, that are background and professionally checked, willing to donate or subsidize their treatment costs and making them available to applicants that have a desire for treatment and show a monetary hardship via a statement of income of themselves/ ∨ of their parents. We organize classes in self help techniques offered by these individuals. These classes are free or subsidized. We plan to do this via the website as well as advertisements in free or low cost publications and websites as well as through informing other like minded organizations, both for profit and not for profit of our existence for them to share that information with their constitutes that are needing of help and those who wish to donate their help. We plan to get donations of vitamins/dietary supplements & herbs or other supplies to distribute as recommended to people in need after consultation and with proper disclaimers.

title: Participate in USC Research Studies
organization: University of Southern California, Emotion and Cognition Lab
description:
USC School of Gerontology researchers seek volunteers from age 18 to 100 and beyond, to participate in studies investigating the effects of aging on cognition and emotion.


Please visit http://healthyminds.usc.edu to sign up for studies or email healthyminds@usc.edu for any questions.***Please note that this posting seeks volunteers to participate in research studies, not volunteer research assistants.***
missionStatement: The Healthy Minds Volunteers help research labs at the University of Southern California. These labs are working towards a greater understanding of how aging can affect physical, mental and emotional health. The goal is to learn how we can maintain healthy minds and bodies across our lifespan.
organizationDescription: The environment at USC is an outstanding one for researchers with interests in cognitive neuroscience, emotion, decision making and aging. The USC Davis School of Gerontology is the oldest and largest school of gerontology in the world and has long been a leader in the field, with its multidisciplinary faculty doing research in neuroscience, molecular biology, psychology, sociology, demography and public policy. The Psychology Department and the Neuroscience Program have outstanding faculty in cognitive and affective neuroscience. There are also faculty members and other researchers with related interests in other schools and departments across campus, such as at the law, business and medical schools.

title: Air & Space Gallery Host
description:
The California Science Center is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join our Guest Services Air and Space Host Volunteer Team.


The California Science Center welcomes people of all backgrounds, identities, and beliefs to stimulate curiosity and inspire science learning in everyone. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are the soul of the volunteer department and we strive to build a community based on mutual respect, equal treatment, and an opportunity to succeed.


Air and Space Host Volunteers welcome guests, provide information and facts about displayed air and space artifacts, including Space Shuttle Endeavour. Volunteers engage guests and are readily available to provide assistance and answer questions. Volunteers serve in the…
missionStatement: We aspire to stimulate curiosity and inspire science learning in everyone by creating fun, memorable experiences, because we value science as an indispensable tool for understanding our world, accessibility and inclusiveness, and enriching people's lives.
organizationDescription: The California Science Center is a modern facility with all-new interactive exhibits and programs, and a seven story IMAX Theater with 3D capabilities. This exciting environment makes for an extraordinary learning experience for guests of all ages. Interested teens and adults can provide assistance in several different ways including stimulating an interest in science by facilitating and encouraging hands-on learning in our educational exhibits; by assisting our curators with the plant and animal life; or by providing our guests with a warm welcome and answering questions. As a California Science Center volunteer you can enjoy many special benefits including free parking, specialized group or individual training, previews of exhibits, invitations to special events and activities. Volunteers also have an opportunity to earn free Explorer Level Membership. The minimum age for volunteers is 16. Opportunities are available 7 days a week and experience is not necessary, only the desire and willingness to be of service, to learn, and share what you learn with our guests.

title: CA Los Angeles Mid City: Help solve America's pollution problem.
description:
Volunteer working on the environment and climate change with our grassroots climate group!


CCL volunteers work with their community and members of Congress on climate change solutions. We are organized into more than 450 local chapters across the U.S.


Your activities might include:

• Educating the community about global warming and legislative solutions
• Meeting with congressional leaders
• Writing letters to the editor
• Hosting film screenings and panel conversations
• Meeting with local media…
missionStatement: We build political will for a livable world.
organizationDescription: CCL empowers everyday people to work with their community and their members of Congress on climate change solutions. Our supporters cover the political spectrum and work in more than 450 local chapters. Together, we’re building support for big solutions to climate change.

title: Virtual Volunteer Tutor + Mentor Elementary School Students (No Experience Required)
description:
Step Up Tutoring is seeking volunteers to provide virtual 1-on-1 tutoring to 2nd-6th grade students from underserved communities to help build fundamental math and literacy skills and to provide support and encouragement. All tutoring will take place virtually! All you need is a computer and internet access. No prior tutoring experience is needed.


Responsibilities:

• Tutor 1-on-1 twice a week via an online video platform; each session is 45 minutes
• All training is done through online, self-paced modules.
• Focus on building fundamental math and literacy skills using evidence-based online programs
• Structured and flexible schedules available…
missionStatement: Step Up Tutoring’s mission is to drive student success by providing virtual high-impact tutoring and mentorship to elementary and middle school students in under-resourced communities. We recruit, train, and support mission-driven high-value tutors to provide individualized academic support and boost habits of success. By combining an innovative human capital solution with the effective use of technology, we provide a scalable and cost-effective tutoring model that drives meaningful academic gains, builds student confidence, and fosters positive relationships for students and tutors alike. Ultimately, we envision a world where all young people have the support they need to learn, develop, and access their dreams.
organizationDescription: Step Up Tutoring is a California based non-profit organization seeking to close the education gap, while developing enduring bonds and cultivating academic success through fun online learning activities. Through our partnership with LAUSD, and with the help of our dedicated volunteers, we offer free online tutoring and mentoring for students grades 2nd-6th to improve student success in under-resourced communities.

title: Pantry Program - Help Distribute Food To Those In Need!
description: As part of the Pantry Program, we have our volunteers sort through donated food products and make to-go pantry boxes to be distributed to families, individuals, and students in need.Why: Volunteers gain firsthand experience of what our extremely low-income families & individuals in our community face every day - food insecurity.Who: Since 1972, the St. Francis Center (SFC) has provided relief and support to homeless and extremely low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles. Much more than a soup kitchen or a food pantry, we offer a unique range of services to sustain and empower those in need. Welcoming all with joy, dignity, and compassion, we dedicate ourselves every day to Serving Hope in our community.What to Expect:
missionStatement: Since 1972, St. Francis Center has provided relief and support to homeless and extremely low-income individuals and families in Los Angeles. Much more than a soup kitchen or a food pantry, we offer a unique range of services to sustain and empower those in need. Welcoming all with joy, dignity and compassion, we dedicate ourselves every day to Serving Hope in our community.
organizationDescription: Our two main programs include our Unhoused Wellbeing - Breakfast Service and the Family Wellbeing - Food Pantry Distribution. Our to-go breakfast service is part of our Unhoused Wellbeing Program. Members of our unhoused community visit the centermost mornings for a hot coffee and breakfast which also includes a bag of lunch for later. Our Food Pantry distribution is part of our Family Well-Being Program. Extremely low-income families, seniors, students, and individuals from the community visit the center once a week for groceries (our distribution days are from Wednesday-Saturday). They receive a pantry program box that includes a variety of fresh produce, bread, and canned goods.

title: 9th Annual LA Black History Month Festival x BrainPower of Health Fair

All volunteers will receive luncheon access, beverages and free grocery card as a thank you :)
missionStatement: Our mission is to commit to assisting Southern California Residents who are challenged with hunger,Unemployment, Displaced Workers, Homelessness, Veterans challenged with PTSD, those who are Disabled & Transitional Age Youth (T.A.Y).
organizationDescription: We provide a helping hand to those who need it the most. Open Arms Food Pantries team gives to over 500+ families monthly essentials not limited to: diapers, hygiene kits, household essentials, formula, vegetables, fruits, can goods, detergent, paper goods, blankets, meal gift cards and more.

title: Become a FRIEND to Individuals Working Out of Homelessness!
description: Become a FRIEND Mentor and work with individuals on building financial literacy and job skills! Why: When the members of our Jobs & Housing program are supported in key skill areas, they will have ahigher rate of success while staying housed and integrating into their community. Who: Food on Foot is a nonprofit dedicated to assisting our unhoused and low-income neighbors in Los Angeles with nutritious meals, clothing, and a fresh start through life-skills training, full-time employment, and permanent housingWhat to Expect: We need FRIEND mentors to connect with our program members and provide insights and skills in a one-on-one format to support their success in the areas of the program they are working through. FRIEND Mentors work in one or all of these departments to…
missionStatement: Food on Foot is a nonprofit dedicated to assisting our unhoused and low-income neighbors in Los Angeles with nutritious meals, clothing, and a fresh start through life-skills training, full-time employment, and permanent housing.
organizationDescription: As a volunteer, you'll strengthen our community by distributing food, clothing and essential supplies to 280+ unhoused and low-income neighbors. You will also meet and hear stories from the participants in our Jobs & Housing program. Graduates from this program earn their way off the streets with full-time jobs, fully-furnished apartments, life-skills training, and the confidence needed to make their accomplishments long-lasting.Kids are welcome! Volunteering with Food on Foot is kid friendly and the perfect way to give back as a family. Children ages 6 and up are welcome. Everyone under 18 must sign up online and be accompanied by a supervising ticketed adult.To Volunteer, sign up at foodonfoot.org/volunteer

title: Join Us: Help Grow Women's Soccer and Build Community
description:
Are you a passionate sports fan eager to make a difference in Los Angeles? Rebellion 99, an independent supporters' group for Angel City Football Club, is seeking dedicated individuals to join our board of directors, leadership council, and volunteer team.We’re looking for people who want to:

• Give back through community initiatives and outreach.
• Grow women’s soccer and inspire the next generation of athletes.
• Build connections within our diverse and vibrant community.
• Make an impact in the sports world and beyond…
missionStatement: We, the supporters of Rebellion 99, vow to support our Angel City Football Club through our wins, draws and losses, as well as work to uplift women, LGBTQIA+ and marginalized communities everywhere. Rebellion 99 and its supporters stand for inclusivity, equality, respect and camaraderie and will uphold these standards at all times - in and out of the stands. We commit ourselves to giving our Angel City athletes the respectfully raucous support they always deserve by standing by them, our Rebellion 99 family and our community as we unapologetically advance the women's game for fans everywhere.
organizationDescription: Rebellion 99, Inc. is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization and independent supporters' group for Angel City Football Club working toward the betterment of our Los Angeles community. Our members are joined together through our love of soccer, and together we use that passion to uplift our community. While our support in the stands is important, the work we do within our Los Angeles neighborhoods is equally - if not more - important. We recognize that soccer is a valuable outlet that can uplift women, our LGBTQIA+ community and marginalized neighborhoods throughout the Greater Los Angeles Area. We seek to inspire, drive change and bring about lasting impact for all underrepresented athletes and individuals for years to come. All funds gained by Rebellion 99, Inc. go toward fulfilling these missions and making Los Angeles a better place today than it was yesterday.

title: Become a Mentor
description:
Extraordinary Families is seeking adult mentors for our youth currently or formerly in foster care ages 16-26.


Our Unlimited Possibilities for Youth (UP4Youth) program is dedicated to improving outcomes for youth and young adults from foster care. One way we do this is by engaging mentors who serve as a consistent, stable adult presence available to provide guidance, uncover options for problem-solving, share information, and assist youth with building strategies for accomplishing important milestones that are essential for being successful adults.


Far too often the term "foster youth" is regarded as synonymous with "troubled," "uncontrollable," or "flawed". Children and youth enter foster care because of exposure to trauma caused by abuse or neglect. Many…
missionStatement: Extraordinary Families' mission is to help children and youth in foster care to have the childhoods and futures they rightfully deserve. Our vision is that every child, youth, and family in child welfare will have the ability to achieve their hopes, fulfill their dreams, and thrive.
organizationDescription: Extraordinary Families (EF) is a leading child welfare organization whose mission is to help children and youth in foster care to have the childhoods and futures they rightfully deserve. For more than 25 years, we have been a leader in foster care and adoption in Los Angeles, joining thousands of children, youth, and families. Our work consists of four primary efforts along a continuum of care: 1) training and supporting foster parents for children entering the foster care system, 2) joining children and families through adoption, 3) supporting young adults with trauma and child welfare history as they transition to adulthood, and 4) advocacy and public policy. We take tremendous pride in our work to reduce childhood trauma, encourage safety and stability, and empower children and youth to thrive. Indeed, 95% of the children we serve experience only one foster home while under our care, a testament to our trauma-informed care model and ongoing individualized support for foster parents. We also help youth aging out of foster care make positive life advancements. We empower them to address past trauma and build skills focused on life improvement, employment, and educational advancement, and match youth with caring mentors to support them every step of the way.

title: Volunteers needed to clean up the streets in LA! | Get Community Service Hours!
description: Our goal is to get as many Earth Heroes as possible to cleanup a location of their liking and inspiring others, while staying safe and respecting County and State orders.What are the "Street to Beach" cleanups?Simply put, it is a cleanup by yourself or with family and/or housemates following your county's orders for COVID-19. It can be around your neighborhood, at the beach, in a needy area, or anywhere actually. You could even "adopt" a specific location in need and care for it on a regular basis. https://www.pacificbeachcoalition.org/street-beach-cleanups/Please Note: If you do a cleanup, you are doing it on your own accord and personally accepting any and all risks. description: We are looking for photo journalists and aspiring photographers to work with us in the Los Angeles area. You will be assisting on productions supporting: Maternal Health Care SupportCancer Research & Healthcare Support International Access to Optometry Infant Health SupportInternational Human RightsAnti Sex Trafficking AdvocacyThe Economic Stabilization of AfricaInternational Arts EducationInternational Peace KeepingSee more about our projects here: https://newmoonfilms.com/projectsSee more about our company history here:…
missionStatement: International filmmaking for a better purpose. A non-profit film company that creates humanitarian and altruistic films shining light into the darkness of the human experience to raise awareness about real-world problems and perhaps even help find solutions. Wings of destiny began as an events based international peace advocacy program generally held in Israel. Through relationships developed on these projects they have been transitioning over the last year to focus on contributions made through the media while retaining an annual documentary film program in Israel, the Young & Emerging Leaders Program. This transition includes partnership arrangement with production companies around the world created under the mutual purpose of generating unbiased, altruistic, macro & globally focused, documentary & content filmmaking. Projects feature: St Jude Children’s Research Center, Hadassah Medical Center, MADRE, the World Health Organization, the Fistula Foundation, and more. Film content is being branded under the DBA: New Moon Films during the transition. more information at: www.newmoonfilms.com

title: Coach/Mentor Girls in 3rd-8th Grade:-- Inspire & Empower- DTLA
description:
MISSION


At Girls on the Run Los Angeles (GOTRLA), we envision a world where every girl knows and activates her limitless potential and is free to boldly pursue her dreams. We inspire girls in 3rd-8th grade to be joyful, healthy, and confident through a fun, experience-based curriculum that creatively integrates running.





Activity Description


YOU can join our team of Coaches/Mentors in a transformational program for girls in 3rd-8th grade. During these challenging times, they need you now more than ever…
missionStatement: Girls on the Run Los Angeles is an Independent Council of Girls on the Run International, which has a network of 200+ locations across the United States and Canada. Girls on the Run is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization dedicated to creating a world where every girl knows and activates her limitless potential and is free to boldly pursue her dreams. Meeting twice a week in small teams of 8-15 girls, we teach life skills through dynamic, conversation-based lessons and running games. The 24-lesson curriculum is taught by certified Girls on the Run coaches and includes three parts: understanding ourselves, valuing relationships and teamwork and understanding how we connect with and shape the world at large.

Who: What exactly is the ReStore? The ReStore is a social enterprise of Habitat for Humanity of Greater Los Angeles (Habitat LA).  It was established to be a self-sustaining funding source for Habitat LA and to provide our local community with low-cost building and home improvement materials. title: Event Support Needed for Nonprofit in Health and Happiness
description: Enhance your skills and professional resume within a nonprofit setting while contributing to a mission dedicated to health and happiness for all, with a focus on youth and marginalized communities.Why:  Your expertise will directly contribute to securing resources and enable us to make a difference in the lives of those we serve.Who: A Healthier, Happier Me (AHHM)'s mission is to provide individuals from marginalized communities with the knowledge and resources needed to thrive physically and emotionally. We envision a world where the barriers for physical and emotional well-being in marginalized communities no longer exist, and everyone enjoys an optimal state of health.What to Expect: …
missionStatement: Our Mission: To improve the physical and emotional health and well-being of youth and young adults in marginalized communities. For youth and young adults in marginalized communities who suffer poor health and wellness, AHHM is a nonprofit that delivers actionable health and wellness education programs that are more inclusive and accessible. We don’t do boring lectures! AHHM programs take a holistic approach to physical and emotional well-being, using interactive experiential learning techniques that make learning fun. Our programs inspire empowerment and resilience to break the barriers to optimal health and well-being in the communities we serve. To help deliver practical education and continuing resources, AHHM partners with any community organization or institution focused on helping youth live healthier, happier lives.

title: The Gift of Giving Back
description:
Only 4 hours a month will Change 2 Lives!


YMC's unique Gift Centered Approach, was developed to awaken young adults from underserved regions to their power, unique gifts, and purpose by matching them with caring adult mentors participating within a structured group dynamic that builds the emotional resiliency skills and confidence in adolescents to self-actualize into adulthood.


Mentors commit to participating in a 6 month program attending scheduled group activities and 1 on 1 sessions on alternating weeks. Staff provides extensive training, resources, and support so the focus can be on nurturing the relationships between mentors and mentees…
missionStatement: Youth Mentoring Connection awakens at-risk youth to their power, unique gifts and purpose by matching them with caring adult mentors and placing that "match" within a structured group dynamic that provides the resources youth need to reach productive, conscious adulthood. We further seek to awaken society to the needs, promise and value of this overlooked population. Our Vision is of a community where young people are truly seen and not just watched, where society understands and accepts its responsibility in meeting the needs of all young people, and where young people bring their gifts back into their communities as productive members of society.
organizationDescription: YMC at its core is a mentoring organization that matches vetted caring adults with youth from underserved communities in Los Angeles with our unique Gift Centered Approach. Our model uses Joseph Campbell's Heroes Journey as a guide for our facilitated group activities, that help promote the mentor-mentee relationship in a community setting. Expert staff provide support, resources, and training for mentors, mentees and their families. YMC's other programs Stoked City Surf Camp, Urban Oasis Film Academy, ECHO (monthly deep conversation sessions) and yearly Initiation Retreats are part of the soulful healing experience offered to the young people in our mentoring community. We are dedicated and committed to the growth, empowerment and success of our youth for a lifetime - once you are a part of us, you will always be a part of us.

title: Pick-Up/Deliver Food to In-Need Pets
description:
Greetings,PAWS/LA is looking to assemble a team of drivers to help us pick up and drop off food to low-income pet owners throughout LA County, individuals that might otherwise struggle to keep their essential service animals.We pick up supplies maybe once a month from warehouses close (approximately a 20 min drive) to our DTLA office. Then we distribute smaller amounts of food to clients throughout the city. Schedule is very flexible. Commitment is on a job-by-job basis.

• Can you drive a small van (or have your own)?
• Or, do you have access to a vehicle to pick up smaller amounts of food and take them to clients…
missionStatement: PAWS/LA is dedicated to preserving the healing bond between disenfranchised individuals and their companion animals; enriching their overall quality of life; and sustaining their independent living. PAWS/LA was founded in 1989 in response to the companion animal-related crises faced by residents of Los Angeles County who were financially and physically debilitated by HIV/AIDS. Since that time, the agency has expanded its scope to assist low-income seniors and any low-income individual living with a chronic or life-threatening illness. PAWS/LA currently serves more than 1,700 disenfranchised animal guardians and their 2,000+ companion animals.

title: Air & Space Gallery Host
description:
The California Science Center is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join our Guest Services Air and Space Host Volunteer Team.


The California Science Center welcomes people of all backgrounds, identities, and beliefs to stimulate curiosity and inspire science learning in everyone. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are the soul of the volunteer department and we strive to build a community based on mutual respect, equal treatment, and an opportunity to succeed.


Air and Space Host Volunteers welcome guests, provide information and facts about displayed air and space artifacts, including Space Shuttle Endeavour. Volunteers engage guests and are readily available to provide assistance and answer questions. Volunteers serve in the…
missionStatement: We aspire to stimulate curiosity and inspire science learning in everyone by creating fun, memorable experiences, because we value science as an indispensable tool for understanding our world, accessibility and inclusiveness, and enriching people's lives.
organizationDescription: The California Science Center is a modern facility with all-new interactive exhibits and programs, and a seven story IMAX Theater with 3D capabilities. This exciting environment makes for an extraordinary learning experience for guests of all ages. Interested teens and adults can provide assistance in several different ways including stimulating an interest in science by facilitating and encouraging hands-on learning in our educational exhibits; by assisting our curators with the plant and animal life; or by providing our guests with a warm welcome and answering questions. As a California Science Center volunteer you can enjoy many special benefits including free parking, specialized group or individual training, previews of exhibits, invitations to special events and activities. Volunteers also have an opportunity to earn free Explorer Level Membership. The minimum age for volunteers is 16. Opportunities are available 7 days a week and experience is not necessary, only the desire and willingness to be of service, to learn, and share what you learn with our guests.

title: Office Volunteer
description:
The Coalition for Economic Survival (CES) is a over 40 year old community-based non-profit organization that works to ensure tenants' rights and the preservation of affordable housing.


Become part of this dynamic organization by assisting with the day-to-day office work and administration.


Work includes the followiing:


-- Answering Phones


-- Assisting with mailings


-- Updating files…
missionStatement: The Coalition for Economic Survival (CES), a grassroots community organization, founded in 1973 for the purpose of uniting people throughout the Los Angeles area to fight for economic and social justice. CES is committed to actively opposing any type of prejudice or discrimination based on race, gender, ethnicity, age, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
organizationDescription: For over a quarter of a century now, CES has organized people throughout the Los Angeles area, achieving an impressive record in fighting and winning many battles. In its over 3 decade history, CES: Led the fight to win rent control in Los Angeles and West Hollywood, and has been the premier a watchdog protecting and strengthening rent control since its adoption. Was the driving force to incorporate the City of West Hollywood and electing CES members to the West Hollywood City Council. Organized thousands of tenants in private and HUD subsidized buildings into tenant unions to preserve affordable housing, stop rent increases and evictions, and to force landlords to make needed repairs. Assisted HUD tenants in purchasing their buildings to preserve them as tenant controlled affordable housing. Helped win a landmark housing inspection program to combat slum housing conditions. Assisted thousands of tenants with information on their rights at CES' twice a week Tenants' Rights Clinic.

title: Help "Spread the Word" in Los Angeles!
description:
Do you want to make an impact in your local community? Do you want to help grow our organization, so we can both feed your community, and reduce food waste? Do you have about 2 hours of free time, on the day of your choosing? If you've answered yes to these questions, please keep reading!


Who We AreRescuing Leftover Cuisine is a 501(c)3 non-profit that redistributes excess food to people experiencing food insecurity.


What We Do
missionStatement: The mission of RLC is to redistribute excess food to feed people experiencing food insecurity.
organizationDescription: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine (RLC) is a nonprofit organization committed to fighting food insecurity and preventing wasted food. We have cultivated a network of dedicated food rescuers who bring food directly from our food donors to nonprofit recipients, letting neighbors help neighbors while reaping the environmental and economic benefits of reducing wasted food. Founded in 2013, our simple, but elegant model has saved over 8 million pounds of food since our inception.

title: Coaches, Mentors, Sports Facilitators, yoga, art and dance instructors for Men's Transitional Living
description: We are in need of volunteers experienced in sports, arts, or dancing to help the men at our transitional living home. Men are in need of mentors as well.
missionStatement: Gracie’s Giving Hands was birthed out of a place of empathy. We knew the first hand stories of homelessness, hunger and hopelessness. It is our mission to show this same community in need the love, hope, support and encouragement we have found. We hope to restore life, and want unhoused people to know that they are not forgotten, that they matter and that they are loved. Our overarching vision is to provide housing and support programs to restore self-esteem, value and dignity to people presently living on the streets. We ultimately hope to transform lives to be free of trauma, addiction, and pain.
organizationDescription: We are a nonprofit organization dedicated to serving the unhoused people of Skid Row in downtown Los Angeles. Our work primarily consists of serving healthy food, and distributing water, canned goods, clothing, and toiletries to the individuals living on the street, of course at no charge to the recipients. We are an all-volunteer organization, with unpaid roles ranging from our Board of Directors to the drivers who deliver our precious cargo--HOPE! -- to children, young girls and boys, women, families, elders, and men from every conceivable background who find themselves on the pavement with nowhere left to turn. Primarily serving a public purpose and significantly benefit the public at-large, homelessness is not just a person crisis; it is a societal issue with broad ramifications. By assisting individuals in their transition from the streets to a safe, supportive environment, we are actively contributing to the well-being of our community as a whole. By investing in the people we serve, we're promoting healthier communities, reducing strain on public resources, and fostering a more inclusive and compassionate society.

title: Host a Foreign Exchange Student!
description:
We are in search of host families in Los Angeles, CA to host exchange students who are coming this August 2024! We have students available who come from all over the world: Italy, France, Spain, Germany, Vietnam, Brazil, Turkey, Paraguay and more! The requirements to become a volunteer host family are simple. A host family must provide:

• 3 meals a day
• Transportation to/from school
• A Bedroom to sleep and study in (Students can share a room with the same gender and similar age)
• Love and Support…
missionStatement: Education Travel & Culture (ETC) is a top-rated non-profit [501(c)(3)] educational exchange organization. Our purpose is to promote international understanding and goodwill by providing high quality educational and cultural exchange programs in the United States and abroad.
organizationDescription: ETC provides inbound program opportunities for high school students throughout the world to study in an American high school and live with an American family. ETC's outbound program offers students the chance to study and live in a foreign country. Education Travel & Culture is a unique, personalized organization whose first goal is to provide exceptional support for both students and host families through a network of local coordinators and dedicated office staff.

title: Disaster Tech Response Team - Southern California
organization: Information Technology Disaster Resource Center, Inc
description:
ITDRC is recruiting Technology Professionals to join our Nationwide, All-Volunteer Disaster Response Team.


Technical Volunteers from all disciplines are needed to assist communities and community organizations with temporary communications, technical support, and community recovery following a disaster.


All Technology skillsets are welcome. On Site and Remote Support Opportunities are available, and can be worked around your current schedule. Visit ITDRC.org for more information.
missionStatement: We harness the collective resources of the technology community to provide no cost Information, Communications, and Technology (ICT) solutions that connect survivors and responders in crisis.
organizationDescription: ITDRC is America's premier team of volunteer technology professionals - Connecting Communities in Crisis(tm)Founded in 2008, the Information Technology Disaster Resource Center (ITDRC) is a nationwide, volunteer-driven nonprofit organization that provides emergency communications and technical resources to communities in crisis. We connect survivors and responders in the days, weeks, and months after a disaster.Each year, ITDRC volunteers and our partners contribute tens of thousands of hours and millions of dollars of in-kind services helping communities recover from catastrophic events through the use of technology. If you're looking for a life changing experience, visit itdrc.org.

title: St. Carmen Hospice patient volunteer
description: Hello everyone!St. Carmen Health Providers, Inc. is offering HOSPICE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIESDo you have the gift of time? We are looking for individuals who desire a rewarding and meaningful experience. Bring a professional and genuine attitude to patients and their families. Gaining experience in the health care industry while providing a compassionate and safe environment.BILINGUEL? (Not required)…
missionStatement: OUR PHILOSOPHY: Those we serve are faced with the challenges associated with end of life care. St. Carmen Hospice is committed to easing those challenges. Our philosophy is to walk together with those we serve to provide the highest quality of care with respect and compassion.

title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children
description:
MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers and related volunteers in California. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation.


MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check…
missionStatement: Any child who has musical potential deserves the opportunity to nurture this talent to its full extent.
organizationDescription: Many children lack the chance to receive music lessons due to financial need. The MusicLink Foundation reaches out to low-income families by linking these students with professional music teachers willing to reduce their fee to make the lessons more affordable for the child. The MusicLink Foundation does not reimburse teachers for this scholarship donation, but supports them in a variety of ways. MusicLink is all across the US and Canada, and is celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2017.

title: Mount Wilson Observatory Volunteer
description:
Mount Wilson Observatory relies on dedicated volunteers to support this historic facility’s mission. Many important positions require no special skills or education - just a love of history, astronomy, nature, or the arts. Volunteer opportunities are available mostly on weekends, during the months of May through October. Volunteers must be at least 18 years old.


Special Event Assistants: Mount Wilson hosts a series of concerts in the 100-inch telescope dome, science lectures in the Museum auditorium followed by telescope viewing sessions, and other special events. May-October. Located at the Observatory.


Member RelationsandOffice Assistants: Help process questions and requests, package and ship materials, update membership lists, and perform other needed tasks. Year-round opportunities located in Pasadena on occasional weekdays.


Observatory Technical Support: Provide support in maintaining the…
missionStatement: The mission of the Mount Wilson Institute is to manage and promote the Mount Wilson Observatory for scientific research, historic preservation, education, public engagement, and the arts.
organizationDescription: Located on Mount Wilson, a 5,710-foot peak in the San Gabriel Mountains near Pasadena, California, the Observatory was conceived and founded by George Ellery Hale in 1904. The home of some of the most important telescopes in the development of modern astronomy - including the two largest telescopes of their time - it is a site of significant scientific and Los Angeles history. The Observatory and grounds are open to the public to visit, and during the spring and summer hosts public programs including observing through the historic telescopes, lectures, concerts, educational programs, and more.

title: READING TO KIDS: March 8th Reading Clubs
description:
Reading to Kids organizes monthly reading clubs on the second Saturday of every month at seven downtown Los Angeles elementary schools. The reading clubs run from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. Pairs of volunteer readers read aloud to small groups of students from the elementary school (typically between 4 and 6 children per group) in a fun environment. Teachers at the elementary school provide supervision and guidance throughout the morning.


To volunteer at our next reading clubs, please visit http://www.readingtokids.org where you'll need to register and RSVP. For more information, please feel free to e-mail us at info@readingtokids.org or call (310) 479-7455…
missionStatement: Reading to Kids is an organization composed of volunteers helping to provide children with an enthusiasm for reading and a brighter future.
organizationDescription: Reading to Kids organizes monthly reading clubs at elementary schools that are held on the second Saturday of every month. The reading clubs run from 9:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. Pairs of volunteer readers read aloud to small groups of students from the elementary school (typically between 4 and 6) in a fun environment. Teachers at the elementary school provide supervision and guidance throughout the morning.

title: Gallery Interpreter
description: Go on a journey of discovery with museum visitors as they experience the 25 brand new Petersen galleries. Chat. Share car stories and history. Ask questions. Make connections. And explore the art, industry, and history of the car together by engaging guests in conversational learning.
missionStatement: The Petersen Automotive Museum believes the car is more than four wheels and a transmission. We believe the car is defined by more than its horsepower and whether it's fuel-injected or carbureted. We believe the car is: a work of art - a shaper of cultural identity - a marvel of technology - a revolution in history. And we are looking for enthusiastic women and men who think so too. We are ready to show the world the car is more than just a car.
organizationDescription: The Petersen Automotive Museum explores and presents the history of the automobile and its impact on American life and culture, with Los Angeles as the prime example, through 25 brand new galleries, 300+ historic vehicles in the collection, and innovative, interactive, family-focused programming.

title: Los Angeles - Film Festival Volunteers
description:
Do you like scary movies? Would you like to be a part of the largest and longest running horror film festival in the United States? Screamfest Horror Film Festival is looking for people who are positive, energetic, and willing to get involved in a busy environment. Volunteers are needed to assist in all areas of the festival - from theater entrances to assisting and meeting the filmmakers. Of course, there are exciting benefits such as being among the first audiences to see world premieres of the best new independent horror films. Benefits are provided in conjunction with the number of hours volunteered.


All Volunteers will need to attend a one-time training session prior to the festival. At that time, you will indicate your hours of availability during the ten day event. The following week you will receive your…
missionStatement: Screamfest provides a platform for talented writers & directors in the genre to showcase their work to the general public & entertainment industry.
organizationDescription: Screamfest is an annual 10-day festival in Los Angeles showcasing new genre features and short films from around the globe. We are best known for discovering and premiering Paranormal Activity. Other past premieres include Paranormal Activity: Ghost Dimension, 30 Days of Night, Trick 'r Treat, The Human Centipide and many more,

title: Volunteer at Los Angeles State Historic Park! (monthly events)
description:
Help the park with their ongoing habitat restoration efforts! Volunteers will use hand tools to remove invasive plants to ensure recently planted native species continue to thrive. This project will protect critical habitat for pollinators and other wildlife. Ages 8 and over welcome (minors must be accompanied by an adult and bring a waiver signed by their guardian).To complete registration, please sign up on our webpage at https://volunteer.calparks.org/. Registration on our webpage is required to ensure volunteers receive important details on where to meet the group and what to bring.


We will have monthly volunteer workday events from June - Nov! Please visit our webpage to register and for more details…
missionStatement: Protecting and preserving the California state park system, for the benefit of all.
organizationDescription: Protecting and preserving the California state park system, for the benefit of all.

title: Community Integrator
description:
We have outgrown ourselves & are now seeking a Community Integrator to help us reach a broader audience. Ideal candidates will have strong brand awareness, will be versed in localized community offerings in the LA areas (concerts, venues, festivals & other relevant events) & help boost Racketeer Broadcast Association's presence in the region. missionStatement: Cereal4all is a youth-run nonprofit fighting hunger around America’s breakfast tables. We work with students and schools to ensure food banks can offer breakfast to disadvantaged children and families. Through our cereal drives and other community projects, we increase youth awareness about hunger issues, promote volunteerism at an early age, and help feed households struggling to secure a meal in the morning.
organizationDescription: Cereal4all is a unique 501c3 nonprofit run by students who are passionate about fighting hunger and strengthening our communities. We believe cereal is about breakfast and starting off the day, but it’s also about happiness. Since breakfast & happiness are two things the world can use more of, we’re working to make it happen. We also think the world can use more young people volunteering at their local food banks and getting more invested in the well-being of their cities and towns, so we’re working on that too. Team up with us to make a positive difference in your community.Since 2016, Cereal4all has provided over 270,000 bowls of cereal to children and families in need and encouraged students across the United States to get active in the fight against hunger.

missionStatement: We are The J Atterby Fields Foundation, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit based in Los Angeles, dedicated to connecting and enriching lives. organizationDescription: We promote mental, physical, and financial fitness through our Kinect and Enrich programs, which are designed to strengthen and support families. These programs, developed and funded by our organization, offer workshops, resources, and services aimed at improving health, wellness, fitness, and financial literacy for children and families. By providing practical life skills, we empower individuals of all ages and backgrounds to achieve personal growth and development. Our consistent efforts have made a meaningful impact on the lives of children and families in lower-income areas of South Los Angeles. title: Neighborhood Clean-up, Isla Intersection
description: This is a great opportunity to come together, make a positive impact on our community. We’ll be picking up litter, tidying green spaces, and ensuring our neighborhood looks its best. How You Can Help: Wear comfortable clothing and sturdy shoes. Bring a friend or family member - the more, the merrier! After the clean-up, we’ll have lunch, refreshments and music. Your participation will make a big difference. Let’s work together to keep the neighborhood clean and beautiful!
missionStatement: American Family Housing provides a continuum of housing and an array of services to support homeless and low-income families and adults to secure a stable home, to be an active part of their community, and to achieve a self-sustaining way of life.
organizationDescription: We need support sorting and organizing donations, assisting our Community Engagement Team with outreach and planning/executing current opportunities, office support (restocking printer station, assisting our office manager with duties, answering the door, assisting community members, clients, residents), food pantry restock, and food distribution.

title: Teens Love Trains? Help restore locomotives & much more in Griffith Park!!
description:
We have several volunteer opportunities!

Restoration Staff: Restore some of our exhibit cars to their former glory! Use your skills in carpentry, refinishing woodwork, plumbing or electrical system!


Gardening: Maintain flowers and keep this part of Griffith Park beautiful!


Track Building Crew: Work outside building track at Travel Town, moving rail, driving spikes, setting ties, etc…
missionStatement: The mission of the Foundation is to educate the public about railroad history as it pertains to the development of the Southwest Region of the United States, particularly the Los Angeles area. We fulfill this mission by supporting the restoration, operation, and interpretation of the historic railroad equipment at the City-operated Travel Town Museum in Griffith Park.
organizationDescription: Educational Tour Guides needed to instruct the general public and school groups. Great way to meet and talk with others in your community and help out the Museum. title: You and Your Dog Can Make a Difference in Patients' Lives
description:
Join Cedars-Sinai’s Volunteer Services team so that you and your dog can provide heartwarming and deeply supportive experiences to patients, visitors, and staff members. The Barbara Cowen POOCH Volunteer Program provides animal therapy throughout Cedars-Sinai. Watch our video on YouTube, read below and check out our website to learn more about the POOCH Program: Pets Offering Ongoing Care & Healing Program.


Dog Requirements

• Must be registered through Pet Partners Therapy Animal Program
• Pass veterinary medical and behavioral screening exams
• Demonstrate basic obedience skills. Be house-trained…
missionStatement: Cedars-Sinai is a nonprofit, independent healthcare organization committed to improving the health status of the communities we serve through: Leadership and excellence in delivering quality healthcare services Expanding the horizons of medical knowledge through biomedical research. Educating and training physicians and other healthcare professionals Improving the health status of the community Quality patient care is our priority. Providing excellent clinical and service quality, offering compassionate care, and supporting research and medical education are essential to our mission. This mission is founded in the ethical and cultural precepts of the Judaic tradition, which inspire devotion to the art and science of healing and to the care we give our patients and staff.
organizationDescription: As a volunteer at Cedars-Sinai, you'll help shape an important chapter in someone's life. You'll be providing comfort, assistance and hope--just by being there. Through volunteer work, you connect with your community, build new friendships and bring greater meaning into your own life. That's why Cedars-Sinai has more than 2,000 volunteers who, on average, stay with the hospital for 4 years. Some even stay for decades.
