title: Event Planner
description:
Please bear in mind that this position must take into consideration CDC guidelines in planning events. Our organization's policy is that Trauma Speaks staff must provide proof of vaccination or proof a negative COVID test within 72 hours of an event hosted by the organization. As an event planner for Trauma Speaks, your responsibilities primarily focus on organization and management of events such as conceptualizing themes and ideas that align with our mission and vision as an organization.


You will also be in charge of planning budgets and preparing invoices, booking venues, acting as a liaison with suppliers, clients, handling/managing logistics of the event, and presenting reports after the event.


You will be in charge of making sure schedules/timelines to make the event come to fruition is followed. …
missionStatement: Our foundation is dedicated to bringing awareness to the Mental Health issues that affect our communities near and far. We aid in the healing of individuals and collectives, through offering mental health resources & wellness tools in the form of; affordable workshops, webinars, podcasts, membership opportunities and more. We also host fundraisers and fairs that instill awareness and empathy, to heal those who’ve been affected by trauma and other mental health issues.
organizationDescription: We are a women-led organization. We hope that this website can serve as an inspiration, motivation and help people understand that mental health is as important as physical health. We are advocates in breaking the stigma attached to trauma and mental illnesses. This is the primary purpose of why Trauma Speaks was created.Started in 2017 as a mental health blog to provide a safe space for individuals suffering or that suffered mental health struggles/mental health disorders, Trauma Speaks expanded into a podcast and website where psychoeducation about mental health was emphasized alongside personal experiences being shared by members of the community. Now, Trauma Speaks has become a start-up non-profit with the goal of expanding psychoeducation on mental health within the community by providing workshops, webinars, fairs, conferences, etc. to raise awareness about mental health and mental health related issues. One of the projects we would like to accomplish in the near future is being able to develop a one-stop-shop mental health app that individuals can access and use without having to download multiple apps to achieve the same purpose.

title: Volunteer Guides Needed to Bring Music to Hospitals in Los Angeles!
description:
Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call (MOC) needs YOU to help us spread the healing power of music to those who need it most!


Volunteer Guides (non-musicians) escort Volunteer Musicians room to room as they play music for patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments.


The Volunteer Guide acts as the "eyes and ears" during the MOC Bedside shift and is the liaison between the hospital, patient, and the Volunteer Musician. Volunteer Guides are critical to the success of MOC Bedside and get to experience the healing power of music firsthand without having to be a musician themselves…
missionStatement: Musicians On Call, a nonprofit organization formed in 1999, brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call uses music to promote and complement the healing process for patients, families and caregivers.
organizationDescription: Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. We are looking for VOLUNTEER GUIDES and VOLUNTEER MUSICIANS to help us deliver the healing power of music. As a volunteer with Musicians On Call, you can brighten the days of hospitalized patients - a truly rewarding experience. MOC currently has volunteer opportunities for both Volunteer Guides and Volunteer Musicians at our weekly Bedside Performance Programs.

description:
OUR HOUSE Grief Support Center es una organización sin fines de lucro que ofrece grupos de apoyo desde 1993 para asistir con el duelo de niños, adolescentes y adultos en su camino hacia la esperanza y la mejoría. Estamos buscando voluntarios(as) bondadosos(as) y con compasión que realmente quieran hacer una diferencia en la vida de un adulto, para que sean Líderes de los Grupos de Apoyo en el area de Los Angeles y en el Valle de San Fernando. ¡Muchas gracias! OUR HOUSE Grief Support Center (310) 473-1511…
missionStatement: To provide our community with grief support services, education, resources and hope.
organizationDescription: For 30 years, OUR HOUSE has helped thousands of children, teens, and adults on their journeys to hope and healing. OUR HOUSE is a nonprofit grief support center, providing support groups for children and adults who have experienced the death of someone close. OUR HOUSE also offers on-site grief support groups and interventions to schools and businesses throughout Los Angeles County. OUR HOUSE is the foremost provider of grief education to mental health and community professionals and is the most recognized grief support center in California.

title: Feeding the Homeless Every Wednesday (11:30am-2:30pm)
description:
Thank you for your interest in volunteering with My Friend's House Foundation LA! We're thrilled to have you join us in making a positive impact on the lives of those experiencing homelessness in Downtown Los Angeles.


About My Friend's House Foundation LA


For over 15 years, our "We Feed The Hungry" program has provided essential items and support to those in need. Every Wednesday, rain or shine, our dedicated staff and volunteers distribute food, clothing, toiletries, and more to individuals, families, seniors, disabled, and Veterans, including their pets. We believe in serving the community with compassion, dignity and respect.


The Impact of Your Volunteerism


Together, we've served over 750,000 meals and essentials, but the need continues. With the rising number of unhoused individuals, including…
missionStatement: My Friend's House Foundation is a 501(c)(3) non-profit human service organization whose mission is to provide a wholistic approach in the care of Los Angeles' marginalized populations regardless of race, color, creed, or religious belief.
organizationDescription: For Just under 11 Years, My Friend's House Foundation has been on the frontlines of providing essential items for men, woman and their children in and around the Skid Row area of Downtown Los Angeles. Skid Row is the capital of homelessness is the United State. Weekly, rain or shine volunteers from all walks of life unite with us to serve Los Angeles' marginalized populations with dignity and humility. We distribute, food, clothing, toiletries and other items as they become available. In addition to our weekly outreach, MFHF offers a plethora of Programs that promote self-sufficiency, personal growth and independence. From our Refresh Program that provides professional barber and salon services for no or low cost, to yoga, pet care, financial literacy, health and nutrition classes, music and art therapy and more. Many of our volunteers have been with us for years. WE ARE Family! However in today's climate the need is becoming greater and we need to grow our Family! Will you join us?

This is a part-time 12 hours per week, 12 week, unpaid remote…
missionStatement: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. and U.K. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis.

The Borgen Project believes that leaders of the most powerful nations on earth should be doing more to address global poverty. The national campaign is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. and U.K. foreign policy.

title: Q1: Resident Resource Fair - Volunteer Opportunity

By eliminating transportation and access barriers, this event helps residents connect with agencies and resources crucial for their successful housing journey.Your support helps remove barriers between vital community services and residents who need them most. By volunteering, you directly contribute to the successful housing journey of community members working to maintain stable housing.

title: Brighten the Day of a Veteran at Veterans Resource Fair

title: Baby2Baby Winter/Spring Internship 2025 - Events Intern
description: Intern at Baby2Baby - recognized as the #1 non-profit on Fast Company's World's Most Innovative Companies List and named by TIME Magazine as one of 2023's most influential companies.Why: The Events Intern will learn about the Los Angeles non-profit and social service sectors, and how Baby2Baby accomplishes its mission for 8 weeks for 8-12 hours/week.Who: Baby2Baby is a national non-profit organization that provides children living in poverty with diapers, formula, clothing, and the basic necessities that every child deserves, serving more than one million children across all 50 states every year. Over the past 13 years, Baby2Baby has distributed over 450 million items- more than any organization of its kind - to children in homeless shelters, domestic violence programs, foster care, hospitals and underserved schools as well as children who have lost everything in the wake of disaster.
missionStatement: Baby2Baby provides children living in poverty with diapers, clothing and all the basic necessities that every child deserves. Led by Co-CEOs Kelly Sawyer Patricof and Norah Weinstein, Baby2Baby is a mega diaper bank and nonprofit organization providing essential items to children in need across the country. In the last 12 years, Baby2Baby has distributed over 300 million items to children in homeless shelters, domestic violence programs, foster care, hospitals and underserved schools as well as children who have lost everything in the wake of disaster.
organizationDescription: Baby2Baby provides children living in poverty with diapers, clothing and all the basic necessities that every child deserves.

title: Be a reading tutor - support students' path toward reading proficiency (Los Angeles)
description:
Volunteer just over an hour per week to empower a student through reading.


Reading Partners believes that our communities do better when all students have access to high-quality learning opportunities and the critical reading skills needed to prepare them for academic, social, and civic success.


Reading Partners is seeking in-person and online volunteer tutors to work one-on-one with students this school year, 2024-2025.Give a little over one hour per week.  We offer flexible weekday session times. No experience is required, as we provide volunteers with a structured curriculum, training, and ongoing support to help you and your student succeed…
missionStatement: Our mission is to help children become lifelong readers by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction with measurable results.
organizationDescription: Reading Partners is a national education nonprofit that partners with students, their families, schools, and communities to provide students with individualized literacy support and the foundational skills they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. We do this by training community volunteers to deliver one-on-one, literacy lessons, using our structured and easy to follow, evidence-based curriculum. Volunteer tutoring happens in-person via our Reading Partners Traditional program and virtually via our Reading Partners Connects program. Programming varies by region. We currently serve twelve regions, nationwide: Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, San Francisco Bay Area, Seattle, Denver, North Texas, Tulsa, Twin Cities, South Carolina, Washington DC, Baltimore, and New York.

missionStatement: Valley Opera and Performing Arts (VOPA) is dedicated to enriching our community through the power of music and the arts. Our mission is to inspire, entertain, and educate through world-class musical and theatrical productions, fostering a vibrant cultural scene in the heart of the valley. We are committed to providing accessible, diverse, and high-quality performances that engage, challenge, and unite our audiences, artists, and supporters, as we celebrate the transformative and timeless beauty of the human spirit expressed through music and the performing arts.
organizationDescription: VOPA presents performances of everything from fully staged opera and musical theater works with orchestra, to laid back concerts of jazz standards and even classic rock concerts with its band VOPA Rocks. Through the company’s Opera Tree Outreach, Education, and Community Service program, VOPA provides entertainment for underserved and economically or otherwise disadvantaged communities such as retirement communities, charities, homeless shelters, schools, and hospitals.

title: Volunteer to help seniors in West LA
description:
Services Provided: Westside Pacific Villages helps seniors thrive as they age in place by providing non-medical services, opportunities to connect socially, and educational events. We are part of a national network that is dedicated to providing residents with resources to help them confidently stay in their home. We assist with transportation, help around the house, arrange social outings, provide companionship and much more.


Areas We Service: Westchester, Culver City, Marina del Rey, Playa del Rey, Mar Vista, Playa Vista, Palms, El Segundo, Manhattan Beach, Ladera Heights, Venice.


Volunteer Positions: We welcome volunteers of all ages and talents. We…
missionStatement: Westside Pacific Villages helps older adults remain active and independent, in the comfort and security of their own homes and neighborhoods. Our services and programs promote healthy and engaged living to improve the well-being of those we serve, and by extension, enhance and improve our community.
organizationDescription: Voted Best Place to Volunteer by the local Hometown News!

title: Meals On Wheels Beverly Hills
description:
BH Meals on Wheels deliveries a hot meal and a cold meal per day to the homebound seniors in and around the beverly hills area. Meals are picked at Cedars Sinai Monday thru Friday at 10 am and are delivered before noon.


We are looking for volunteers who can make a commitment to deliver meals in a friendly and sincere manner and to report any suspicious findings.


Please contact Pat Jacobson at 310-423-3517


Thank you
missionStatement: To keep aged or infirm people in their homes as long as possible, thus preserving their dignity and independence..
organizationDescription: BH Meals on Wheels deliveries a hot meal and a cold meal per day to the homebound seniors in and around the beverly hills area. Meals are picked at Cedars Sinai Monday thru Friday at 10 am and are delivered before noon.

title: Foster for Best Friends Animal Society- Los Angeles
description: Fosters needed! Fostering is an easy, short-term, hands-on way to make a lifetime of difference in a pet's life. Whether you open your home (and heart) to a dog, cat, puppy or kitten, Best Friends will provide everything you need, including food, supplies, support and medical care, to ensure that your foster pet’s stay is a happy and healthy one.
missionStatement: Every day, nearly 1,000 dogs and cats are killed in America's shelters. But every day, there's something all of us can do to help save those animals. Together, we can Save Them All.
organizationDescription: About Best Friends Animal Society:

title: Committee Members
description:
We are in need of volunteers who can help in the Programs Department in various capacities. We have opportunities for volunteers to help with office support, to help us bring awareness about Alzheimer's disease by participating in community events like health/resource fairs, helping us facilitate support groups, and also educating the community about Alzheimer's disease by doing presentations out in the community. Additionally, we are looking for volunteer committee members for our "The Longest Day" fund.


The Longest Day (TLD) is a fundraising event held by the Alzheimer's Association, where participants engage in activities they love from sunrise to sunset to raise funds and awareness for Alzheimer's care, support, and research. Committee members play a crucial role in…
missionStatement: To eliminate Alzheimer's disease through the advancement of research; to provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through the promotion of brain health.
organizationDescription: We are in need of volunteers who can help in the Programs Department in various capacities. We have opportunities for volunteers to help with office support, to help us bring awareness about Alzheimer's disease by participating in community events like health/resource fairs, helping us facilitate support groups, and also educating the community about Alzheimer's disease by doing presentations out in the community.

title: Community Representative

• Planning special events and coordinating the distribution of goods and services.
• Responsible for oversight of all community events for Soldiers’ Angels.

• Coordinate delivery of Soldiers’ Angels support to local service members, military units, veterans, and their families, Veteran support are non-VA sponsored events.
• Responsible for recruitment, training and retention of all community activities and event volunteers.
• Coordination of the volunteer resources of Soldiers’ Angels and all aspects of their participation in the…
missionStatement: The mission of Soldiers’ Angels is to provide aid, comfort, and resources to the military, veterans, and their families.
organizationDescription: The vision of Soldiers’ Angels is to ensure military, wounded military, veterans, and their families have access to needed community resources and support. The values of Soldiers’ Angels: Compassion, Dedication, Effectiveness, Efficiency, Collaborative, Credibility, Responsiveness.

title: Become a Mentor with Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of LA!
organization: Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of LA
description: In just 5-6 hours each month, you can help change a child’s perspective of what the world can offer. Spending quality, one-on-one time as a mentor and helping a child realize their potential can have a transformative effect on that child’s life - and on yours, too.
missionStatement: JBBBSLA assists youth in achieving their full potential through innovative, impactful programs -- Youth Mentoring, Camp Bob Waldorf, College Access + Success.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1915, JBBBSLA enriches the lives of children through its meaningful programs: Youth Mentoring, Camp Bob Waldorf, College Access + Success, and Teen Talk App. JBBBSLA’s mission is to assist youth in achieving their full potential by providing impactful programs that facilitate lasting relationships and support positive youth development. Each year JBBBSLA serves more than 1,200 youth from a variety of backgrounds, races, religions, and socio-economic status.Not only can a mentor have a profound impact on a child’s growth and success, but the effect on mentors themselves can also be significant. Our volunteers join a valued community, meet interesting new people, and describe experiencing joy and pride in their mentoring role. Jewish Big Brothers Big Sisters of Los Angeles has been matching Jewish mentors ("Bigs"), ages 21 and up, with Jewish mentees ("Littles"), ages 6-17, for over 100 years. Many of our Big/Little matches report that their relationships with one another have been deeply impactful, and even life-changing for them both. Whether a match lasts a year or a lifetime, mentoring makes a Big difference.

title: Volunteer Drivers
description: DAV needs volunteer drivers to transport veterans to and from their medical appointments.
missionStatement: Providing transportation for veterans to medical appointments.
organizationDescription: Our agency is in need of volunteer drivers to help provide transportation for veterans from their homes to medical appointments. Volunteers drive our vehicles. Contact us for more details

title: Friendly Visitor for Hospice Patients
organization: Kaiser Permanente Hospice Volunteer and Bereavement Services
description:
Looking for a way to engage your heart, mind and spirit? Consider becoming a Hospice Volunteer, with Kaiser Permanente Tri-Central Hospice Volunteer program. Kaiser honors the basic principle of Hospice care helping terminally ill patients balance the spirit of living, giving them as much comfort and peace as possible no matter how long or short their remaining time is. We provide physical, emotional, and spiritual comforts to increase the quality of life in this season with family and friends.


Here are some ways you can help:


Patient Care: Provide companionship to patients at home or in a skilled nursing facility through social, emotional, presence, and spiritual…
missionStatement: Our cause is health. Our passion is service. We work to make lives better.
organizationDescription: Volunteers Needed: KAISER PERMANENTE Hospice Volunteer program is seeking caring individuals to volunteer in our communities: Downey, Baldwin Park, South Bay and their surrounding cities. Our Hospice Volunteer program honors the basic principle of Hospice care, helping terminally ill patients keep the spirit of living and make the most of the remaining time of their lives with family and friends. If you are considering contributing your time and experience to something meaningful, become a Hospice Volunteer, it just might appeal to you. Volunteers must be at least 18 years of age and able to make a commitment for one year.

title: DOG WALKERS NEEDED
description: One of our foster facilities in West LA needs dog walkers. We have 7-10 small rescue dogs (under 20 lbs) cared for at Urban Dog, and they would love to go for walks daily! Have a great time playing with and walking the dogs and getting an extra abundance of unconditional love!If you are interested, please complete our Volunteer Application (http://lhasahappyhomes.org/volunteer-for-lhh/volunteer-application/) to be approved.
missionStatement: Lhasa Happy Homes is a private rescue and foster care organization with a goal to rehome and save the lives of as many the breed (including Lhasa, Shih Tzu, Maltese and small mixed breeds) as humanly possible. It is our endeavor to educate the public on a grassroots level as to the importance of spaying and neutering their animals and training them them as forever parents so that these animals are never in the "system" again.
organizationDescription: Lhasa Happy Homes is a private rescue and foster care organization created for the safe haven and permanent placement of homeless pups, primarily Lhasa Apsos, Shih Tzus, Maltese and small mixed breeds. We are not a shelter facility. Dogs are housed in a homelike environment, given very special and loving attention during their "temporary" stay at our facility. We rescue from the Los Angeles city and county shelters, and we accept Lhasa Apso, Shih Tzu, Maltese and owner turn-ins who are need of re-homing on a case-by-case basis.

title: Holi Color Festival + Walkathon
description:
We are excited to celebrate the Holi Color Festival for the second year in a row! This wonderful event was created to promote a more inclusive environment for all seniors in our community. Last year, we organized a health fair in celebration of Holi, which turned out to be a tremendous success, featuring over 12 community partners and attracting more than 60 friends, neighbors, and seniors to join the fun. We managed to raise $500 for the senior center.


This year, we’re thrilled to announce a walkathon that encourages everyone in the community to get involved, all while supporting the senior center’s mission to provide enriching programs for our seniors. Our fundraising goal for this year is set at $1,000 for the senior center…
missionStatement: To Help Eliminate Food Insecurity & Social Isolation In Our Aging Population... To provide services and programs that engage, uplift and enrich the lives of older adults
organizationDescription: VIC-Valley InterCommunity Council offers a variety of nutritionally balanced meals to seniors, families, and individuals across the San Fernando Valley through its diverse nutrition programs. Whether it's for those recovering from a hospital stay, homebound individuals, or adults seeking a vibrant social dining experience, there’s something available for everyone. In addition to meal services, VIC also provides transportation, case management, health and wellness activities, and a range of social and recreational events. As our society evolves, we are inspired to find innovative ways to embody our values, adapt to current needs, and enhance the relevance of our services and programs.

title: Classroom Volunteer
description:
Join Girls Inc. of Los Angeles as a classroom volunteer!


Bring your boldest self to empower girls to discover their inherent strengths and mentor girls on making informed decisions while having fun.


In-class volunteers support instructors with weekly activities in our classrooms once or twice a week from 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm, 2 to 3 hours a day. Girls Inc. proudly serves girls in six schools located in the South and West Los Angeles area. Volunteers will be assigned to one location only.


To begin volunteering, please complete a Girls Inc. application on our website. Applicants will be scheduled to attend a Zoom Orientation to…
missionStatement: Girls Inc. inspires all girls to be strong, smart, and bold, through direct service and advocacy.
organizationDescription: About Girls Inc.

title: LAXceeders Student Volunteers
organization: City of Los Angeles, Los Angeles World Airports
description:
The LAXceeders mission is to empower students with skills to exceed within the aviation industry, while introducing students to the airport environment, developing communications skills and promoting community partnerships.  The LAXceeders Student Volunteer Program is committed to the enhancement of guest services. The program is comprised of good will representatives who provide high-level, personal assistance and information in a professional manner to guests using LAX.  LAXceeders Student Volunteers represent a very important segment of the airport’s elite team of volunteers. As student volunteer, you are free to set your volunteer schedule, but you must be prepared to fulfill your LAXceeders Student Volunteer Program commitments. WHAT DO LAXceeders DO?

• Directly and positively influence the guest's experience at Los Angeles…
missionStatement: The Volunteer Information Professional Program’s mission is to assist guests to ensure an efficient, hospitable and memorable LAXceptional Xperience. The personal touch is what guests remember most during their travels, and our Volunteers are truly exceptional at offering a smile, warm greetings and reliable information in what can be a challenging environment at times. The VIP Program is committed to providing excellent guest services. Positive one-on-one interactions are what make the difference, and that’s what the VIP program brings to LAX.
organizationDescription: At LAX, we strive to make our guest visits efficient,

title: USO LAX Center Volunteer
description: USO Airport Centers are private clubs, staffed by volunteers, where our active-duty military and military families can rest and recharge while traveling. Our USO LAX Center provides not only a place to relax, but a big screen TV, a movie room, Wi-Fi, gaming, a place to nap, family rooms, an outdoor patio, and a canteen with beverages, snacks and sandwiches. Volunteers staff the front reception desk area and canteen. They also visit with our guests and make them feel at home. Our volunteers work as a team, and our team is awesome! Volunteers work a set schedule, either every week or every other week. We ask for a commitment of six months. Our shifts are 7am-10am, 10am-2pm, 2pm-6pm and 6pm-9pm. We are open Sunday - Friday. …
missionStatement: The USO strengthens America’s military service members by keeping them connected to family, home and country, throughout their service to the nation.
organizationDescription: The USO Center at LAX provides a place of rest and relaxation for our service members and military families when they travel. Staffed by caring volunteers, we provide Wi-Fi, activities, movies, family rooms, gaming and snacks to make their day a little easier. Since 1941 the USO has proudly served active duty, Guards, Reserves and their dependent family members.

title: Kitchen Volunteering
description: Spend the day volunteering with L.A. Family Housing in their Kitchen. Why: Provide quality service by serving nourishing meals for those who may not otherwise have access to them. You can also help to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where people can gather and connect over a warm meal.Who: L.A. Family Housing (LAFH) works to help families transition out of homelessness and poverty through a continuum of housing enriched with supportive services. Founded in 1983, LAFH served more than 2,500 people living in poverty this past year through its multiple housing and supportive service programs, and has served over 100,000 people since its inception. What to Expect:…
missionStatement: L.A. Family Housing (LAFH) works to help families transition out of homelessness and poverty through a continuum of housing enriched with supportive services. Founded in 1983, LAFH served more than 2,500 people living in poverty this past year through its multiple housing and supportive service programs, and has served over 100,000 people since its inception. In total LAFH owns and operates 21 properties, including three homeless shelters and 18 permanent rental properties. LAFH provides temporary housing, including the Sydney Irmas Transitional Living Center, for families who require additional time for achieving sufficient independence to secure permanent housing. These transitional living programs offer: * Six Months to Two Years of Transitional Housing * Food Services * Case Management * Mandatory Savings Program * Full Range of On-Site Supportive Services
organizationDescription: Service Enterprise year 2

title: School Garden Program Volunteer
organization: Sustainable Palos Verdes Schools dba Palos Verdes School Gardens
description:
School Garden Program Volunteer


General interest in gardening? Assist PVSG Garden Team with various ongoing school garden program garden clubs, maintenance and administration! In the garden: weeding, fertilizing, pruning, composting, soil building and planting. No green thumb required! Student groups welcome with adult supervision. Great for corporate team building and community engagement!In the virtual office and administration: grant writing, communications, newsletters, database management, events, workshops, cooking and garden classes. Weekly commitment ongoing…
missionStatement: Palos Verdes School Gardens seeks to create community based edible education opportunities in public places of greater Los Angeles including weekly school garden programing and restaurant gardens that connect chefs to schools.
organizationDescription: Sustainable Palos Verdes Schools (SPVS) dba Palos Verdes School Gardens (PVSG) is an environmental community based non-profit organization that works to enrich the health and education of K-12 students and their greater community by providing weekly garden based programming on school campuses within Los Angeles County and installing and maintaining edible restaurant gardens that function as a representation of edible education awareness outside of the school campuses and engaging the greater South Bay community by bringing school garden produce to local chefs. Palos Verdes School Gardens (PVSG) Outdoor Classroom program seeks to encourage students and teachers to consider the school garden as an extension of the traditional classroom rather than an extracurricular activity. The PVSG Outdoor Classroom is a living laboratory where lessons are tied to state curriculum standards, encourage inquiry-based learning, provide hands-on experiential learning opportunities and support next generation science standards. As part of their grade level experience each week, students have the opportunity to collaborate with their peers, write and draw what they experience in their garden journals, prepare and taste seasonal and local produce, plant and tend to their school garden beds and develop an understanding of what is needed to become environmental stewards of the future.

title: Foster Home Volunteer -- Help Us Save Cats and Kittens!
organization: Rock & Rescue - Stray No More Project
description:
Short and Long-Term Foster Volunteers Desperately Needed!

• Provide a Safe and Loving Environment: Create a nurturing, safe, and quiet home environment for cats in foster care, ensuring they feel secure and comfortable
• Basic Care: Feed, groom, and clean up after the foster cats, maintaining a regular feeding schedule and ensuring they have clean water and litter at all times
•
missionStatement: Stray No More's mission is to end cat and dog overpopulation and suffering. We are a passionate, volunteer-driven charity whose primary goal is to rescue, assess, vet, heal, spay/neuter, and eventually place homeless animals, first in our network of amazing fosters, and then ultimately in carefully matched, loving, forever homes. Sadly, while not every animal can find a loving forever home, we believe that no-kill is the only responsible approach to rescue, that Trap-Neuter-Return works and that above all: Animals are AWESOME!
organizationDescription: Stray No More is an all-volunteer-run animal rescue that is primarily foster-based. We rely entirely on volunteers to help manage the intake, care, transportation, and placement of the animals we save, as well as all social media, outreach, networking, foster coordination, and adoption management ... so we need all the help we can get.

title: Emerson Avenue Community Garden Community Volunteer Day
description: We hope you will share in the stewardship of the garden. Join us for Community Volunteer Days from 9 am-noon the first Saturdays of the monthWhy: Community gardens are a vital cog in the machinery of healthy, vibrant neighborhoods. They provide a tangible and hopeful sign of renewal and of the potential for growth given the right mix of intention, energy, and nurturing.Who: In 2011, a group of dedicated volunteers took a derelict piece of land in Westchester. The Emerson Avenue Community Garden began a labor of love that gradually transformed into a thriving, bountiful green space that brings a special sense of enjoyment to our entire…
missionStatement: The Emerson Avenue Community Garden is a group of enthusiastic volunteers dedicated to developing and maintaining one acre of a sustainable, organic food garden and green space for educational purposes and community enjoyment. The community garden resides in the friendly neighborhood of Westchester within the Orville Wright Middle School campus at the southwest corner of Emerson Avenue and 80th Place.
organizationDescription: Join us for Community Volunteer Days at the garden from 9am - noon the first Saturday of the month (unless it's a holiday). Help us maintain and beautify our garden. Activities include mulching, weeding, clearing pathways, organizing, watering + lots of other fun things!Everyone welcome! We love to host students earning community service hours. This is family-friendly event. Light refreshments provided. No skills are needed.Community gardens are a vital cog in the machinery of healthy, vibrant neighborhoods. They provide a tangible and hopeful sign of renewal, and the potential for growth given the right mix of intention, energy, and nurturing.We hope you will share in the stewardship of the garden.Details on our website: eacgc.org/calendar

title: Cat Adoption Team Volunteer Opportunity
description: The C.A.T. Program is led by our dedicated CAT volunteers at the PetSmart Tujunga location. This program is ideal for volunteers who are able to commit to weekly shifts, have reliable transportation to the store, able to speak confidently to prospective adopters and members of the public alike, work cooperatively with like-minded volunteers, and... must love cats!Within the program, volunteers are responsible for multiple daily shifts to perform husbandry and socialization duties, while even performing adoption counsels with prospective, inquiring adopters. Volunteers will engage with members of the public, educating them on the cat's background, history, needs, and any other relevant information to finalize a successful adoption placement.…
missionStatement: Compassion and care for all animals.
organizationDescription: The Pasadena Humane Society & SPCA is an independent, donor-supported, non-profit agency that provides animal care and services for homeless and owned animals in our community. PHS takes in nearly 12,000 animals each year from the cities of Altadena, Arcadia, Bradbury, Glendale, La Cañada Flintridge, La Crescenta-Montrose, Monrovia, Pasadena, San Marino, Sierra Madre and South Pasadena. With over 100 employees, we are dedicated to promoting humane treatment and compassionate care for all animals-domestic, exotic, wild or livestock.

title: Video Production Editor: Help solve the literacy crisis
description:
Have you ever wanted to do something AMAZING to change the world but didn't know where to start?


Here is an opportunity to join the American Youth Literacy Foundation, an all- volunteer 501 c 3 charitable non-profit organization, founded in 2008 and dedicated to providing a gateway to a future in which all children, in every classroom in America, learn how to read by the end of 3rd grade. Our mission is to save millions of children from a lifetime of illiteracy and bring about true education parity in just a few years’ time by deploying the FUNetix(r) 12 Hour Reading App(tm) nationwide.


With the FUNetix app, which is 100% free to download and use, any child can learn how to read in about 12 hours of total play time; and in…
missionStatement: The Vision of FUNetix is: UNIVERSAL LITERACY. The Mission of FUNetix is: Deliver a free smartphone app that will make that vision happen. Think of what it would mean if EVERY child could learn how to read from a smartphone in 12 hours! The mission of FUNetix is simple: get the app out! Get the FUNetix 12 hours Reading App out to America's children through smartphones, laptops, desktops, tablets, and classrooms. Get the app out through partnerships with publishing companies, schools, NGOs, parents, teachers, corporations and federal, state and local governments. Universal literacy is within reach because FUNetix is able to teach reading in a way that it has never been taught before, and with a speed that has never been conceived of before. FUNetix is here, and if your child is ready, we're ready. You can start learning how to read in 12 hours, today!
organizationDescription: FUNetix is a patented, science-based, and incredibly simplified way of teaching reading to children that's available to parents and children anywhere in the United States and anywhere in the world. The FUNetix 12 hours Reading App is available in the App Store, Google Play store and Amazon App store.

title: Volunteer on Tuesdays@10am: Mosaic Sun Community Art Project!
description:
Every Tuesday, volunteers join us at Big Sunday HQ to decorate mosaics in the shape of a sun. These beautiful works of art are then donated to schools, shelters, food banks - anywhere in need of a little more sunshine and warmth!


This wonderful project is the brainchild of our old friend Cathy Weiss and led by Cathy and our own Big Sunday staff.


You don’t need to be a brilliant artist to participate - just friendly and sincere. Just about everybody who’s worked on one tells us the mosaic suns are their favorite Big Sunday project!





The events take place at our Big Sunday headquarters on Tuesdays 10am-12pm.
missionStatement: Big Sunday connects people through helping. We offer an enormous variety of opportunities and projects that unite people to improve lives, build community, and give everyone a sense of belonging.
organizationDescription: We organize over 2000 ways for you to get involved every year - from working on service projects at our headquarters, to helping us collect materials for food, book, and school supply drives, to joining us for school beautification projects, and much more! Below, you will find a summary of each of our programs - whether you’re interested in volunteering, contributing money or items, or co-producing a service event with us - there is truly a place for everyone at Big Sunday!

title: Westwood Village Cooking Together: Hands-On, Kid- Friendly Cooking Classes
description:
Are you passionate about cooking and helping others? We’re seeking dedicated volunteers for our Cooking Together program, where you'll lead or assist in cooking classes that make a real difference.


In our classes, we focus on teaching practical skills to incorporate more vegetables into everyday meals, rather than just following recipes.


Here’s how you can get involved:

• Chef-Educator Volunteers: Lead engaging cooking classes, sharing your expertise and inspiring others.
• Assistant Volunteers: Support the chef, helping kids and families cook along and learn new skills…
missionStatement: Farm to Market, Market to Community. Farm Habit and Good Habits believe it takes a community to create a healthy lifestyle. We teach elementary students and their families about healthy eating and responsible farming practices, as well as running four Certified Farmers' Markets in Southern California. Farmer Mark's vision for his markets is to uphold the highest integrity, keep the best interest of the farmer and community in mind, educate consumers and actively promote the benefits of locally sourced produce. With this "Farmer First" philosophy, we strive to cultivate the best conditions for small farmers to sell the freshest and most nutritious produce direct to the community.
organizationDescription: Farm to Market, Market to Community Farm Habit and Good Habits believe it takes a community to create a healthy lifestyle. We teach elementary students and their families about healthy eating and responsible farming practices, as well as running six Certified Farmers Markets in Southern California. Farmer Mark's vision for his markets is to uphold the highest integrity, keep the best interest of the farmer and community in mind, educate consumers and actively promote the benefits of locally sourced produce. With this "Farmer First" philosophy, we strive to cultivate the best conditions for small farmers to sell the freshest and most nutritious produce direct to the community.

title: Los Robles Hospice | LA County
description:
Considered to be the model for quality, compassionate care for people facing a life-limiting illness or injury, hospice involves a team-oriented approach to skilled care, pain management, and emotional and spiritual support tailored to the patient and family. At the center of hospice is the belief that each of us has the right to die pain-free, with dignity, and on our own terms.


Our Hospice team is dedicated to improving the lives of those with late-stage illness, injury, or disease. We enable patients and families to live life on their terms with more knowledge of what to expect from their disease progression, greater confidence in living life fully in the comfort of their own homes, and the relief that comes from our expertise in pain and symptom management.
missionStatement: Los Robles Healthcare at Home has been dedicated to providing exceptional healthcare at home since 2000. We believe that everyone is entitled to the highest quality of personalized care and attention - whether you’re recovering from an illness or surgery or looking to live all the days of your life with the support of hospice care. Our belief in total care extends beyond our patients and families to include our healthcare partners, the members of our team, and the community we serve together. That’s why we take a team approach to meeting the physical, spiritual, emotional, and social needs of those under our care, and it’s why we are relentless in the pursuit of our shared vision to set the standard for healthcare in the home.
organizationDescription: After all, we understand that no patients are exactly alike - just like no two home health or hospice agencies are exactly the same either. This is at the heart of our commitment to listening to our patients, customizing our care plans to meet their needs, and empowering them to make informed decisions on their own terms ... and in the comfort of wherever they call home.

missionStatement: Building A Better Belize For The Next Generation. The People's Foundation is a non- profit organization that works with the country of Belize, where we are engaged in sourcing and allocation of medical equipment for the country. Our goals are to help provide a better medical care, in the country of Belize. It would be great to have the latest and more reliable medical items, however, not all the hospitals in Belize can afford the latest in medical technology, and this is where The People's Diabetes Foundation comes in. What seemed as out dated or obsolete medical equipment in our developed nation may prove to be of great use to the country of Belize.

title: Director of Donor Development
description:
Wells Bring Hope drills wells to bring safe water to rural villages in Niger and Mali, West Africa, among the poorest countries in the world. Our mission is to save lives with safe water. The burden of fetching water falls on women and girls, which means that girls can't go to school and women can't work to earn money for their families. All that changes when a well is drilled in a village. Your help is more than just a drop in the bucket, it transforms lives for generations to come.


Why not start the year off by giving of your time and energy? Few things have the potential for boosting your spirits more than giving back to others in need.


Currently, we are looking for someone to help design and implement a…
missionStatement: Our Mission: Saving lives with safe water.
organizationDescription: Wells Bring Hope is a non-profit committed to drilling wells to bring safe water to rural villages in Niger, West Africa. Niger is a place where contaminated water kills innocent victims, most often infants and young children.One out of seven children will die before the age of 540% have trachoma, which leads to blindness when untreated85% of women cannot read or write

title: Hospice Volunteer Mission Hills
description:
Turn your interests and hobbies into meaningful, fulfilling moments. Dedicate as little as 60 minutes of your time a week to patients who need your companionship. You decide how much time you are able to devote and we’ll match your interests and schedule.


Do you like to read? Are you in a book club? Then why not read to one of our patients! Play a musical instrument; why not play for one of our patients? No interests or hobbies? You can lend a hand in our office. Fill out the volunteer application to get started!


Hospice Volunteer Activities Anyone Can Do

• Companionship
• Supportive Listening and Conversation
• Applying Holistic Therapies Reading or Other Activities of Interest
• Support with Life Review (reminiscing, sharing stories, pictures, etc.)
• Assistance with Documenting One’s Life Story
• Support with Audio or Video Taping of Treasured Messages for One’s…
missionStatement: "Hands to Help, Hearts to Care"
organizationDescription: Assisted Hospice is always looking for committed and caring people to add to our team of volunteers. If you have an interest in patient care; if you have special talents you would like to share; or if you can lend a hand in an office setting, you should consider becoming a part of our volunteer team as an Assisted Angel.

title: School Beautification at Melvin Avenue Elementary
description:
Join us on Saturday, April 26, 2025.  The School Project will consist of painting, helping with murals, helping with gardening, moving materials, having a great time, and building community.  IMPACTThe scope of impact is profound. We are pouring love creativity, inspiration, and hope into this elementary school by giving it's Staff Room a make-over, by painting inspirational murals around the campus, by painting positive affirmations around the campus, by adding to the landscape, by encouraging the Staff and Students and so much more.


VOLUNTEER ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

• painting…
missionStatement: Devoted, compassionate, and committed to the betterment of humanity, the team at Operation Project HOPE represents a new model of collaboration with the academic community to make a difference in the lives of students by creating exceptional and supportive environments.
organizationDescription: Founded in 2010 on the belief that a small group of thoughtful and committed people can make a difference in the world, Operation Project HOPE (OPH) was formed to enhance the learning experience of children through school beautification. Positive affirmations in the hallways of education and on the playgrounds provide reinforcement to children that they can achieve and that they make a difference. OPH was founded to support children and to see them thrive in their learning environment.Safety & SupportTo provide a safe and supportive learning environment for all children regardless of race, ability, income or any other social identifier.Human NecessitiesTo support the learning environment by ensuring that children and their families have access to non-perishable foods, clothing, and health screenings.Learning EnviormentsTo prioritize beautification projects where budget cuts have affected the schools.

title: Volunteer with Team Rubicon
description: We are actively working with local emergency managers and community leaders to determinehow best to align our capabilities with the increasing need in CA. Ready to step into arena? Join us as a volunteer.
missionStatement: Team Rubicon is a veteran-led humanitarian organization that serves global communities before, during, and after disasters and crises.
organizationDescription: Team Rubicon is a 501(c)3 nonprofit that utilizes the skills and experiences of military veterans with first responders to rapidly deploy emergency response teams. Founded in 2010, Team Rubicon has deployed across the United States and around the world to provide immediate relief to those impacted by disasters and humanitarian crises. Directly impact our mission as a Greyshirt volunteer, where you and your diverse, badass, service-fueled teammates will lift people and communities up when facing disasters.

title: Donation Pick-Up and Drop-Off Volunteer Needed!
description:
Are you ready to make a difference? Join Composed Giving as a Donation Pick-Up and Drop-Off Volunteer! In this role, you’ll be vital to our mission of delivering essential items to partner organizations and recycling materials sustainably. Volunteers will pick up donations from our store in Woodland Hills and deliver them to local nonprofits and designated recycling centers. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys being on the go, is reliable, and has a passion for community support and environmental impact.


Responsibilities:

• Pick up donation items from our store in Woodland Hills.
• Deliver donations to our partner organizations across the area…
missionStatement: The mission of Composed Giving is to alleviate the burdens of individuals and families experiencing hardship by providing free personal and household items.
organizationDescription: We are committed to helping others through compassionate outreach and community partnerships and we work to serve any individual - regardless of background - by providing essential personal and household items free of charge while fostering unity within our community.

title: Fresh Produce Distribution Center at NHMC
description: First of all, the Wellness and Activities Committee at NHMC would like to thank you for your interest in volunteering at our Produce Distribution. The 4th Thursday of every month NHMC conducts a free produce distribution for our San Fernando Valley Community. This volunteer opportunity consist of sorting, cleaning, bagging and distributing produce to our community members.
missionStatement: As CommonSpirit Health, we make the healing presence of God known in our world by improving the health of the people we serve, especially those who are vulnerable, while we advance social justice for all.
organizationDescription: Northridge Hospital in partnership with the American Heart Association (AHA) became the first fresh produce distribution center in the San Fernando Valley. Our goal is to bring fresh, healthy and nutritious options to our community members table. Since 2021, we have been distributing an average of 10k pounds of fresh produce monthly feeding an average of 350 families. We are very glad to provide such a great service to our community, where there are no questions asked, all you need to do is drive-thru to obtain two bags of fresh produce. Come and join us.

title: Play Lacrosse & Mentor Youth in Chicago's West Side - Austin Neighborhood!
description:
The True Foundation is seeking volunteers to support our after-school programming in the Austin community on Chicago’s West Side. As a volunteer, you’ll work alongside True Foundation staff to guide students through a 60-minute tutoring session, followed by a 70-minute introductory lacrosse session that emphasizes camaraderie, mentorship, and a love for the game.


You can choose the days, age groups, and programming areas that best match your expertise-tutoring, coaching, or both-as well as the frequency of your involvement.


Volunteering is one of the most impactful ways to support these students-creating opportunities, building relationships, and inspiring young minds, all while making a lasting difference. Together, we can introduce lacrosse to this community for the first time and help shape its future.
missionStatement: The True Lacrosse Foundation provides first-time access to the sport of lacrosse along with academic and holistic support for the students we serve.
organizationDescription: The True Lacrosse Foundation is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profit organization deeply committed to breaking down the socio-economic barriers that limit access and entry to the game of lacrosse. We strive to fulfill our mission by reimagining the future of lacrosse through free year-round after-school programming and holistic support for youth from diverse socio-economic backgrounds. Partnering with Title I schools, community centers, and park districts, introducing instructional programming where lacrosse is traditionally not found, focused on foundational skills, mentorship, pride, and purpose.

title: Volunteer to tutor and mentor 1:1 with a student in Chicago (In person and remote options available)
description:
Become a tutor, mentor and role model.Tutoring Chicago is a free one-to-one tutoring program for students in grades 1-12.


During the 2024-2025 school year, Tutoring Chicago will offer both in-person and digital tutoring options to our tutors/students from late September to late May.No special skills, no experience or background in education is necessary. Above all the willingness to be there and the desire to impact, inspire and empower a student. Being present is all it takes. One and a half hours per week is enough to change a kid's life.
missionStatement: Delivering the power of education through one-to-one tutoring
organizationDescription: For nearly 60 years Tutoring Chicago has dedicated its mission to delivering the power of education to children facing economic barriers through one-to-one tutoring and high-quality programming that is not only academic, but developmental and reflective. Our vision is a brighter future for all of Chicago’s children.

title: Join our Event Planning Committee for the 2025 Walk to End Alzheimer's - Chicago
description:
The Walk to End Alzheimer’s is the world’s largest fundraiser for Alzheimer’s care, support, and research, with events held annually in more than 600 communities nationwide. Chicago is home to one of the largest Walks in the country annually raising over $1.2 million, and we need passionate volunteers like you to make it a success!


When you volunteer with the Walk to End Alzheimer’s, you’re directly contributing to advancing research, supporting families, and raising awareness for millions affected by this disease. Join a dedicated group of like-minded individuals passionate about making a difference here in Chicago!
missionStatement: The Alzheimer's Association leads the way to end Alzheimer's and all other dementia -- by accelerating global research, driving risk reduction and early detection, and maximizing quality care and support.
organizationDescription: The Alzheimer's Association is the leading voluntary health organization in Alzheimer's care, support, and research. The Illinois Chapter serves 87 counties, with offices in Bloomington, Marion, Chicago, Joliet, Peoria, Quincy, Rockford, and Springfield. Since 1980, the Association has provided reliable information and care consultation; created supportive services for families; increased funding for dementia research; and influenced public policy changes across the state.

title: Help a Neighbor in the Chicago, IL area with a Homemade Meal
description: Lasagna Love is a global movement, with thousands of people all cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during a time full of uncertainty and stress. Lasagna Love matches neighbors who can provide a meal with a neighbor who needs a little help. You can decide how often you participate- once a month, multiple lasagnas a week, or somewhere in between. You decide how far you can drive to deliver a meal, and if you can accommodate special diets like vegetarian or gluten free. The Lasagna Love Team does the rest to match you with a neighbor in need…
missionStatement: Lasagna Love was started at the beginning of the pandemic, when the founder of Good to Mama was looking for a way to help moms in her community. She and her toddler started making and delivering meals to families in the neighborhood who were struggling, whether that struggle was financial, emotional, or simply a feeling of overwhelm. Lasagna Love has since grown into a global grassroots movement, with thousands of people all cooking and delivering meals to families in their communities. What we do is simple: feed families, spread kindness, and strengthen communities. Our mission is not only to help address the incredible rise in food insecurity among families, but also to provide a simple act of love and kindness during a time full of uncertainty and stress.
organizationDescription: Thousands of volunteers in all 50 states, Canada and Australia delivering home-cooked meals to spread love and kindness.

title: ShowerUp Chicago
description:
We would love to have you join us for a ShowerUp serving event! No experience is necessary and no special training needed. Most of our volunteer opportunities are 3 hours long and are hands-on serving our guests. There are several different ways to be involved including: Shower Prep Crew (cleaning and preparing the shower for the next person), Table (hand our guests shower kits, towels, socks, underwear, etc.), Shower List (manage the sign up list for our guests and let them know when it’s their turn), and Treat Team (bring drinks, treats, snacks, etc. to pass out to our guests.)





If you would like to volunteer as in individual, check out our volunteer portal to sign up directly for the day and task of your choosing…
missionStatement: ShowerUp serves those experiencing homelessness by providing showers, hygiene resources and personal care with our mobile shower units. We hope to share love, build relationships, and restore hope. ​
organizationDescription: ShowerUp serves those experiencing homelessness by providing showers, hygiene resources and personal care with our mobile shower units. We hope to share love, build relationships, and restore hope. ​We are currently in Nashville, Huntsville, Wichita, Chicago, Chattanooga, Tampa Bay and soon Memphis.

title: Visionaries of the Year Grand Finale Volunteer - 2025
organization: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society -  Illinois Region
description:
We are currently looking for volunteers for our Visionaries of the Year Grand Finale, a huge event that celebrates philanthropic individuals throughout our communities. These candidates put together teams, reach out to corporations and businesses, and tap into their networks to raise as much money as possible for a specific LLS mission pillar: Research, Advocacy, or Patient Support & Education.


Example of the event: https://youtu.be/qXeCyjNEa3o?feature=shared


Position Tasks


Set-Up Shift Volunteers- June 5th (11-3 PM) - Location TBD ~ we will meet at a location near Rockwell on the River:

• Help assist with the assembly of candidate paddle fans and program book frames. Other set up tasks may be included (3-4 volunteers needed)…
missionStatement: The mission of The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) is: Cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families. We work tirelessly to find cures and ensure patients can access the lifesaving treatments they need. When someone experiences the fear and uncertainty of a blood cancer diagnosis, we provide hope, compassion, education and support. Our impact is felt beyond blood cancer. The breakthrough treatments we helped advance for blood cancers are now improving the lives of people affected by many types of cancer.
organizationDescription: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Illinois Region serves Illinois residents who have been touched by blood cancers: leukemia, lymphoma and myeloma. Volunteers are our partners in this crusade to end cancer. Sign up to day to help us help people with blood cancer and their families, and become a part of the dedicated community at the heart of LLS.

title: Become a Mentor with LINK Unlimited Scholars!
description:
We connect Black students with resources and opportunities that strengthen the necessary skills to succeed as they advance to, through, and beyond college.


Overview:


LINK Mentors commit to supporting our Scholars to, through, and beyond college by becoming an integral part of their LINK fellowship. Our Mentors participate in LINK-organized trainings and events. They introduce their Scholar to their networks and regularly communicate and meet up with their them throughout the calendar year.

Benefits of Mentoring with LINK
missionStatement: The mission of LINK Unlimited Scholars is to connect high potential Black high school students with mentors, resources and foundational skills required for success as they advance into, through and beyond college. Since 1966, we have successfully supported over 2,500 low- to moderate-income students. LINK Scholars are actively equipped with the knowledge, skills, resources and social equity that furthers college completion and career placement in order to increase the economic mobility and stability of Black students in Chicago and create a diverse leadership pipeline for our city.
organizationDescription: Our Scholars complete a four-year fellowship that includes academic enrichment, leadership development, career exposure, and college access to move them to, through, and beyond college. LINK offers the necessary backing to help close the opportunity gap and further ensure economic stability for our Scholars. In addition to the four programmatic elements, our Scholars’ growth and future success is supported by the unique relationship between LINK Mentors and Scholars. We match civic-minded professionals across a wide range of industries-from education and business to finance and medicine-who all share one goal: to transform the lives of high-potential Black students in Chicago. Our Mentors commit to guiding a Scholar for his or her entire fellowship. We provide training and resources to equip and support our Mentors in this vital piece of our four-year high school fellowship model. We are committed to the growth and development of our Mentors as they support our Scholars, and have ongoing workshops and networking opportunities designed to build their confidence and enhance their cultural competence. Our goals are that mentors are empowered to become advocates, allies and disruptors as they engage in this work, and are able to influence their wider ecosystem as we build a more equitable society.

title: Volunteers Needed to Rescue Food & Fight Hunger In Chicago!
description: Who We AreRescuing Leftover Cuisine is a 501(c)3 non-profit that redistributes excess food to people experiencing food insecurity.What We DoWe partner with licensed food vendors (restaurants, bakeries, etc) and businesses who order catering (offices, production companies, etc) who know they will have excess, wholesome cuisine and link their food donations to a nonprofit recipient within their local community. Our dedicated team of Lead Rescuers collect that excess food on a set schedule (pickups can be once a week, daily, or anywhere in between) and deliver it to one of RLC's nonprofit partners to help feed our neighbors who can benefit from a good meal!…
missionStatement: The mission of RLC is to redistribute excess food to feed people experiencing food insecurity.
organizationDescription: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine (RLC) is a nonprofit organization committed to fighting food insecurity and preventing wasted food. We have cultivated a network of dedicated food rescuers who bring food directly from our food donors to nonprofit recipients, letting neighbors help neighbors while reaping the environmental and economic benefits of reducing wasted food. Founded in 2013, our simple, but elegant model has saved over 8 million pounds of food since our inception.

title: French Translators Needed!
description: Nuestros Pequeños Hermanos (NPH) means "Our Little Brothers and Sisters" in Spanish. NPH USA transforms the lives of vulnerable children in Bolivia, the Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, and Peru. Together, we help children overcome poverty and become productive, caring leaders in their own communities. Founded in 1954 by Father William Wasson, NPH is supporting nearly 8,000 children, both inside and outside our homes, ensuring they have a safe and nurturing place to live, an education, clothing, healthcare, and a strong family support system. In addition, NPH’s St. Damien Pediatric Hospital employs more than 500 Haitians and is the only hospital wholly dedicated to pediatric and prenatal care in Haiti, a country of 11.5 million people…
missionStatement: NPH USA is dedicated to improving the lives of orphaned, abandoned and disadvantaged children through the support of the Nuestros Pequeños Hermanos (NPH, Spanish for "Our Little Brothers and Sisters") network of orphanages in Latin America and the Caribbean.
organizationDescription: Through volunteer and fundraising efforts, NPH USA supports the NPH homes. NPH was founded by Fr. William Wasson in the 1950's in Cuernavaca, Mexico.

title: Join the America Needs You - Chicago Associate Board!
description:
America Needs You fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first-generation college students. We do this by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. We are looking for volunteers to join our Illinois Associate Board. America Needs You - Associate Board Roles and Responsibilities


The America Needs You (ANY) Associate Board (AB) is the local market's volunteer board aimed at recruiting Mentor Coaches/other volunteers and raising funds for ANY. As ambassadors for ANY, AB members enthusiastically support our mission and work. Nationally, ABs bring in over $250,000 annually to support ANY’s mission and recruit 500+ of Mentor Coaches to ensure a strong program. For those interested in future nonprofit board leadership, the AB is a great place to learn…
missionStatement: America Needs You fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first-generation college students. We do this by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Our Fellows Program operates in New York, New Jersey, and Illinois (Chicago). Visit www.americaneedsyou.org to learn more information.
organizationDescription: America Needs You aims to build a movement of like-minded individuals who believe that one day there will be no barriers to economic mobility for students with ambition and ability. By mobilizing volunteers we will ensure that low-income and first-generation college students have the support, information and access necessary to realize their career aspirations.

title: ABTA Breakthrough for Brain Tumors 5K Run and Walk: Chicago 2025
description:
We're looking for enthusiastic, driven individuals aged 16 and older to help make our BT5K Breakthrough for Brain Tumors event a huge success. Lend a hand out on the course, at the event site, with pre- or post-event activities, as part of the planning committee, or in one of many other ways.


And don't worry... ABTA staff will be with you all the way through training and event day guidance.For more information on the volunteer roles needed and how to register go to https://abta.volunteerhub.com/vv2/
missionStatement: The mission of the American Brain Tumor Association is to advance the understanding and treatment of brain tumors with the goals of improving, extending and, ultimately, saving the lives of those impacted by a brain tumor diagnosis.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1973, the American Brain Tumor Association (ABTA) was the first national nonprofit organization dedicated solely to brain tumors. For over 40 years, the ABTA has been providing critical funding to researchers working toward breakthroughs in brain tumor diagnosis, treatment and care. We remain the only national organization providing comprehensive resources and serving the complex supportive care needs of brain tumor patients and their caregivers - from diagnosis through treatment and beyond.

title: Looking for help at Chicago Bears/Fire games
description:
Hello!


We are in need of volunteers to manage our concessions stand at Soldier Field
missionStatement: At Alenza Wellness Community Outreach, our mission is to improve our community by implementing physical and emotional betterment by practicing healthy habits one day at a time.
organizationDescription: This was developed due to my mom passing 8 years ago from a massive heart attack and sister passing prior to that with breast cancer. I realize that i need to get up and get moving and impact and influence our community with betterment by practicing heathy habits through exercising and being active.I am assisting title one school in Clayton County that is active with dance, football and etc.

title: MBIC Volunteer Opportunities for OT's and PT's
description:
MBIC Clubhouse is seeking Occupational Therapists (OTs) and Physical Therapists (PTs) to volunteer their time and expertise to support our community. Our members, ranging from young adults to seniors, experience various physical and cognitive challenges, and benefit greatly from the insights and support provided by trained professionals. Whether you're a licensed therapist or a student in these fields, your knowledge and skills are invaluable in enhancing our members' daily experiences.


About MBIC Clubhouse


MBIC provides a supportive environment where members with disabilities and cognitive challenges can engage in daily tasks and group activities. The clubhouse is a dynamic setting where every day offers a…
missionStatement: MBIC is a hub of empowerment and holistic care, dedicated to fostering independence, inclusion, and equity for individuals and communities. Through our comprehensive programs--including health services, education, vocational training, mental health support, social integration, case management, food security, advocacy, and crisis intervention--we address critical needs, bridge systemic gaps, and reduce disparities. Our work enhances quality of life, provides tools for sustainable growth, and creates pathways to brighter, more equitable futures. MBIC is committed to building a stronger, more inclusive society where every individual, regardless of circumstance, has access to the resources, opportunities, and support they need to thrive.
organizationDescription: MBIC is a cornerstone in the Chicagoland area, dedicated to empowering individuals facing disabilities and life challenges. Our mission focuses on fostering independence, inclusion, and equity through comprehensive programs such as health services, vocational training, mental health support, social integration, and crisis intervention. We strive to bridge systemic gaps and reduce disparities, ensuring that everyone, regardless of their circumstances, has access to the resources and opportunities needed to thrive. Join us in building a more inclusive society.

title: Moments Hospice Pet Therapy Volunteer - Chicago, IL
description:
Moments Hospice is a Medicare Certified Hospice Agency serving the Chicago area. We are focused on creating individual plans of care, because every patient and family is unique. Moments Hospice is committed to honoring patient’s and family’s wishes during the end of life process. We take great pride in creating long lasting partnerships with our Hospitals, Facilities and Community Partners by recognizing that we are guests in their facilities and that collaborating on a joint plan of care always results in the best outcome for the patient. It is our mission to help increase the communities awareness of the Hospice Benefit as we believe that everyone deserves to be comfortable with an optimal quality of life during the end of life process.


Moments Hospice is looking for compassionate volunteers and their…
missionStatement: We aim to add value to patients and their families at the end-of-life, and assist them to create moments to remember.
organizationDescription: Hospice is about living, about giving people access to what they need so they will have the best quality of life during a difficult time. Patients who choose hospice have made the decision, along with their families and doctors, to change cure goals for comfort goals. Hospice believes that through personalized services and a caring community, patients and their loved ones can obtain the necessary preparation for death so that it can be not merely a period of sorrow, but one which gives them deeper understanding of life.

title: IL Chicago Court Ordered Community Service ANYDAY. Nobel & Prize Winners Library
description:
Our letters have been swiftly accepted by courts in the US. Work will be based on YOUR background, interests and hobbies.


Accepting applicants nationwide. Pursue your passions. Many service options. Easy onboarding. Enjoy flexible hours. Get inspired and gain valuable experience volunteering for our virtual library.


Work X hours as ordered by court or diversion program or advised by attorney or probation officer. Work is Documentable, Ongoing, Engaging and Exciting! Work always available.


Nonprofit 501(c)3 organization.


Why choose Ganga Library…
missionStatement: Ganga Library's mission is to globally meet the needs of people for obtaining ideas to solve scientific, social and planetary problems. The library will make every effort to procure or to create for its patrons, media pertaining to Alfred Nobel and Laureates and which they need for their education, teaching, research, social or visionary entrepreneurship, reading pleasure or to just satisfy their curiosity.
organizationDescription: Exciting work. Virtual or Local. Multiple opportunities‎. Ongoing. Nobel and Laureates Library. Please email your resume including all your hobbies and interests as a simple Microsoft Word doc to info@gangalib.org We shall see as to which aspect of the work would be most useful and interesting to you. Nonprofit 501(c)3 org. Ganga Library kindles a fire in you, revealing to you your hidden aspirations, abilities and skills.

title: Make Your Life Magical: Bring laughter and joy to sick kids at Lurie Children's
description: Here it is ... the opportunity you’ve been looking for. Volunteer with Open Heart Magic to experience the best, most rewarding way to help a child in the hospital and provide memories that will last a lifetime. Through fun, personal magic shows you will engage and empower young patients facing critical medical situations to help them laugh again.But don’t worry, no magic experience is required.Open Heart Magic is - quite possibly - the best place to volunteer.Why’s that? Because Open Heart Magic (OHM) volunteers create remarkable transformations in a matter of minutes; they witness first-hand the incredible impact magic has on a vulnerable child; and they bring joy and hope to where it’s needed most. Volunteer and you will…
missionStatement: Open Heart Magic inspires anxious kids dealing with difficult illness, unexpected hospital stays, and frightening medical situations, to sit up, laugh, and face their situation with courage through a personal bedside magic show.
organizationDescription: As a Chicago-based 501(c)(3) children’s charity, Open Heart Magic (OHM) focuses on improving the medical experience for sick kids in hospitals through joy, laughter, and hope.
