title: Drive cancer patients to treatment -  Chicago, Illinois
description:
Help cancer patients in your community get to life-saving medical appointments.


Road To Recovery drivers donate their time and vehicle to help cancer patients with limited or no transportation get to treatments.


You choose the rides that work with your schedule. Rides are weekdays. We hope drivers provide 2 rides per month minimum; some help weekly if available.

• a safe driving record,
• a current license, reliable vehicle, and insurance,
• and comfortable using technology.

We would love your help…
missionStatement: At the American Cancer Society our mission is to improve the lives of people with cancer and their families through advocacy, research, and patient support, to ensure that everyone has an opportunity to prevent, detect, treat, and survive cancer.
organizationDescription: While most people know us for our research, we do so much more. We promote healthy lifestyles to help you prevent cancer. We research cancer and its causes to find more answers and better treatments. We fight for lifesaving policy changes. We provide everything from emotional support to the latest cancer information for those who have been touched by cancer.

title: Illinois Host Families for Amazing Exchange Students (Chicago Metro)
description:
Opportunity for families & individuals in Chicago and surrounding area ! Ready to have a fun experience? Ready to enjoy some cultural diversity? Ready to get inspired?


Invite an international high school student to your home for a few weeks, a semester or even a full school year! Hosting is an amazing experience that will enrich, not only yourself and your family, but also schools and the entire community. Host families come in all shapes and sizes. You may be a single parent, an empty-nester, a couple with or without children - All family dynamics are welcome!


Our students are 15-18 years old and they come from Europe, Asia, Oceania and Latin America. They are carefully selected and come with…
missionStatement: ICES is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting a peaceful world by increasing international awareness and understanding through cultural sharing experiences. As the global community we live in becomes increasingly interdependent and subject to change, today's young people will face numerous challenges on the journey to becoming tomorrow's leaders. We believe the foreign student exchange experience helps young people of all nationalities embrace those challenges and discover new opportunities that will help them dream and achieve more than they ever thought possible.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1991, ICES is a nonprofit organization dedicated to increasing awareness and understanding among the peoples of the world. ICES has accomplished this goal for many thousands of exchange student through its dedicated volunteers and international partners.

title: Are you seeking connection? Feeling lonely? Join us to build friendship!
organization: Little Brothers - Friends of the Elderly Chicago Chapter
description:
Little Brothers - Friends of the Elderly's (LBFE) philosophy, programs and activities are focused on relieving loneliness and isolation among older adults throughout Chicago. Our community of older adults, volunteers, staff, and supporters fosters friendship and social connection throughout the year. The need for social interaction is critical to the human spirit - we believe that nurturing the soul is as important as feeding the body.


If you are seeking to make new friends, be part of an in-person social group, or are yourself experiencing isolation, consider volunteering with LBFE. Our volunteers engage older persons through in-person visiting and events, celebrating birthdays and holidays, and delivering meals or groceries. Volunteers also engage with other volunteers and help form…
missionStatement: Little Brothers - Friends of the Elderly is a national network of non-profit volunteer-based organizations committed to relieving isolation and loneliness among the elderly. We offer to people of goodwill the opportunity to join the elderly in friendship and celebration of life.
organizationDescription: Little Brothers - Friends of the Elderly (LBFE) is committed to meeting the needs of elders who are isolated and alone. Our motto, flowers before bread, expresses the belief that love, dignity and beauty in life are as important as basic physical needs. This philosophy is reflected in all of our activities, which include one-on-one visits, holiday parties, vacations in the country and individual birthdays celebrated by the delivery of a cake and a gift. The quality of our services is just as important as the services themselves.The elders served by LBFE have little or no contact with family and friends, few financial resources and many reside in dangerous and deteriorating neighborhoods. When we enter their lives we provide them with companionship, which is something that many of them have not had in years.

title: Create and Lead Cultural and Historical Pub Tours for Travelers
description:
ABOUT THE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITY


The HI USA PUB TOUR allows our travelers to engage in a common social activity that allows an opportunity for them to learn more about the community and each other. The primary purpose of a PUB TOUR is to expose guests to new locations within our community and have conversations with other guests.


As the PUB TOUR volunteer, we ask that you ensure your program provides opportunities for guests to learn and share history, culture, and perspectives. When leading the PUB TOUR, we require the following:

• Each establishment you visit must have: A unique history/story that gives insight to the local culture, and/or inclusion of historically underrepresented / diverse perspectives of the city - this could be represented by…
missionStatement: To help all, especially the young, gain a greater understanding of the world and its people through hostelling.
organizationDescription: Who We Are

title: Big Shoulders Fund Next Generation Boards
description:
In 2007, Big Shoulders Fund formed our next generation boards, Teen Board, Auxiliary Board and Chairmen's Advisory Council, to engage active and altruistic young professionals in our work. These boards are the pipeline to our future and support the mission of the Big Shoulders Fund through volunteering in the schools, outreach, and fundraising. Plus, it is a fun way to professional and personally network!


The next generation boards have helped us innovate the ways our supporters engage with our students by growing our volunteer opportunities with service days, weekend test prep, Law Program, Stock Market Program, aftercare help, and more! They help build partnerships with companies, alumni groups and other organizations. The boards have created new innovative activities and support for our work, like…
missionStatement: Big Shoulders Fund is an independent charitable organization that serves inner-city Catholic schools which provide a quality, values-based education for Chicago’s children, thereby contributing to stronger communities.
organizationDescription: Big Shoulders Fund was founded in 1986 as an organization to help support Chicago’s inner-city Catholic schools. Many of our students face disruptive family situations, gangs, crime, drugs, poverty, and racism. Of the nearly 20,000 children enrolled in the 75 schools - 61 elementary and 14 high schools - Big Shoulders support, 80% are minorities, and 66% are living at or below the poverty level and 32% are not Catholic. Today, Big Shoulders has expanded upon that initial strategic vision by taking a proactive rather than supporting role in four major areas - scholarships and enrichment, operational improvements, academic programs, and leadership development - with the goal of not just strengthening schools, but whole communities, and preparing students for life-long success.

title: Help Save Lives - Blood Drive Volunteer - Jefferson Park Area
description:
Help us brighten lives for area patients by providing a positive, rewarding experience for donors at Vitalant’s one-day Mobile Blood Drives.


Responsibilities may include:

• Welcome and check-in donors
• Explain the donation process and answer any non-medical/eligibility questions
• Manage donor flow when needed
• Provide courteous communication and assistance to donors and staff
• Assist with set up and help maintain cleanliness in Reception and Refreshment areas
• Report any possible adverse…
missionStatement: Vitalant exists to help people realize their life-transforming potential by offering convenient blood donation opportunities and sharing our expertise in transfusion medicine.
organizationDescription: Volunteering to donate blood at Vitalant is one important way to join our lifesaving team, but we also offer other volunteer opportunities that make a difference in your community. Volunteer opportunities at Vitalant vary, but the impact is the same - your actions save lives by helping patients get the blood they need.Volunteer opportunities include:Canteen/refreshment area: Vitalant's donation centers and blood drives have a refreshment area, also called a canteen. Volunteers manage the area, monitoring donor safety by making sure each donor stays for 15 minutes and enjoys a snack and drink to help replace lost fluids. Most importantly, volunteers make our donors feel appreciated by thanking them for transforming patients' lives.Administrative/clerical: Volunteers assist with tasks such as data entry, answering phones, mailings, and sorting and filing.Drivers/couriers: Some of our locations use volunteer drivers to pick up and deliver blood products.Blood drive support: Volunteers at community blood drives may work in the refreshment area, check donors in at the door, help with donor flow, hand out thank-you gifts and other duties as needed.

title: Volunteer with Students and Adults with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities!
description:
Volunteering for Esperanza is essential for fostering connection to the greater community for our clients. Your time and skills contribute to creating a more accessible environment, breaking down barriers, and enhancing the quality of life for individuals with disabilities.


Esperanza offers Individual, Group, and long-term volunteering options.


Individual Volunteering:Individual volunteering at Esperanza involves offering time and support to enhance the lives of our people through activities like educational programs and recreational activities. This promotes inclusion and personal growth for those served. Such efforts help build a compassionate, inclusive community.


Group Volunteering:Group volunteering for our people involves…
missionStatement: At Esperanza Community Services, our mission is to empower people with developmental disabilities to reach their full potential and lead fulfilling, independent lives. We strive to achieve this through innovative education, effective advocacy, and compassionate support while fostering a supportive community where everyone can thrive.
organizationDescription: For over 50 years, Esperanza Community Services has been providing life-changing support to hundreds of children and adults with Autism and other disabilities in the West Town neighborhood of Chicago, along with their families. Our mission is to help individuals achieve their fullest potential and become as independent as possible through a range of services, including adult residential, adult day training, home-based support, art exploration, Esperanza Therapeutic Day School, and Esperanza Learning Center.

title: Spanish Speaking Youth Program Volunteer
organization: The Salvation Army North and Central Illinois Division
description:
We at the Chicago Temple Corps are looking for a bilingual volunteer to assist with our youth programming on Thursday nights from 5:30-7:30! The youth age group spans from Kindergarten to 8th grade and is usually made up of 10-15 children. We are looking for translation assistance during our music lesson and bible class.





If you are over 18, bilingual in Spanish and English and interested in serving with our youth, please reach out!
missionStatement: The mission of The Salvation Army is to meet human needs wherever they may be, without discrimination.
organizationDescription: The Salvation Army is serving more people in need and delivering the broadest array of services than any other not-for-profit organization in Chicagoland. The Salvation Army is making an impact every day in three key areas of critical importance and concern to people across Chicagoland -- Homelessness, Violence and Education. And, The Salvation Army is delivering the most critical services -- food, shelter, emergency assistance and disaster relief.

title: Back to School Drive Volunteer
description:
NAAAP-Chicago is seeking volunteers to serve on our Back to School Drive Committee, a signature event that is part of our Community Service Program. This is an excellent opportunity to gain valuable work experience for a career in Program Management by accomplishing independent tasks.


Our Back to School Drive & Packing Party unites individuals and organizations to collect and assemble donated backpacks and school supplies for students, creating a meaningful impact on our Chicago Asian & Pacific Islander community. This initiative not only supports education but also strengthens connections and fosters goodwill among residents.


We are in search of individuals who embodies both organization and motivation, a go-getter who thrives on completing tasks with minimal…
missionStatement: NAAAP's Mission is to: Cultivate and empower leaders for professional excellence Connect accomplished professionals for mutual success Engage and participate with the community-at-large Inspire leaders to make a meaningful difference in government, education, business and society
organizationDescription: The Chicago chapter of the National Association of Asian American Professionals is a not-for-profit, 501(c)(3), Pan-Asian American professional organization that promotes the career advancement and leadership development of Asian American professionals in all fields through networking, respecting Asian multi-culturalism, and supporting diversity and community service.

title: Volunteer Digital Retouch Artist
organization: Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep
description: A Digital Retouch Artist at Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep plays a crucial role in our mission of providing compassionate support to families experiencing the loss of a baby. As a Digital Retouch Artist, you will utilize your creative and technical skills to enhance and refine photographs to gift families with the healing images we provide. These photographs serve as precious memories for grieving families, and your meticulous retouching work helps create images that are both sensitive and respectful.Digital Retouch Artists must be proficient in Photoshop and utilize Photoshop software. Other editing programs are not accepted at this time. …
missionStatement: To introduce remembrance photography to parents experiencing the loss of a baby with a free gift of professional portraiture.
organizationDescription: 'Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep' (NILMDTS) is a nonprofit 501(c) (3) organization. All proceeds go directly into the operation of this organization to help parents who are experiencing an early infant loss.

title: Are you a LEADER? HELP Veterans and Military Non-Profit Org-become VA DEPUTY REPRSENTATIVE VOLUNTEER
description:
VA Deputy Representative


Leaders needed! Put your people skills to use helping veterans through Soldiers’ Angels!
missionStatement: The mission of Soldiers’ Angels is to provide aid, comfort, and resources to the military, veterans, and their families.
organizationDescription: This site provides support to the Chicago metro area and the Chicago VA and the Jesse Brown VA Medical Center.

title: Chicago Social Justice News Editor with LoveJustice - Remote
description:
www.lovejustice.com  is looking for Volunteer Editors who will dedicate one to three hours a week for at least two months. The role is to locate the most impactful social justice news and events from credible sources on the web.


A Volunteer Editor will focus on either a specific cause or a metro area. LoveJustice does not create its own content, its Volunteer Editors identify vital information weekly and provide the content to a senior editor at LoveJustice.com for reposting. Volunteer Editor content gathering is crucial in advancing the LoveJustice mission and social justice awareness.


Potential volunteer editors will provide basic personal information, preference for their cause or metro area, and informal references…
missionStatement: Via its website, social media presence and newsletter distribution, LoveJustice is designed to provide current updates on a wide range of social justice areas - with vital details, relevant news and quick summaries of challenges ahead. Whether working to make our world more just for all or focusing on helping those who suffer from injustice, the effort can be daunting, exhausting and sometimes heartbreaking. LoveJustice is geared to provide peer recognition and the resources for renewal essential to ongoing success in the work to counter the terrible human cost of injustice and deal with its root causes. The organization is neutral regarding religious affiliation, political party or philosophical persuasion - it honors and encourages all who advance the cause of social justice. LoveJustice is an entirely volunteer organization, providing no compensation to any affiliated person beyond reimbursement for direct expenses for normal business operation.
organizationDescription: LoveJustice is a new 503(c)3 non-profit organization established 9/14/2020 in the state of Texas. LoveJustice is currently building its website at www.lovejustice.com to provide information, resources and encouragement for all who are engaged in the advancement of social justice.Site main page will be a member portal - joining is free but members must agree with the mission statement. The main page will have 20 linked pages providing overviews, current news and action items for the following social justice areas: Environment Prison Reform Police Reform Living Wage Housing/Homelessness Immigration Voting Rights Religious Liberty Separation of Church & State War/Global Conflict Hunger Poverty Education Reproductive Rights Women’s Issues/Rights Minority Issues/Rights Health & Wellness LGBT Issues/Rights Cults & Conspiracy Theories Human Dignity & Decency

title: Ceramic artist with a heart for helping?
organization: Unity Hospice of Chicagoland, Northwest Indiana, Greater St. Louis and Houston
description: Are you a student or artist in the area of ceramics who has already given all your friends & family all the mugs they can fit in their cupboards? Do you want something beautiful you make to go into the hands of someone who needs desperately to remember that someone cares? Have you felt the comfort that comes from receiving a heartfelt gift and want to spread that feeling?Unity Hospice's goal is to provide care and comfort to patients AND their families. Patients are in the final 6 months of their lives, and many families have been caring for their loved one for years and are feeling the emotional strain of caregiver fatigue, and the approaching grief and loss. …
missionStatement: The mission of Unity Hospice is to provide comprehensive care, support, and education to people facing life-limiting disease, those who care for them and our community. Unity Hospice provides top-notch palliative care for those with life limiting illnesses along with great customer support - a combination that can't be beat!
organizationDescription: Founded in 1992 by Michael Klein, J.D., at his kitchen table. Unity Hospice is backed with over a decade of industry experience and excellence.

title: Help Provide Clerical Duties in Hospice Office
description:
Administrative volunteers promote hospice care by helping perform clerical assignments in an office setting. These assignments can include helping process mail outs, filing, data entry, answering phones, restocking supplies, making packets, plus many other tasks.


VITAS Volunteer orientation is provided free of charge to help you learn the skills required to be an outstanding Office Volunteer. Volunteers are needed between the hours of 8am and 5pm, Monday through Friday.


For more information about VITAS Volunteer Services visit  https://www.vitas.com/volunteer.
missionStatement: VITAS Healthcare recognizes the importance of a strong and innovative program. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice program, allowing VITAS to continue personalizing, enhancing and expanding services offered to patients and families. By exemplifying the VITAS Values, volunteers serve as patient and family advo cat es and are proactive in meeting the needs of patients and families. VITAS integrates volunteers into the hospice team by actively recruiting, training, supporting and creatively utilizing volunteers to meet patient and family needs. Volunteers and their contributions are respected and valued.
organizationDescription: Volunteers are the heart of VITAS Healthcare, providing friendly, non-medical patient and family care and offering support services in the office.

title: Teaching English To Adults - Bilingual Volunteers
description:
Tutoring English as a Second Language to adults


Helping Adults to improve their vocabulary, pronunciation, reading and writing, and motivate them to enjoy learning English. Materials and classroom provided. 1-on-1 tutor and small group teacher positions available. We prefer Bilingual volunteers as many of our students are complete beginners in English.


When: We have availability from Monday through Friday from 9 am to 8pm; Saturday 9-1; usually 2 hours at a time. We are flexible when you would like to tutor.
