missionStatement: Erie Neighborhood House is a community service agency founded in 1870 that promotes a just and inclusive society by strengthening low-income, primarily Latino, families through skill-building, access to critical resources,advocacy and collaborative action.
organizationDescription: Erie Neignborhood House Core Values:

title: Card Processing Event
description:
Sign up here to reserve your spot! --> https://www.cardzforkidz.org/eventsWe are excited that you have considered joining the Card Counting Crew, one of the most important teams at Cardz For Kidz.


Our mission is to encourage and empower people of all ages via handmade cards. Averaging over 11,000 deliveries a month, we need additional volunteers to help reduce our processing time and create more smiles than ever.


Join us for a fun and fulfilling event where we count, sort, and package handmade cards for global deliveries! This is an excellent opportunity to make a difference and spend time with friends and community members…
missionStatement: Cardz For Kidz is an organization dedicated to uplifting spirits across the globe by delivering inspiring handmade cards!
organizationDescription: We connect with companies, organizations, and schools and help them host events where participants directly impact disheartened children and solemn seniors worldwide by creating encouraging cards. We deliver the cards to the staff at each hospital/nonprofit, and they work with volunteers to ensure each card is hand-delivered room by room.

title: Business Mentor: Share your knowledge with a small business owner!
description:
A SCORE mentor is an adviser who helps individuals and small businesses reach their goals. Mentors provide free business advice and education to aspiring entrepreneurs and existing business owners.


As a mentor, you’ll help clients solve problems, make businesses more efficient, and assist with developing long-term business plans. Additionally, you may discover new sources of insight and knowledge to help your own business and leadership style. Teaching others how to manage people or projects, along with illustrating ways to succeed in other aspects of business, could inspire you to continue with your own professional growth-all of this while helping your local community.


The ideal mentor is empathetic, flexible, and loves connecting people…
missionStatement: SCORE, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, is dedicated to helping small businesses get off the ground, grow and achieve their goals through education and mentoring. Our mission is to foster vibrant small business communities through mentoring and education.
organizationDescription: SCORE, America's premier source of free and confidential small business advice for entrepreneurs and small businesses, is a nonprofit resource partner with the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA). We have over 300 SCORE offices across the country and 10,000 volunteers offering free business mentoring and low- or no-cost workshops. For over 50 years, SCORE's thousands of working and retired business professionals have volunteered to support the success of small business nationwide. SCORE business mentoring is free and confidential. We provide:

title: WHEELSFORALL Members for High School and College students
description:
WHEELSFORALL is looking for active members for its cause of helping families in under supported causes all over the world. Be part of the change and take action within the multiple departments of our organization. Get the ability to refine abilities and use your skills to help others in need. We have multiple opportunities within:

• Social Media Team
• Podcast Team
• Science Team ( Biology, Chem, and Psychology)
• Business Team
• Website Team
• Engineering Team


Get to work with multiple students across the world and be part of the active member community. Join us!
missionStatement: We are a high school student-led non-profit organization dedicated to help provide free and reliable transportation to low income families.
organizationDescription: WHEELSFORALL is a national non-profit organization that works on providing resources to low income families. We have donated over 100 bikes across 4 states and thrive to help the community in multiple areas. The organization is high school student led in order for the youth to have active engagement within the community. We have also helped hundreds of families with free public tutoring, care packages, and food drives in order to spread out the ways we can help our community. WHEELSFORALL has one goal: to help its community it any way it can and have an impact on someone's life.

title: Monthly Volunteer Packing event
description: We host volunteers on the last Monday of every month between 5:30 and 7:30 pm to pack kits, clean the space, and complete other miscellaneous projects.
missionStatement: SparkShop inspires the next generation of engineers, innovators, entrepreneurs & manufacturing geniuses. We empower students to see their value in STEM because we want to see a larger, more diverse pool of talent to tackle the next wave of technical challenges.
organizationDescription: SparkShop provides a fully prepared, in-school curriculum, professional development, and all the supplies needed to teachers who run our engineering-focused activities in their classrooms for free. In the 2024-2025 school year we’ll work with 42 schools in the City of Chicago, reaching over 2,300 students and delivering 8,000 kits.

title: Veteran Volunteer - Honor Patients in Chicago
description:
Veteran Volunteers play a unique and very important role in the care we provide to hospice patients at JourneyCare Hospice.

• Veterans may be asked to "be a friend to another veteran" and provide weekly or monthly visits to our patients who have served our country.
• Our agency has a "pinning program," where Veteran volunteers facilitate a short, but very moving ceremony for hospice patients. With patriotic music playing, the volunteer will recite a brief reading-tailored to the appropriate military branch-and award a service pin to the patient, thanking them for their service to our country. Some of these ceremonies are done via Zoom online.
• Veteran Volunteers also attend group honorings at nursing facilities in their neighborhood to salute and honor the Veteran residents, especially on or around Veterans Day.
JourneyCare offers many in person and at home volunteer opportunities to support hospice patients:

• Visit hospice patients and their loved ones where they live....visit patients in these Illinois locations (and surrounding areas): Barrington, Chicago, Des…
missionStatement: Providing cost-effective care and assistance that gives people the freedom to remain in their homes.
organizationDescription: The largest provider of supportive, palliative and hospice care in Illinois, JourneyCare, part of the Addus Homecare Family of Companies, serves nearly 2,300 patients and their families each day with an unmatched depth and breadth of expertise, experience and services, providing exceptional care for each person, and support for those who love them, at every stage of the journey. JourneyCare helps people facing serious illness live life to the fullest, with dignity and without pain, on their own terms. We care for the whole person - body, mind and spirit - not just the disease, and work together with the patient, family and other care partners to create a customized care plan that supports and respects their goals, preferences and choices. Care is provided wherever the patient calls home...a private residence, senior living community, a long-term care facility or hospital. If pain and symptoms become too difficult to manage at home, around-the-clock care can be provided in one of our inpatient hospice care centers.

title: Polish Medical Interpreter- Onsite
description:
CommunityHealth is a free health clinic serving the low-income, uninsured.


At CommunityHealth, we rely on generous volunteer interpreters to make sure our Polish-speaking patients have the opportunity to communicate fully and openly with their care providers, and that our providers can provide the full quality of care regardless of language barriers.


Polish interpreters should be fluent in both Polish and English, and will have the unique opportunity to assist medical providers and patients in the exam room, for a variety of appointment types, including primary care, dental, and over 20 specialties.


Volunteers commit to at least two four-hour shifts per month for at…
missionStatement: Serving people without essential health care.
organizationDescription: CommunityHealth is a volunteer-run free clinic providing healthcare to low-income, uninsured patients. We offer primary and specialty care, including dental and vision, along with lab, pharmacy, behavioral health services, and health education programming, all thanks to an amazing team of roughly 1,000 volunteers.

title: Even in IOWA has an housing issue. Chicago student can help this spring break
organization: Habitat for Humanity International: Collegiate Challenge
description:
You've heard of Habitat for Humanity and guess what? We host college groups just like yours to help us build homes across the nation. If you are looking for an alternative, volunteer based spring break activity for 10-25 of your college students keep reading,


Join us for a week starting a new affordable home for a new homebuyer who has been on our waiting list for 5 years! We will be setting walls, framing, and installing windows and doors. No experience required, but more advanced tasks will be assigned to those who do have experience! Tools and safety gear provided, closed-toe shoes and clothing appropriate for the weather are required.


WHO:…
missionStatement: Seeking to put God’s love into action, Habitat for Humanity brings people together to build homes, communities, and hope. We partner with people in your community and all over the world to help them build or improve a place they can call home. Habitat homeowners help build their own homes alongside volunteers and pay an affordable mortgage. With your support, Habitat homeowners achieve the strength, stability, and independence they need to build a better life for themselves and for their families. Through our work, we strive to achieve our vision of a world where everyone has a decent place to live.
organizationDescription: Collegiate Challenge is an alternative break program that strives to capture the imagination, energy, and hope of young people in order to productively and responsibly involve them in the work of Habitat for a week.

title: Host an International High School Exchange Student (Cook County, IL)
organization: SHARE! High School Student Exchange Program, Exchange Students
description:
SHARE! Your Heart & Homewith a high school exchange student


Host an international exchange student! Host families and adults are needed to host exchange students for a school year or semester. SHARE! students, boys and girls who are 15 -18 years old from countries like France, Germany, Spain, China, Brazil, Poland, Italy, Mexico, Japan, and South Korea are waiting for a family or adult(s) to choose them as their exchange student! SHARE! students speak English, have medical insurance, and spending money for personal expenses. They will attend their host family's local high school and want to become a member of your family! SHARE! families are diverse- traditional two-parent families (with or…
missionStatement: To create opportunities for greater tolerance and understanding between Americans and peoples of the world.
organizationDescription: ERDT/SHARE! is a global non-profit educational foundation that has been providing international student exchange services to host families and international teens since 1974.

title: Le Tour de Shore 2025 Charity Ride
description: Help make Le Tour de Shore Charity Bike Ride a success. Le Tour de Shore is 2-day recreational charity bike ride from Chicago to New Buffalo, MI (100 miles). Volunteers are needed to assist at SAG stops to serve water, Gatorade, fruit, and snacks, while cyclists explore dedicated lakefront and duneland bike paths, and scenic Harbor Country secondary roads. Proceeds to benefit Maywood Fine Arts, Maywood, IL, a not-for-profit organization providing programs in art, dance, drama, music, tumbling and voice to children in the Chicago area. The mission of Maywood Fine Arts Association is to provide a safe and nurturing environment in which children can develop skills and appreciation of the arts that will enable them to succeed academically and socially and obtain higher educational opportunities.
missionStatement: The mission of Maywood Fine Arts (MFA) is to provide affordable quality arts and fitness education to enrich and transform the lives of children and families in Maywood and surrounding communities.
organizationDescription: Maywood Fine Arts was established in 1996 by concerned parents and community leaders in the Village of Maywood, Illinois to help combat escalating rates of drug activity, gang involvement, and teen pregnancies by providing youth with enriching alternative activities in the community. From the beginning, a key goal for the founders of Maywood Fine Arts was to create an arts center in the heart of their community that would serve as a safe place for children to attend classes and engage in healthy activity protected from gangs and violence. Through grass-roots efforts within the community, MFA transformed a previously boarded up bank building into a vibrant center of arts activity in downtown Maywood.

title: Project Manager: Help Solve the Literacy Crisis
description:
Have you ever wanted to do something AMAZING to change the world but didn't know where to start?


Here is an opportunity to join the American Youth Literacy Foundation, dba FUNetix, an all- volunteer 501 c 3 charitable non-profit organization, founded in 2008 and dedicated to ensuring that all children, in every classroom in America, learn how to read by the end of 3rd grade. Our mission is to save millions of children from a lifetime of illiteracy and bring about true education parity in just a few years’ time by deploying the FUNetix 12 Hour Reading App nationwide.


With the FUNetix app, which is 100% free to download and use, any child can learn how to read in just 12 hours of total play time; and in America’s public schools today, there are millions of children who can’t…
missionStatement: The Vision of FUNetix is: UNIVERSAL LITERACY. The Mission of FUNetix is: Deliver a free smartphone app that will make that vision happen. Think of what it would mean if EVERY child could learn how to read from a smartphone in 12 hours! The mission of FUNetix is simple: get the app out! Get the FUNetix 12 hours Reading App out to America's children through smartphones, laptops, desktops, tablets, and classrooms. Get the app out through partnerships with publishing companies, schools, NGOs, parents, teachers, corporations and federal, state and local governments. Universal literacy is within reach because FUNetix is able to teach reading in a way that it has never been taught before, and with a speed that has never been conceived of before. FUNetix is here, and if your child is ready, we're ready. You can start learning how to read in 12 hours, today!
organizationDescription: FUNetix is a patented, science-based, and incredibly simplified way of teaching reading to children that's available to parents and children anywhere in the United States and anywhere in the world. The FUNetix 12 hours Reading App is available in the App Store, Google Play store and Amazon App store.

title: Spanish School Coordinator
description:
Location: Chicago, ILReports to: Spanish Programming DirectorPosition Type: Volunteer, Part-time


About Us: She Became is dedicated to empowering young women by providing them with opportunities to develop leadership skills, engage in community service, and prepare for future success. Our mission is to empower girls to embrace their potential and pursue their dreams. We welcome applications from all individuals who are passionate about our mission and want to make a positive impact.


Position Summary: We are seeking a facilitator to support our Spanish programming. This role may involve working alongside another Spanish-speaking facilitator or taking on responsibilities as a full-time facilitator with a focus on programming.


Commitment: This position requires a commitment of approximately 4-5 hours per week, with flexibility based on project needs and timelines…
missionStatement: Empowering girls to embrace their potential and pursue their dreams.
organizationDescription: She Became is a nonprofit program dedicated to inspiring confidence in young girls and championing gender equality through mentorship and education. By connecting elementary school girls with female leaders in a variety of industries and pairing them with a mentor, we foster their growth through exposure to diverse careers, role models, and engaging activities. Every She Became session provides a new opportunity for girls to explore the vast world of what’s possible to chart their own path to success. Our sessions are dedicated at every step of the way to building confidence; one girl at a time.

title: With Cake4Kids, baking from home in the South Loop IS volunteering!
description:
Hi Bakers!At Cake4Kids we bake and deliver birthday cakes, cupcakes, cookies, bars and brownies to foster children and at-risk youth -- and all of the baking and decorating is done by you, the volunteers! We aim to raise their self-esteem with this seemingly simple gift on their special day. Cake4Kids supports as many at-risk youth as possible in the communities we serve, including homeless youth, victims of human trafficking and domestic violence, kids in transitional housing and those in foster care. Now, we are proud to bring our service to the Chicago area - serving Cook county!


If you like to bake and decorate cakes, you would love to volunteer with Cake4Kids. We don't require any time commitment -- bake 1 cake or…
missionStatement: At Cake4Kids, we bake and deliver birthday cakes for foster children and at risk youth. We support all sorts of under-privileged children and youth - they might be in group homes, at a domestic violence or human trafficking agency/shelter, in low income housing with or without a parent or even homeless. We aim to raise these children's self-esteem and confidence with this seemingly simple gift on their special day. It may just be a cake, but the children we bake for know somebody took the time and effort to do something special just for them. The children realize they are important and in turn can have an impact on the world. Cake4Kids is powered by an amazing and compassionate group of volunteers. Our bakers are mostly home-bakers. There are no minimum commitments - you choose how often you want to bake a cake for us. It's pretty simple - a Cake4Kids volunteer baker chooses a cake theme from our online calendar and bakes the cake in their own home and delivers the cake to one of the agencies we serve. Our volunteers never meet the children we support, but every cake is custom-made specially for each child with love.
organizationDescription: Volunteers needed to bake birthday cakes for foster children and at risk youth in Fresno, CA. If you enjoy baking cakes, we'd love to meet you. We need bakers urgently.

title: Volunteer Guides Needed to Bring Music to Hospitals in Chicago!
description:
Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call (MOC) needs YOU to help us spread the healing power of music to those who need it most!


Volunteer Guides (non-musicians) escort Volunteer Musicians room to room as they play music for patients, families and caregivers in healthcare environments.


The Volunteer Guide acts as the "eyes and ears" during the MOC Bedside shift and is the liaison between the hospital, patient, and the Volunteer Musician. Volunteer Guides are critical to the success of MOC Bedside and get to experience the healing power of music firsthand without having to be a musician themselves…
missionStatement: Musicians On Call, a nonprofit organization formed in 1999, brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. Musicians On Call uses music to promote and complement the healing process for patients, families and caregivers.
organizationDescription: Musicians On Call (MOC) brings live and recorded music to the bedsides of patients in healthcare environments. We are looking for VOLUNTEER GUIDES and VOLUNTEER MUSICIANS to help us deliver the healing power of music. As a volunteer with Musicians On Call, you can brighten the days of hospitalized patients - a truly rewarding experience. MOC currently has volunteer opportunities for both Volunteer Guides and Volunteer Musicians at our weekly Bedside Performance Programs.

title: 2025 Partners in Purpose: A Scientific Social
description:
This social will showcase the many facets of the Foundation’s critical mission in one event and highlight our most important asset: our Partners in Purpose.


Join us for a delightful night of helping register attendees, minor set up, and enjoy learning about the newest breakthroughs in lymphoma.
missionStatement: The Lymphoma Research Foundation's mission is to eradicate lymphoma and serve those touched by this disease.
organizationDescription: The Lymphoma Research Foundation (LRF) is the nation’s largest non-profit organization devoted to funding innovative research and serving the lymphoma community through a comprehensive series of education programs, outreach initiatives and patient services.

title: Social Media Volunteer
description:
Recruiting Organization: Therapy  Access Project


TAP is a grassroots community initiative based in Chicago, IL, with a mission to make disruptive change to the status quo for current access to and perceptions of mental health care, specifically in the LGBTQIA+ and BIPOC communities. TAP aims to remove barriers to access to identity-affirming and intersectional mental health care for these populations through volunteer-based services matching TAP program applicants throughout the U.S. We match with mental health providers vetted in our directory based on financial accessibility, shared identities, and shared values. TAP also works to remove the stigma against mental health care through developing free psycho-educational resources around accessing mental health care, understanding mental health conditions and experiences, and what to expect in mental health care.


We are looking for volunteers to join our social media team who are interested in spreading the message of our therapy matching services and resources as well as creating psychoeducational content and…
missionStatement: To bridge the gap between intention and action in order to bring about social impact.
organizationDescription: Idealist is a leading online global resource for finding jobs in the nonprofit sector, as well as volunteer opportunities and graduate school programs for social impact.

title: Help Lead Family Volunteer Programs
description:
Come join our hive! We are looking for fun and enthusiastic people just like YOU to help run our weekend volunteer projects. Honeycomb volunteers help deliver the very best volunteer experiences for families and organizations alike. They are leaders, party hosts, teachers, and organizers. Honeycomb volunteers love working with kids and enjoy a variety of projects across Chicago.


Volunteer responsibilities include:

• Assist Project Leaders in managing Honeycomb’s family volunteer programs
• Teach, direct, and motivate kids and their families
• Help with day-of logistics including set-up and break down…
missionStatement: Founded in 2011, The Honeycomb Project engages, mobilizes and inspires kids and their families to strengthen Chicago’s communities through public service.
organizationDescription: The Honeycomb Project is Chicago’s go-to organization for family volunteering. We're on a mission to engage, mobilize and inspire kids and their families to build stronger communities through service. Each month, we offer a robust schedule of programs that bring people-power and resources to more than 50+ local organizations.

title: Neighborhood Orientations for Newly Arrived Refugee Family
description:
One of the most difficult part of new arrivals’ transitions to life in the United States is settling into and learning to navigate their neighborhoods. The seemingly mundane tasks that comprise our days such as taking the CTA, going to the grocery store, or walking to our children’s schools can pose very real challenges for people who are in the early days of resettlement. To this end, Heartland Alliance is seeking volunteers to greet our new Chicago neighbors and help them learn to navigate their neighborhood.


Volunteers will visit a newly arrived refugee family approximately an hour to two hours a week for two months to help them learn the way to a few key locations in their neighborhood and how to navigate the CTA. Some of the locations include:…
missionStatement: Heartland Human Care Services advances the human rights and responds to the human needs of endangered populations--particularly the poor, the isolated, and the displaced--through the provision of comprehensive and respectful services and the promotion of permanent solutions leading to a more just global society.
organizationDescription: Refugee & Immigrant Community Services (RICS) partners with refugees, asylees, immigrants and survivors of trafficking to address their needs by connecting them to their new community, providing education and employment services, and the help they need to succeed in their new country. RICS annually resettles more than 150 individuals in Chicago from places like Afghanistan, Burma, Democratic Republic of Congo, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Iraq, Sudan, Ukraine, and Syria. RICS serves an additional 500 refugees through a variety of services including cultural orientation, adjustment counseling, employment, job readiness and placement services, as well as medical case management, family literacy, and English language training for adults.

title: Associate Board Member
description:
While the AB is not currently accepting new members, you are welcome to send your information and we will contact you when a there is an opening.


Renaissance Social Services' Associate Board Makes an Impact to those in the Greatest Need!MissionThe Associate Board’s mission is to support and promote Renaissance’s mission andvision through fundraising, volunteerism, and spreading awareness. We provide supportto the organization, its staff, clients, and Board of Directors and work with a diversegroup of individuals to develop creative solutions to help combat homelessness inChicago.…
missionStatement: Renaissance Social Services is changing the lives of individuals and families in Chicago, giving them hope and vision for a new life. By supporting communities and the people who live within them with quality affordable housing, behavioral healthcare, outreach, homeless prevention, compassionate support services and a purposeful focus on racial equity, we provide the opportunity for stability and wellness.
organizationDescription: Renaissance Social Services, Inc provides housing and support services for Chicago’s most vulnerable homeless residents. This past year, Renaissance helped more than more than 3,600 people - families and individuals - find homes, address their mental and physical health issues, and reintegrate into their communities.

title: STEM Mentors Needed in Chicago, IL Area
description: Are you a high school student looking to make a difference in your community? Are you passionate about STEM and want to develop leadership skills for college and beyond? If this is you, please contact us as we're looking to start a new chapter in Chicago and surrounding areas.STEM for Others - www.stemforothers.orgYour hours will qualify for the Presidential Volunteer Service AwardSTEM for Others - MissionOur education system is at a crossroads where it is not preparing our students to be competitive at the global level. The issue is more pronounced for socio-economically disadvantaged families as the disparity in STEM education widens as they face substantial hurdles in…
missionStatement: Our education system is at a crossroads where it is not preparing our students to be competitive at the global level. The issue is more pronounced for socio-economically disadvantaged families as the disparity in STEM education widens as they face substantial hurdles in accessing quality learning opportunities. We believe that advancement in STEM is the greatest equalizer that creates the greatest opportunities for upward mobility. Our mission is to make a concerted effort to provide deeper and more targeted programs that focus on equitable access to STEM education.
organizationDescription: STEM for Others (https://www.stemforothers.org) is continuing to grow and we're looking for help in a multitude of areas including:

title: Regional STEM leaders in the Chicago Area
description:
Do you have a passion for STEM. Do believe in equal acess in STEM education for all children? If so you should consider becoming a Regional Leader for a 501(c)(3) non profit with the goal of increasing STEM education for all.


Reach out to local communities (ie libraries, smaller ogranizations) and using provided materials teach classes for local youth!


All materials and email template will be provided!


Get featured on our website and Instagram as a Regional Leader!!
missionStatement: At Crochet for Crisis, we are passionate about creating - crochet pieces that make a difference. Our team is dedicated to crafting cute accessories with love and care. Our proceeds will go towards planning educational events such as public classes and courses. These events will teach young women a variety of skills, such as finance, coding, circuit running and more. Some funds will also be donated to charities that are designed to help women in unfortunate situations gain access to education. We aim to make a positive impact during challenging times by spreading joy through our hand-made crochet pieces.
organizationDescription: The goal of the organization is to fund our STEM based classes in local communities through the use of funds made through the sale of crochet goods.

title: Race to Cure Sarcoma Chicago 5K
description:
The Race to Cure Sarcoma (RTCS) is the premier 5K Run/Walk series in the United States, focused on raising awareness and important research funds for sarcoma. Sarcoma is a rare cancer found in adults and nearly 20% of all childhood cancers. Through the Race to Cure Sarcoma events, sarcoma patients, survivors, caregivers, medical professionals, and people who have lost a loved one, all come together as a community to support innovative research for better treatments and an end to sarcoma.


Join our movement to help people impacted by sarcoma.  Volunteer to support the Sarcoma Foundation of America (SFA), in one of the following key areas:…
missionStatement: The mission of the Sarcoma Foundation of America (SFA) is to advocate for sarcoma patients by funding research and by increasing awareness about the disease. The organization raises money to privately fund grants for sarcoma researchers and conducts education and advocacy efforts on behalf of sarcoma patients.
organizationDescription: Our goal is to find the cure in our time. We do this by:

title: Teach Immigrants English - Become an English Literacy Tutor!
description:
Help adult immigrants learn English at Aquinas Literacy Center! By volunteering as an English Literacy Tutor for just 90 minutes per week (plus 30 minutes of lesson planning and paperwork), you can empower an adult learner to achieve their personal and professional goals.


Tutoring is scheduled at your convenience during regular Center hours (Monday/Tuesday 9am-4:30pm and Wednesday/Thursday 9am-8pm). No weekend tutoring. All tutoring occurs in-person  at our Center, located  at 1751 West 35th Street in Chicago. Prospective t utors must be native or near native English speakers.  Knowledge of another language is not required; all tutoring is in English.


Your first step to becoming a Volunteer English Tutor is to attend a…
missionStatement: The Aquinas Literacy Center exists to offer individualized tutoring in the English language to area residents at no cost to the students. The Center accepts every race, color or creed. We strive to provide an environment conducive to learning, and one which reverences and respects each individual person. Closely allied with this intent is the fostering of independent learning, personal growth and responsibility. Our service is based on the expertise and experience of the Adrian Dominican Sisters and their continuing commitment to education.
organizationDescription: Here at Aquinas Literacy Center we strive to help change lives word by word in an effort to help our students share their story and engage more fully in the world around them. We offer a variety of programming to help students in their learning. The Literacy Center is a place that offers hospitality, opportunity for education and learning, and a community of learners and supporters. We invite you to join us as a volunteer! In particular, Aquinas Literacy Center is seeking volunteers who can commit 90 minutes per week as an ESL tutor. Tutor training is provided, and knowledge of a second language is not necessary.

title: Enhance Fitness Instructor
description:
Lead Enhance Fitness low impact workout classes for seniors.


Instructors will need to commit to a consistent schedule of classes.


Instructors will be provided training through a remote course.


Instructors must be bilingual (English and Mandarin or Cantonese)


CASL will pay a stipend of $16 per class. Instructors must provide a W-9.Classes are held Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday 9:00 am - 11:00 am at CASL
missionStatement: Building on the wisdom of generations, CASL catalyzes the transformation of individuals, families, and the community for an equitable future.
organizationDescription: CASL is an all-inclusive non-profit agency with over 45 years of experience connecting families and individuals with the vital support they need: providing an educational and cultural foundation for our children, ensuring our seniors live full and independent lives with dignity, enhancing education and training for tomorrow’s workforce, putting immigrants on the pathway to citizenship, securing our community’s housing and financial well-being, navigating healthcare systems and wellness resources,​ and fighting for equal access to justice. Since our founding, CASL has been rooted in the principles of equity and justice. That legacy continues to shape our efforts today as we strive to champion diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility at all levels of the organization.

title: Make An IMPACT Today!!
description: Join Midtown Achievement Center's tutoring program and make a lasting difference in a young boy’s life! With just two hours a week, you can provide personalized academic and personal growth support to a student. You'll set goals, help with study skills, and collaborate with parents to track progress. Become a positive influence and guide your student toward success.
missionStatement: Midtown-Metro guides low-income urban youth in Chicago along pathways of success. Our proven enrichment programs embrace the dignity of the person by focusing on academic excellence, virtue development, individual attention, and parental engagement.
organizationDescription: Midtown-Metro operates through its Metro Achievement Center for girls and Midtown Achievement Center for boys in grades 3 - 12. Programs focus on Hispanic and African American youth, offering after-school and summertime growth opportunities that help students of average academic ability to achieve above-average results. Programs are rooted in Catholic moral and social teaching and embrace students regardless of their religious, racial, ethnic, or familial status. Midtown-Metro received its original inspiration from Opus Dei, an institution of the Catholic Church, and continues today its partnership with Opus Dei.Be a tutor, role model, and mentor at Metro Achievement Center for girls or Midtown Center for boys!

title: Do You Have the Heart of a Hospice Volunteer? Volunteers Needed in Chicago, IL
description:
Do you have a Big Heart and a Little Time to Listen?


If you have one or all of these qualities, please call and become a volunteer with HarmonyCares Hospice. Men or women, young or old can make a difference TODAY in the life of a hospice patient and their family.


Volunteers spend time with a terminally ill patient doing enjoyable activities - reading, talking, engaging in a hobby. Volunteers help family members take a break to rejuvenate, go shopping, or keep appointments. Volunteers are often the highlight of someone's day.


Won't you please call and find out how you can make a difference in the life of a person TODAY…
missionStatement: For each employee to treart every patient as their own treasured loved one, providing care that affords a quality of life that outweighs quantity of days, and supports caregivers as their hearts find healing.
organizationDescription: HarmonyCares Hospice of Lansing provides patients with a terminal illness, with a life expectancy of 6 months or less, the specialized care needed at end of life. Volunteers provide a wide range of activities across several counties including Ingham, Shiawassee, Clinton, Jackson, and Eaton. Volunteers can sign up to provide companionship, emotional support, supportive presence, light housekeeping, lawn/ pet care, and MUCH MUCH MORE!

title: Homelessness Volunteer
description:
Join Us in Making a Difference!


Are you passionate about creating a positive change in society? Our CBS-featured non-profit wants you to join us in making a difference.





About Us:


Bright Mind is an award-winning non-profit organization recognized for our innovative initiatives such as Wellness Week and Street Care. Our outreach has reached up to 60 million people and has been featured on CBS, Politico, ABC, and Newsweek. We are looking for a passionate and versatile volunteer to join our team. If you have a desire to make a positive impact in the lives of those experiencing homelessness, we would love to hear from you!

•
missionStatement: Helping individuals thrive academically, socially, and emotionally
organizationDescription: Bright Mind is a community wellness education organization.Bright Mind recently launched Street Care, a massive initiative built by our homelessness and wellness experts, 'your toolkit to help homeless people.' We have an app, an expanding series of informational materials and instructional videos (25+ already), and more (at streetcare.us). We are pioneering an online and on-the-streets outreach approach, accessible to everyone.For all of Bright Mind's work, well-being, tenacity, curiosity, and creativity are the heart of the approach, to help individuals thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. We are passionate about building community. This is a crucial time to create positive change, and we look forward to working together as we accomplish great things together!

title: Girls Empowerment Volunteer Coach
description:
Girls Rugby is a nonprofit empowerment based organization working to help girls reach their fullest potential both on an off the pitch! We provide inclusive and accessible flag rugby programming for Girls in 2nd through 8th grade regardless of experience level!


We are looking for several volunteers with a passion for inspiring and empowering girls to develop their leadership skills and build confidence through sport! Never played Rugby? Never HEARD of Rugby? That's okay! Girls Rugby provides Coaches with a step by step season guide book, free and comprehensive training, and a local team to provide on site support.


This opportunity requires roughly a 2 month commitment, with one practice and one game day per week. If you're interested in supporting…
missionStatement: We empower girls to realize their potential through sport and become better leaders both on and off the field!
organizationDescription: We are an empowerment based nonprofit, we encourage leadership development, confidence building, and important life skills that can be practiced on the field and utilized in their daily lives. We are looking for coaches who are passionate about empowering san diego's young female leaders! There is no experience with Rugby needed, we will teach you everything you need to know. We ask for a 7 week commitment twice a year. Practices are an hour one or two nights a week with game days on Saturday mornings from 9am to 12! Training is fully provided and paid for.

title: Want to help kids in low-income communities? Become a virtual tutor!
description: If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply directly at  https://forms.gle/De4juKf8HhyLUgBQ7 .  There is more information listed there as well, including information about our pairing process. (You do not need to indicate your interest through VolunteerMatch unless you have specific questions.) Thank you! Background: Pandemic Professors, a 501c3 organization, was founded in April 2020 with the mission of facilitating free online tutoring to students in underserved communities affected by the pandemic. We are a 100% volunteer-based organization. Our philosophy not only supports academic achievement but also emphasizes the importance of socio-emotional health. We rely on committed volunteers who have a passion for education and are dedicated to offering academic support to students at risk of falling behind. Your contribution is crucial in this endeavor!  You will interact with families and help students perform and learn! Join our…
missionStatement: The mission of Pandemic Professors is to facilitate free tutoring to children in low-income communities impacted by the pandemic.
organizationDescription: At Pandemic Professors, we believe all K-12 students deserve an opportunity to receive free supplemental learning through private tutoring, in order to help them remain on track and meet their educational goals. Our organization was founded to match underserved students across the United States with free online tutors to more safely help during this unprecedented crisis and beyond.Historically, students in underserved communities are at greater risk of falling behind in academics and socio-emotional skills. Much like Hurricane Katrina, the COVID-19 crisis is exacerbating the plethora of academic and personal challenges these students already face. Our organization presents students in low-income communities with opportunities to strengthen subject comprehension and boost confidence. The needs, strengths, and voices of the impacted students drive our family-centered philosophy and evidence-based practices.Together with our partners, Pandemic Professors combats adverse effects on learning resulting from the pandemic and exacerbated by poverty. Students in underserved communities don’t lack a hunger for knowledge, they lack the means to access quality tutoring. Pandemic Professors provides effective tools for students to complete their K-12 education, and we will continue to work with our students after the pandemic until the educational gap is resolved. We sincerely hope you consider joining us in the fight to improve the lives of students adversely affected by poverty and the pandemic.

title: Handyman
description:
We are looking for someone to come in to weather-proof a door, hang up a blind, and look into fixing a blind.


We don't have many tools on sight so we would need those provideded.


We can provide other materials.
missionStatement: Community TV Network (CTVN), a leader in community access to media, empowers low-income young adults and children in Chicago to identify, address, and resolve issues through the use and understanding of digital media arts. CTVN instills in youth the awareness, motivation, and tools they need to create a positive future for themselves and their neighborhoods. Engaging youth in the creative and collaborative process of digital video production, we use the resulting media content to promote positive youth and community development with the overall goal of raising the educational success and economic viability of the neighborhoods where youth participants live and work.
organizationDescription: Since 1974, our technology and arts curriculum has empowered more than 11,000 city youth with a platform for self-representation while building self-esteem, community awareness, and intellectual curiosity. Filmmaking is taught through hands-on, interdisciplinary, student- and problem-centered programming, capturing the attention of our focus age group in a society dominated by visual media. Digital video production provides youth with tools to enhance academic learning, further developing essential skills that will lead to success in other subjects and endeavors.

title: A Fight Against Leukemia: Volunteer for ABC7 Gibbons Run
description: Are you looking for a chance to make a difference and be a hero for a great cause? Then join us and become part of our volunteer squad for the ABC 7 Gibbons Run! Our aim is to help find a cure for leukemia and with your unique skills and abilities, we can make a real impact.We have a range of volunteering options available, so whether you're fantastic at organizing or love being a cheerleader, there's a role for you. We need volunteers for packet pick up on Thursday, May 29, and on race day itself - Saturday, May 31st. This is an incredible opportunity to be a part of something special and give back to your community.All the proceeds benefit the Leukemia Research Foundation.…
missionStatement: The Leukemia Research Foundation's mission is to cure leukemia by funding innovative research, and to support patients and families.
organizationDescription: As the nation's largest nonprofit focused exclusively on funding leukemia research, our grants are accelerating the development of new and better treatments and an ultimate cure for leukemia.Through our patient-centered approach, access to leukemia experts, and nationwide partnerships, our support programs help patients and their loved ones navigate every step of the cancer journey.

title: Event Volunteers NEEDED! Walk MS: Chicago 2025
description:
Join one of the largest MS fundraisers in the country on Sunday, April 27, 2025 at our Annual MS Walk in downtown Chicago to fund important research and services for the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, Greater Illinois.


Plans are underway to make this year's event a great day of fun and festivities in support of those living with multiple sclerosis, their families, and caregivers.


If you are interested in helping plan the event and would like to join the planning committee. Please e-mail Specialist, Volunteer Engagement, Amy Stock at amy.stock@nmss.org for more information.


Volunteer Needs include:…
missionStatement: People affected by MS can live their best lives as we stop MS in its tracks, restore what has been lost and end MS forever. The National MS Society's vision: A World Free of MS.
organizationDescription: The National Multiple Sclerosis Society funds more MS research, offers more services to people with MS, provides more professional education programs and advances more MS advocacy efforts than any other MS organization in the world. Through its home office and fifty-state network of chapters, the National MS Society provides assistance to over a million people annually in its continuing mission to end the devastating effects of multiple sclerosis.

title: Chicago TechPath Alliance: Program Manager
description:
NOTE: To apply, please fill out the volunteer form at: https://forms.gle/1W5w4Ec2dFvx3tYF9


Chicago TechPath Alliance: Program Manager


Location: Chicago (remote)


Commitment: 5-10 hours per week


About Wevise


Wevise is a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping other nonprofits succeed. Our mission is to make tools, expertise, and resources accessible to organizations that need them the most, enabling them to create meaningful, scalable impact. At Wevise, we believe in collaboration, equity, and the power of technology to transform…
missionStatement: Our mission is to make careers in the technology industry more attainable through equitable access to mentorship, education, and career opportunities.
organizationDescription: Wevise is on a mission to level the playing field in tech. Through direct programming and partnerships with nonprofits supporting underserved and disadvantaged people to enter and advance in the technology industry, we provide access to mentors, training and educational opportunities, and careers.

title: Help fight hunger by rescuing food!
description:
Join Chicago Food Rescue in the fight against food waste and hunger!


When you download the app, you can see where and when food need is available and choose the rescues that fit your schedule-whether one-time or recurring.


Most rescues take less than an hour and can easily fit into your day, whether you're heading to work or running errands.


Ready to make a difference? Download Chicago Food Rescue, claim a rescue, and follow the simple step-by-step instructions. Together, we can make a big impact!
missionStatement: Increase access to nutritious food and reduce environmental impact by rescuing surplus food and delivering it to individuals and communities in need.
organizationDescription: Chicago FR is a nonprofit organization whose goal is to bridge the gap between food waste and food insecurity in Chicago and the surrounding areas. We aim to make healthy food accessible to anyone in need, free of charge, wherever they are. We believe that no one should go hungry when there is an abundance of food available.

title: Meals from the Heart with Ronald McDonald House
organization: Ronald McDonald House Charities of Chicagoland & Northwest Indiana
description:
Ronald McDonald House Charities of Chicagoland & Northwest Indiana (RMHC-CNI) exists so families can get better together. Families staying at a Ronald McDonald House are often far from the comforts of home, including freshly prepared meals. Through Meals from the Heart, volunteers provide meals for families, allowing them to eat together without the stress of cooking or the expense of dining out.


Whether you’re looking for a teambuilding activity for colleagues or a fun way to give back with friends, Meals from the Heart is a great way to give families a taste of home.Head to the RMHC-CNI website for more details, or to sign up for a meal date: https://rmhccni.org/get-involved/meals-from-the-heart/


Meals from the Heart volunteer groups (up to ten volunteers per group) handle the meal planning and preparation from start to finish. Volunteers create their menu, purchase all necessary ingredients, and cook their meal in our fully-equipped Ronald McDonald House kitchens.
missionStatement: We exist so families can get better together.
organizationDescription: Ronald McDonald House Charities of Chicagoland & Northwest Indiana (RMHC-CNI) is an independent, 501(c)(3) organization with the mission of existing so families can get better together. Every night, more than 150 families heal together because of the comfort, compassion and community they find at our five area Ronald McDonald Houses and three Ronald McDonald Family Rooms. That’s 44,000 nights each year when families are able to stay close to their children, helping them to heal faster and saving them more than $9 million in lodging and food costs. We are located near Advocate Children's Hospital, Loyola University Medical Center, University of Chicago Comer Children's Hospital, Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago, Edward Hospital in Naperville and Central DuPage Hospital.

title: Foster Coordinator
description:
With the increase in animals being rescued and the need for ISO foster homes, we are in search of more Foster Coordinators for the team. Becoming a Foster Coordinator is one of the most important roles within our organization. You will be the face of ALIVE Rescue to potential and current foster homes (who often become adopters!) and help us to be able to save more animals by getting new foster homes approved.


Prerequisites:  excellent communication skills, ability to manage multiple/competing priorities, work as team player, detail-orientation, capacity to check email at least once per day, access to a vehicle, and a basic knowledge of positive reinforcement training methods and cat and/or dog behavior.


Tasks for this role include:

• Processing foster home applications from start to finish (this includes: initial assessment of foster application, reference checks, phone interviews, and virtual home visits)…
missionStatement: ALIVE Rescue is an animal rescue that protects the lives and the rights of animals. We believe every animal has the right to a well-balanced, socialized and fulfilled life. We take on the responsibility to save, rehabilitate and place abandoned, abused and stray animals. We provide medical, behavioral and physical support for animals despite their age, health and/or breed. ALIVE promotes sustainable living and care giving by building awareness, appreciation and respect for all animals and the environment within our communities.
organizationDescription: ALIVE Rescue is a volunteer run organization who rescues cats, dogs, and rabbits who would otherwise be euthanized.

title: Shelter Assistant
description: Partner with staff to support intake process, answer phones, sign guests in, and monitor chores.
missionStatement: Breakthrough partners with those affected by poverty to build connections, develop skills and open doors of opportunity.
organizationDescription: Breakthrough is a community organization that serves as an anchor in the community of East Garfield Park on Chicago's west side. Breakthrough provides a myriad of services in the community focusing on the following: Homeless Intervention, Youth Development and Neighborhood Transformation.

title: Love Letters | Chicago Sinfonietta | Downtown Chicago
description: Chicago Sinfonietta is the most diverse orchestra in the U.S. and a nonprofit 501(c)3 organization.On Sunday March 16th, we are performing Love Letters in The Auditorium in downtown Chicago. Maestra Mei-Ann Chen weaves notions of devotion and adoration through a symphonic lens, featuring compositions by six distinctly different composers, representing historic men and modern women. This concert honors women through several perspectives, including romance, respect, admiration, and achievement. We need people who are passionate about the Arts and Racial Diversity to help us run the show in Chicago.If you're passionate about diversity, classical music, live performances, or the Arts you'll love volunteering for the Chicago Sinfonietta…
missionStatement: Chicago Sinfonietta is a professional orchestra dedicated to modeling and promoting diversity, inclusion, and both racial and cultural equity in the arts through the universal language of symphonic music. Our core values are built around being bold and daring in all aspects of our work, providing a source of connectivity through music, and ensuring and inspiring a continued investment in diversity and inclusion in classical music.
organizationDescription: Founded in 1987, the Chicago Sinfonietta performs classic and contemporary concerts at North Central College in Naperville and the Auditorium Theatre in downtown Chicago. Following in the legacy of the legendary Maestro Paul Freeman, Maestro Mei-Ann Chen ensures that each Sinfonietta concert showcases diverse guest artists and features a surprising array of sound from composers throughout the world and the ages. The Sinfonietta's commitment to diversity has created an open environment for minority musicians to develop their careers, and its educational outreach initiatives provide education and music programming for underserved communities in the Chicago area.

title: Greater Chicago Food Depository Repack Session (Afternoon Shift)
description: The Greater Chicago Food Depository is the food bank for Cook County, with 750 partner agencies that include places like food pantries, soup kitchens, and shelters that help provide food for food insecure individuals. The Food Depository regularly needs volunteers to help repack donated food and other products. With your support we effectively distribute food to our participating partners and in the last year alone have supported in distributing food to over 800,000 food insecure people. The Repack session is a great introduction to the Greater Chicago Food Depository, the work we do, and the need we see in Cook County. The food we receive in our warehouse comes in bulk quantities and volunteers are scheduled to help us break it down into manageable sizes. What you can expect to do in a Repack session is sort produce, inspect and box shipments of bread, or repack bulk dry goods (pasta, rice, beans) into…
missionStatement: Providing food for hungry people while striving to end hunger in our community
organizationDescription: The Greater Chicago Food Depository is Chicago’s food bank. We provide food for hungry people while striving to end hunger in our community.

title: Creative Arts Engagement Coordinator volunteer
description:
Position: Volunteer Creative Arts Engagement Coordinator


Organization: The Chrysalis Program


Location: 5017 South Hermitage Ave, 2nd Floor, Chicago, IL


Time Commitment: 2nd Saturdays (10 am - 1 pm), Summer Camp (July 1 - August 4, 8 am - 2 pm), Annual Retreat, Flexible Hours for Planning


Position Overview:


The Chrysalis Program is seeking a passionate and creative individual to serve as a Volunteer Creative Arts Engagement Coordinator. This role is central to our mission of achieving mental wellness through the expressive and therapeutic power of creative arts. The coordinator will lead engaging sessions during 2nd Saturdays, Summer Camp, and our Annual Retreat, creating an environment that fosters self-expression, personal growth, and community connection…
missionStatement: The Chrysalis Program cultivates self-love and acceptance, instill purpose, and support the well-being of black women, girls, and families through wellness, life skills, and creative arts programming.
organizationDescription: The Chrysalis Program seeks to reduce or eliminate the effects of childhood trauma for African American girls and their families on Chicago's South Side and beyond.The Chrysalis Program creates safe spaces for girls to heal, learn and grow by offering Wellness Workshops, Counseling, Life Skill Classes, Creative Arts Lessons, Parent Classes, Enrichment Field Trips, Mentorship and Community Events.​The Chrysalis Program is unique because it takes a holistic approach to empowering; teaching both life skills and coping skills that gradually improves the quality of life for participants and their families.

title: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED
description:
JOIN US IN BRINGING COMFORT AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOSPICE PATIENTS IN THEIR TIMEOF NEED.








GENTIVA HOSPICE IS SEEKING  COMPASSIONATE VOLUNTEERS TO HELP MAKE A MEAINGFUL IMPACT IN THE LIVES OF PATIENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.

SHARE HOBBIES AND STORIES, OR SIMPLY SIT QUIETLY WITH PATIENTS.


FLEXIBLITY TO MEET YOUR AVAILABILITY/SCHEDULE.

title: Chicago Student Mentorship
description: HFS Chicago Scholars has served the Chicago community for over 30 years. By providing private high school scholarships, one-on-one mentorship and individualized college preparation, we give underserved students that opportunity to change their life! We are seeking dedicated individuals to support our students as mentors. Mentors provide life advice, advocacy, support and guidance throughout the high school journey. Meetings ae in-person once a month and the mentor can expect to give 2-4 hours of their time each month. We look forward to working with you and lifting up the youth of our city that are so often overlooked.
missionStatement: HFS Chicago Scholars assists economically disadvantaged Chicago inner-city high school students who show academic and leadership promise achieve their educational goals by providing financial assistance and mentoring.
organizationDescription: We provide the following to our scholars:

title: Help CUB Spread the Word About Clean Energy!
description:
CUB’s coming to your community and we need your help! We’re building a volunteer team to educate your neighbors about big issues that impact utility bills-and to help people save money.


Over the past few years, several key clean energy policies have been passed on a state and federal level that help consumers access clean and affordable energy.  If these policies are implemented correctly, they can provide a path to fighting the most devastating and expensive consequences of climate change while controlling costs for energy customers. We are looking for long-term volunteers who can help us continue our fight for clean energy policies like the Climate and Equitable Jobs Act (CEJA) and the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA). CUB needs your help reaching out to local elected officials and community organizations, organizing phone…
missionStatement: When the Illinois General Assembly created CUB in 1983, it gave the nonprofit, nonpartisan organization a clear mission: to represent the interests of residential utility customers across the state. The statute directs CUB to carry out that mission by intervening in rate making proceedings before the Illinois Commerce Commission (ICC), in the courts and before other public bodies and by providing consumers with information and assistance regarding their utility companies. Since its inception in 1984, CUB has been doing just that--working for lower rates and better service from the state's investor-owned electric, gas and telephone companies.
organizationDescription: Since CUB opened its doors, the watchdog has saved Illinois consumers more than $20 billion saved by fighting proposed electricity, natural gas and telephone rate hikes. For every dollar CUB has raised during that time, it has yielded roughly $300 in savings-a dramatic return on investment that represents one more reason why the St. Louis Post-Dispatch praised CUB as the "gold standard" of consumer advocates.

title: Writer/Journalist Internship
description: Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Look no further! The Borgen Project is an international organization that works at the political level to improve living conditions for people impacted by war, famine and poverty.With 20 years of experience in the advocacy space, The Borgen Project has worked to support the passage of numerous bills that have benefitted close to 500 million people in developing countries.Writer/Journalist Internship:The role is focused on content creation for BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. This is a part-time 12 hours per week, 12 week, unpaid remote…
missionStatement: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. and U.K. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis.
organizationDescription: From CNN to The Huffington Post, the world is talking about the innovative movement that is downsizing global poverty. The Borgen Project believes that leaders of the most powerful nations on earth should be doing more to address global poverty. The national campaign is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. and U.K. foreign policy.

title: Outreach Volunteer
description: StandUp for Kids Chicago is looking for Volunteers to provide street outreach and community outreach for homeless and at risk youth and young adults.  Must be non judgmental and able to think on yor feet.  Must be reliable and commited to ending the cycle of youth homelessness.
missionStatement: The mission is to end the cycle of youth homelessness throughout the United States. We do this, every day, in cities across America. We carry out our mission through our volunteers who go to the streets in order to find, stabilize and otherwise help homeless and street kids improve their lives.
organizationDescription: StandUp for Kids fights to end youth homelessness by providing resources to homeless and at-risk kids. Resources range from basic hygiene, healthcare, counseling, mentoring, and drug and alcohol rehabilitation to support through our four core programs: Street Outreach, Mentoring, Outreach Centers and Apartment Support.Aside from these resources and services, StandUp for Kids provides a caring community who values all homeless and at-risk youth. Our mentors and volunteers establish non-threatening relationships with youth and provide them with the love and support of family, helping guide them to independence, education, and self-sufficiency.

title: Assist with Governance as a BOARD MEMBER for our Thriving Charity.
description:
The primary duties of The Metro Mentorship Initiative’s (TMMI) Board of Directors include setting policy, evaluating programs, representing the organization in the community and helping the company with fundraising. The Board also appoints, hires, evaluates and supervises the Executive Director of TMMI, working closely with this role to ensure organizational effectiveness, quality and integrity.


Help with council and if necessary, act on the organization's behalf in legal and financial contexts. Our goal is to be compliant with tax law and federal/state regulations regarding non-profit activities. This volunteer will help set important guidelines for the organization so that there is low risk of liability and proper governance with corporate leadership. Experience in risk management would be beneficial and preferred to ensure the engagement of all our partners.
missionStatement: The Metro Mentorship Initiative (TMMI) is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit public charity that provides wraparound support and resources to partners by helping their mentoring causes achieve sustainability and be viable in marginalized communities.
organizationDescription: TMMI primarily seeks to be collaborative with entities that facillitates mentoring programs for individuals (children, teens, young adults) from low-income communities. This organization was formed out of a genuine belief that mentoring initiatives must have sustainable resources and tools in order to effectively cause global change. Our agency will provide full-service support to partner entities that focus on serving kids, teens, young adults in four key pillars: EDUCATION, TECHNOLOGY, JOB READINESS/EMPLOYMENT AND PUBLIC HEALTH & FITNESS .

title: Grocery Delivery | Support Families Facing Food Insecurity | CFF
description: We have launched our newest initiative- Care Pack grocery deliveries! For the past few months we have been packaging essential kitchen items (such as dairy products, grains, bread, protein, non-perishables, etc.) and delivering them to families facing food insecurity. Where do you come in? By getting good food to good people!We are looking for volunteers to help us assemble grocery boxes and drivers to help us deliver the grocery boxes to our families in need. Each family receives 1-3 boxes, weighing 35-60lbs per box. We assemble the Care Packs with food. All you have to do is drive to our location, get the family's address, and fulfill the contactless delivery to their home. (Delivery driver is not required - volunteers may just…
missionStatement: Care for Friends provides easy access to community, food and overall wellness for Chicago’s most vulnerable and under-served people, in an atmosphere of dignity and respect. Through its programs, Care for Friends successfully connects people with community resources to enable them to achieve a better quality of life.
organizationDescription: Our flagship program is "Food for Friends" - where we create a safe space for anyone requiring a meal to gather in community for a no-cost hot lunch served in sit-down, family style with dignity and respect.

title: Donation Bundling at Inspired Home Show with Habitat for Humanity Chicago
description:
It’s time for one of our biggest volunteer events - the Inspired Home Showon Tuesday, March 4.At this annual event, vendors donate their brand-new product to ReStore and other local nonprofits once the trade show is over. At the conclusion of the show, our volunteers will pack the product to be delivered to both ReStores.In 2024, we packed 100 pallets of kitchenware, home goods, and tools that were sold at ReStore, generating tens of thousands of dollars in sales which went back into Habitat Programs and Chicago communities.


Snacks, a meal and a T-shirt provided to every volunteer on each shift.Inspired Home Show takes place at McCormick Place. Visit our website for more information and to register for this event:…
missionStatement: The purpose of ReStore Chicago is to contribute to the work of Habitat for Humanity by building strength, stability and self-reliance through shelter. We raise funds by selling donated home goods to the public at largely reduced rates, funneling 100% of the proceeds into Habitat for Humanity Chicago's efforts to support our city. When you support your local ReStore by shopping, donating or volunteering, you're not just supporting your local community, you’re helping to provide assistance to the 259,000 people facing critical housing needs in Chicago.
organizationDescription: The ReStore is Habitat for Humanity's ecosystem in action - every purchase, donation and volunteer hour breathes life into our mission. Each simple yet significant act contributes to bringing safe, affordable housing to the 1 in 10 Chicagoans who need assistance.Every year, ReStore Chicago diverts over 800 tons of goods from the landfill and reinvests half a million dollars directly into the communities that need it most. We invite people of all backgrounds, races, and religions to volunteer at our location at 6040 N Pulaski. From customer service to merchandising to event planning, ReStore Chicago offers a variety of volunteer opportunities geared toward individual interests and skills. In addition to helping families create safe, decent, and affordable housing, you can expect a fun and rewarding time while volunteering. It’s a great place to interact with staff and volunteers while engaging with your community. Opportunities are available Tuesday through Sunday all year round, as well as during special events at trade shows and exhibitions.You can sign up today by visiting our volunteer portal and registering for ReStore Volunteer 101. Take the first step in becoming a ReStore Chicago volunteer now: https://habitatchicago.volunteerhub.com/

title: Volunteer with Project Helping in Chicago!
description:
Project Helping is a Denver, Colorado-based 501 (c)(3). Our mission is to improve mental wellness through accessible experiences that create purpose and connection. We do this through volunteering, as research shows that giving back to the community is great for mental wellness. Essentially, we partner with local nonprofits, discuss what their volunteer needs are, and present those as opportunities to our volunteer base.


Browse our volunteer opportunities and register for events here: projecthelping.org/chicago/
missionStatement: Volunteering improves your mental wellness. We make it ridiculously easy to volunteer so you can access this meaningful self-care tool.
organizationDescription: We organize and lead group volunteer events to make it incredibly easy to volunteer and use the act of serving others to improve mental wellness.

title: Help some new friends navigate the food market.
description: Love to serve? Then here is your chance to put that passion to work, every Saturday of the month between the hours of 10am--3pm we have an opportunity for you. missionStatement: Our mission is to help the homeless and needy find stable housing, and to empower them to become gainfully employed. To instill a sense of respect, value, worth and dignity for life. As well as integrate all into the family of God and the life of the Church.
organizationDescription: StreetHope at New Hope is a ministry created to love, care for, befriend, and reach the poor and needy of the inner city. We desire to give them a place where they can belong and begin to live a life with meaning and purpose, enabling them to experience of life of value and worth in this world. Our hope is to ultimately have a facility that will enable us to have a shelter and in-house program to help those men and women who genuinely desire to live changed lives and become productive members of the community and society to the honor and glory of God. StreetHope at New Hope has been in existence for over 15 years and has assisted thousands of community members over that time. As we continue to love our friends would you join us.

title: Hospital Volunteer
description:
Ascension Saint Mary - Chicago is looking for friendly, compassionate volunteers with excellent customer service skills to serve our patients and visitors.


We have opportunities available in many departments including: Associate Health, Cardiology, Food Services, Front Desk Greeter, GI Lab, Inpatient Care units, Women's Health Program, Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Shipping & Receiving, Surgery, ED, Rehab Services, Infection Control, and Medical Staff.


Volunteers are assigned to a department by Volunteer Services based on the medical center's needs.


Volunteer Requirements: Positive and friendly attitude, reliable, responsible, and excellent communication and customer service skills

• Minimum age of 16 at the time of application
• Able and willing to dedicate a minimum of 100 hours within a year…
missionStatement: Our Unified Mission Commitment is the joining of our Heritage, Mission, Vision and Values that help us bring to life the healing ministry of Jesus. We call it "unified" because it draws on elements of our Adventist, Ascension and local heritages. We have a "mission commitment" because we want to reaffirm daily our commitment to steward the business of healthcare in fidelity to our mission.​
organizationDescription: Ascension Saint Mary - Chicago is an award-winning medical center on Chicago's near northwest side. For more than a century, we have delivered outstanding, compassionate medical care, which are hallmarks of our facility. We have a rich history in the community -- providing patients and their families with patient- and family-centered care from the moment they walk through our doors. Ascension St Mary - Chicago ranks No. 26 out of 118 Chicago metro area hospitals in U.S. News & World Report's 2014-15 "Best Hospitals" rankings. Ascension St Mary - Chicago earned distinctions as high-performing in three specialties: nephrology, neurology and neurosurgery and urology. Our medical center has an outstanding health-care team of primary care doctors, specialists, nurses and staff who provide care. Our team is highly skilled, compassionate, multilingual and attentive to patient and family needs. On staff, we have more than 500 physicians in 40 specialties.

title: Event Volunteer Help! Ongoing opportunity with flexibility
description:
Chicago Angels is looking for individuals who would like to volunteer at a variety of events. We typically have a least one event per month. Our fundraisers and community events always need extra hands and that is where you come in!


Chicago Angels is a non-profit organization that works to walk alongside children, youth, and families in the foster care community by offering consistent support through intentional giving, relationship building, and mentorship.
missionStatement: The Chicago Angels mission is to walk alongside children, youth, and families in the foster care community by offering consistent support through intentional giving, relationship building, and mentorship. Our vision to ensure that every child, youth, and family in the foster care community has healthy, affirming, and lasting relationships. We do this by educating and empowering the local community and by recruiting compassionate, committed, and diverse volunteers to offer support through intentional giving, relationship building, and mentorship. Intentional Giving: Give thoughtful and personal resources, gifts, and care packages that meet the real needs of the child and their entire family. Relationship Building: Devote time and energy to fostering healthy relationships that promote healing through connections and interpersonal bonding. Mentorship: Equip and empower the youth in our programs to be prepared for independent living and to reach their fullest potential.
organizationDescription: LOVE BOX PROGRAM

title: Music Therapy Instructor
description:
The Dina and Eli Field EZRA Multi-Service Center is searching for a volunteer to lead our music therapy class!


Formal therapy credentials are not required; we’re looking for someone who has a passion for music, ability to play/sing, and a desire to share that joy with others. This is a great opportunity to make a meaningful impact by using music to support and enrich the lives of our clients.


If this sounds like a good fit for you, reach out today by clicking the 'I Want to Help' button!You can also contact our Program and Outreach Associate directly: AudreyBrown@juf.org | 773-467-3845
missionStatement: Our Jewish values dictate that we provide the resources necessary to help people live with dignity. EZRA, the Hebrew word for Help, is committed to "Tikkun Olam," repairing the world. We do this through professional and compassionate interventions in response to human suffering, with appreciation that all are created in God's image; EZRA offers help to anyone in need.
organizationDescription: EZRA's services strive to alleviate homelessness, hunger, unemployment and other self-sufficiency barriers. In addition, EZRA offers social activities and holiday celebrations to ensure that Jews who live in poverty remain actively connected to their heritage. EZRA is funded through the Jewish United Fund/Jewish Federation of Metropolitan Chicago and is administered by Jewish Community Center of Chicago.

missionStatement: Proudly founded by ethnic Chinese refugees in 1981, the Chinese Mutual Aid Association (CMAA) is led by many prominent individuals from the Asian American community. Our purpose is to serve the needs, promote the interests, and enhance the well-being of low-income, diverse immigrant and refugee communities across metropolitan Chicago through social services, advocacy, educational programming, and assistance for youth, adults, the elderly, and small businesses.
organizationDescription: CMAA is a pan-Asian social services non-profit serving people of all ethnic backgrounds from more than 60 countries, generations from youth to seniors, and abilities. Through our Chicago office and Elgin, IL satellite office, CMAA is dedicated to providing a wide range of programs to meet its community’s diverse needs, including in-home care services, English as a Second Language courses, immigration case assistance, job placement and consultation services, an Illinois Small Business Development Center, and youth programs.

title: Event Day Volunteer - Komen Chicago Race for the Cure
