Join us at our MONTHLY (virtual) Chicago Scholars New Mentor Open House to learn more about becoming a mentor:…
missionStatement: Chicago uniquely select, train, and mentor academically ambitious students from under-resourced communities to complete college and become the next generation of leaders who will transform their neighborhoods and our city.
organizationDescription: Chicago Scholars is transforming the leadership landscape of our city by resolving the fundamental barriers to success for academically driven, first generation college students from under-resourced communities. Through college counseling, mentoring, and by providing a supportive community to our Scholars through each phase of our program: College Access: Launch, College Persistence: Lift and College to Careers: Lead, we ensure that they realize their full potential as students and leaders.

title: Looking for volunteers for Lollapalooza in Chicago
description: We need assistance on running our guest services if you are interested please email us back for pertinent information...Thanks
missionStatement: Goodman Homes, Inc.’s mission is to reduce recidivism and incarceration, improve the outcomes of formerly incarcerated individuals, and build healthier communities. Goodman Homes, Inc. seeks to accomplish this mission in a three-fold approach: (1) to advocate for fair and just policies that: reduce crime, decrease the use of incarceration, and serve the needs and well-being of formerly incarcerated people; (2) to provide housing, services, and resources to rebuild broken men and women affected by the criminal justice system that improves outcomes; and (3) to build healthier communities by returning motivated, mentally prepared, and high character men and women from incarceration to crime-ridden neighborhoods to serve as ambassadors for change. In brief, Goodman Homes, Inc. is a support network, a connection to services and support, and an advocate for just and fair policies.
organizationDescription: At Goodman Homes, Inc., we dedicate ourselves to supporting people re-entering society after incarceration. We provide a wide range of resources and services to help people successfully transition into their new lives. Our team is composed of experienced professionals who are passionate about helping people overcome challenges and achieve their goals. We believe in creating a supportive environment that fosters growth and encourages personal development.

title: IVC Seeks Active Seniors for the Chicago Area
description:
Active Senior? Eager to "give something back?"


The Ignatian Volunteer Corps is accepting volunteers (age 50 ) to work with the poor two days a week in the Chicago area.
missionStatement: The Ignatian Volunteer Corps (IVC) harnesses the expertise of individuals over 50 who have the passion and commitment to direct their attention to issues impacting their region. Service Corps Members use their time and experience to give back and make a difference. They are leaders of change, offering vital resources to organizations, churches and schools that are at the heart of these struggling communities. Through their direct service among the materially poor, members enter the lived experience of others, showing respect for the dignity and equality of those they serve and serve with.
organizationDescription: IVC works in partnership with hundreds of community partner organizations. These nonprofit organizations provide IVC Service Corps Members with substantive work to serve individuals who have slipped through this country’s safety net. And hundreds of community organizations are on waiting lists to get an IVC corps member.

title: OPEN CALL for new performers
description: Join us at the Glenwood Dance Studio on Sun. March 9th for our first practice for the 2025 season. Practice is then once a week every Sunday.We are a Country Dancing performing group The Second City Outlaws. It's a great way to meet people doing a really fun activity. We perform in summer festivals and parades including the Chicago Pride Parade. NOW is the time to get involved in the COUNTRY DANCING FUN AND ENTERTAINMENT ahead. All you have to do is reply and let us know!It's OK if you are inexperienced or a new dancer. We'll teach you everything you need to know every week at practice.
missionStatement: The Second City Outlaws 501(c)(3) Non-Profit Charity Organization (Federal ID 83-1702277) takes great PRIDE in being a Mainstream Country Dancing Performing Group that is OPEN and Inclusive to ALL Country Dancers regardless of age, race or gender identity throughout Chicagoland. It's always completely FREE to be a member of the team thanks to our wonderful sponsors! It's a great way to meet people doing a really fun activity. We perform in summer festivals and parades including the Chicago Pride Parade.
organizationDescription: At each performance we hand out information cards that showcase all of our sponsors. We strongly believe that as a community it is our responsibility to be supportive of each other. We are stronger together. ​

title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children
description:
MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers and related volunteers in Illinois. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation.


MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check…
missionStatement: Any child who has musical potential deserves the opportunity to nurture this talent to its full extent.
organizationDescription: Many children lack the chance to receive music lessons due to financial need. The MusicLink Foundation reaches out to low-income families by linking these students with professional music teachers willing to reduce their fee to make the lessons more affordable for the child. The MusicLink Foundation does not reimburse teachers for this scholarship donation, but supports them in a variety of ways. MusicLink is all across the US and Canada, and is celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2017.

title: After School Tutor
description:
The Rohingya have been denied formal education due to the genocidal Myanmar government, and many families are preliterate. This creates significant challenges for young students who are unable to receive academic help from their parents and other family members.


Many K-12 students come to RCC after school to get help in their classes. That means we need dedicated and hardworking volunteers to support them!


Academic Support serves as a safe space for students to complete homework, study, and read. (Sept-June only).
missionStatement: The Rohingya Culture Center is a community based social service organization aimed at serving the needs of the Rohingya refugee population in Chicago as well as raising awareness of the persecution of the Rohingya in Burma/Myanmar.
organizationDescription: RCC opened its doors in April 2016. Our purpose then and now was to help the Rohingya refugees in Chicago become self-sufficient in the US. RCC now serves one of the largest Rohingya populations in the US. Rohingya from other cities move to Chicago because they know we are an organization they can trust. We currently support 500+ families. Without the help RCC provides Chicago’s Rohingya community, their struggle could well be overwhelming.

title: Make a Difference for Persons with Disabilities.  Become a Human Rights Authority Member.
description: The Human Rights Authority is a division of the Illinois Guardianship and Advocacy Commission that is statutorily empowered to investigate alleged violations of the rights of persons with disabilities, including persons with behavioral health needs, cognitive disabilities, physical disabilities and older individuals with disabilities. There are nine Authorities throughout the state and separated according to geographic regions. The membership of each Authority consists of nine volunteers. Three of these, by statute, are providers of disability services, one each from the areas of mental health, developmental disability services and rehabilitation/vocational services. The remaining six members are service consumers, family members of consumers or concerned citizens interested in advocating for disability rights. Members attend monthly meetings and serve on investigative teams. For further information, contact Jeremy Polk at 312-793-5908 or Jon Burnet at 217-785-1540 or submit and online application at https://www2.illinois.gov/sites/gac/HRA/Pages/Volunteers.aspx. The Human Rights Authority has improved disability rights protections for thousands of individuals. Join us today!
missionStatement: The Illinois Guardianship and Advocacy Commission safeguards the rights of persons with disabilities by providing public guardianship services, legal representation and a process to investigate alledged rights violations.
organizationDescription: The agency provides court appointed guardianship services to the mentally and physically disabled. It also investigates claims of human rights violations in residential treatment facilities and provides legal representation for the disabled.

title: Give Children the Greatest Gift
description:
When a child is in pain or feeling ill, you never hear them say "I want to go to Disney World". Rather, they say "I WANT MY MOMMY" or "I WANT MY DADDY" and we make it easier for Mommy and/or Daddy to spend time with their critically ill and/or medically fragile child by having volunteers help with some of the day-to-day tasks that rob parents of important time and energy, like housekeeping, laundry, lawn maintenance, pet care, and other little jobs.


***ADDRESS LISTING IS NOT EXACT - VOLUNTEERS ARE MATCHED WITH A FAMILY AS CLOSE TO THEIR HOME AS POSSIBLE AND ARE LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE GREATER CHICAGOLAND AREA***
missionStatement: Normal Moments, Inc. is devoted to supporting parents with critically ill children in the home, in the hospital, and via web resources so that they can spend as much time as possible sharing the most normal moments possible with their children. We will achieve this goal by alleviating the home stresses while parents sit with their hospital-bound child, by providing them with experienced resources to whom they can vent or who can be used as sounding boards either in person or by telephone, by reducing some daily cares such as housecleaning, lawn maintenance, and meals from local restaurants, by providing a consolidated location where they can research medications and treatment protocols via links to reputable websites, among other services, and by providing access to other service providers who can assist them with those needs not met by Normal Moments, Inc. All services will be provided on a charitable basis without consideration to race, religion, financial need, or any requirement beyond the medical needs of the child.
organizationDescription: Normal Moments provides housekeeping, lawn maintenance, restaurant meals, house sitting, pet care, and other services to parents of critically ill chidlren. Parents need to be able to focus on their child(ren) during these times and to have as much extraneous stress alleviated so that they can be a source of strength for their child(ren). We aim to relieve their stress through the tasks we perform and the services we offer. Serivces are currently offered only in the Chicagoland area but we hope to expand as our resources grow.

title: Youth Tutor
description:
Changing schools is difficult enough; now imagine your new school is in a completely different country, culture, and language. This is the reality for refugee and immigrant youth when they first start school in America. As a Youth Tutor, you can help ease this transition by coming alongside them and their parent(s) as they begin the process of adjusting to school and pursuing academic success.


You’ll have the opportunity to help with homework, build a friendship, practice English, provide social-emotional support, and-in some settings-enjoy fun activities together like soccer, art, etc. Tutors are normally paired with a student of the same gender in one of our after-school clubs or outside of our clubs at a mutually determined time, meeting in-person or virtually in some locations.


A typical commitment is about 1 - 2 hours once a week over a school semester. Training is provided.
missionStatement: At World Relief Chicagoland, we come alongside refugees and other immigrants in vulnerable situations as they rebuild their lives in the United States. For over 40 years, we’ve been welcoming immigrants and refugees across Chicagoland, starting with refugee resettlement in Chicago and DuPage County (1979), and later in Aurora (1999). For decades, we have empowered churches, community organizations and people like you to adapt to the challenges of the moment for the sake of refugees. As needs have increased in recent years, we have expanded our work beyond refugees to include all immigrants in vulnerable situations. Today, World Relief Chicagoland is part of a national network of offices through which over 400,000 immigrants and refugees have been welcomed into this country.
organizationDescription: Our work consists of refugee resettlement, community-based ESL (English as a Second Language), mental health services, and immigrant legal services, employment counseling, and more. We work with volunteers from all walks of life from college students to retirees. If you want to help the refugees and immigrants in your community, we can help you connect with them.

title: USHERING AT THEATERS and RECEIVING A SEAT AS A GIFT FROM THEATER
description:
The Saints are volunteers for the performing arts. At the present time our 1600+ members serve well over one hundred Chicago and suburban theater, dance and music organizations, ranging in size from storefronts to world-class theaters, from seasonal musical groups to world-trotting dance companies.


The Saints members provide help to these groups for a variety of activities including ushering at performances and in return are allowed to attend these activities and performances at no charge. Members choose the venues and performances where they want to volunteer, as often as they like.The Saints also awards financial grants to not-for-profit performing arts organizations located in Chicago and the surrounding area. In 2022…
missionStatement: The mission of The Saints shall be to support arts organizations (primarily not-for-profit) in Chicago and nearby communities through volunteer and charitable services.
organizationDescription: The Saints exists to support Chicago's performing arts through ushering and raising grants for theater companies. We have been in operation since 1980, supporting our city's illustrious and world-famous performing arts.

title: PAWS Chicago Lincoln Park Adoption Center Volunteer
description:
Want to make a life-saving difference for homeless cats and dogs? Consider volunteering at PAWS Chicago, the city’s largest No Kill animal shelter!


PAWS Chicago is a national model in sheltering, committed to bringing an end to the killing of homeless cats and dogs in our community, and volunteers play an invaluable role in nearly every aspect of our life-saving efforts. PAWS Chicago offers a wide variety of volunteer opportunities within each of our programs and volunteers can train for any role or program they are interested in! This enables our volunteers to bring personal expertise from their own backgrounds to enable us to save more lives.


We are especially looking for volunteers with weekday availability. If you have weekday availability, please email volunteers@pawschicago.org…
missionStatement: PAWS Chicago is Chicago's largest non-profit, no-kill humane organization whose work is focused on alleviating our city's tragic pet overpopulation problem. PAWS Chicago envisions a no-kill Chicago - a city in which pets are not destroyed just because they are homeless.
organizationDescription: PAWS Chicago's solution to ending the pet overpopulation epidemic in Chicago is through targeted free and low-cost spay/neuter, community outreach and humane education and innovative adoption events.

title: Volunteer Tutors needed for Adult Literacy, ESL, Digital Literacy
description:
Unlock the door to a brighter future by becoming a Volunteer Tutor at Literacy Chicago! You can make a real impact in the lives of adults seeking to learn to read, enhance their English skills, embark on the journey to citizenship, or gain proficiency in Digital Literacy.


No experience is needed. We provide a fun, comprehensive 15-hour training program that ensures you're fully equipped to make a difference from day one.


Literacy Chicago is a non-profit organization with a heart for understanding. We embrace diversity and create a safe, non-judgmental space for learning.
missionStatement: ​Literacy Chicago's mission is to empower individuals to achieve greater self-sufficiency through language and literacy instruction.
organizationDescription: Established in 1968, thousands of adults have participated in the broad range of programs Literacy Chicago has developed, including Basic Literacy, GED preparation, English as a Second Language, Workforce Development, Citizenship classes, Digital Literacy, and numerous bridge programs. Dedicated tutor volunteers contribute significantly to Literacy Chicago's success and make a big difference in the lives of the students they work with.

title: Help organize taste of science Chicago - A SciFest for grown-ups
description:
Kids get plenty of science festivals - so we make something for adults, for them to play.


taste of science is an events series and annual festival dedicated to bringing scientists out of the lab, in from the field and away from their computers to meet with non-specialist audiences in their favorite places. We are a national organization with community roots. Those involved are hardworking, creative and passionate people dedicated to making science more accessible to everyone. Find out more here:  www.tasteofscience.org/volunteer.


As a volunteer you would be working to connect your local community with the exciting and valuable research being carried out at…
missionStatement: Our mission is to create community-based connections between people and science that would not exist otherwise. We want to do this regardless of the background of our volunteers or the communities that we engage with.
organizationDescription: Scientists, Inc. is a nonprofit dedicated to science outreach. We connect with our non-specialist audience through events such as our national annual taste of science festival, a week long program dedicated to adults. Every year, our festival runs simultaneously in multiple cities across the US. In 2019 we reached 16 city chapters lead by volunteers, featuring scientists, researchers, engineers and artists from their local institutions.

title: General volunteer help
description:
Our nonprofit engages with the youth, by use of STEM radio-control truck racing events.  We seek individuals who are willing to assist us with getting ready(charging batteries, managing the score table, race track setup, and organizing the youth) for the race day.  This does not require heavy lifting or anything that is physically intrusive.  We are trying to build our team to better position ourselves to have a seamless experience every time.  We run three, nine-week sessions annually. Our sessions are every Saturday(8a - 1p).  Our 2025 dates are listed below.Please, go to our website(www.cobraback.org) and make sure that this is an organization you're willing to support and grow with as we move forward.  We have a lot of video content for you to look through, under the "Media" tab. Please click through all of our sections under this tab.  This is an ongoing position.


1st Trimester(8a - 1p)…
missionStatement: Block by block, building stronger residential blocks. One strong block, one strong cluster of blocks, one strong community. We are definitely stronger together.
organizationDescription: The Cobra Back Foundation(CBF) was founded to fill voids. The Founder, E. Dixon, has been a civil servant in the City of Chicago since 2001 and has devoted his life to helping residents and guests of the city. CBF will focus on the subjects listed below, in an effort to create solutions, unity, safer neighborhoods, and ultimately foster a better partnership between Police and those in the communities they serve in. * Community Policing and understanding perspectives* Self-awareness and self-defense* Competitive Youth radio-controlled truck program* Assisting underserved families and individuals* Touring the city's most challenged areas in search of appropriate solutions

title: Be a Friendly Visitor: Make a Meaningful Impact on an Older Adult's Life!
description:
Join us in making a positive impact on isolated older adults. Our friendly visitors are a source of companionship, connection, and smiles to older adults in the greater Chicago area. As a volunteer, you'll be a lifeline to our clients and residents by spending quality time sharing stories, laughter, and experiences that create cherished memories.


Don't wait to make a difference! Sign up now to volunteer with CJE SeniorLife and experience giving back. Your commitment will transform their lives and enrich your own journey with new friendships and personal growth.


Contact us today at volunteers@cje.net or 773-508-4232 to learn more and take the first step toward becoming a friendly visitor.
missionStatement: The mission of CJE SeniorLife is to enhance quality of life and facilitate independence of older adults. At CJE SeniorLife, we fulfill our mission and realize our vision for and on behalf of our Clients, our Clients’ families, our Staff, our Board Members and our Volunteers by striving for excellence through Respect, Advocacy, Compassion, Intention, Innovation and Accountability.
organizationDescription: Since 1972, CJE SeniorLife has enhanced the lives of older adults and their families through a comprehensive network that includes housing, health care, community services, health and wellness education, life enrichment programs and applied research. CJE SeniorLife serves older adults and their families throughout Chicago and its surrounding suburbs.

title: Volunteer Buddy with Jill's House Camper with Disabilities
description:
Weekend Adventures are exciting weekends away at camp for kids (ages 6 to 17) with intellectual disabilities. As a volunteer, you will be a kid’s assigned "buddy" for a whole weekend of fun and engaging activities! There are always staff around who are trained to handle any medical or behavioral changes, so you and your team can simply focus on having fun with your campers as they enjoy activities such as archery, hiking, rope swings, s’mores, campfires, bounce castles... and so much more!


And while you and your buddy are having an awesome weekend, their families are given critical time to rest and recharge. This is truly a gift you are giving to the parents and will empower them in their lives and relationships.


We welcome groups or individuals, ages 16 and older and provide all the training you’ll need! Our staff are with you every step of the way, so no special needs experience is required. All you need is a heart to serve these wonderful kids…
missionStatement: Jill’s House celebrates children with special needs and provides relief to the extraordinary families who love them through short-term, overnight respite care. https://youtu.be/YYiXgsZS6As
organizationDescription: Description

title: Monthly Saturday Volunteering with Volunteering Untapped Chicago!
description: We strive to "untap" resources and opportunities in Chicago for those we serve. Join us for volunteering on the second Saturday morning of every month. We partner with different nonprofits each month, so not only will you get to know different organizations across Chicagoland - we hope you find a cause you want to keep supporting!To sign up for our next event visit: https://volunteeringuntappedchi.org/ We reward the hard work of our volunteers by tapping beers at the bar (or at our home during virtual events), tapping into new connections with other young people, and tapping into new opportunities and relationships through giving back and inspiring change in our communities.Note: Given the COVID-19 pandemic, we are consistently offering virtual volunteer events. All in-person events are subject to local…
missionStatement: Improving Chicago through increasing volunteerism.
organizationDescription: Chicago possesses compassionate individuals who care about their communities and want to make a change. Up until now though, those individuals and their individual talents have been underutilized.

title: Chicago Chapter Leader
description:
MVA is looking for Chapter Leaders to help support the growth of a local chapter of MVA in Chicago.Responsibilities:Chicago Chapter Leaders will be responsible to:

• Develop and cultivate positive relationships with community partners (nonprofits, government agencies, and businesses) in your geographic location
• Work with staff to plan and facilitate monthly community events
• Facilitate food distribution and maintain minority veteran food pantry
• Conduct outreach efforts to signup veterans for the community events…
missionStatement: Minority Veterans of America (MVA) is a 501(c)(3) organization that is dedicated to create belonging and advance equity for underrepresented veterans. MVA will receive grants for four key purposes: The primary underrepresented groups that MVA serves are: veterans of color, womxn, LGBTQ, and religious and non-religious minorities. We believe that through bringing these four minority groups together, we can build a veteran community that encompasses veterans from a wide range of diverse backgrounds and experiences. By bringing together these specific communities of underrepresented veterans, we are able to hear the voices and stories and better understand the needs of those that we wish to serve. In properly advocating for the needs of our constituents, we have the opportunity to change the landscape of services for those who feel as though they have been forgotten in the veteran community.
organizationDescription: MVA was founded in November of 2017 by two University of Washington Husky veterans, Lindsay Church and Katherine Pratt. Church and Pratt first began their work in 2014 through the Husky United Military Veterans where they built a Diversity Committee that celebrated the underrepresented groups within the student veteran community at the University of Washington.

title: Hospital Elder Life Program Volunteer
description: Hospital Elder Life Program (HELP) is a patient care program that helps prevent delirium and functional decline in older hospitalized patients. Using a trained team, HELP addresses a wide range of geriatric issues during a patient’s hospitalization by providing support to keep the patient comfortable and conducting activities to keep them mentally and physically active.
missionStatement: The mission of Rush University Medical Center is to provide the very best care for our patients. Our education and research endeavors, community service programs and relationships with other hospitals are dedicated to enhancing excellence in patient care for the diverse communities of the Chicago area, now and in the future.
organizationDescription: Rush University Medical Center will be recognized as the medical center of choice in the Chicago area and among the very best clinical centers in the United States.

title: Volunteers Needed for our Outreach Events to Help Homeless
description: We are looking for volunteers to help with our Outreach Events for the Homeless. So many people are in need and we are dedicated to doing our part to help in anyway we can. We are looking for individuals that can volunteer every month to go out with us to give meals, hygiene kits, and clothing items to the homeless within our local Chicago communities. If able and interested we thank you in advance and ask that you contact us at outreachevents@preacherhead.org to sign up or learn more about how you can help us serve others!!To learn more about the work we do in the community please visit our website at www.preacherhead.org **We follow CDC social guidelines during our outreach events**
missionStatement: The mission of PreacherHead Ministries is to preach the gospel globally and help the poor and needy. Our initiatives thrive on these two objectives. We want to reach the 80,000 homeless people in the Chicagoland and beyond. We love and welcome the opportunity to serve and give back to those that are less fortunate.
organizationDescription: We teach the Bible from Genesis to Revelation and share bible studies every Friday evening and Saturday afternoon. You are more than welcome to join us virtually. Since 2006 we have conducted a Friday night Bible Study Conference Line. The conference began with five people and has now blossomed into a National Conference Line where people from all over the United States call in to hear the Word of God taught from the Bible. As a mission sent by God we went to Zimbabwe Africa for duration of 30 days. We journeyed to Zimbabwe to teach the brothers and sisters there the truth about God. This experience was life changing and an amazing eye-opener. We learned so many things while teaching so many amazing people. While in Zimbabwe we established a reputation with the National Radio Station and TV Platforms in the country. Our plan is to continue missionary journeys to Zimbabwe Africa to service the people there using this Teaching Ministry.

title: Play a musical instrument for memory support residents!
description:
About:


We're looking for a volunteer for our award-winning Memory Support Unit to keep residents company by playing a musical instrument for them.


Time Commitment: Minimum once a week at the same time every week. Day of the week is semi-flexible but mornings are preferred.


Responsibilities and Expectations:


*  Play music on your instrument for residents on a weekly basis…
missionStatement: At nor •VOL• ution we are mission-driven and our vision is an important part of that. We are sponsored by Norwood Life Society; a 501c(3) organization dedicated to enhancing the independence and well-being of older adults. Part of that enhancement is providing meaninful volunteer experiences for all members of our community; with a focus on creating or providing volunteer opportunities specifically for older adults who are looking to give back. Mission: The purpose of the new organization is to enrich the lives of members of the Norwood Life Society community including the seniors we serve, our volunteers, the staff, and the community at large. Vision: Our vision is to grow and strengthen our volunteer efforts to: 1) provide more services to our senior clientele, 2) enhance the lives of our volunteers, particularly mature adults, and 3) be of service to the broader community. Values Statement: We are committed and passionate about the work we do. We respect the personal contribution of each individual and honor the impact they make. We respect our neighbors and work with them to improve the community in which we all reside. We value volunteers for the friendly, caring spirit that has characterized this organization for over 100 years.
organizationDescription: Volunteers are welcomed and appreciated by all aspects of our organization. Volunteer opportunities are available in the following places:

title: Animal Transport Volunteer
description:
Position entails transporting pets.

• Transport pets to and from local places (vet, Skokie Petsmart, Norridge Petco, adoption events, training)
• All transport locations are within half hour of 60631 zipcode
• Email or text after transport to Executive Director
missionStatement: Chicago Pet Rescue is a PUBLIC BENEFIT501c(3) nonprofit corporation organized and operated exclusively for charitable purposes as an all volunteer run organization, supported entirely by donations and fundraisers. Our volunteers foster, transport, and in many other ways assist in this rescue effort.Our mission is to improve the quality of life for the homeless, needy animals of the community by providing the following services:
organizationDescription: CPR saves animals thru adoption.

title: Food Pantry Support
description:
Role: Food Pantry Support


About Us:  Open Arms Ministry is a non-profit based in Logan Square focused on obliterating poverty with a specific emphasis on homelessness and hunger.


Mission:  Open Arms Ministry is a community leveraging collective power to  end hunger, homelessness and wholistic poverty to create nourishment, safe housing, and gainful employment . We do this through a transformative shared space and empowerment programs delivering equality and relationships with our brothers and sisters in need.


Vision : We are a transformative, shared space of nourishment, opportunity, and connection.


Objective:  In partnership with the Greater Chicago Food Depository, Open Arms Ministry’s Food Pantry provides grocery items to individuals and families experiencing food insecurity and/or homelessness. Even…
missionStatement: Open Arms Ministry supports and partners with those struggling with homelessness, poverty, and food insecurity to enhance human dignity, community, and opportunity.
organizationDescription: Open Arms Ministry has two programs addressing homelessness, poverty, and food insecurity on the northwest side of Chicago.

title: Help End Clothing Insecurity in Chicago - Volunteer with Cradles to Crayons!
description:
Cradles to Crayons (C2C), founded in 2002, provides children living in homeless or low-income situations, with the essential items they need to thrive-at home, at school, and at play. We supply clothing, shoes, diapers, school supplies, and more, free of charge. Our vision is that one day all children will have the essentials they need to thrive. We rely on volunteers to help us quality check, sort, and organize donated items to be packaged up and ready for distribution to our partners! We need your help!


We are looking for adult volunteers to help us during the weekdays in particular. We offer shifts Tuesday-Friday 10 am to 12 pm and 1:30-3:30 pm as well as Saturdays 10 am to 12 pm and 1:30-3:30 pm. All shifts must be scheduled in advance; we do not accept walk-ins. If you…
missionStatement: Cradles to Crayons (C2C), founded in 2002, provides children from birth through age 12, living in homeless or low-income situations, with the essential items they need to thrive--at home, at school, and at play. We supply clothing, shoes, diapers, school supplies, and more, free of charge. Our vision is that one day all children will have the essentials they need to thrive.
organizationDescription: Two in 5 kids in the United States are currently facing Clothing Insecurity, going without basic essentials like pants, shoes, diapers, and school supplies during their critical development years. Three of the top 10 reasons kids miss school are rooted in Clothing Insecurity-just one example of the significant short- and long-term social and economic costs when these needs go unmet. Cradles to Crayons keeps Clothing Insecurity at the core of our mission and is the only large-scale nonprofit organization to focus on this resource gap. Since its founding, Cradles to Crayons has distributed more than three million customized packages of essentials to children in Massachusetts, Greater Philadelphia, Chicagoland, and nationally, through Giving Factory Direct-a first-in-kind online product donation platform launched in 2021. Volunteers help to quality check, sort, and organize donations of essential items - such as clothing, shoes, books, school supplies, winter accessories, hygiene items, and more. We welcome volunteers as young as 5 years old with a parent/guardian to volunteer.

title: Join Us for the TBCC Community Giveaway March 29th
description:
Hello Volunteers,


We are excited to announce the upcoming TBCC Community Giveaway, taking place on Saturday, March 29th, from 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM at 459 W. 79th Street, Chicago, IL. This event is a wonderful opportunity to support our community by providing essential items to those in need, and we would love your help to make it a success!

• Setting up and organizing items before the event
• Welcoming community members and distributing items
• Helping with clean-up after the event
missionStatement: Our mission is to foster community relations throughout the local community by collaborating with community partners to offer supportive services for youth/young adults aged 11 to 24 in the Auburn Gresham, Englewood, Greater Grand Crossing, and the Chatham communities, empowering young women and men to live healthy, productive lives.
organizationDescription: For a decade, TBCC has been at the forefront of delivering impactful services in our targeted areas, gaining valuable experience in supporting high-risk individuals and families. Our focus encompasses mentoring, social-emotional learning, service learning, employment, delinquency prevention, and poverty alleviation. Proudly holding a CARF International accreditation for community youth development, which is a testament to our unwavering dedication to delivering high-quality services.

title: Food pantry volunteers needed - all shifts
description: The Friendship Center (TFC) supports the food-insecure populations of Chicago’s northwest side neighborhoods like Albany Park, Lincoln Square, North Park, Ravenswood, and West Ridge. We are a welcoming, fresh food, full-choice pantry providing hot meals, home delivery, and pet food distributions. Our food-rescue program is one of the largest in the city of Chicago. We serve over 4,500 neighbors facing hunger each month.However, it requires more volunteers than we currently have - we would love to have you join! Shifts are usually 2-3 hours and opportunities are every day except Sunday. Feel free to visit our website and sign up to view the specific tasks and when they are needed to be filled.Thanks for your consideration!
missionStatement: The Friendship Center fosters hope and dignity on Chicago’s northwest side through access to food and vital resources.
organizationDescription: Since 1969, The Friendship Center has operated as a food pantry on Chicago's northwest side. In addition to providing fresh fruits and vegetables, meats, dairy, and other groceries four days a week to our neighbors facing hunger, we offer a weekly hot meal service, homebound delivery, and a monthly pet food pantry. Located on Lawrence Avenue at Washtenaw Avenue, each year The Friendship Center supports over 24,000 food-insecure residents of Albany Park, Lincoln Square, North Park, Ravenswood, Lincolnwood, and West Ridge.

title: Looking for Influential and Passionate Board Members
description: Of Color Inc was founded in 2016 and incorporated in 2019. We seek a diverse board of directors to add to our portfolio (please view our website at www.ofcolorinc.org). Skillsets needed for this opportunity are those individuals with legal, corporate, marketing & communications, grant making, and fundraising expertise. We are currently a board of 10 and are seeking to grow to 11 with a professional that is connected to the corporate and philanthropic industry to help advance our agency mission. Our board meets 4 times per year with Officers meeting 4 additional times. Meetings are after work hours and board membership fees are $750 per year. Board terms are for two three-year periods. At this time, our board meets virtually with a plan to perhaps begin…
missionStatement: To help people of "all colors" enhance their own economic and education goals.
organizationDescription: Of Color Inc is a minority female owned and incorporated 501c3. We are founded on the belief that "all people" regardless of color, can achieve their highest dreams if given the proper resources and tools to do so. We offer a variety of workforce development and housing services to homeless veterans, young adults, and homeless families from under-resourced and forgotten communities. We also link individuals to health services. Our client's ages are 18 - 65. Our goals are many but specific to serving those most in need, helping them to get to economic and housing stability for a lifetime.

title: Request for Food Pantry Volunteers
description: Circle Urban Ministries' is a Community Outreach organization in Chicago's Austin Community since 1974. Through our core values of Serve First, Welcoming, Optimistic, Faith Based, and Family we adhere to our mission to Empower Communities and Transform Lives. Currently we are seeking individuals who are looking to make a difference, surround themselves with driven and caring people to volunteer in our Food Pantry. Our Food Pantry is small, but mighty, serving approximately 300-400 households a month. The ideal volunteer for this need could be someone looking to be more helpful in the Austin Community, someone who may enjoy a light work out and get more movement in their day, individuals looking to complete community service hours, or someone overall looking for a better way to spend their free time. No matter your ability, there is something for everyone…
missionStatement: Our corporate mission is to inspire, equip, and empower urban youth to develop Godly character, to reach their full potential, and to transform lives and communities on the Westside of Chicago.
organizationDescription: Since 1974, Circle Urban Ministries has worked to combat poverty, improve the educational, social, and vocational opportunities for at-risk youth, and help stabilize low-income families by providing a variety of quality social services and community development to our neighbors in Chicago’s Austin community. Our 5-building campus now houses the expertise of 5 of our strategic partners from the community. Circle Urban Ministries currently offers a comprehensive Youth Development After School Programs, Community Outreach & Crisis Intervention Services, and Food insecurity assistance through our Food Pantry.

title: Pigeon Transport Volunteer
description:
We are constantly transporting pigeons around the Great Lakes area, primarily in Greater Chicagoland and Northwest Indiana. If you’d like to give a pigeon a lift please let  us know where you’re located and what your transport availability is.1. We need volunteers  specifically to drive within Chicago. 2. We need volunteers specifically to drive back-and-forth between Chicago and the greater suburbs.


GLPR can provide mileage reimbursement if needed.
missionStatement: To save the lives of homeless domestic and non-releasable pigeons and doves in the Great Lakes region, who otherwise would face euthanasia or a slow death from lack of care, by providing foster homes, adoption services, medical treatment, and compassionate education about the need for pigeon and dove rescue.
organizationDescription: To address the absence of rescue and adoption services for pigeons and doves in the Great Lakes region. To enhance awareness of the suitability of rescued pigeons and doves as pets, especially as an alternative to the exotic pet trade. To advocate for pigeons and doves, and in doing so foster compassion for all living creatures.

title: GENERAL CALL: Volunteers
organization: Chicago City Theatre Co. dba Joel Hall Dancers & Center
description:
Joel Hall Dancers & Center seeks reliable and enthusiastic volunteers to support our classes, productions, and office administration. If you are interested -- and would like to support an organization that has expanded dance opportunities in Chicago since 1974 -- please send us a note!Some example opportunities:

• performance usher
• production staff
• financial and administrative support
• board development and recruiting
missionStatement: Joel Hall Dancers & Center awakens the dancer in everyone’s soul. By highlighting and spotlighting the Black and Brown and LGBTQIA+ experience, we provide comprehensive dance education and artistic expression. We believe dance is a powerful tool to educate and inspire, offering not only instruction in techniques but also deep insights into the history and cultural significance of dance. Our commitment to making dance accessible and affordable helps break down barriers and challenges oppressive systems. By championing Urban Jazz, we engage both performers and audiences to enhance our collective culture and educate future generations, cultivating a more inclusive and equitable world for all.
organizationDescription: JHDC builds upon its longstanding tenets of diversity and accessibility to provide movers of all backgrounds the same diligent commitment to artistry, curiosity, self-expression, and growth. JHDC rejects the idea that high-quality artistic programming should be a privilege; at JHDC, this level of programming is a right. Moreover, this programming is a tool for community building, for fostering creativity, and for having difficult but necessary conversations about how to productively dismantle issues like racism, sexism, transphobia, and homophobia.

title: Chipride Volunteering + Greater Chicago Food Depository
description:
Join LGBTQ+ and Ally Volunteers as we partner with the Greater Chicago Food Depository!


Volunteers will be packing food at the Chicago Food Depository. Come join us as we repack bulk products into family-sized portions, sort and categorize donated food items, glean fresh produce items and bread. This food will be distributed to food bank, soup kitchens and shelters across Cook County.
missionStatement: Chipride connects Chicago’s diverse LGBTQ+ community and allies through unified volunteerism. We strive to create a more inclusive city by centralizing opportunities that support a variety of non-profits, fostering connection and driving positive change at a local level.
organizationDescription: We are a local grassroots organization, formed by a group of local LGBTQ+ and Ally friends that want to make a difference. Our goal is to create a more vibrant, connected and inclusive Chicago.Chipride partners with other non-profit organizations and provides the human power to complete projects.

title: JASC Volunteer Receptionist
description: JASC is looking for volunteers to cover the front receptionist desk at our new facility on 5700 N. Lincoln Ave.  Volunteer shifts are available on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Business hours are 9:00-5:00. Applicants available during business hours are preferred, but shorter shifts are also available during peak hours (10:00-3:00)  Volunteer tasks include: 1. Greeting visitors and answering the phone 2. Check JASC info email, voicemail, and faxes 3. Setting up for special events and classes  Thank you for your support!  Please fill out this form if interested (you can copy and paste URL into your search bar):   https://forms.gle/fTuTDDqgzVwdgDGg6    Questions? Please contact: Tricia Soo, Director of Operationsoperations@jasc-chicago.org, 773.275.0097 x225
missionStatement: JASC engages people of all ages to experience Japanese American history and culture and to improve their well-being through innovative, high quality programs and services tailored to the multicultural community.
organizationDescription: Founded on August 30, 1946, the Japanese American Service Committee of Chicago originally served the needs of the Issei and Nisei (Japanese immigrants and their American-born children) who left World War II internment camps to resettle in Chicago and start new lives. As the needs of the community have changed over the years, so, too, have the programs and services provided by the JASC.

title: Environmental Engagement Assistant
organization: THE GAIA-MOVEMENT LIVING EARTH GREEN WORLD ACTION USA INC
description: We are offering all high school and college students in the Chicagoland area the ability to volunteer at the Gaia Climate Center in Chicago. This will afford them the ability to make a change in the community as well as earn volunteer hours! They will be doing beautification by cleaning up the area of debris and trash, planting and caring for the garden, completing renewal process for bird sanctuary, and compiling donations for local organizations and shelters. Tasks may not be given at one period but spread over the course of multiple volunteer shifts. Our goal is to uplift and promote the livelihood and beautification of Chicago, while also encouraging sustainability and environmental efforts to help the planet!
missionStatement: To create awareness about the ongoing plight of the environment and to educate everyone in caring for our planet, humanity, and the environment.
organizationDescription: Gaia USA is a textile reuse and recycling organization that supports environmental projects worldwide. We frequently make in-kind donations to local organizations such as shelters, homeless centers, churches, and food pantries. In addition, we make beautification efforts for the surrounding area including cleaning up garbage, maintaining a sustainable community garden, and taking care of our bird sanctuary. We aim to spread awareness about environmentalism and encourage sustainable efforts by everyone.

title: Urgent Need for Blood Donors! Save Lives Today!
description:
Join us in making a life-saving difference! We are urgently seeking volunteers to donate blood. Your donation can help save lives and provide critical support to those in need. Whether you're a first-time donor or a regular, your contribution is invaluable.


Why Volunteer?

• Every donation can save up to three lives.
• Blood is needed for surgeries, cancer treatment, chronic illnesses, and traumatic injuries.
• It's a simple and safe process that takes about an hour.
missionStatement: Connect Lives | Share Life
organizationDescription: Established in 1955, The Community Blood Center was founded in response to the need for a reliable, local blood supply. At that time, Outagamie County Medical Society voted to form a community blood donor program to service St. Elizabeth and Kaukauna Community Hospitals. We are so pleased that this foundation paved the way for our growth over the years. What started as a service to two hospitals has grown into a partnership with more than 40 hospitals throughout the Midwest.

title: Help Kids Read!
description:
Do you have a passion for reading? Come and volunteer with SitStayRead as a Book Buddy!


As a Book Buddy volunteer, you will work with a small group of students on different reading and writing activities. No previous classroom or reading experience is needed! We are recruiting for our three programs, Kindergarten through 2nd Grade.


SitStayRead is a non-profit that uses an engaging curriculum to advance children's literacy skills through our trained literacy volunteers and Certified Reading Assistance Dogs. We help Kindergarten through 1st Grade students on the South and West sides of Chicago.


We have in-person opportunities for volunteers to spend 1.5 hours, at…
missionStatement: Our mission is to advance children's literacy and builds confidence in young readers by using an engaging curriculum incorporating on social-emotional learning enriched by Certified Reading Assistance Dogs.
organizationDescription: We were founded in 2003 at Sulzer Library in Lincoln Square as a community outreach opportunity to re-engage aging therapy dogs. Shorty after, we transitioned to the classroom model, and created our own curriculum. We're Chicago's first and only literacy organizations that uses the power of the human-dog bond to advance kids' reading and writing skill. We have an emphasis on social-emotional learning built into our curriculums and the books we read, and we also support classrooms with our Bilingual (Spanish) curriculum.In the last 20 years we’ve evolved, changed, and grown significantly. So far, we’ve supported over 25,000 students, distributed over 60,000 books, and partnered with 27 schools and community partners.

title: Mentor a Youth in Foster Care
description: Each year, an estimated 25,000 youth across the U.S. emancipate or "age out" of the foster care system, and are at risk of having few adult supports or job opportunities. Safe Families PLUS (Providing Lasting Unconditional Support) Mentors are key partners in helping older youth successfully transition to adulthood. Mentors are paired with a youth or young adult between the ages of 14 to 21, and are expected to commit to at least a year of meeting on a consistent basis (twice per month). Mentors provide a safety net to fall back on after leaving the child welfare system.All Safe Families PLUS mentees have completed an application requesting a mentor, and have identified goals they would like support in. Some of the activities our mentors have assisted youth with: …
missionStatement: Safe Families PLUS (Providing Lasting Unconditional Support) Mentors are key partners in helping older youth successfully transition to adulthood. Mentors are paired with a youth or young adult between the ages of 14 to 21, and are expected to commit to at least a year of meeting on a consistent basis. Mentors can serve as "anchor families" to youth, providing a safety net to fall back on after leaving the child welfare system.
organizationDescription: Safe Families PLUS, in conjunction with the Department of Children and Family Services (DCFS), provides caring mentors to youth ages 14 to 21 as they transition to adulthood. Mentors come alongside the youth to provide them with support that endures. Through consistent, one-on-one contact, mentors helpyouth explore their self-identity, talents, strengths, and career interests. These relationships expose them to new experiences.

title: Companionship Volunteers Needed-East Chicago, IN
description:
At Transitions Care we rely on the support from our volunteers to share their time and talents to provide the highest level of care. We believe volunteers are a vital part to the patient care team as they provide comfort and companionship to the patient like no other. We have several volunteer opportunities to choose from that can be tailored to fit your busy schedule.


Our hospice companion volunteers visit with our patients a few times a month. These visits provide companionship to our patients and for patients living at home our volunteers provide much needed relief to primary caregivers to take some time for self-care. Common activities our volunteers do with our patients include

• Reading to the patient…
missionStatement: Our philosophy is to empower our patients and families by providing the tools and support necessary to embrace life. We don’t focus on the finality of death; we focus on the practical side of living. Our job is to assist our patients and families through the physical, emotional, and spiritual challenges of life’s final transition. We understand that to our patients and their families, it’s about living!
organizationDescription: At Transitions Hospice, we hold ourselves to the highest standards in hospice and palliative care. We specialize in supporting individuals and families who are facing the physical, emotional, social and spiritual challenges confronted when dealing with terminal illness. Hospice care neither prolongs nor shortens life. Our objective is to maximize our patients’ comfort and quality of life during the time they have remaining.

title: Urgent Need for Blood Donors! Save Lives Today!
description:
Join us in making a life-saving difference! We are urgently seeking volunteers to donate blood. Your donation can help save lives and provide critical support to those in need. Whether you're a first-time donor or a regular, your contribution is invaluable.


Why Volunteer?

• Every donation can save up to three lives.
• Blood is needed for surgeries, cancer treatment, chronic illnesses, and traumatic injuries.
• It's a simple and safe process that takes about an hour.
missionStatement: Connect Lives | Share Life
organizationDescription: Established in 1955, The Community Blood Center was founded in response to the need for a reliable, local blood supply. At that time, Outagamie County Medical Society voted to form a community blood donor program to service St. Elizabeth and Kaukauna Community Hospitals. We are so pleased that this foundation paved the way for our growth over the years. What started as a service to two hospitals has grown into a partnership with more than 40 hospitals throughout the Midwest.

title: Serve your community from your home with The Birthday Giving Program - Chicago, IL
description: Opening a birthday giving chapter is easy, fun, and a great way to give back to the community! Here's how it works:1. We schedule a video call with you to explain how the process works.2. Our first choice is to find a Salvation Army location (or another organization that is willing to pick up the birthday bags from your house) that is geographically close to where you live.3. We contact the Salvation Army (or another organization that is willing to pick up the birthday bags from your house) and explain The Birthday Giving Program's mission. This organization should be able to pick up the birthday bags from your house.…
missionStatement: Can you imagine being a kid (or even an adult for that matter) and not having a cake and gifts on your birthday? Everyone has a birthday and everyone deserves to be celebrated. Due to budget constraints, the organizations we serve do not have the funds to provide for birthdays. Our organization fills this void and brings joy, happiness and respect into the lives of those who are often neglected. The Birthday Giving Program's mission is to provide birthday bags and celebrations to children, adults, senior citizens, and veterans affected by poverty, addiction, abuse, homelessness, violence, physical/mental challenges, old age, and loneliness. Our mission is to ensure that everyone is celebrated and never forgotten. Birthdays are important because they provide the confidence, love, and hope people need to commemorate their existence in the world.
organizationDescription: The organization was founded by teens and young adults and started off extremely small. Initially, The Birthday Giving Program was partnered with one organization in Aurora, Illinois. Today, we are partnered with over 100 organizations. Since the organization was founded in May 2017, we have raised over $45,000 and delivered over 4,500 birthday bags. The Birthday Giving Program serves over 100 organizations across 37 states (plus the District of Columbia) along with the help of over 100 volunteers. We have been recognized by several news outlets including CNN, WGN News, and the Naperville Sun.

title: Tutor in-person with Adult Literacy program! - They need hope & reading skills!
description:
Tutor in-person with Adult Literacy program! (1802 W. Berteau Ave. Chicago, 60613)


The Anixter Center is seeking volunteer tutors for our adult literacy program! Volunteers would be expected to complete approximately fourteen hours of online training on being a literacy tutor and working with adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. Once training is complete we ask that volunteers commit to one hour a week of one-on-one tutoring for a minimum of three months but we would of course prefer that they stick around longer! We currently have in person options or virtual options depending on the learner’s access to and ability to use the internet.
missionStatement: The mission of Anixter Center is to provide an array of services and supports for people with disabilities and related challenges to live, learn, work and play in the community.
organizationDescription: Anixter Center provides an array of services for individuals with disabilities and related challenges to live, learn, work and play in the community.Anixter Center is one of the largest nonprofit organizations in the Chicago area serving people of all ages with disabilities and related challenges. Each year Anixter Center and its division-Chicago Hearing Society (CHS)-help more than 8,000 children, teens and adults by providing residential, educational, employment, socialization and health services. What makes us truly unique are the array of services we offer plus our ability to help people at every stage of life-children, teens, young adults and older adults.Our clients span the age spectrum, from birth to 90+, and represent all walks of life. Most have a least one disability and many have more than one. While we serve people of all income levels, most of our clients have incomes significantly below the poverty level.As the parent organization, Anixter Center itself provides a broad range of programs for those who have physical, developmental, cognitive, psychiatric or sensory disabilities. These Anixter Center programs include: a literacy program for adults with disabilities; 24-hour supervised residential homes; substance use disorder programs for those who are deaf; and employment programs to help people with disabilities find jobs.

title: Volunteer to Assist ORD TSA Canine Program Weekly Opportunities
description:
We are seeking volunteers to assist TSA's National Explosive Detection Team Program at Chicago O'Hare International Airport (ORD).


Your role will be to serve as a decoy and to carry a concealed training aid through an area where a Passenger Screening Canine (PSC) team is conducting search activity. This training is a critical component of maintaining, improving, and assessing the effectiveness of our PSC teams.


Prior to the training, you will be given a short safety briefing. You will then review and sign both a consent form and a non-disclosure form.
missionStatement: The National Explosives Detection Canine Team Program (NEDCTP) exists to deter and detect the introduction of explosives devices into the transportation system. The program has been in existence since 1972 and has grown significantly in the past several years due to its proven effectiveness and reliability as a mobile security screening resource. Since 2011, TSA has deployed Passenger Screening Canines (PSC). PSC Teams are vital to TSA’s current risk-based security initiatives given their ability to detect explosives concealed on the body or artfully concealed in a passenger’s accessible property. Today, more than 1,000 funded NEDCTP teams are stationed at more than 100 of the nation’s airports, mass transit, and maritime systems.
organizationDescription: TSA was created in the aftermath of 9/11 to oversee security in all modes of transportation. As a volunteer, you will be assisting our highly trained canines in maintaining their level of efficiency and effectiveness as a tool to deter explosive devices from entering into the nation's transportation systems.

title: Thrift Store Volunteer
description:
Profits of Second Chance Thrift Shoppe go toward vocational and residential services for adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities at Garden Center Services.


We are looking for entergetic folks who would like to join our fun group and help us run the best thrift shop around! Volunteers may help accept donations, test donated electronics, display and tag items for sale, use the sales register, and provide general customer service to our shoppers.


Join our fun & friendly family of volunteers and support a worthwhile cause!
missionStatement: Advancing lives of connection, contribution, and meaning for persons with developmental disabilities and the individuals that support them.
organizationDescription: Garden Center Services was established in 1956 as a grassroots effort to support children with developmental disabilities and their families. What started as an organization run entirely from a space above the garage at Reavis High School has blossomed into a multi-program agency that has a reputation for providing outstanding services to adults with disabilities.Today, Garden Center Services serves over 120 people in a wide range of community living arrangements, community day service programs, and in our supported employment program.

We schedule a video call with you to explain how the process works.2. Our first choice is to find a Salvation Army location (or another organization that is willing to pick up the birthday bags from your house) that is geographically close to where you live.3. We contact the Salvation Army (or another organization that is willing to pick up the birthday bags from your house) and explain The Birthday Giving Program's mission. This organization should be able to pick up the birthday bags from your house.…
